original: des ni phung po'i mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i gang zag gis sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas so zhes bstan te /
analyzed: des ni phung po'i mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i gang zag gis sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas so zhes bstan te /
translated: This shows that the self does not create suffering, where the self is something other than the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i gang zag nam mkha'i me tog lta bu gzhan med pa'i phyir des na sdug bsngal ma byas so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i gang zag nam mkha'i me tog lta bu gzhan med pa'i phyir des na sdug bsngal ma byas so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that since there is no self that is not the entity of suffering, like a sky flower, therefore suffering is not created by the self.

original: ci ste sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i gang zag med pa'i phyir des de ma byas pa'i skyon du gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas gang zag ni sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i gang zag med pa'i phyir des de ma byas pa'i skyon du gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas gang zag ni sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that it is not correct that the error of “that does not create that” arises because there is no self that is not the entity of suffering, then the self is the entity of suffering.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid yin na yang /
translated: But if the self is the entity of suffering,

original: de nyid kyis ni de ma byas /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni de ma byas /
translated: then it does not create itself.

original: gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
analyzed: gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
translated: If it were created by itself,

original: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: then it would not arise in dependence.

original: zhes bya ba der bkag zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba der bkag zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what is meant by the phrase “This has already been refuted.”

original: gang zag gang yin pa de nyid sdug bsngal yin la /
analyzed: gang zag gang yin pa de nyid sdug bsngal yin la /
translated: That very person is suffering.

original: des de byas par gyur na gang gi phyir bdag gis byas pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de la brten nas byung ba nyid kyi chos med pa'i phyir de ni mi 'dod de sngar bkag zin to zhes bya bar dgongs so
analyzed: des de byas par gyur na gang gi phyir bdag gis byas pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de la brten nas byung ba nyid kyi chos med pa'i phyir de ni mi 'dod de sngar bkag zin to zhes bya bar dgongs so
translated: If it were produced by itself, then what is produced by itself would not be produced by causes and conditions. Therefore, since it is unacceptable that it arises in dependence on that, because it was refuted earlier, this is the intended meaning.

original: // yang na /
analyzed: // yang na /
translated: Or else,🔽🔽

original: de nyid kyis ni de ma byas //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni de ma byas //
translated: that itself does not produce that.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the intended meaning:🔽Because it is not seen to perform the action on itself, and because it is unacceptable that it produces itself, it is unacceptable that it produces that.

original: rang la bya ba byed pa ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / bdag las skye ba mi 'thad pa bzhin du des byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes @271b bya bas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba 'di'i don rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: rang la bya ba byed pa ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / bdag las skye ba mi 'thad pa bzhin du des byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes @271b bya bas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba 'di'i don rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston to //
translated: This teaches the explanation of the meaning of this root verse in another way.

original: gang zag gang yin pa de nyid sdug bsngal yin par gyur na de nyid kyis de mi byed de rang la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir dang / bdag las skye ba mi 'thad pa bzhin du des de byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gang zag gang yin pa de nyid sdug bsngal yin par gyur na de nyid kyis de mi byed de rang la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir dang / bdag las skye ba mi 'thad pa bzhin du des de byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: If the person himself were suffering, he himself would not create it, because it is contradictory for something to act on itself, and because it is untenable that it creates itself, just like it is untenable that it arises from itself.🔽The meaning is that suffering is not created by itself.🔽If you say that suffering is created by another,

original: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gang zag ma yin pa'i phyir des byas pa ni gzhan gyis byas pa yang yin te zhes gang smras pa de yang bzang po ma yin te zhes bya bas ni gang zag phung po dang gcig pa ma yin pas des byas
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gang zag ma yin pa'i phyir des byas pa ni gzhan gyis byas pa yang yin te zhes gang smras pa de yang bzang po ma yin te zhes bya bas ni gang zag phung po dang gcig pa ma yin pas des byas
translated: because that which is suffering is not the person,🔽that is also not good.

original: pa ni sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa yin par 'dod pa'i phyogs su dgag pa ston to //
analyzed: pa ni sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa yin par 'dod pa'i phyogs su dgag pa ston to //
translated: This shows the refutation of the position that suffering is created by another, because the person is not the same as the aggregates.🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / gal te gzhan bdag ma byas na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gal te gzhan bdag ma byas na //
translated: If another does not create itself,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan byas ga la 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan byas ga la 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: how could suffering be created by another?

original: des ni gal te pha rol po dag gis phung po las gzhan pa'i gang zag yod par brtags pa des bdag nyid byas te yod par gyur na ni de nyid gzhan yin pas des byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni gzhan gyis byas pa zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ba
analyzed: des ni gal te pha rol po dag gis phung po las gzhan pa'i gang zag yod par brtags pa des bdag nyid byas te yod par gyur na ni de nyid gzhan yin pas des byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni gzhan gyis byas pa zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ba
translated: If the self were to exist as it is imagined by the opponent, as something other than the aggregates, then since it would be other, the suffering created by it would be created by another.

original: zhig na / phung po las gzhan pa'i gang zag des bdag nyid ma byas te /
analyzed: zhig na / phung po las gzhan pa'i gang zag des bdag nyid ma byas te /
translated: But the self that is other than the aggregates does not create itself.

original: yod pa ma yin pas gzhan nyid med na des sdug bsngal byas par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pas gzhan nyid med na des sdug bsngal byas par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: Since it does not exist, if it is not other, how could suffering be created by it?

original: mi 'gyur ro zhes ston to //🔽de nyid bstan pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gis gzhan nyid du bsam pa gang yin pa de gal te bdag gis ma byas shing bdag nyid ma skyes kyang yod par gyur na ni des na de gzhan nyid du grub pa'i phyir des byas pa yang gzhan gyis
analyzed: mi 'gyur ro zhes ston to // de nyid bstan pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gis gzhan nyid du bsam pa gang yin pa de gal te bdag gis ma byas shing bdag nyid ma skyes kyang yod par gyur na ni des na de gzhan nyid du grub pa'i phyir des byas pa yang gzhan gyis
translated: It could not be.

original: byas par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: byas par 'gyur grang na /
translated: To demonstrate this, if that which is imagined by the opponent to be other, even though it is not created by the self and does not arise by itself, existed, then since it would be established as other, that created by it would be created by another.

original: mkhas pa rnams ni ma skyes pa yod pa nyid du mi ston pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni ma skyes pa yod pa nyid du mi ston pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: But the wise do not teach that what has not arisen exists. Therefore how could suffering be self-produced?

original: de ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The meaning of the words “it does not exist” is that suffering is not produced by another.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus:🔽It is illogical that suffering is self-produced

original: sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang // gzhan gyis byas par mi rigs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang // gzhan gyis byas par mi rigs so //
translated: Or produced by another.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngar pha rol po dag na re gang zag bdag gis byas pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngar pha rol po dag na re gang zag bdag gis byas pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yang yin la /
translated: Previously, the opponent said: “Suffering is self-produced because it is produced by the person himself.

original: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gnag zag ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gnag zag ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Suffering is not produced by another because that which is suffering is not another person.

original: de ltar rnam grangs las bdag dang gzhan gyis byas par grub pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes gang zag gi mtshan nyid phyogs @272a * //
analyzed: de ltar rnam grangs las bdag dang gzhan gyis byas par grub pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes gang zag gi mtshan nyid phyogs @272a * //
translated: Thus, because it is established by enumeration that suffering is produced by itself and by another, there is no error.”

original: su byas nas sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas so zhes zer ba'i lan gyi mjug bsdu ba yin no /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu pa /
analyzed: su byas nas sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas so zhes zer ba'i lan gyi mjug bsdu ba yin no / // / bam po lnga bcu pa /
translated: This is the conclusion of the response to the assertion that suffering is produced by both.

original: da ni dam bcas pa gsum pa de nyid sgrub pa'i phyir grangs can dag gis /
analyzed: da ni dam bcas pa gsum pa de nyid sgrub pa'i phyir grangs can dag gis /
translated: Now, in order to prove the third thesis, the Sāṃkhya present another

original: rang bzhin dang skyes bu phyogs su byas nas sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas byas pa dgag pa'i rnam pa gzhan ston te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang skyes bu phyogs su byas nas sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas byas pa dgag pa'i rnam pa gzhan ston te /
translated: form of the refutation of the self and another producing suffering.🔽In order to demonstrate the opponent’s position, the text says, “The Sāṃkhya🔽say that the manifestations of the puruṣa and prakṛti, which are engaged in

original: de'i phyir phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir grangs can dag ni rdul shas che bas bya ba byed pa'i 'jug pa de dag dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir grangs can dag ni rdul shas che bas bya ba byed pa'i 'jug pa de dag dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal yin la /
translated: activity because of the predominance of rajas, are the objects of suffering.🔽Since the internal manifestations are the agent, the self is the possessor of

original: de yang gang gi phyir bdag nyid kyi nang gi byed pa dag byed pa po nyid yin pa de'i phyir byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pa yin pa la /
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir bdag nyid kyi nang gi byed pa dag byed pa po nyid yin pa de'i phyir byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pa yin pa la /
translated: the agent.

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i nang gi byed pa gzhan du gyur pa dag byed pa po nyid yin pa de'i phyir byed pa po gzhan dang ldan pa yin pa las des byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni bdag dang gzhan gyis byas pa🔽yin no zhes zer zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i nang gi byed pa gzhan du gyur pa dag byed pa po nyid yin pa de'i phyir byed pa po gzhan dang ldan pa yin pa las des byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni bdag dang gzhan gyis byas pa yin no zhes zer zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Because the person is distinct from the internal agents that are its transformation, it is the agent. Therefore, since it possesses another agent, the suffering it creates is self-created and created by another.

original: grangs can dag na re skyes bu ma gtogs pa'i dngos po thams can ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin yin pa las gang gi tshe rdul shas che bas lus dang / dbang po dang / blo'i tshogs kyi bya ba byed pa'i 'jug pa de dag dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal yin la /
analyzed: grangs can dag na re skyes bu ma gtogs pa'i dngos po thams can ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin yin pa las gang gi tshe rdul shas che bas lus dang / dbang po dang / blo'i tshogs kyi bya ba byed pa'i 'jug pa de dag dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal yin la /
translated: Sāṃkhyas say: All things except the person are the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas. When rajas predominates, the person engages in the activities of the collection of body, sense faculties, and mind.🔽The observation of that is suffering.

original: sdug bsngal de yang rang bzhin la ltos nas byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pas byas pa ni bdag gis byas pa yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de yang rang bzhin la ltos nas byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pas byas pa ni bdag gis byas pa yin la /
translated: That suffering is self-created because it is created by the person itself, which possesses the nature of the agent.

original: skyes bu la ltos nas byed pa po gzhan dang ldan pas byas pa ni gzhan gyis byas pa yin pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal ni bdag dang gzhan gyis byas pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skyes bu la ltos nas byed pa po gzhan dang ldan pas byas pa ni gzhan gyis byas pa yin pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal ni bdag dang gzhan gyis byas pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Suffering is self-produced and other-produced because it is produced by the self and by another in reliance on a person.

original: de la rang bzhin la ltos nas byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pa ci lta bu yin zhe na /🔽gang gi phyir bdag nyid kyi nang gi byed pa dag byed pa po yin pa de'i phyir byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pa yin te /🔽rdul shas che ba'i rang bzhin las nga rgyal byung zhing nga rgyal las dbang po rnams dang de tsam rnams 'byung bas rdul shas che ba las nga rgyal 'byung ba ni rdul gyi rang bzhin las byung ba'i nang gi byed pa yin pas de dag ni bdag nyid
analyzed: de la rang bzhin la ltos nas byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pa ci lta bu yin zhe na / gang gi phyir bdag nyid kyi nang gi byed pa dag byed pa po yin pa de'i phyir byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pa yin te / rdul shas che ba'i rang bzhin las nga rgyal byung zhing nga rgyal las dbang po rnams dang de tsam rnams 'byung bas rdul shas che ba las nga rgyal 'byung ba ni rdul gyi rang bzhin las byung ba'i nang gi byed pa yin pas de dag ni bdag nyid
translated: How is it self-produced in reliance on intrinsic nature?🔽Because the internal activities of the self are the agent, therefore it is self-produced.

original: kyi nang gi byed pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: kyi nang gi byed pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: Since pride arises from the intrinsic nature of predominance, and the faculties and objects arise from pride, pride arising from the predominance of rajas is the internal activity arising from the intrinsic nature of rajas. Therefore, they are called the internal activities of the self.

original: bdag nyid kyi nang gi byed pa de dag las dbang po rnams dang de tsam rnams byung ba ni phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin pas sdug bsngal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi nang gi byed pa de dag las dbang po rnams dang de tsam rnams byung ba ni phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin pas sdug bsngal zhes bya ste /
translated: The faculties and the mere entities that arise from those internal activities of the self are the nature of the aggregates and are called suffering.

original: sdug bsngal de bdag nyid kyi nang gi byed pa dag @272b gis bskyed pa ni byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de bdag nyid kyi nang gi byed pa dag @272b gis bskyed pa ni byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The generation of that suffering by the internal activities of the self is called “endowed with an agent that is itself.”

original: skyes bu la ltos nas byed pa po gzhan dang ldan pa ci lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu la ltos nas byed pa po gzhan dang ldan pa ci lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the self is endowed with an agent that is different from itself?

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i nang gi byed pa gzhan du gyur pa dag byed pa po nyid yin pa de'i phyir byed pa po gzhan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i nang gi byed pa gzhan du gyur pa dag byed pa po nyid yin pa de'i phyir byed pa po gzhan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Since the self is an agent that is different from the internal activities that are different from the nature of the self, it is endowed with an agent that is different from itself.

original: skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pas rdul shas che ba'i rang bzhin las nga rgyal 'byung ba ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i nang gi byed pa gzhan du gyur pa dag yin pas de
analyzed: skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pas rdul shas che ba'i rang bzhin las nga rgyal 'byung ba ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i nang gi byed pa gzhan du gyur pa dag yin pas de
translated: Since the nature of a person is not the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas, the arising of pride from the nature of predominance of rajas is a transformation of another internal agent that is different from the nature of a person.

original: dag ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i nang gi byed pa gzhan du gyur pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: dag ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i nang gi byed pa gzhan du gyur pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called “a transformation of another internal agent that is different from the nature of a person.”

original: skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i nang gi byed pa gzhan du gyur pa de dag las dbang po rnams dang / de tsam rnams byung ba yang phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin pas sdug bsngal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i nang gi byed pa gzhan du gyur pa de dag las dbang po rnams dang / de tsam rnams byung ba yang phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin pas sdug bsngal zhes bya ste /
translated: From those internal agents that are different from the nature of a person, the faculties and the subtle elements arise. Since they are the nature of the aggregates, they are called suffering.

original: sdug bsngal de skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i nang gi byed pa gzhan du gyur pa dag gis bskyed pa ni byed pa po gzhan dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i nang gi byed pa gzhan du gyur pa dag gis bskyed pa ni byed pa po gzhan dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That suffering generated by internal agents that are different from the nature of a person is called “endowed with another agent.”

original: de ltar byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pa dang / byed pa po gzhan dang ldan pa des byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni bdag dang gzhan gyis byas pa yi no zhes zer zhes grag go //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pa dang / byed pa po gzhan dang ldan pa des byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni bdag dang gzhan gyis byas pa yi no zhes zer zhes grag go //
translated: Thus, the suffering created by the self that possesses the creator and the suffering created by the other that possesses the creator is said to be self-created and other-created.

original: de dag 'di skad ces /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad ces /
translated: They say this:

original: phung po skad cig smra ba yi //
analyzed: phung po skad cig smra ba yi //
translated: The Sakyan who advocates momentary aggregates

original: sh'akya pa dag bdag med na //🔽mtho ris thar la dgos pa yi //
analyzed: sh'akya pa dag bdag med na // mtho ris thar la dgos pa yi //
translated: has no self.🔽The effort for the purpose of

original: 'bad pa don med nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bad pa don med nyid du 'gyur //
translated: heaven and liberation is pointless.🔽From the generation of the result of the virtue

original: phung po snga mar gtogs pa yi //🔽dge ba de 'bras skyed pa las //
analyzed: phung po snga mar gtogs pa yi // dge ba de 'bras skyed pa las //
translated: that belongs to the previous aggregates,

original: phung po phyi ma khyad par can //
analyzed: phung po phyi ma khyad par can //
translated: the special later aggregates

original: kun du 'byung bar 'dod mod kyi //
analyzed: kun du 'byung bar 'dod mod kyi //
translated: are asserted to arise.

original: 'on kyang de dag gzhan don du //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gzhan don du //
translated: However, their effort for the sake of others🔽is not tenable.

original: 'bad pa 'thad par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'bad pa 'thad par mi 'gyur te //
translated: They do not engage in any activity

original: gzhan la phan par bya ba ni //🔽'ga' yang 'jug par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan la phan par bya ba ni //🔽'ga' yang 'jug par mi byed do //
translated: that benefits others.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang brjod do zhes bya ba ni grangs can rang bzhin dang skyes bu brtag par 'dod pa de dag 'di skad ces kyang brjod ces grag ste phung po rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can yin par smra ba'i
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang brjod do zhes bya ba ni grangs can rang bzhin dang skyes bu brtag par 'dod pa de dag 'di skad ces kyang brjod ces grag ste phung po rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can yin par smra ba'i
translated: and so on.🔽The Sāṃkhyas who assert that the self and nature are permanent say this:

original: sh'a kyang pa dag la ni gang zag ces bya ba'i bdag brtag med pas de dag mtho ris la dgos pa'i 'bad pa brtul zhugs dang / nges pa la sogs pa yang dag par len pa dang / thar pa la dgos pa'i 'bad pa bsgom pa la sogs pa nyams su len pa dag don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /🔽phung po rnams skad cig ma'i rgyud tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir lhas byin mtho ris dang thar pa la dgos pa'i @273a * //
analyzed: sh'a kyang pa dag la ni gang zag ces bya ba'i bdag brtag med pas de dag mtho ris la dgos pa'i 'bad pa brtul zhugs dang / nges pa la sogs pa yang dag par len pa dang / thar pa la dgos pa'i 'bad pa bsgom pa la sogs pa nyams su len pa dag don med pa nyid du 'gyur te / phung po rnams skad cig ma'i rgyud tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir lhas byin mtho ris dang thar pa la dgos pa'i @273a * //
translated: “Since the Śākyas assert that the aggregates are momentary and disintegrate moment by moment, they do not investigate the self called the person. Therefore their practice of the austerities necessary for higher rebirth and their practice of meditation and so on that is necessary for liberation is pointless.

original: 'bad pa rtsom pa dag mchod sbyin gyi rgyud la don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'bad pa rtsom pa dag mchod sbyin gyi rgyud la don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because the aggregates are a different continuum of moments, the effort of Devadatta to attain higher rebirth and liberation is pointless in the continuum of Yajña.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sh'akya pa dag phung po snga ma'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i las dge ba de'i 'bras bu mtho ris skyed pa las phung po phyi ma lha dang mi'i lus khyad par can dag sa bla dang bar snang yan chad du kun du 'byung bar 'dod pas las dge ba
analyzed: sh'akya pa dag phung po snga ma'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i las dge ba de'i 'bras bu mtho ris skyed pa las phung po phyi ma lha dang mi'i lus khyad par can dag sa bla dang bar snang yan chad du kun du 'byung bar 'dod pas las dge ba
translated: Because the Śākyas assert that the result of virtuous karma belonging to the continuum of former aggregates generates a high rebirth, and the special bodies of gods and humans of the later aggregates arise in the upper and intermediate realms and so on.

original: de dag mngon par 'du byed cing las mi dge ba ngan song gi 'bras bu skyed pa dag spong bar byed pa tsam zhig dge mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag mngon par 'du byed cing las mi dge ba ngan song gi 'bras bu skyed pa dag spong bar byed pa tsam zhig dge mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, although it is virtuous to create those virtuous karmas and abandon nonvirtuous karmas that generate the result of the lower rebirths,

original: 'on kyang de dag da ltar gyi phung po skad cig ma 'dis phyi ma'i phung po skad cig ma gzhan gyi don du 'bad pa 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag da ltar gyi phung po skad cig ma 'dis phyi ma'i phung po skad cig ma gzhan gyi don du 'bad pa 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: nevertheless it is not tenable that the present moment of the aggregates strives for the sake of another moment of the aggregates in the future.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na mkhas pa bdag la legs par 'dod pa dag las 'ga' yang gzhan la phan gdags pa'i don du 'jug par mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang brjod ces grag go //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na mkhas pa bdag la legs par 'dod pa dag las 'ga' yang gzhan la phan gdags pa'i don du 'jug par mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang brjod ces grag go //
translated: Because in the world, those who are wise and who desire what is best for themselves do not engage in benefiting others.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of this commentary says the following.

original: sngar gang zag gi mtshan nyid phyogs su byas pa sun dbyung ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa de nyid yang bzlas te /
analyzed: sngar gang zag gi mtshan nyid phyogs su byas pa sun dbyung ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa de nyid yang bzlas te /
translated: In response to that, the author of this commentary repeats the verses that refute the definition of the person that was previously presented in the chapter on the person.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here, he explains:

original: re zhig sdug bsngal bdag byas min //
analyzed: re zhig sdug bsngal bdag byas min //
translated: Suffering is not self-created.

original: skyes bus so zhes bya ba smras te /🔽re zhig sdug bsngal ni skyes bu bdag gis ma byas te /
analyzed: skyes bus so zhes bya ba smras te / re zhig sdug bsngal ni skyes bu bdag gis ma byas te /
translated: The person is the experiencer.

original: 'di ltar grangs can dag gi gzhung las rang bzhin byed pa po yin la skyes bu ni za ba po yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar grangs can dag gi gzhung las rang bzhin byed pa po yin la skyes bu ni za ba po yin te /
translated: Suffering is not created by the person himself because, according to the Sāṃkhya scriptures, the person is not the creator but the experiencer,

original: dper na long ba dang grum po'i tshul bzhin no zhes 'byung bas skyes bu byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na long ba dang grum po'i tshul bzhin no zhes 'byung bas skyes bu byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: just as a blind man and a lame man are mutually dependent.

original: gal te nang gi byed pas byas so zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te grangs can dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag gi gzhung las bdag nyid kyi nang gi byed pa skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa gzhan du gyur pa dag sdug bsngal
analyzed: gal te nang gi byed pas byas so zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te grangs can dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag gi gzhung las bdag nyid kyi nang gi byed pa skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa gzhan du gyur pa dag sdug bsngal
translated: If you say that suffering is created by an internal creator,

original: gyi byed pa po nyid du 'dod pas des byas so zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: gyi byed pa po nyid du 'dod pas des byas so zhes zer na'o //
translated: then since Sāṃkhyas say that suffering is created by the internal creator,

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: the master says in response:

original: nang gi byed pa rdul shas che ba de ni sdug bsngal yin pas sdug bsngal de nyid kyis de nyid byed par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: nang gi byed pa rdul shas che ba de ni sdug bsngal yin pas sdug bsngal de nyid kyis de nyid byed par mi 'thad de /
translated: Since that internal creator that is dominated by rajas is suffering, it is untenable that it creates itself.🔽For example, it is untenable that a vase creates itself.

original: dper na bum pa de nyid kyis bum pa de nyid byed par mi 'thad pa bzhin no zhes bya bar slob dpon gyis dgongs nas /
analyzed: dper na bum pa de nyid kyis bum pa de nyid byed par mi 'thad pa bzhin no zhes bya bar slob dpon gyis dgongs nas /
translated: Thinking of this, the master says:

original: de nyid kyis ni de ma byas //🔽zhes gsungs te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni de ma byas //🔽zhes gsungs te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is not created by itself.

original: bdag nyid kyi nang gi byed pa zhes bya ba rdul shas che ba las nga rgyul  'byung ba de ni dbang po rnams dang de tsam rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas de nyid kyis de nyid byed par mi 'thad de dper na bum @273b pa
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi nang gi byed pa zhes bya ba rdul shas che ba las nga rgyul  'byung ba de ni dbang po rnams dang de tsam rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas de nyid kyis de nyid byed par mi 'thad de dper na bum @273b pa
translated: being the agent of itself.

original: bzhin no zhes bya bar slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis dgongs nas /
analyzed: bzhin no zhes bya bar slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis dgongs nas /
translated: Thinking this, Master Nāgārjuna said:

original: de nyid kyis ni de ma byas //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni de ma byas // zhes gsungs so //
translated: It does not make itself.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas so zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag gi byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pas sdug bsngal ma byas par dgag pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas so zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag gi byed pa po bdag nyid dang ldan pas sdug bsngal ma byas par dgag pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, “Suffering is not self-produced” is the conclusion of the refutation of the assertion that suffering is not produced by the self that is the agent of the Sāṃkhyas.

original: da ni grangs can dag gi byed pa po gzhan dang ldan pas sdug bsngal ma byas par dgag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: da ni grangs can dag gi byed pa po gzhan dang ldan pas sdug bsngal ma byas par dgag pa'i phyir //
translated: Now, in order to refute the assertion that suffering is not produced by another that is the agent of the Sāṃkhyas, he said:

original: gal te gzhan bdag ma byas na //
analyzed: gal te gzhan bdag ma byas na //
translated: If another is not self-produced,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan byas ga la 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan byas ga la 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: how could suffering be produced by another?

original: des ni gal te grangs can dag gis skyes bu las gzhan pa'i nang gi byed pa yod par brtags pa de bdag nyid grub par gyur na ni de nyid gzhan yin pas des byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni gzhan gyis byas pa zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ba zhig
analyzed: des ni gal te grangs can dag gis skyes bu las gzhan pa'i nang gi byed pa yod par brtags pa de bdag nyid grub par gyur na ni de nyid gzhan yin pas des byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni gzhan gyis byas pa zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ba zhig
translated: This shows that if the Sāṃkhya’s internal creator other than the person were established, then since it would be different, the suffering created by it would be created by another.

original: na / skyes bu las gzhan pa'i nang gi byed pa de bdag nyid ma grub pas gzhan nyid med na des /
analyzed: na / skyes bu las gzhan pa'i nang gi byed pa de bdag nyid ma grub pas gzhan nyid med na des /
translated: But since that internal creator other than the person is not established, it does not exist as another.

original: sdug bsngal byas par ga la 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro zhes ston to //🔽de nyid bstan pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gis nang gi byed pa las gzhan yin par bsams pa gang yin pa'i gzhan de ni bdag gis ma byas te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal byas par ga la 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro zhes ston to // de nyid bstan pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gis nang gi byed pa las gzhan yin par bsams pa gang yin pa'i gzhan de ni bdag gis ma byas te /
translated: How could suffering be created by it? It could not!🔽To demonstrate this, he says, “That other that is thought to be different from the internal creator is not created by the self.”

original: bdag nyid ma grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bdag nyid ma grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This means it is not established.

original: grangs can dag gi gzhung las snying stobs la sogs pa yon tan gsum ni rtag pa dang / thams cad du song bas dngos po thams cad kyang thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin par 'dod pas des na nang gi byed pa las gzhan pa'i skyes bu yang gzhan du ma grub la /
analyzed: grangs can dag gi gzhung las snying stobs la sogs pa yon tan gsum ni rtag pa dang / thams cad du song bas dngos po thams cad kyang thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin par 'dod pas des na nang gi byed pa las gzhan pa'i skyes bu yang gzhan du ma grub la /
translated: The Samkhyas assert that the three gunas, such as rajas, are permanent and all-pervading, and that all things are the nature of all things. Therefore, the person is not established as other than the internal agent.

original: skyes bu gzhan du ma grub na nang gi byed pa yang de las gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pas gzhan nyid med na sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan du ma grub na nang gi byed pa yang de las gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pas gzhan nyid med na sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the person is not established as other, the internal agent is not other than it. Since there is no otherness, how could suffering be produced by another? It could not be!

original: 'dir gal te sgra'i mtshan nyid la 'chel ba dag 'di skad ces /
analyzed: 'dir gal te sgra'i mtshan nyid la 'chel ba dag 'di skad ces /
translated: Here, those who are attached to the definition of the word “other” say:🔽The meaning of “not established as other” is stated in the metrical text as “not produced by itself.” The statement “not produced by itself” is a corruption of the text.

original: gzhan de bdag nyid ma grub pa'i don yin pa las tshig le'ur byas pa las bdag ma byas zhes smos pa ni tshig zur chag yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: gzhan de bdag nyid ma grub pa'i don yin pa las tshig le'ur byas pa las bdag ma byas zhes smos pa ni tshig zur chag yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this former opponent, the author of the commentary here says:

original: bdag ma byas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don du ma la 'jug pa'i phyir dper na zan byas so zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bdag ma byas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don du ma la 'jug pa'i phyir dper na zan byas so zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The word “self” is used in many senses, as in “I have eaten.”🔽For example, when food is prepared, it is said, “I have eaten.” There is no fault in the expression.

original: dper na zas kyi g-yos grub pa la zan byas so zhes brjod pa la tshig zur chag med pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bdag nyid ma grub pa la bdag ma byas zhes brjod pa la @274a * //
analyzed: dper na zas kyi g-yos grub pa la zan byas so zhes brjod pa la tshig zur chag med pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bdag nyid ma grub pa la bdag ma byas zhes brjod pa la @274a * //
translated: Similarly, here, when the self is not established, it is said, “I have not made myself.”

original: tshig zur chag med do //
analyzed: tshig zur chag med do //
translated: There is no fault in the expression.🔽Therefore, how could suffering be created by another, since “another” is not established?

original: de'i phyir de nyid gzhan zhes bya ba bdag nyid ma grub pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i nang gi byed pa gzhan du gyur pa bdag nyid ma grub pas gzhan nyid med
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid gzhan zhes bya ba bdag nyid ma grub pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i nang gi byed pa gzhan du gyur pa bdag nyid ma grub pas gzhan nyid med
translated: Since the internal agent that is different from the nature of the person is not established, there is no other.

original: na des sdug bsngal byas par ga la 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: na des sdug bsngal byas par ga la 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: How could suffering be created by that?

original: yang na gzhan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir te skyes bu ni nang gi byed pa las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na gzhan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir te skyes bu ni nang gi byed pa las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Or, because difference itself is not established, a person is not different from inner activity.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na nang gi byed pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya bas ni rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas gzhan nyid dgag pa ston te /
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na nang gi byed pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya bas ni rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas gzhan nyid dgag pa ston te /
translated: Because it is a thing, like the self of inner activity, this is a refutation of the inference of the other. This teaches that difference is refuted through inference.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the property of the probandum, the example, and the conclusion are applied in order.

original: dper na nang gi byed pa ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du skyes bu yang dngos po yin pa'i phyir nang gi byed pa las gzhan ma yin pas de'i phyir dngos po nyid du rjes su dpog pas
analyzed: dper na nang gi byed pa ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du skyes bu yang dngos po yin pa'i phyir nang gi byed pa las gzhan ma yin pas de'i phyir dngos po nyid du rjes su dpog pas
translated: For example, because inner activity is a thing, it is not different from itself. In the same way, because a person is a thing, it is not different from inner activity. Therefore, because it is inferred to be a thing,

original: gzhan nyid med pas skyes bu'i gzhan nyid bsal bas grangs can dag gi rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do //
analyzed: gzhan nyid med pas skyes bu'i gzhan nyid bsal bas grangs can dag gi rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do //
translated: Since there is no difference, the difference of the person is refuted, and the inference of the Sāṃkhya is undermined.

original: gzhan nyid du rjes su dpog pas sdug bsngal dmigs pa'i byed pa po ma yin pa nyid kyis de bsal ba'i phyir /🔽dam bcas pa la chos kyi ngo bo nyid bzlog pa'i skyon yang yod do zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las nang gi byed pa gzhan nyid du rjes su dpog pas des na nang gi byed pa sdug bsngal dmigs pa'i byed pa
analyzed: gzhan nyid du rjes su dpog pas sdug bsngal dmigs pa'i byed pa po ma yin pa nyid kyis de bsal ba'i phyir / dam bcas pa la chos kyi ngo bo nyid bzlog pa'i skyon yang yod do zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid las nang gi byed pa gzhan nyid du rjes su dpog pas des na nang gi byed pa sdug bsngal dmigs pa'i byed pa
translated: Since difference is inferred, the person is not the experiencer of suffering, and that is refuted.🔽Since the nature of the property of the thesis is contradicted, there is the fault of contradiction.🔽Since difference is inferred from the nature of the person, the internal agent is not the experiencer of suffering.

original: po ma yin pa nyid kyis byed pa po yin pa de bsal ba'i phyir grangs can dag gis dam bcas pa la nang gi byed pa sdug bsngal gyi byed pa po yin par bsgrub par bya ba chos kyi ngo bo nyid bzlog pa'i skyon nang gi byed pa
analyzed: po ma yin pa nyid kyis byed pa po yin pa de bsal ba'i phyir grangs can dag gis dam bcas pa la nang gi byed pa sdug bsngal gyi byed pa po yin par bsgrub par bya ba chos kyi ngo bo nyid bzlog pa'i skyon nang gi byed pa
translated: Since it is not the experiencer, the agent is refuted. Therefore, since the Sāṃkhya prove that the internal agent is the agent of suffering, the nature of the property of the thesis is contradicted. The internal agent🔽is not the agent of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi byed pa po ma yin pa nyid du grub pa yang yod do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi byed pa po ma yin pa nyid du grub pa yang yod do zhes bstan to //
translated: It is also established that the self is not the agent of suffering.

original: de ltar na yang sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas par mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni sngar grangs can dag rang bzhin dang skyes bu phyogs su byas nas sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas so zhes zer ba'i lan gyi mjug bsdu ba yin no
analyzed: de ltar na yang sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas par mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni sngar grangs can dag rang bzhin dang skyes bu phyogs su byas nas sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas so zhes zer ba'i lan gyi mjug bsdu ba yin no
translated: Thus, it is not logical that suffering is self-produced or produced by another. This is the conclusion of the response to the Sāṃkhya assertion that suffering is produced by both self and other, which was presented earlier in the context of nature and spirit.

original: // da ni dam bcas pa gsum pa de nyid sgrub pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag gi lus dang srog gi rnam grangs phyogs su byas nas sdug bsngal bdag dang @274b gzhan gnyi gas byas pa'i dgag pa'i rnam pa gzhan ston te de'i phyogs snga ma
analyzed: // da ni dam bcas pa gsum pa de nyid sgrub pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag gi lus dang srog gi rnam grangs phyogs su byas nas sdug bsngal bdag dang @274b gzhan gnyi gas byas pa'i dgag pa'i rnam pa gzhan ston te de'i phyogs snga ma
translated: Now, in order to establish the third thesis, the two-part thesis that the body and life force are synonyms is presented, and then another way of refuting the assertion that suffering is produced by both self and other is taught.🔽The opponent’s position is stated in the following.

original: bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag na re 'o na rnam grangs las sdug bsngal ni gnyi gas byas pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su smra ba dag na re 'o na rnam grangs las sdug bsngal ni gnyi gas byas pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “But if suffering is produced by both, there is no error.”

original: 'dir rnam gnyis su smra ba zhes bya ba mu stegs 'os pa ba nam mkha'i gos can dag na re /
analyzed: 'dir rnam gnyis su smra ba zhes bya ba mu stegs 'os pa ba nam mkha'i gos can dag na re /
translated: Here, the proponents of the two part theory are the tīrthikas, the Ājīvikas, and the sky-clad ones.

original: lus kyi rnam grangs ni sdug bsngal nyid yin pas des byas pa ni sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yin la /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam grangs ni sdug bsngal nyid yin pas des byas pa ni sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa yin la /
translated: They say: The part of the body is suffering itself, so suffering produced by it is self-produced suffering.🔽The part of the life force is different from suffering, so suffering produced by it is suffering produced by another.

original: srog gi rnam grangs ni sdug bsngal las gzhan yin pas des byas pa ni sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa yin pa'i phyogs snga ma dag tu bstan pa'i skyon kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: srog gi rnam grangs ni sdug bsngal las gzhan yin pas des byas pa ni sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas pa yin pa'i phyogs snga ma dag tu bstan pa'i skyon kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ro //
translated: The error that was demonstrated in the former position does not exist in our position.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: de'i phyir de dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, in order to refute that, it is said:

original: gal te re res byas gyur na //
analyzed: gal te re res byas gyur na //
translated: If suffering were produced by each,

original: sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas par 'gyur //
translated: Suffering would be created by both.🔽When it is not tenable that suffering is created by itself or created by another, as it has been explained, then it is impossible to state that suffering is created by both.

original: gang gi tshe ci skad bstan pa'i bsgrubs pas bdag gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas par mi rigs pa de'i tshe gnyi gas byas so zhes bya ba'i skabs med do zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ci skad bstan pa'i bsgrubs pas bdag gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas par mi rigs pa de'i tshe gnyi gas byas so zhes bya ba'i skabs med do zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: When it is not tenable that suffering is created by itself or created by another, as it has been explained, then it is impossible to state that suffering is created by both.🔽When it is not tenable that suffering is created by itself or created by another, as it has been explained, then it is impossible to state that suffering is created by both.🔽When it is not tenable that suffering is created by itself or created by another, as it has been explained, then it is impossible to state that suffering is created by both.🔽When it is not tenable that suffering is created by itself or created by another, as it has been explained, then it is impossible to state that suffering is created by both.

original: gang gi tshe sngar bdag dang gzhan phyogs su byas pa dang phung po'i mtshan nyid phyogs su byas pa dang gang zag gi mtshan nyid phyogs su byas pa dang rang bzhin dang skyes bu phyogs su byas pa dag dgag pa'i sgrub pa ci skad bstan pa dag gis

translated: When it is not tenable that suffering is created by itself or created by another, as it has been explained, then it is impossible to state that suffering is created by both.

translated: When it is not tenable that suffering is created by itself or created by another, as it has been explained, then it is impossible to state that suffering is created by both.🔽When it is not tenable that suffering is created by itself or created by another, as it has been explained, then it is impossible to state that suffering is created by both.🔽When it is not tenable that suffering is created by itself or created by another, as it has been explained, then it is impossible to state that suffering is created by both.🔽When it is not tenable that suffering is created by itself or created by another, as it has been explained, then it is impossible to state that suffering is created by both.🔽When it is not tenable that suffering is created by itself or created by another, as it has been explained, then it is impossible to state that suffering is created by both.🔽When it is not tenable that suffering is created by itself or created by another, as it has been explained, then it is impossible to state that suffering is created by both.🔽When it is not tenable that suffering is created by itself or created by another, as it has been explained, then it is impossible to state that suffering is created by both.

original: de ltar dam bcas pa gsum pa yang bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: de ltar dam bcas pa gsum pa yang bsgrubs zin to //
translated: Thus, the third promise has been fulfilled.🔽Now, in order to fulfill the fourth promise, he says,🔽Things do not arise causelessly,🔽because arising would be incessant.🔽Since arising from self is illogical,

original: da ni dam bcas pa bzhi pa sgrub pa'i phyir rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni dam bcas pa bzhi pa sgrub pa'i phyir rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: arising from other is illogical,🔽and arising from both is illogical,🔽things do not arise causelessly.🔽Since arising from self is illogical,🔽arising from other is illogical,🔽and arising from both is illogical,🔽things do not arise causelessly.

original: skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed pa rgyu med par smra ba bsal bas de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed pa rgyu med par smra ba bsal bas de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Since arising from self is illogical,🔽arising from other is illogical,🔽and arising from both is illogical,🔽things do not arise causelessly.🔽Since arising from self is illogical,

original: gzhan gyis ma byas bdag ma byas //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma byas bdag ma byas //
translated: arising from other is illogical,🔽and arising from both is illogical,

original: sdug bsngal rgyu med ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu med ga la 'gyur //
translated: things do not arise causelessly.🔽Since arising from self is illogical,🔽arising from other is illogical,🔽and arising from both is illogical,🔽things do not arise causelessly.🔽Since arising from self is illogical,🔽arising from other is illogical,🔽and arising from both is illogical,🔽things do not arise causelessly.🔽Since arising from self is illogical,🔽arising from other is illogical,🔽and arising from both is illogical,🔽things do not arise causelessly.🔽Since arising from self is illogical,🔽arising from other is illogical,🔽and arising from both is illogical,🔽things do not arise causelessly.🔽Since arising from self is illogical,🔽arising from other is illogical,🔽and arising from both is illogical,🔽things do not arise causelessly.🔽Since arising from self is illogical,🔽arising from other is illogical,🔽and arising from both is illogical,🔽things do not arise causelessly.🔽Since arising from self is illogical,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: arising from other is illogical,🔽and arising from both is illogical,🔽things do not arise causelessly.🔽Since arising from self is illogical,🔽arising from other is illogical,🔽and arising from both is illogical,

original: sngar rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed par dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba med de /
analyzed: sngar rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed par dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba med de /
translated: things do not arise causelessly.🔽Since arising from self is illogical,🔽arising from other is illogical,

original: de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes pa dang / yang na rgyu med ces bya ba ni rgyu ngan @275a * //
analyzed: de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes pa dang / yang na rgyu med ces bya ba ni rgyu ngan @275a * //
translated: and arising from both is illogical,🔽things do not arise causelessly.🔽Since arising from self is illogical,🔽arising from other is illogical,🔽and arising from both is illogical,🔽things do not arise causelessly.🔽Since arising from self is illogical,🔽arising

original: pa ste / ngo bo nyid dang / dbang phyug dang / skyes bu dang / gtso bo dang / dus dang / sred med kyi bu la sogs pa dag las skye ba med par bkag pa bzhin du 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs nas dam bcas pa bzhi pa'i skabs 'di bsgrub pa mdzad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽gzhan gyis ma byas bdag ma byas //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gzhan gyis byas pa ni gzhan gyis de byas pa ste gzhan gyis de byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa ste / ngo bo nyid dang / dbang phyug dang / skyes bu dang / gtso bo dang / dus dang / sred med kyi bu la sogs pa dag las skye ba med par bkag pa bzhin du 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs nas dam bcas pa bzhi pa'i skabs 'di bsgrub pa mdzad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro // gzhan gyis ma byas bdag ma byas // zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir / gzhan gyis byas pa ni gzhan gyis de byas pa ste gzhan gyis de byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and that it is not produced from a self, an isvara, a purusha, prakriti, time, or Narayana, and so on.🔽  The meaning of the words “not created by another, not self-created” is explained in order to demonstrate the commentary.🔽  “Created by another” means that another creates it; it is created by another, that is the meaning.🔽

original: gzhan gyis ma byas pa ni gzhan gyis mi byed pa'o //🔽bdag gis byas pa yang bdag gis de byas pa ste bdag gis byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽bdag gis ma byas pa ni bdag gis mi byed pa'o //

original: gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang / bdag gis ma byas pa ni gzhan gyis mi byed pa dang bdag gis mi byed pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang / bdag gis ma byas pa ni gzhan gyis mi byed pa dang bdag gis mi byed pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: That which is not created by another and not created by itself is not created by another and not created by itself.

original: gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang / bdag gis ma byas pa'i phyir sdug bsngal rgyu med pa las byung ba ma yin par bsgrub pa'i 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang / bdag gis ma byas pa'i phyir sdug bsngal rgyu med pa las byung ba ma yin par bsgrub pa'i 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the logic proving that suffering does not arise without a cause, he says:

original: gang gi tshe ji skad smos pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir don dam par sdug bsngal dmigs su med pa de'i tshe sdug bsngal rgyu med pa las byung bar ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji skad smos pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir don dam par sdug bsngal dmigs su med pa de'i tshe sdug bsngal rgyu med pa las byung bar ga la 'gyur te /
translated: When suffering is not observed in an ultimate sense because it is undermined by the valid cognition just mentioned, how could suffering arise without a cause?

original: de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of the words “it does not exist” is stated.

original: sngar rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang por /
analyzed: sngar rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang por /
translated: In the first chapter, the examination of conditions, it was said:

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from another,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //🔽dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min // dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: Not from both, not without cause,🔽Nowhere do any entities

original: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: Ever arise.

original: zhes smos pa'i tshad mas don dam par sdug bsngal la sogs pa dngos po thams cad dmigs su med pa de'i tshe sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa rgyu med pa las byung bar ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes smos pa'i tshad mas don dam par sdug bsngal la sogs pa dngos po thams cad dmigs su med pa de'i tshe sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa rgyu med pa las byung bar ga la 'gyur te /
translated: When valid cognition shows that ultimately all things such as suffering are not observed, how could suffering arise causelessly, without intrinsic reality?

original: sdug bsngal de yod pa ma yin na rgyu med pa las byung ba lta yod par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //🔽de'i phyir de ltar rnam pa thams cad du sdug bsngal mi srid pas pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por don dam par phung po rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de yod pa ma yin na rgyu med pa las byung ba lta yod par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to // de'i phyir de ltar rnam pa thams cad du sdug bsngal mi srid pas pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por don dam par phung po rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: If that suffering does not exist, how could it arise causelessly? This is the meaning of the words.

original: sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, since suffering is impossible in any way, the reason stated by the opponent in the first chapter, “The aggregates ultimately exist because suffering exists,” is not established. This is the conclusion and the result of valid cognition.

original: pha rol pos smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyis bstan bcos mdzad pa'i dam bcas pa @275b grub po //
analyzed: pha rol pos smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyis bstan bcos mdzad pa'i dam bcas pa @275b grub po //
translated: The meaning of the reason stated by the opponent is not established, and thus the thesis of the treatise author is established.

original: da ni slob dpon gyis sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi yod par mi 'thad par bstan pa bzhin du dngos po lhag ma rnams la yang 'dra bar bstan par bzhed nas /🔽sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: da ni slob dpon gyis sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi yod par mi 'thad par bstan pa bzhin du dngos po lhag ma rnams la yang 'dra bar bstan par bzhed nas / sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig rnam pa bzhi //
translated: Now, just as the master has shown that it is untenable that the four types of suffering exist, he wishes to show that the same applies to the remaining things.🔽Not only suffering

original: yod ma yin pa ma yin gyi //
analyzed: yod ma yin pa ma yin gyi //
translated: Does not exist in these four ways,

original: phyi rol dngos po rnams la yang //
analyzed: phyi rol dngos po rnams la yang //
translated: External things

original: rnam pa bzhi po yod ma yin //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po yod ma yin //
translated: Do not exist in these four ways.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams la yang rnam pa bzhi po de dag yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams la yang rnam pa bzhi po de dag yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: As was explained, external things such as form also do not exist in these four ways.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na dngos po thams cad bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyis dang / rgyu med pas byas par mi 'thad pa de'i phyir sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig la bdag dang / gzhan dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na dngos po thams cad bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyis dang / rgyu med pas byas par mi 'thad pa de'i phyir sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig la bdag dang / gzhan dang /
translated: Because when one analyzes things in this way, correctly and in accordance with reality, it is untenable that all things are created by self, other, both, or causelessly, therefore, one should not say that suffering is created by self, other,🔽

original: gnyis dang / rgyu med pas byas pa yod pa ma yin par ma zad kyi gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi dngos por 'dod pa thams cad la yang bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyis dang / rgyu med pas byas pa yod pa ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: gnyis dang / rgyu med pas byas pa yod pa ma yin par ma zad kyi gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi dngos por 'dod pa thams cad la yang bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyis dang / rgyu med pas byas pa yod pa ma yin par ston to //
translated: Because when one analyzes things in this way, correctly and in accordance with reality, it is untenable that all things are created by self, other, both, or causelessly, therefore, not only does suffering not exist as created by self, other, both, or causelessly, but also all external things asserted to be forms and so on do not exist as created by self, other, both, or causelessly.

original: de la re zhig gzugs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig gzugs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, first, I will explain from the perspective of form.

original: gzugs ni bdag nyid kyis ma byas te /
analyzed: gzugs ni bdag nyid kyis ma byas te /
translated: Form is not created by itself.

original: yod pa dang med pa la byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir tshul sngar bstan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir tshul sngar bstan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: de la re zhig yod pa bdag nyid kyis byas pa mi 'thad pa'i dbang du byas nas dper na bum pa yod pa ni yod pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyis ma byas pa de bzhin du gzugs yod pa yang yod pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyis ma byas so //
analyzed: de la re zhig yod pa bdag nyid kyis byas pa mi 'thad pa'i dbang du byas nas dper na bum pa yod pa ni yod pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyis ma byas pa de bzhin du gzugs yod pa yang yod pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyis ma byas so //
translated: First, with respect to the untenability of the production of an existent thing, it is like, for example, a vase that exists because it exists is not produced by itself. In the same way, form that exists because it exists is not produced by itself.

original: med pa bdag nyid kyis byas pa mi 'thad pa'i dbang du byas nas dper na nam mkha'i me tog med pa ni med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: med pa bdag nyid kyis byas pa mi 'thad pa'i dbang du byas nas dper na nam mkha'i me tog med pa ni med pa'i phyir /
translated: With respect to the untenability of the production of a nonexistent thing, it is like, for example, a sky flower that does not exist because it does not exist is not produced by itself.

original: bdag nyid kyis ma byas pa de bzhin du gzugs med pa yang med pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyis ma byas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ma byas pa de bzhin du gzugs med pa yang med pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyis ma byas so //
translated: In the same way, form that does not exist because it does not exist is not produced by itself.

original: yang na brten nas byung ba'i phyir dper na myu gu bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bdag gis ma byas pa'i rjes su dpag pa gzhan yin te /
analyzed: yang na brten nas byung ba'i phyir dper na myu gu bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bdag gis ma byas pa'i rjes su dpag pa gzhan yin te /
translated: This is another inference of non-self-making.

original: gzugs ni bdag nyid kyis ma byas te brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na myu gu bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni bdag nyid kyis ma byas te brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na myu gu bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Form is not self-made because it is dependently arisen, like a sprout.

original: 'byung ba gzhan du gyur pa dag gis kyang ma byas te de dag gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gzugs gzhan gyis ma byas te gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'byung ba gzhan du gyur pa dag gis kyang ma byas te de dag gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gzugs gzhan gyis ma byas te gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes ston to //
translated: It is not made by others, the elements, because it is not tenable that they are different. This shows that form is not made by another, because another does not exist.

original: de'i phyir de'i @276a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i @276a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: ltar mi 'thad ce na /
analyzed: ltar mi 'thad ce na /
translated: if you say that is not tenable,

original: 'byung ba chan po de dag ni gzugs las gzhan du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chan po de dag ni gzugs las gzhan du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: those great elements are not different from form,

original: phyi rol pa yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyi rol pa yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because they are external, like the intrinsic nature of form itself.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na gzugs ni phyi rol pa yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'byung ba chen po dag kyang phyi rol pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs las gzhan du gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na gzugs ni phyi rol pa yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'byung ba chen po dag kyang phyi rol pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs las gzhan du gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, form is not different from its own nature because it is external. Likewise, the great elements are not different from form because they are external.

original: yang na rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or, because substantial existence is refuted,

original: med pa la gzhan nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po dag gzugs las gzhan du gyur pa ma yin par rjes su dpag pa gzhan yin te /
analyzed: med pa la gzhan nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po dag gzugs las gzhan du gyur pa ma yin par rjes su dpag pa gzhan yin te /
translated: for it is untenable that the nonexistent is different. This is another inference that the great elements are not different from form.

original: 'byung ba chen po dag ni gzugs las gzhan du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po dag ni gzugs las gzhan du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: The great elements are not different from form,

original: rdzas su med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rdzas su med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: because they do not substantially exist, like the horn of an ass.

original: gnyi gas kyang ma byas te /
analyzed: gnyi gas kyang ma byas te /
translated: Neither is the case.

original: re res byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gzugs bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas ma byas par bstan to //
analyzed: re res byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gzugs bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas ma byas par bstan to //
translated: The phrase “because it is untenable that each is the cause” indicates that form is not produced by self, by other, or by both.

original: rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te rgyu med par smra ba bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gzugs rgyu med pa las byung ba ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te rgyu med par smra ba bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gzugs rgyu med pa las byung ba ma yin par bstan to //
translated: The phrase “nor does it arise without a cause, because the assertion of causeless arising has been refuted” indicates that form does not arise without a cause.

original: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra dang / dri dang ro dang rig pa dang / chos rnams la yang bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis dang rgyu med pas byas pa rnam pa bzhi po dag mi 'thad par snga ma bzhin du sbyar ba bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra dang / dri dang ro dang rig pa dang / chos rnams la yang bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis dang rgyu med pas byas pa rnam pa bzhi po dag mi 'thad par snga ma bzhin du sbyar ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase “the same should be said of sound, etc.” indicates that the four alternatives of being produced by self, by other, by both, or without a cause are untenable for sound, smell, taste, tangible objects, and the entities of the heaps of consciousness and formations. The same should be said of all entities.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du brjod pas sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du brjod pas sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba
translated: This is the conclusion.

original: dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: This is the result of valid cognition.🔽In this twelfth chapter, the examination of suffering, the meaning of the present chapter should be seen as the result of valid cognition.

original: sdug bsngal brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu gnyis pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur blta ba ni pha rol pos sngar phung po dang khams dang skye mched dam par yod bar bsgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma don dam par phung po rnams
analyzed: sdug bsngal brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu gnyis pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur blta ba ni pha rol pos sngar phung po dang khams dang skye mched dam par yod bar bsgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma don dam par phung po rnams
translated: The opponent previously argued that the aggregates, elements, and media exist ultimately.

original: yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The aggregates exist ultimately.🔽This is because they are suffering.

original: sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du brjod pas sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du brjod pas sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of this reason is shown to be unestablished, and so suffering is shown to be essenceless.

original: sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon @276b tan ci yod pa dang de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi
analyzed: sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon @276b tan ci yod pa dang de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi
translated: What is the benefit of teaching that suffering lacks entityness?

original: khungs kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: khungs kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: To dispel the claim by others that this teaching is merely a dry treatise of sophistry, it is established here by means of a source of trust, a citation from scripture.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: Thus the Questions of Subāhu chapter of the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas says:

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba ma yin no //
translated: Subāhu, form is not happiness or suffering.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, and consciousness are not happiness or suffering.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang /
translated: That is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las tshangs pa rnam grangs des kyang khyod kyis 'di ltar shes par bya ste /🔽sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam ni 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las tshangs pa rnam grangs des kyang khyod kyis 'di ltar shes par bya ste / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam ni 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, the Questions of Brahma Sûtra says:🔽Brahma, by this method you should understand that suffering, origin, cessation, and path are not the truths of the noble ones.🔽In this way, the non-arising of suffering, origin, cessation, and path is the path of the noble ones.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam ma skyes pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi lam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i mdo mtha' yas pa dag las sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam ma skyes pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi lam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i mdo mtha' yas pa dag las sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du gsungs pa dang /
translated: In this way, the infinite Mahâyâna sûtras teach that suffering is essenceless.

original: theg pa chen po'i lung 'ba' zhig las sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du gsungs par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i lung 'ba' zhig las sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du gsungs par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it taught in the Mahayana scriptures that suffering is essenceless,

original: nyan thos kyi theg par bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg par bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal te /
translated: but it is also taught in the Hinayana scriptures.🔽A brahman asked the Lord, “O Gautama, is suffering produced by itself?”

original: bcom ldan 'das la bram ze zhig gis kye goo ta ma sdug bsngal bdag gis byas sam zhes zhus pa dang / bka' stsal pa tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la bram ze zhig gis kye goo ta ma sdug bsngal bdag gis byas sam zhes zhus pa dang / bka' stsal pa tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: The Lord replied, “Venerable sir, it is not.”

original: gsol pa / gzhan gyis byas sam /
analyzed: gsol pa / gzhan gyis byas sam /
translated: He asked, “Is it produced by another?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: “Venerable sir, it is not.”

original: gsol pa gnyi gas byas sam /
analyzed: gsol pa gnyi gas byas sam /
translated: He asked, “Is it produced by both?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no //🔽gsol pa bdag gis kyang ma byas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no // gsol pa bdag gis kyang ma byas /
translated: “Venerable sir, it is not.”

original: gzhan gyis kyang ma byas sam /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang ma byas sam /
translated: He asked, “Is it produced by neither?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord replied,🔽“Venerable sir, it is not.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
translated: And so on extensively.

original: de ltar theg pa che chung gi yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin te /
analyzed: de ltar theg pa che chung gi yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin te /
translated: Thus, the establishment of those scriptures that are trusted in the Great and Lesser Vehicles is the good quality and the source of the teaching of the realitylessness of suffering.

original: de'i phyir kho bos rang gi bsam pas rtog ge skam po tsam gyis bsgrubs pa ma yin te @277a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bos rang gi bsam pas rtog ge skam po tsam gyis bsgrubs pa ma yin te @277a * //
translated: Therefore, I have not established it by mere dry logic of my own thinking.

original: lung de dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: lung de dag kyang yod do //
translated: Those scriptures exist.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar theg pa che chung gi mdo sde mtha' yas pa dag las sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar theg pa che chung gi mdo sde mtha' yas pa dag las sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang /
translated: And because the realitylessness of suffering is taught in those scriptures of the Great and Lesser Vehicles, the teaching of this treatise is the very object to be explained.

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is the knowledge of the master himself and the skill of the commentator.
