original: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa /
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa /
translated: The commentary on the root text of the middle way composed by the master Bhāviveka.

original: shes rab sgron ma las sdug bsngal brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu gnyis pa rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: shes rab sgron ma las sdug bsngal brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu gnyis pa rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: This is the twelfth chapter of the Prajñāpradīpa, called “The Examination of Suffering.”

original: slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the twelfth chapter of the Prajñāpradīpa, composed by the master Avalokitavrata, is complete.

original: // / da ni sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa dang rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa'i mthus 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / da ni sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa dang rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa'i mthus 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate through the force of the response to the refutation and the autonomous inference that compounded phenomena do not intrinsically exist apart from their aspects, the thirteenth chapter is begun.

original: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The word “force” should be understood in this context to have the meaning of the cause of the commitment and the meaning of the subject matter of the text that will follow. The meaning of the words is the same as before.

original: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas da ni sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa dang rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa'i mthus zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas da ni sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa dang rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa'i mthus zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In this context, in terms of the purpose of engaging the commitment, he says, “Now, by the power of responding to objections and autonomous inferences,”

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bcas pa mdzad pas 'dir yang sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du🔽byas nas de skad smras te /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bcas pa mdzad pas 'dir yang sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
translated: Since the treatise author, in the context of beginning the first chapter, the analysis of conditions, committed to the position that all things are unarisen, here he also says this in terms of the purpose of engaging the commitment of the treatise author as it was previously stated.🔽By the power of responding to objections means that the Madhyamaka responds to the arguments of others that are objections to the Madhyamaka’s commitment that all things are essenceless.

original: sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa'i mthus zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam bcas pa la pha rol po dag gis sun 'byin pa'i sgrub pa gang dag smras pa'i lan dbu ma pas btab pa las mthu🔽gang skyes so //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa'i mthus zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam bcas pa la pha rol po dag gis sun 'byin pa'i sgrub pa gang dag smras pa'i lan dbu ma pas btab pa las mthu🔽gang skyes so //
translated: The power of responding to objections is the power of autonomous inferences.

original: rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa'i mthus zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa nyid kyis dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa rang dbang du smras pa las mthu gang skyes pas te /
analyzed: rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa'i mthus zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa nyid kyis dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa rang dbang du smras pa las mthu gang skyes pas te /
translated: “By the power of independent inference” means that the power of the independent inference of the Madhyamika himself, which proves that all things are essenceless, is born.

original: de ltar na bstan bcos mdzad pas dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam bcas nas brgal ba'i lan btab pa dang rang gi dam bcas bsgrub pa las de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba'i mthu gang dag skyes pa des sngar dam bcas
analyzed: de ltar na bstan bcos mdzad pas dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam bcas nas brgal ba'i lan btab pa dang rang gi dam bcas bsgrub pa las de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba'i mthu gang dag skyes pa des sngar dam bcas
translated: Thus, the author of the treatise, having asserted that all things are essenceless, answers the objections and proves his own thesis, and by the power of that, one comes to understand reality.

original: pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i @277b don gyi dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i @277b don gyi dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, the thirteenth chapter is begun in order to engage in the thesis stated earlier, in terms of the power of the meaning of the cause of engagement.

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown to be essenceless in terms of aspects other than those previously explained.🔽The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown to be essenceless in terms of aspects other than those previously explained.🔽The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown to be essenceless in terms of aspects other than those previously explained.

original: de kho na brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni 'du byed rnams sngar bstan pa'i rnam pa las gzhan pa'i sgo nas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pas de kho na'i don bstan pa yin pas de'i🔽dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //🔽rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
analyzed: de kho na brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni 'du byed rnams sngar bstan pa'i rnam pa las gzhan pa'i sgo nas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pas de kho na'i don bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so // rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
translated: The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown to be essenceless in terms of aspects other than those previously explained.🔽The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown to be essenceless in terms of aspects other than those previously explained.🔽The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown to be essenceless in terms of aspects other than those previously explained.🔽The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown to be essenceless in terms of aspects other than those previously explained.🔽The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown to be essenceless in terms of aspects other than those previously explained.🔽The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown to be essenceless in terms of aspects other than those previously explained.🔽The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown to be essenceless in terms of aspects other than those previously explained.🔽The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown to be essenceless in terms of aspects other than those previously explained.🔽The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown to be essenceless in terms of aspects other than those previously explained.🔽The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown to be essenceless in terms of aspects other than those previously explained.🔽The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown to be essenceless in terms of aspects other than those previously explained.

original: 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pas de kho na'i don bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pas de kho na'i don bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown to be essenceless in terms of aspects other than those previously explained.🔽The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown to be essenceless in terms of aspects other than those previously explained.🔽The meaning of the treatise that will be explained below is that conditioned states are shown

original: sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa dang / rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa'i mthu'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir yang thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa dang / rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa'i mthu'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir yang thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
translated: The reply to the refutation and the power of autonomous inference are the means for attaining that result, so the author of the commentary teaches just the means and the result that arises from the means at the beginning of this section of the treatise.

original: rnam pa gang gis 'bras bu de 'thob pa'i thabs nyid bstan pa'i phyir /🔽chos gang slu ba de brdzun zhes //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis 'bras bu de 'thob pa'i thabs nyid bstan pa'i phyir / chos gang slu ba de brdzun zhes //
translated: In order to teach just the means for attaining that result,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, “Whatever phenomenon is deceptive, that is false . . .” and so on.

original: slob dpon gyis 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don de nyid sgrub pa'i thabs su /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don de nyid sgrub pa'i thabs su /
translated: The master Nāgārjuna taught that conditioned phenomena are essenceless in all respects. In order to prove that, he says,

original: chos gang slu ba de brdzun zhes //
analyzed: chos gang slu ba de brdzun zhes //
translated: “Whatever phenomenon is deceptive, that is false,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs //
translated: the Bhagavat has said.”

original: 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos //
translated: All conditioned phenomena are deceptive phenomena.

original: des na de dag brdzun pa yin //
analyzed: des na de dag brdzun pa yin //
translated: Therefore, they are false.

original: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa 'di gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar te 'dus byas slu ba gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa'o zhes /
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa 'di gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar te 'dus byas slu ba gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa'o zhes /
translated: This is the verse that he spoke.🔽The Lord has said that whatever is compounded is false and deceptive.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs te gang gi phyir 'du byed rnams slu ba'i chos yin pa de'i phyir des na 'du byed de dag brdzun pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs te gang gi phyir 'du byed rnams slu ba'i chos yin pa de'i phyir des na 'du byed de dag brdzun pa yin te /
translated: Because compounded phenomena are deceptive phenomena, therefore they are false,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no //🔽sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam bcas pa la gzhan dag na re 'du byed rnams don dam par rdzas su yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no // sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam bcas pa la gzhan dag na re 'du byed rnams don dam par rdzas su yod pa yin te /
translated: they are essenceless.🔽Earlier, the author of the treatise committed himself to the position that all things are essenceless.

original: mi sru ba'i phyir ro zhes sun 'byin pa de'i lan du 'dir 'dus byas slu ba gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa'o zhes /
analyzed: mi sru ba'i phyir ro zhes sun 'byin pa de'i lan du 'dir 'dus byas slu ba gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa'o zhes /
translated: In response to the opponent’s refutation, “Compounded phenomena exist substantially ultimately because they are objects of knowledge,” here, in response to the opponent’s refutation, “Compounded phenomena are false,”🔽the author of the treatise explains, “The Lord has said that whatever is compounded is false and deceptive.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs so zhes bshad pa ni sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs so zhes bshad pa ni sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa yin la /
translated: This is the response to the refutation.

original: ci'i phyir ro 'dus byas brdzun pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ro 'dus byas brdzun pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why are compounded phenomena false?

original: gang gi @278a * //
analyzed: gang gi @278a * //
translated: Because all formations are deceptive phenomena, therefore those formations are false.

original: phyir 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos yin pa de'i phyir des na 'du byed de dag brdzun pa yin no zhes rjes su dpag pa 'og nas ston pa de dag ni rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: phyir 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos yin pa de'i phyir des na 'du byed de dag brdzun pa yin no zhes rjes su dpag pa 'og nas ston pa de dag ni rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: The subsequent inferences that will be taught are autonomous inferences.🔽The power that arises from the response to the refutation and the autonomous inference is the method.

original: de ltar sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa dang / rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa las mthu gang dag skyes pa'i rnam pa de dag gis 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de kho na'i don de rtogs par 'gyur ba ni thabs dang thams las byung ba'i 'bras bur
analyzed: de ltar sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa dang / rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa las mthu gang dag skyes pa'i rnam pa de dag gis 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de kho na'i don de rtogs par 'gyur ba ni thabs dang thams las byung ba'i 'bras bur
translated: The result that arises from the method is the realization of the meaning of the teaching that formations lack entityness in terms of their nature.

original: 'brel pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: 'brel pa yin par ston to //
translated: The result is related to the method.

original: de la 'dir 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni chos can yin /🔽brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni chos can yin / brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
translated: Here, “conditioned” is the subject.🔽“False” is the property of the thesis.

original: slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
analyzed: slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
translated: “Deceptive phenomena” is the proving property.

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus la sogs pa dag ni dpe yin par ston te /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus la sogs pa dag ni dpe yin par ston te /
translated: The body of a woman conjured up by a magician, etc., are the examples.

original: de la re zhig brdzun pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni log pa'i shes pas dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / byis pa'i skye bo dag la sogs pa'i tshul gyis 'drid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la re zhig brdzun pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni log pa'i shes pas dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / byis pa'i skye bo dag la sogs pa'i tshul gyis 'drid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To explain the meaning of the term “false,” he says, “because it is the object perceived by a false cognition and because it deceives childish beings, etc.”

original: gang gi phyir 'dus byas ni log pa brdzun pa'i shes pas dmigs par bya ba yin gyi yang dag pa'i shes pa don dam pa las dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir brdzun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dus byas ni log pa brdzun pa'i shes pas dmigs par bya ba yin gyi yang dag pa'i shes pa don dam pa las dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir brdzun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because conditioned phenomena are the objects perceived by false, deceptive cognition, and not the objects perceived by a true cognition that is ultimate, they are called “false.”

original: yang na 'dus byas ni byis pa'i skye bo 'drid pa'i phyir brdzun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dus byas ni byis pa'i skye bo 'drid pa'i phyir brdzun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, conditioned phenomena are called “false” because they deceive childish beings.

original: ji ltar 'drid ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'drid ce na /
translated: How do they deceive?

original: bdag la sogs pa'i tshul gyis 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa'i tshul gyis 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are desired in the manner of a self, etc.

original: gang gi phyir byis pa rnams kyis bdag dang gtsang ba dang rtag pa dang bde bar dmigs pa de'i phyir byis pa'i skye bo 'drid pas brdzun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byis pa rnams kyis bdag dang gtsang ba dang rtag pa dang bde bar dmigs pa de'i phyir byis pa'i skye bo 'drid pas brdzun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because fools perceive a self, purity, permanence, and pleasure, therefore, the childish are deceived by that which is false.

original: slu ba zhes bya ba ni dran pa la sogs pa don dam pa'i yul can dag rab tu slu ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas ni dran pa dang / shes pa dang / bsgom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa nyon mongs pa spong ba gang dag la don dam pa'i yul yod pa'i dran pa la sogs pa'i don dam pa'i yul can dag rab tu slu ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir slu ba'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slu ba zhes bya ba ni dran pa la sogs pa don dam pa'i yul can dag rab tu slu ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas ni dran pa dang / shes pa dang / bsgom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa nyon mongs pa spong ba gang dag la don dam pa'i yul yod pa'i dran pa la sogs pa'i don dam pa'i yul can dag rab tu slu ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir slu ba'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: Deceptive means that memory, etc., which have ultimate objects, are the cause of complete deception. That is to say, conditioned entities are the cause of complete deception for memory, knowledge, meditation, concentration, etc., which have ultimate objects and which abandon the defilements. Therefore, they are called deceptive phenomena.

original: de la brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig yin la /
analyzed: de la brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig yin la /
translated: Here, false is a term that indicates.

original: slu ba zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: slu ba zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The word “deceptive” is the predicate of the probandum, and the word “false” is the reason.🔽Who said this?🔽The Bhagavān said this.

original: de skad sus gang du gsungs she na /
analyzed: de skad sus gang du gsungs she na /
translated: The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.🔽The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.🔽The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.🔽The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.🔽The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs zhes bya ba ni mdo sde las so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs zhes bya ba ni mdo sde las so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.🔽The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.🔽The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.

original: de skad ces bya ba'i sgra ni nye @278b bar bstan pa'i don to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba'i sgra ni nye @278b bar bstan pa'i don to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.🔽The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.🔽The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.🔽The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.🔽The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las 'di skad gsungs pa dngos nye bar mtshon pa'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las 'di skad gsungs pa dngos nye bar mtshon pa'i don to //
translated: The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.🔽The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.🔽The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.🔽The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.🔽The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.🔽The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.🔽The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las ji skad gsungs she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las ji skad gsungs she na /
translated: The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.🔽The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.🔽The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.🔽The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.🔽The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.🔽The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.🔽The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa las kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa las kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.🔽The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.🔽The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.🔽The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.🔽The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.🔽The Bhagavān said this in the sūtras.

original: 'dus byas gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos so ;
analyzed: 'dus byas gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos so ;
translated: The word “this” refers to the proximate object of reference.🔽The Bhagavān said

original: / dge slong dag 'di lta ste mi slu ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa de ni bden pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: / dge slong dag 'di lta ste mi slu ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa de ni bden pa'i mchog go //
translated: “Monks, it is thus: that which is the supreme truth, nirvana, is non-deceptive.

original: 'dus byas de ni slu ba'i chos kyang yin de ni rab tu 'jig pa'i chos kyang yin no zhes kyang gsungs la /
analyzed: 'dus byas de ni slu ba'i chos kyang yin de ni rab tu 'jig pa'i chos kyang yin no zhes kyang gsungs la /
translated: That which is compounded is deceptive and is subject to destruction.”

original: theg pa chen po las /
analyzed: theg pa chen po las /
translated: And in the Mahayana scriptures it says:

original: rab 'byor ji tsam du 'dus byas pa de tsam du brdzun la ji tsam du 'dus ma byas pa de tsam du mi brdzun no zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji tsam du 'dus byas pa de tsam du brdzun la ji tsam du 'dus ma byas pa de tsam du mi brdzun no zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “Subhuti, to the extent that something is compounded, to that extent it is false. To the extent that something is uncompounded, to that extent it is not false.”

original: de dag gis ni phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i lung gi khungs kyis 'dus byas ni slu ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir brdzun pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag gis ni phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i lung gi khungs kyis 'dus byas ni slu ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir brdzun pa yin la /
translated: They say that because compounded phenomena are deceptive, they are false.

original: 'dus ma byas ni mi slu ba'i phyir bden pa'i mchog yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni mi slu ba'i phyir bden pa'i mchog yin par bstan to //
translated: And because uncompounded phenomena are non-deceptive, they are the supreme truth.

original: de'i phyir de ltar phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i lung dag yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i lung dag yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because there are scriptures that are accepted by both sides,

original: 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos /
translated: all compounded phenomena are deceptive phenomena.

original: 'dis ni 'du byed kyi chos ni slu ba'i chos nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba 'dis ni 'du byed gang yin pa de brdzun pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni slu ba'i chos nyid yin par bstan te
analyzed: 'dis ni 'du byed kyi chos ni slu ba'i chos nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba 'dis ni 'du byed gang yin pa de brdzun pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni slu ba'i chos nyid yin par bstan te
translated: This shows that conditioned phenomena are deceptive by nature.🔽This root verse shows that the reason that proves that whatever is conditioned is false is that it is deceptive by nature.

original: / slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir brdzun pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: / slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir brdzun pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word “deceptive” is applied to the reason, “because they are deceptive phenomena,” and the predicate, “they are false.”

original: des na de dag brdzun pa yin //
analyzed: des na de dag brdzun pa yin //
translated: Therefore they are false.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /🔽de ni mjug bsdu ba'i tshig yin no zhes bya bas ni slu ba'i chos yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na 'du byed de dag brdzun pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te / de ni mjug bsdu ba'i tshig yin no zhes bya bas ni slu ba'i chos yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na 'du byed de dag brdzun pa yin te /
translated: This is because they lack an essence.🔽This is the concluding statement.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the application of the reason, “because they are deceptive phenomena,” and the conclusion, “therefore those conditioned phenomena are false because they lack an essence.”

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te /
translated: The words of the syllogism are as follows: “The inner entities are ultimately empty of essence because they are deceptive phenomena.”

original: slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sbrul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sbrul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject is “all internal things,” the predicate is “are empty of essence,” and the example is “because they are deceptive phenomena, like the body of a woman conjured up by a magician.”

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus ni slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid stong pa de bzhin du nang gi dngos po rnams kyang slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid stong pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus ni slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid stong pa de bzhin du nang gi dngos po rnams kyang slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid stong pa yin no //
translated: Just as the body of a woman conjured up by a magician is empty of essence because it is a deceptive phenomenon, so all internal things are empty of essence because they are deceptive phenomena.

original: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa dag ni yan lag gsum smra ba yin pas de'i phyir nye bar sbyar @279a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa dag ni yan lag gsum smra ba yin pas de'i phyir nye bar sbyar @279a * //
translated: “Since Buddhists maintain the three parts of a reason, the application of the example is incorrect.”

original: ba dang mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa dag gis rjes su dpag pa'i yan lag lnga bo phyogs dang / gtan tshigs dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag las nye bar sbyar ba dang /
analyzed: ba dang mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa dag gis rjes su dpag pa'i yan lag lnga bo phyogs dang / gtan tshigs dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag las nye bar sbyar ba dang /
translated: The statement “The words of application and conclusion are illogical” means that the Buddhist refutes the two, application and conclusion, from among the five parts of inference, namely, the subject, the reason, the example, the application and the conclusion.

original: mjug bsdu ba gnyis sun phyung ste yan lag lhag ma gsum khas blangs pas de'i phyir yan lag lngar smra ba dag gis 'dir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba gnyis sun phyung ste yan lag lhag ma gsum khas blangs pas de'i phyir yan lag lngar smra ba dag gis 'dir /
translated: Since he accepts the remaining three parts, he is a proponent of five parts.

original: sangs rgyas pas nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba'i tshig smos pa de dag mi bzod pas de skad zer ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pas nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba'i tshig smos pa de dag mi bzod pas de skad zer ro //
translated: Therefore, he says that the words of application and conclusion that the Buddhist uses are unacceptable.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te 'di ltar nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag yan lag gzhan nyid du mi 'dod med kyi /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te 'di ltar nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag yan lag gzhan nyid du mi 'dod med kyi /
translated: That is not good, because we do not assert that application and conclusion are different parts.

original: de dag sbyar bar mi bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de dag sbyar bar mi bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: But it is not that they should not be applied.

original: kho bo cag sangs rgyas pa dag nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag yan lag gsum po phyogs dang / gtan tshigs dang / dpe de dag las gzhan nyid du mi 'dod pas yan lag lngar ni mi smya mod kyi 'on kyang nye bar sbyar ba dang /
analyzed: kho bo cag sangs rgyas pa dag nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag yan lag gsum po phyogs dang / gtan tshigs dang / dpe de dag las gzhan nyid du mi 'dod pas yan lag lngar ni mi smya mod kyi 'on kyang nye bar sbyar ba dang /
translated: We Buddhists do not assert that the application and conclusion are different from the three members, the position, reason and example, and therefore we do not say that there are five members.

original: mjug bsdu ba dag sbyar bar mi bya ba ni ma yin pas kho bo cag gis nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag byas pa mi rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba dag sbyar bar mi bya ba ni ma yin pas kho bo cag gis nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag byas pa mi rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that the application and conclusion should not be applied, and therefore it is not incorrect for us to use the words application and conclusion.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya bas ni gal te nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag ma smos na sbyor ba gang la gtan tshigs ma smos par chos mthun pa'i dpe dang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa de dag la dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs gyi  don gsal bar mi 'gyur bas de dag la nye bar
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya bas ni gal te nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag ma smos na sbyor ba gang la gtan tshigs ma smos par chos mthun pa'i dpe dang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa de dag la dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs gyi  don gsal bar mi 'gyur bas de dag la nye bar
translated: Otherwise indicates that if the application and the conclusion were not mentioned, then in whatever application where the reason is not mentioned, only the concordant example and the discordant example exist, and since the meaning of the reason of the thesis would not be clearly stated, it is necessary to apply the application and the conclusion to those.

original: sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu bdag sbyar bar bya dgos par ston to //
analyzed: sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu bdag sbyar bar bya dgos par ston to //
translated: This is taught.

original: de la sbyor ba gang la chos mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa la nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag ma sbyar ba dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar mi 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba gang la chos mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa la nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag ma sbyar ba dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar mi 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that in whatever application where only the concordant example exists, if the application and the conclusion are not applied, the meaning of the reason of the thesis will not be clearly stated, it is said:

original: gang la chos mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa la sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la chos mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa la sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Whatever has only a concordant example, like sound, is impermanent because it is produced.

original: byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
analyzed: byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
translated: That which is produced is seen to be impermanent,

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no /
translated: like, for example, a pot.

original: sgra yang de bzhin pas de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bya ba dag la dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sgra yang de bzhin pas de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bya ba dag la dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In that syllogism, the meaning of the statement of the reason is not clear.

original: sbyor ba gang la chos mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa 'di lta ste sgra ni mi rtag ste /🔽dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu de la ni nye bar sbyar bas sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba gang la chos mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa 'di lta ste sgra ni mi rtag ste / dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu de la ni nye bar sbyar bas sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In a syllogism that has only a concordant example, such as “The subject, sound, is impermanent

original: byas pa ni mi rtag @279b par mthong ste /🔽dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byas pa ni mi rtag @279b par mthong ste / dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: because of being produced,” the meaning of the statement of the reason is clear.🔽In that syllogism, the meaning of the statement of the reason is clear because the meaning of the statement of the reason is stated in the proof statement, “The subject, sound, is impermanent because of being produced.”

original: sgra yang de bzhin pas zhes nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yang byas la mjug bsdu bas de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes mjug bsdus na dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sgra yang de bzhin pas zhes nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yang byas la mjug bsdu bas de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes mjug bsdus na dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: The meaning of the statement of the reason is stated in the proof statement, “The subject, sound, is impermanent because of being produced,” because the meaning of the statement of the reason is stated in the proof statement, “The subject, sound, is impermanent because of being produced.”🔽In a syllogism that has only a concordant example, such as “The subject, sound, is impermanent because of being produced,” the meaning of the statement of the reason is clear because the meaning of the statement of the reason is stated in the proof statement, “The subject, sound, is impermanent because of being produced.”🔽In a syllogism that has only a concordant example, such as “The subject, sound, is impermanent because of being produced,” the meaning of the statement of the reason is clear because the meaning of the statement of the reason is stated in the proof statement, “The subject, sound, is impermanent because of being produced.”

original: de la nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag ma sbyar na dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag ma sbyar na dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the words “in the same way” and “in all ways” are not applied, how can the meaning of the proof statement be clarified?

original: de bas na sbyor ba gang la chos mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa la nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag sbyar bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: de bas na sbyor ba gang la chos mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa la nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag sbyar bar bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, in any syllogism where there is only a similar example, the words “in the same way” and “in all ways” must be applied.

original: de bzhin du sbyor ba gang la chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa la yang nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba dag ma sbyar na dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar mi 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du gang la chos
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyor ba gang la chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa la yang nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba dag ma sbyar na dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar mi 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du gang la chos
translated: In the same way, in any syllogism where there is only a dissimilar example, if the words “in the same way” and “in all ways” are not applied, the meaning of the proof statement will not be clarified. To demonstrate this, the text says, “In the same way, in any syllogism where there is only a dissimilar example . . .”

original: mi mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa la sgra me rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa la sgra me rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The syllogism is: “The sound of a conch is permanent because it is produced.”

original: ma byas pa ni rtag par mthong ste dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: ma byas pa ni rtag par mthong ste dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: “That which is not produced is seen to be permanent, like space.”

original: sgra ni de ltar ma byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni de ltar ma byas pa ma yin te /
translated: “The sound of a conch is not like that; it is not unproduced.”

original: de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bya ba dag la dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs gyi don ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bya ba dag la dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs gyi don ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus, how could the meaning of the reason that is the thesis “because it is produced” be clarified?🔽In a syllogism where there is only an example that is dissimilar to the subject, as in the case of the syllogism “The subject, sound, is impermanent because of being produced,” the meaning of the reason that is the thesis is clarified by the application and the conclusion.

original: sbyor ba gang la chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa 'di lta ste sgra ni mi rtag ste dper na nam mkha' rtag pa lta bu ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu de la yang nye bar sbyar bas sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i
analyzed: sbyor ba gang la chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa 'di lta ste sgra ni mi rtag ste dper na nam mkha' rtag pa lta bu ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu de la yang nye bar sbyar bas sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i
translated: The application is “Sound is impermanent because of being produced.

original: phyir ro // ma byas pa ni rtag par mthong ste /
analyzed: phyir ro // ma byas pa ni rtag par mthong ste /
translated: That which is not produced is seen to be permanent,

original: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: like space.”

original: sgra ni de ltar ma byas pa ma yin te byas pa yin pas zhes nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yang byas la /
analyzed: sgra ni de ltar ma byas pa ma yin te byas pa yin pas zhes nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yang byas la /
translated: The application is “Sound is not like that, not being unproduced but being produced.”

original: mjug bsdu bas de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes mjug bsdus nas dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mjug bsdu bas de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes mjug bsdus nas dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: The conclusion is “Because it is produced, it is impermanent.” Thus, the meaning of the reason that is the thesis is clarified by the conclusion.

original: de la nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag ma sbyar ba dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag ma sbyar ba dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: How could the meaning of the thesis-statement be made clear without the words “in relation to” and “in conclusion”?

original: de bas na sbyor ba gang la chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa la yang nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag sbyar bar bya dgos so //🔽de lta bu dang mthun pa'i don gyi tshig dag la dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba gang la chos mthun pa'i dpe'am /
analyzed: de bas na sbyor ba gang la chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa la yang nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag sbyar bar bya dgos so // de lta bu dang mthun pa'i don gyi tshig dag la dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba gang la chos mthun pa'i dpe'am /
translated: Therefore, in any syllogism in which there is only an example that is similar to the predicate, the words “in relation to” and “in conclusion” must be supplied.🔽How could the meaning of the thesis-statement be made clear in a syllogism in which there are only words that have a meaning that is similar to that?

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa de lta bu dang mthun pa sbyor ba gang la dam bcas pa'i don gyi tshig nyi tshe yod pa la gtan tshigs dngos su ma smos pa @280a * //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa de lta bu dang mthun pa sbyor ba gang la dam bcas pa'i don gyi tshig nyi tshe yod pa la gtan tshigs dngos su ma smos pa @280a * //
translated: This means that in any syllogism in which there is only an example that is similar to the predicate, or only an example that is dissimilar to the predicate, or only words that have a meaning that is similar to the meaning of the thesis, the reason is not explicitly stated.

original: dag la gal te nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag ma smos na dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar mi 'gyur bas de dag la ni nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag sbyar bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: dag la gal te nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag ma smos na dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar mi 'gyur bas de dag la ni nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag sbyar bar bya dgos so //
translated: If the words of application and conclusion are not stated in regard to them, then the meaning of the thesis and reason would not be clear, so the words of application and conclusion must be added to them.

original: sbyor ba'i tshig dag la ni de dag mi dgos te /🔽don med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni sbyor ba'i tshig gang dag la yang yan lag gsum tshang bar yod pa 'di lta ste sgra ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i tshig dag la ni de dag mi dgos te / don med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni sbyor ba'i tshig gang dag la yang yan lag gsum tshang bar yod pa 'di lta ste sgra ni mi rtag ste /
translated: But they are not necessary in the words of the proof.🔽Because they are meaningless.

original: byas pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu dag la ni nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba de dag mi dgos te /
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu dag la ni nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba de dag mi dgos te /
translated: The words of the proof that have all three members complete, such as “Sound is impermanent because it is produced, like a pot,” do not need those words of application and conclusion.

original: 'di ltar gtan tshigs nyid kyi nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag smos zin pas de dag smos pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gtan tshigs nyid kyi nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag smos zin pas de dag smos pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the words of application and conclusion are already stated in the reason itself, it is meaningless to state them again.

original: yan lag lngar smra ba dag na re yan lag gsum nyid du mi rigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yan lag lngar smra ba dag sangs rgyas pa yan lag gsum du smra bar mi rigs par sun 'byin pa'i gzhung ston te /
analyzed: yan lag lngar smra ba dag na re yan lag gsum nyid du mi rigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yan lag lngar smra ba dag sangs rgyas pa yan lag gsum du smra bar mi rigs par sun 'byin pa'i gzhung ston te /
translated: The five-part argument is as follows: It is not logical to have only three parts, etc. This is the text of the refutation of the five-part argument that it is not logical for the Buddhist to have a three-part argument.

original: de dag na re sbyor ba gang la sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes yan lag gsum char tshang ba yod du zin kyang de la nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag med na dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag na re sbyor ba gang la sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes yan lag gsum char tshang ba yod du zin kyang de la nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag med na dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that even if the three parts are complete in the argument, “Sound is impermanent because it is produced, like a pot,” if the application and the conclusion are not there, the meaning of the thesis and the reason are not clearly stated.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba chos 'ba' zhig la gtan tshigs brjod na ni dpe la de med pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba chos 'ba' zhig la gtan tshigs brjod na ni dpe la de med pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, if the reason is stated only for the property of the thesis, it is not shared because it does not exist in the example.

original: bsgrub par bya ba tshes ni sgra mi rtag ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba tshes ni sgra mi rtag ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The property of the thesis is “Sound is impermanent.”

original: de 'ba' zhig la gtan tshigs byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de brjod na ni dpe bum pa zhes bya ba la sgra'i byas pa rkan dang mchu dang lce la sogs pas byas pa de med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs de bsgrub par bya ba chos dang dpe gnyi
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig la gtan tshigs byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de brjod na ni dpe bum pa zhes bya ba la sgra'i byas pa rkan dang mchu dang lce la sogs pas byas pa de med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs de bsgrub par bya ba chos dang dpe gnyi
translated: If you say, “Because it is a reason that is only applied to that,” then the example, “like a pot,” is not established because the sound’s being produced by the palate, lips, tongue, and so on is not established.

original: ga'i thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas des dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ga'i thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas des dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that reason is not common to both the predicate and the example, it does not clarify the meaning of the thesis.

original: de la nye bar sbyar bas 'di na gang byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
analyzed: de la nye bar sbyar bas 'di na gang byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
translated: In that case, the application is, “Whatever is produced is seen to be impermanent.

original: dper na bum pa 'jim pa dang dbyu gu dang 'khor lo la sogs pas byas pa mi rtag pa de bzhin du sgra yang rkan dang mchu dang lce la sogs pas byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pas zhes nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba byas la /
analyzed: dper na bum pa 'jim pa dang dbyu gu dang 'khor lo la sogs pas byas pa mi rtag pa de bzhin du sgra yang rkan dang mchu dang lce la sogs pas byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pas zhes nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba byas la /
translated: For example, a pot, which is produced by clay, a stick, a wheel, and so on, is impermanent. Likewise, sound is impermanent because it is produced by the palate, lips, tongue, and so on.”

original: mjug bsdu bas kyang de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bsnan na dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir nye bar sbyar ba dang @280b mjug bsdu ba gnyis kyang yan lag re rer gzhag dgos so zhes zer ro //🔽dpe'i chos 'ba' zhig la gtan tshigs brjod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni gal te khyed sangs rgyas pas /
analyzed: mjug bsdu bas kyang de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bsnan na dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir nye bar sbyar ba dang @280b mjug bsdu ba gnyis kyang yan lag re rer gzhag dgos so zhes zer ro // dpe'i chos 'ba' zhig la gtan tshigs brjod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni gal te khyed sangs rgyas pas /
translated: If one adds that, then the meaning of the syllogism would be clearly stated, and therefore the application and the summary would also have to be posited as separate members.🔽If the reason is stated only with respect to the property of the example, then the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: dpe'i chos bum pa 'ba' zhig la byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de brjod na ni sgra mi rtag bar bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: dpe'i chos bum pa 'ba' zhig la byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de brjod na ni sgra mi rtag bar bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: If you Buddhists state the reason, “because it is a product,” only with respect to the property of the example, a pot, then the meaning of the reason, “because it is a product,” in the proof that sound is impermanent is not established.

original: 'di ltar bum pa la 'jim pa dang dbyu gu dang 'khor lo la sogs pas byas pa yod pa de sgra la med pas bum pa 'jim pa dang / dbyu gu dang 'khor lo la sogs pas byas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi sgra mi rtag par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa la 'jim pa dang dbyu gu dang 'khor lo la sogs pas byas pa yod pa de sgra la med pas bum pa 'jim pa dang / dbyu gu dang 'khor lo la sogs pas byas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi sgra mi rtag par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, since a vase is produced by clay, a stick, a wheel, and so on, but sound is not, the reason that a vase is produced by clay, a stick, a wheel, and so on does not make sound impermanent.

original: de la nye bar sbyar bas 'di na gang byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
analyzed: de la nye bar sbyar bas 'di na gang byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
translated: In that case, the application is “Whatever is produced is seen to be impermanent,

original: dper na bum pa 'jim pa dang dbyu gu dang 'khor lo la sogs pas byas pa mi rtag pa de bzhin du sgra yang rkan dang mchu dang lce la sogs pas byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pas zhes nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba byas la /
analyzed: dper na bum pa 'jim pa dang dbyu gu dang 'khor lo la sogs pas byas pa mi rtag pa de bzhin du sgra yang rkan dang mchu dang lce la sogs pas byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pas zhes nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba byas la /
translated: for example, a vase produced by clay, a stick, a wheel, and so on is impermanent. In the same way, sound is impermanent because it is produced by the palate, lips, tongue, and so on.”

original: mjug bsdu bas kyang de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bsnan na dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir yang nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba gnyis yan lag 'dir gzhag dgos so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mjug bsdu bas kyang de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bsnan na dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir yang nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba gnyis yan lag 'dir gzhag dgos so zhes bstan to //
translated: The summary also states that because of that, it is impermanent, and if one adds because of that, the meaning of the argument of thesis becomes clear. Therefore, it is taught that both the application and the summary must be posited as branches here.

original: spyi'i chos la gtan tshigs brjod na ni rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa don med do //🔽dpe'i chos la yang spyir bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gal te khyed sangs rgyas pas /
analyzed: spyi'i chos la gtan tshigs brjod na ni rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa don med do // dpe'i chos la yang spyir bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gal te khyed sangs rgyas pas /
translated: If one states the reason for a general property, demonstrating the pervasion is pointless.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgra dang / dpe'i chos bum pa gnyi ga la spyir byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de brjod na ni 'di na gang byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgra dang / dpe'i chos bum pa gnyi ga la spyir byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de brjod na ni 'di na gang byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
translated: Because the example property is also taught generally, if you Buddhists state that reason because both the property to be proven, sound, and the example property, pot, are made, then demonstrating the pervasion Whatever is made is seen to be impermanent,

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: like a pot.🔽Sound is also like that is pointless.

original: sgra yang de bzhin pas zhes rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa de don med de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sgra yang de bzhin pas zhes rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa de don med de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de dpe'i chos bum pa la yang spyir bstan pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgra dang / dpe'i chos bum pa gnyi ga 'dra bas bum pa'i dpes sgra mtshon pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de dpe'i chos bum pa la yang spyir bstan pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgra dang / dpe'i chos bum pa gnyi ga 'dra bas bum pa'i dpes sgra mtshon pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The reason “because of being produced” is stated in general with respect to the example property vase, and because the property of the thesis sound and the example property vase are similar, it would be pointless to illustrate sound with the example of a vase.

original: de la yang byas pa spyir ma brjod par nye bar sbyar bas 'di na gang byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
analyzed: de la yang byas pa spyir ma brjod par nye bar sbyar bas 'di na gang byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
translated: Moreover, without stating the general “produced,” the application would be “Whatever is produced is seen to be impermanent,

original: dper na bum pa 'jim pa dang dbyu gu dang 'khor lo la sogs pas byas pa mi rtag pa de bzhin du sgra yang rkan dang mchu dang lce la sogs pas byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pas zhes nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba byas la @281a * //
analyzed: dper na bum pa 'jim pa dang dbyu gu dang 'khor lo la sogs pas byas pa mi rtag pa de bzhin du sgra yang rkan dang mchu dang lce la sogs pas byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pas zhes nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba byas la @281a * //
translated: like a vase, which is produced by clay, a stick, a wheel, and so on, and is impermanent. In the same way, sound is impermanent because it is produced by the palate, lips, tongue, and so on.”

original: mjug bsdu bas kyang de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bsnan na dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir yang nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba gnyis yan lag re rer gzhag dgos so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mjug bsdu bas kyang de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bsnan na dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir yang nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba gnyis yan lag re rer gzhag dgos so zhes bstan to //
translated: If you were to add “because it is impermanent,” then the meaning of the argument of the thesis would be clarified, and for that reason also it is necessary to posit both the application and the summary as individual parts.

original: dpe la gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba yod pa nyid du ston na ni ba sgrub par bya ba la yang de dang 'brel pa bstan pa'i tshig gzhan brjod dgos so zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: dpe la gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba yod pa nyid du ston na ni ba sgrub par bya ba la yang de dang 'brel pa bstan pa'i tshig gzhan brjod dgos so zhes bya bas ni /
translated: If you were to demonstrate that the example possesses the forward pervasion, then you would have to state another sentence that demonstrates the connection between the example and the probandum.

original: gal te khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'di skad ces bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang / dpe'i chos gnyi ga la yang byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs spyir 'dra bar yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'di skad ces bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang / dpe'i chos gnyi ga la yang byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs spyir 'dra bar yod mod kyi /
translated: If you Buddhists were to say, “Although in general the property of the subject and the example both possess the reason ‘because it is produced,’

original: 'on kyang sbyor bar bya ba'i dus na dpe la gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba yod pa nyid du bstan dgos kyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang sbyor bar bya ba'i dus na dpe la gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba yod pa nyid du bstan dgos kyi /
translated: nevertheless, when the application is made, it is necessary to demonstrate that the example possesses the forward pervasion.

original: bsgrub par bya ba la mi dgos so zhes ston na ni de lta na ji ltar dpe la 'di na gang byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba la mi dgos so zhes ston na ni de lta na ji ltar dpe la 'di na gang byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
translated: If you say that the example is not necessary for the proof, then how is it that the pervasion is indicated in the example, “Whatever is produced is seen to be impermanent,

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba la yang 'di na gang byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba la yang 'di na gang byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
translated: like a pot,” and in the same way, the pervasion is indicated in the proof, “Whatever is produced is seen to be impermanent,

original: dper na sgra bzhin no zhes gtan tshigs de dang 'brel pa bstan pa'i tshig gzhan brjod dgos pa zhig na /
analyzed: dper na sgra bzhin no zhes gtan tshigs de dang 'brel pa bstan pa'i tshig gzhan brjod dgos pa zhig na /
translated: like sound.” If you say that you must state another reason that is related to that,

original: khyed de yang ni brjod pas des na bsgrub par bya ba'i gtan tshigs smos nas dpes rjes su 'gro ba mjug bsdu ba bstan dgos pas de'i phyir yang nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba gnyis yan lag re rer gzhag dgos so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: khyed de yang ni brjod pas des na bsgrub par bya ba'i gtan tshigs smos nas dpes rjes su 'gro ba mjug bsdu ba bstan dgos pas de'i phyir yang nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba gnyis yan lag re rer gzhag dgos so zhes bstan to //
translated: then you must state the reason in the proof and indicate the conclusion by means of the example. Therefore you must posit both the application and the conclusion as individual members.

original: gal te dam bcas pa'i mjug thogs su smos pas bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel par 'grub po zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag gis sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: gal te dam bcas pa'i mjug thogs su smos pas bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel par 'grub po zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag gis sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: this is a statement anticipating the qualm of a Buddhist opponent.

original: gal te khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'di skad ces /🔽sgra mi rtag ste zhes dam bcas pa'i mjug thogs su byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs smos pas bsgrub par bya ba chos dang 'brel par 'grub pa'i phyir sbyor ba gang la yan lag gsum tshang bar brjod pa de la nye bar sbyar ba dang
analyzed: gal te khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'di skad ces / sgra mi rtag ste zhes dam bcas pa'i mjug thogs su byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs smos pas bsgrub par bya ba chos dang 'brel par 'grub pa'i phyir sbyor ba gang la yan lag gsum tshang bar brjod pa de la nye bar sbyar ba dang
translated: If you Buddhists say,

original: mjug bsdu ba dag sbyar mi dgos so zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba dag sbyar mi dgos so zhes zer na'o //
translated: because the reason “because it is a product” is stated immediately after the thesis “Sound is impermanent,” the probandum is related to the property of the subject, then in a syllogism in which all three members are stated, it is unnecessary to state the application and the conclusion.

original: de'i lan du de lta na sgra ni mi rtag ste mig gi gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i lan du de lta na sgra ni mi rtag ste mig gi gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, “In that case, it would also be established that sound is impermanent because it is perceived by the eye.”

original: gal te dam bcas pa'i mjug thogs su smos pa kun bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa 'grub na ni de lta na kha cig gis sgra mi rtag ste zhes dam bcas @281b pa'i mjug thogs su de'i gtan tshigs mig gi gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes
analyzed: gal te dam bcas pa'i mjug thogs su smos pa kun bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa 'grub na ni de lta na kha cig gis sgra mi rtag ste zhes dam bcas @281b pa'i mjug thogs su de'i gtan tshigs mig gi gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes
translated: If it were the case that the statement following the thesis were established as related to the probandum, then in that case, someone could state “Sound is impermanent” and then state “The reason is because it is perceived by the eye,”

original: bya ba yang bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel par grub pa zhig na de ni mi 'grub pas de'i phyir nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba dag sbyar dgos so //
analyzed: bya ba yang bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel par grub pa zhig na de ni mi 'grub pas de'i phyir nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba dag sbyar dgos so //
translated: and that would be established as related to the probandum. But since that is not established, therefore the application and the conclusion must be applied.

original: grags pa de dang 'brel par 'grub pa nyid du rtog na ni zhes bya ba yang pha rol pos /🔽sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: grags pa de dang 'brel par 'grub pa nyid du rtog na ni zhes bya ba yang pha rol pos /🔽sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: If you imagine that it is established as related to that which is renowned,🔽then the opponent raises an objection.

original: gal te khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'di snyam du sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu sgra'i chos mi rtag pa yin par grags pa ni dam bcas pa'i mjug thogs su smos pas bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel bar 'grub kyi
analyzed: gal te khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'di snyam du sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu sgra'i chos mi rtag pa yin par grags pa ni dam bcas pa'i mjug thogs su smos pas bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel bar 'grub kyi
translated: If you Buddhists think, “In a case like ‘Sound is impermanent because it is produced,’ the property of sound, impermanence, is renowned, and so it is established as related to the predicate by being stated immediately after the thesis.

original: / sgra ni mi rtag ste mig gi gzung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu sgra'i chos mig gi gzung ba yin par ma grags pa ni mjug thogs su smos su zin kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel par mi 'grub bo snyam du rtog🔽na'o // de'i lan du /
analyzed: / sgra ni mi rtag ste mig gi gzung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu sgra'i chos mig gi gzung ba yin par ma grags pa ni mjug thogs su smos su zin kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel par mi 'grub bo snyam du rtog na'o // de'i lan du /
translated: But in a case like ‘Sound is impermanent because it is not apprehended by the eye,’ the property of sound, not being apprehended by the eye, is not renowned. Even though it is stated immediately after the predicate, it is not established as related to the predicate,’”

original: khyed kyi dpe la yang de bzhin du 'gyur te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: khyed kyi dpe la yang de bzhin du 'gyur te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: then in response to that, Bhāviveka says, “In the same way, your example would also be . . .”

original: bsgrub par bya ba chos la gtan tshigs grags pa de dang 'brel par 'grub pa nyid du rtog na de lta na yang khyed sangs rgyas pa dag gi dpe bum pa la yang gtan tshigs byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba grags pa de dang 'brel par 'grub par
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba chos la gtan tshigs grags pa de dang 'brel par 'grub pa nyid du rtog na de lta na yang khyed sangs rgyas pa dag gi dpe bum pa la yang gtan tshigs byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba grags pa de dang 'brel par 'grub par
translated: If you think that the proof is established in relation to the property to be established, then in that case, the proof would be established in relation to the property to be established, because you Buddhists use the example of a pot.

original: 'gyur ro // de lta na bum pa la sogs pa dag byas pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de lta na bum pa la sogs pa dag byas pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that case, pots and so on would be understood to be produced,🔽but sound would not be understood to be produced.

original: sgra ni byas pa nyid du mi rtogs so zhes bya ba ni de ltar khyed kyi dpe la grags pa de dang 'brel par 'grub pa nyid du rtogs na /🔽byas pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba des bum pa la sogs pa dpe dag byas pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sgra ni byas pa nyid du mi rtogs so zhes bya ba ni de ltar khyed kyi dpe la grags pa de dang 'brel par 'grub pa nyid du rtogs na / byas pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba des bum pa la sogs pa dpe dag byas pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If you think that the proof is established in relation to the example,🔽then the error would arise that pots and so on would be understood to be produced,🔽but sound would not be understood to be produced, by the statement “Because it is produced, like a pot.”

original: sgra ni byas pa nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas de'i phyir yan lag lnga char sbyar dgos so //
analyzed: sgra ni byas pa nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas de'i phyir yan lag lnga char sbyar dgos so //
translated: Therefore, all five parts must be applied.

original: nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba dag yan lag gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba dag yan lag gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Application and conclusion are not separate members,🔽because there is no difference in meaning, just as a reason itself is.

original: don la khyad par med pa'i phyir dper na gtan tshigs nyid bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba yang pha rol bos sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: don la khyad par med pa'i phyir dper na gtan tshigs nyid bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba yang pha rol bos sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is a statement anticipating the opponent’s doubt,

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /🔽gal te khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'di skad ces dper na gtan tshigs byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs nyid kyi don las khyad par med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid las yan @282a * //
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / gal te khyed sangs rgyas pa dag 'di skad ces dper na gtan tshigs byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs nyid kyi don las khyad par med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid las yan @282a * //
translated: because they are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the proving property, and the example, respectively.

original: lag gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag kyang gtan tshigs kyi don las khyad par med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs las yan lag gzhan ma yin no zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: lag gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag kyang gtan tshigs kyi don las khyad par med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs las yan lag gzhan ma yin no zhes zer na'o //
translated: If you Buddhists say, “For example, because it is a reason, it is not a separate member from the reason itself, because there is no difference in meaning from the meaning of the reason itself,” then in the same way, application and conclusion are not separate members from the reason, because there is no difference in meaning from the meaning of the reason.

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: de la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: it is said that the meaning of the reason is not established and so on.

original: de skad ces zer na khyed sangs rgyas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don las khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub pa nyid yin pas nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag yan lag gzhan ma yin te zhes bsgrub par bya ba de mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de skad ces zer na khyed sangs rgyas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don las khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub pa nyid yin pas nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag yan lag gzhan ma yin te zhes bsgrub par bya ba de mi 'grub po //
translated: If you say that, then because there is no difference between the meaning of the Buddhist reason and yours, that is not established. Therefore, the application and the conclusion are not other parts. Thus, the probandum is not established.

original: ci'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ce na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ce na //
translated: Why is the meaning of the reason not established?

original: de'i phyir nye bar sbyar bas bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa gtan tshigs ma brjod kyang gcig tu byed pa'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs grub na yang smos pas mjug bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar sbyar bas bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa gtan tshigs ma brjod kyang gcig tu byed pa'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs grub na yang smos pas mjug bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that although the probandum and the proof, the reason, are not stated, they are made into one, and even if the reason is established, the conclusion is stated by mentioning it.

original: nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor bas ni sgra mi rtag ste zhes bsgrub par bya ba dang / byas pa nyid ces bya ba sgrub pa'i chos de nyid gtan tshigs byas pa'i phyir zhes dngos su ma brjod kyang /
analyzed: nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor bas ni sgra mi rtag ste zhes bsgrub par bya ba dang / byas pa nyid ces bya ba sgrub pa'i chos de nyid gtan tshigs byas pa'i phyir zhes dngos su ma brjod kyang /
translated: In the application of application, the probandum is sound is impermanent and the property of the proband that is explicitly stated is not the reason, namely, because it is produced.

original: gang dang gang byas pa de dang de ni mi rtag ste dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya bas gcig tu 'brel par byed pa'i phyir nye bar sbyar ba dang gtan tshigs dag don la khyad par yod la /
analyzed: gang dang gang byas pa de dang de ni mi rtag ste dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya bas gcig tu 'brel par byed pa'i phyir nye bar sbyar ba dang gtan tshigs dag don la khyad par yod la /
translated: However, since it is related in the sense that whatever is produced is impermanent, like a pot, the application and the reason are different in meaning.🔽Also, when the reason because it is produced is stated and established, the conclusion is stated in the sense that it is impermanent because it is produced.

original: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs brjod cing grub na yang mjug bsdu bas de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes smos pas mjug bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir mjug bsdu ba dang gtan tshigs dag kyang don la khyad par yod pa'i phyir khyed sangs rgyas
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs brjod cing grub na yang mjug bsdu bas de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes smos pas mjug bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir mjug bsdu ba dang gtan tshigs dag kyang don la khyad par yod pa'i phyir khyed sangs rgyas
translated: Therefore, the conclusion and the reason are also different in meaning.

original: pa'i gtan tshigs don la khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma grub pas nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag yan lag gzhan ma yin te zhes bya bar bsgrub pa ma grub bo //
analyzed: pa'i gtan tshigs don la khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma grub pas nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag yan lag gzhan ma yin te zhes bya bar bsgrub pa ma grub bo //
translated: Because the reason “because there is no difference in fact” is not established, the application and the conclusion are not other branches, but the proof “because there is no difference in fact” is not established.

original: des na sangs rgyas pa dag yan lag gsum du smra ba ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas pa dag yan lag gsum du smra ba ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the Buddhists’ assertion of three branches is unreasonable.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary here says:

original: de la 'dir gtan tshigs spyir grags pa nyid brjod pas gtan tshigs phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga dang 'brel par 'grub po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de la 'dir gtan tshigs spyir grags pa nyid brjod pas gtan tshigs phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga dang 'brel par 'grub po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Here, by stating a reason that is generally accepted, the reason is established as related to both the position and the similar position.

original: des ni sngar pha rol po dag na re bsgrub par bya ba chos 'ba' zhig la gtan tshigs brjod na ni dpe la de med pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid do zhes zer ba @282b dang / dpe'i chos 'ba' zhig la gtan tshigs brjod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ba'i lan btab ste /
analyzed: des ni sngar pha rol po dag na re bsgrub par bya ba chos 'ba' zhig la gtan tshigs brjod na ni dpe la de med pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid do zhes zer ba @282b dang / dpe'i chos 'ba' zhig la gtan tshigs brjod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ba'i lan btab ste /
translated: This responds to the former statement of the counterparts that if the reason is stated only in regard to the predicate of the probandum, then it is not common because it does not exist in the example.🔽And it responds to the statement that if the reason is stated only in regard to the property of the example, then the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: sgra mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ni sgra dang bum pa gnyi ga la spyir grags pa nyid yin la de 'dir gtan tshigs nyid du brjod pas de ni sgra mi
analyzed: sgra mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ni sgra dang bum pa gnyi ga la spyir grags pa nyid yin la de 'dir gtan tshigs nyid du brjod pas de ni sgra mi
translated: The reason “because it is produced” in the statement “Sound is impermanent because it is produced, like a pot” is generally renowned in regard to both sound and a pot. Here, it is stated as the reason, and thus it is not the case that the reason is not common.

original: rtag ste zhes bya ba phyogs dang / dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga dang 'brel par grub pas thun mong ba nyid kyang yin la don ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
