analyzed: rtag ste zhes bya ba phyogs dang / dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga dang 'brel par grub pas thun mong ba nyid kyang yin la don ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: The term permanent is the position, and the term for example, like a pot is the similar position. Since both are related, it is common, and it is not the case that the meaning is not established.

original: dpe bstan pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The example is taught in order to understand the particular of the similar position.🔽Since the thesis is taught in order to understand the particular of the position, it is said, Therefore, the meaning of the reason is stated to be applied.

original: phyogs bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dam bcas pa bstan pa bzhin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don nyid nye bar sbyar bar brjod do zhes bya bas ni sngar pha rol po dag na re spyi'i chos la gtan tshigs brjod na ni rjes su 'gro🔽ba don med de /
analyzed: phyogs bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dam bcas pa bstan pa bzhin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don nyid nye bar sbyar bar brjod do zhes bya bas ni sngar pha rol po dag na re spyi'i chos la gtan tshigs brjod na ni rjes su 'gro ba don med de /
translated: Previously, the opponent said, If the reason is stated for a general property, then the pervasion is meaningless.🔽Because the example is also taught in general.

original: dpe'i chos la yang spyir bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de'i lan btab ste //
analyzed: dpe'i chos la yang spyir bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de'i lan btab ste //
translated: This is the response to that.

original: kho bo cag gis dpe ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis dpe ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
translated: Why do we teach the example?

original: dper na chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos kyi phyogs bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sgra ni mi rtag ste zhes dam bcas pa bstan pa de bzhin du sgra mi rtag pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes
analyzed: dper na chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos kyi phyogs bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sgra ni mi rtag ste zhes dam bcas pa bstan pa de bzhin du sgra mi rtag pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes
translated: Similarly, in order to understand the specific concordant example of the impermanence of sound, “It is like a pot” is stated.

original: bstan te / gang la bsgrub par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i gtan tshigs kyis khyad par byed pa de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe yin pas de'i phyir chos mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir dpe ston par byed de /
analyzed: bstan te / gang la bsgrub par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i gtan tshigs kyis khyad par byed pa de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe yin pas de'i phyir chos mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir dpe ston par byed de /
translated: Since that which is qualified by a reason that pervades the probandum is a concordant example, the example is taught in order to present the definition of a concordant example.

original: gang dang gang byas pa de dang de ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang byas pa de dang de ni mi rtag ste /
translated: Whatever is produced is impermanent.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpes phyogs kyi chos kyang rtogs pas nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor bas ni gtan tshigs kyi don nyid brjod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs spyir brjod kyang rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpes phyogs kyi chos kyang rtogs pas nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor bas ni gtan tshigs kyi don nyid brjod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs spyir brjod kyang rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa don med pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, it is like a pot.🔽Since the property of the position is also understood through this example, the statement of the reason is not meaningless because the meaning of the syllogism is stated by the statement of the syllogism.🔽Even though the reason is stated, the meaning of the thesis is not different, and that meaning is summarized by the conclusion, so the meaning of the reason is not unestablished.

original: gtan tshigs smos na yang dam bcas pa'i yan lag gi don tha mi dad pa'i phyir don de nyid mjug sdud pas byed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bas ni sngar pha rol po dag na re nye bar sbyar🔽ba dang mjug bsdu ba dag yan lag gzhan ma yin te /🔽don la khyad par med pa'i phyir dper na gtan tshigs nyid bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs smos na yang dam bcas pa'i yan lag gi don tha mi dad pa'i phyir don de nyid mjug sdud pas byed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bas ni sngar pha rol po dag na re nye bar sbyar🔽ba dang mjug bsdu ba dag yan lag gzhan ma yin te /🔽don la khyad par med pa'i phyir dper na gtan tshigs nyid bzhin no zhe na /
translated: The opponents say: The application and the conclusion are not different parts because there is no difference in meaning, for example, like the reason itself.

original: @283a * // de la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de nye bar sbyar bas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa gtan tshigs ma brjod kyang gcig tu byed pa'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs grub na yang smos pas mjug bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i lan btab ste /🔽byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs smos na yang ci ltar sgra mi rtag par dam bcas pa dang bum pa mi rtag par dam bcas pa'i yan lag gi don byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba la tha dad pa med
analyzed: @283a * // de la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de nye bar sbyar bas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa gtan tshigs ma brjod kyang gcig tu byed pa'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs grub na yang smos pas mjug bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i lan btab ste / byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs smos na yang ci ltar sgra mi rtag par dam bcas pa dang bum pa mi rtag par dam bcas pa'i yan lag gi don byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba la tha dad pa med
translated: The meaning of the reason is not unestablished because, although the probandum and the proof, the reason, are not stated, they are combined into one and because, even if the reason is established, the summary statement is stated by the reason.🔽  When the reason “because it is produced” is stated, then, just as the proposition “sound is impermanent” and the proposition “a vase is impermanent” are not different in terms of the probandum, the reason “because it is produced” is not different in terms of the probandum.

original: pas gtan tshigs kyi don de nyid mjug bsdu bas ston pa'i phyir gtan tshigs dang nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba dag don la khyad par med pa'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: pas gtan tshigs kyi don de nyid mjug bsdu bas ston pa'i phyir gtan tshigs dang nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba dag don la khyad par med pa'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the summary statement teaches the meaning of the reason, there is no difference in meaning between the reason and the summary statement. Therefore my reason is not unestablished.

original: yan lag gsum gyis bsgrub par bya ba grub na yan lag bzhi 'am lngar sbyor ba don med pas de ni lan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu bste /
analyzed: yan lag gsum gyis bsgrub par bya ba grub na yan lag bzhi 'am lngar sbyor ba don med pas de ni lan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu bste /
translated: The conclusion is: Since the proof of the probandum by three members is established, it is pointless to apply four or five members. Therefore, that is not a response.

original: kho bo cag gis bsgrubs pa ltar sgra mi rtag par bsgrub par bya ba yan lag gsum gyis ni khyod kyis yan lag bzhi 'am lngar brtag pa don med pas khyod na re yan lag gsum nyid du mi rigs te zhes zer ba de ni lan ma yin
analyzed: kho bo cag gis bsgrubs pa ltar sgra mi rtag par bsgrub par bya ba yan lag gsum gyis ni khyod kyis yan lag bzhi 'am lngar brtag pa don med pas khyod na re yan lag gsum nyid du mi rigs te zhes zer ba de ni lan ma yin
translated: Since the proof of the probandum, sound is impermanent, by three members is established, it is pointless to imagine four or five members. Therefore, your statement, “Three members alone are not logical,” is not a response.

original: no // grangs la sogs pa'i yan lag gi mtshan nyid ni dpyad par mi bya ste /
analyzed: no // grangs la sogs pa'i yan lag gi mtshan nyid ni dpyad par mi bya ste /
translated: The definition of the number of members and so on should not be analyzed,🔽because it would lead to absurd consequences.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni rigs pa'i bstan bcos la yan lag ji snyed kyis bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa de tsam zhig ston par zad kyi /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni rigs pa'i bstan bcos la yan lag ji snyed kyis bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa de tsam zhig ston par zad kyi /
translated: This says that in a treatise of reasoning, only as many members as are necessary to establish the probandum are taught.

original: yan lag gi grangs gsum dang bzhi dang lnga la sogs pa dag gi mtshan nyid mi dpyod pas 'dir yang yan lag gsum gyis bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa de tsam zhig smos par zad kyi /
analyzed: yan lag gi grangs gsum dang bzhi dang lnga la sogs pa dag gi mtshan nyid mi dpyod pas 'dir yang yan lag gsum gyis bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa de tsam zhig smos par zad kyi /
translated: Since the number of parts is not analyzed as three, four, five, and so on, here it is said that the probandum is established by just three parts.

original: gzhan du na ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas khyed rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las yan lag du 'dod pa dag kyang kho bo cag 'gog par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan du na ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas khyed rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las yan lag du 'dod pa dag kyang kho bo cag 'gog par mi byed do //
translated: Otherwise, there would be an absurd consequence. Therefore, we do not refute the number of parts asserted in your tenets.

original: 'di na bstan bcos byed pa'i tshig dag ni phal cher chos mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dang chos mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dang gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gsum gyis tha snyad byed de /
analyzed: 'di na bstan bcos byed pa'i tshig dag ni phal cher chos mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dang chos mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dang gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gsum gyis tha snyad byed de /
translated: Here, the words of the treatise are mostly expressed by means of three: the definition of a similar instance, the definition of a dissimilar instance, and the definition of a reason.

original: phyogs kyi chos nyid dang mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nyid dang mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa ste /
translated: The property of the subject and the pervasion are established by the definition of a similar instance and the definition of a dissimilar instance.

original: de'i phyir phyogs tsam zhig bstan to zhes bya bas ni 'jig rten 'di na bstan bcos byed pa'i tshig dag ni phal cher @283b chos mthun pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / chos mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa dang gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gsum gyis tha snyad byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs tsam zhig bstan to zhes bya bas ni 'jig rten 'di na bstan bcos byed pa'i tshig dag ni phal cher @283b chos mthun pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / chos mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa dang gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gsum gyis tha snyad byed de /
translated: In this world, the words of treatises are mostly expressed by the three characteristics of reasonings: the characteristic of a reason that is a property of the subject, the characteristic of a reason that is a positive entailment, and the characteristic of a reason that is a negative entailment.

original: gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gsum ni phyogs kyi chos nyid dang mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa ste /🔽de la phyogs kyi chos nyid kyis ni bsgrub par bya ba chos nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gsum ni phyogs kyi chos nyid dang mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa ste / de la phyogs kyi chos nyid kyis ni bsgrub par bya ba chos nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan pa /
translated: The three characteristics of a reason are the property of the subject, positive concomitance with the similar class, and the absence of the reason in the dissimilar class.🔽The property of the subject indicates a reason that is a property of the predicate of the proposition.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro bas ni chos mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro bas ni chos mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan /
translated: Positive concomitance with the similar class indicates a reason that is a positive entailment.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pas ni chos mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pas ni chos mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan te /
translated: The reason of dissimilar attributes is taught by the absence of the dissimilar class.

original: de ltar de dag gis yan lag gsum phyogs tsam zhig bstan pas pha rol po dag 'dod pa nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba zhes bya ba gnyis yan lag gsum las don gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gis yan lag gsum phyogs tsam zhig bstan pas pha rol po dag 'dod pa nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba zhes bya ba gnyis yan lag gsum las don gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since the three branches are merely taught in part, the two, the application and the conclusion, are not different in meaning from the three branches.🔽The two, the application and the conclusion, are not different in meaning from the three branches, but it is necessary to state them, and since those two are not different from the three branches, they are not posited as five branches.🔽The explanation of the topic at hand is sufficient.

original: zhar la bshad pas chog gi skabs nyid dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba gnyis yan lag gsum las don gzhan ma yin yang brjod par bya dgos pa dang / de gnyis yan lag gsum las gzhan ma yin pas yan lag lngar mi gzhag pa dpyad pa zhar la bshad pas chog gi 'du byed rnams ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub pa'i skabs nyid de phyad par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas chog gi skabs nyid dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba gnyis yan lag gsum las don gzhan ma yin yang brjod par bya dgos pa dang / de gnyis yan lag gsum las gzhan ma yin pas yan lag lngar mi gzhag pa dpyad pa zhar la bshad pas chog gi 'du byed rnams ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub pa'i skabs nyid de phyad par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to the explanation of the topic at hand, which is the proof that compounded phenomena are essenceless.

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa la /
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa la /
translated: Thus, in the demonstration of the inference that reveals realitylessness,🔽some say that the meaning of “realitylessness” is nonexistence, and that the meaning of “because of being a deceptive reality” is also nonexistence.

original: kha cig na re ngo bo nyid stong pa ni med pa'i don yin la slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang med pa'i phyir don de nyid yin pas dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir bsgrub pa gtan tshigs ma tshang ba nyid
analyzed: kha cig na re ngo bo nyid stong pa ni med pa'i don yin la slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang med pa'i phyir don de nyid yin pas dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir bsgrub pa gtan tshigs ma tshang ba nyid
translated: Since that is the meaning, it is a part of the meaning of the proposition, and the proof, the reason, is incomplete.🔽Since that is a fault, the desired meaning is not established.🔽The above is the statement of the opponent’s position.

original: kyi skyon yod pas 'dod pa'i don mi 'gyur bo zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni sngar dbu ma pas don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te /
analyzed: kyi skyon yod pas 'dod pa'i don mi 'gyur bo zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni sngar dbu ma pas don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te /
translated: The Madhyamika previously made the statement, “Ultimately, internal things are empty of reality,🔽because of being deceptive realities, like, for example, the body of a woman conjured up by a magician.”

original: slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes sbyor ba'i tshig byas pa de la pha rol po dag na re khyed kyis ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te zhes dam bcas pa de ni med pa'i
analyzed: slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes sbyor ba'i tshig byas pa de la pha rol po dag na re khyed kyis ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te zhes dam bcas pa de ni med pa'i
translated: The opponent says to the Madhyamika, “Your proposition, ‘Realityless,’ means nonexistence,

original: don yin la de bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang med pa'i phyir don de nyid yin pas dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir sgrub @284a * //
analyzed: don yin la de bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang med pa'i phyir don de nyid yin pas dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir sgrub @284a * //
translated: Since that is the case, the reason is incomplete because it is only part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: pa gtan tshigs ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod pas khyod dbu ma pa'i 'dod pa'i don nang gi dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid stong ba yin te zhes dam bcas pa de mi 'grub po zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: pa gtan tshigs ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod pas khyod dbu ma pa'i 'dod pa'i don nang gi dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid stong ba yin te zhes dam bcas pa de mi 'grub po zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, you Mādhyamikas do not establish the point you assert, namely, that internal things are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: gal te slu chos gang yin pa //
analyzed: gal te slu chos gang yin pa //
translated: If that which is a deceptive phenomenon

original: de brdzun de la ci zhig slu //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de brdzun de la ci zhig slu // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: is false, what is deceptive about it?

original: sngar kho bos 'dus byas gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa ste /
analyzed: sngar kho bos 'dus byas gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa ste /
translated: Previously I said, “Whatever is a conditioned thing is false,🔽because it is a deceptive phenomenon.”

original: slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni nang gi dngos po rnams so //
analyzed: slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni nang gi dngos po rnams so //
translated: “Conditioned thing” refers to internal things.

original: brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid stong pa ste /
analyzed: brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid stong pa ste /
translated: False means empty of intrinsic reality.

original: rnam par brtag pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par brtag pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is the emptiness of an imputed intrinsic reality.🔽The reason “because it is a deceptive phenomenon” proves the thesis that compounded phenomena are false,

original: slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni log par snang ba'i phyir dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes 'dus byas brdzun par dam bcas pa sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa
analyzed: slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni log par snang ba'i phyir dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes 'dus byas brdzun par dam bcas pa sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa
translated: because they are deceptive phenomena, like the body of a woman conjured up by a magician, because they appear falsely.

original: de la 'dir khyed na re brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid stong pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir khyed na re brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid stong pa ste /
translated: Here you may say, “False means empty of intrinsic reality.

original: med pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: med pa'i don yin la /
translated: It means nonexistent.

original: slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang brdzun pa dang med pa'i don yin pas dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir bsgrub pa gtan tshigs ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod pas 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub po zhes zer ba ni de
analyzed: slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang brdzun pa dang med pa'i don yin pas dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir bsgrub pa gtan tshigs ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod pas 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub po zhes zer ba ni de
translated: Because it is a deceptive phenomenon also means false and nonexistent. Therefore, since it is a part of the meaning of the thesis, the reason is incomplete and there is the fault that the thesis is not established. Therefore, the desired meaning is not established.”

original: lta ma yin te /
analyzed: lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gal te kho bo'i gtan tshigs slu ba'i chos zhes smos pa gang yin pa de brdzun pa dang med pa'i don yin na ni brdzun pa med pa de la ci zhig slu bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te kho bo'i gtan tshigs slu ba'i chos zhes smos pa gang yin pa de brdzun pa dang med pa'i don yin na ni brdzun pa med pa de la ci zhig slu bar 'gyur te /
translated: If what I call “deceptive phenomena” means false and nonexistent, then what is deceptive about that which is false and nonexistent?🔽If it is nonexistent, then there would not even be the term “deceptive phenomena.”

original: slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyang med pa zhig na kho bo'i gtan tshigs slu ba'i chos zhes smos pa gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa dang med pa'i don ma yin te /🔽log par snang ba'i don yin pas des na 'dus byas rnams ni rnam par brtag pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa ste /
analyzed: slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyang med pa zhig na kho bo'i gtan tshigs slu ba'i chos zhes smos pa gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa dang med pa'i don ma yin te / log par snang ba'i don yin pas des na 'dus byas rnams ni rnam par brtag pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa ste /
translated: But what I call “deceptive phenomena” does not mean false and nonexistent.

original: log par snang ba'i phyir dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul ba'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bstan pa'i gtan tshigs de dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig ma yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa gtan tshigs ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon med pas 'dod pa'i don
analyzed: log par snang ba'i phyir dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul ba'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bstan pa'i gtan tshigs de dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig ma yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa gtan tshigs ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon med pas 'dod pa'i don
translated: It means that which appears falsely. Therefore, the argument that “because they are deceptive phenomena, compounded phenomena are empty of the entity that is their conceived object” is not flawed by the fault of the nonestablishment of the reason, because the reason is not a part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: 'grub bo zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'grub bo zhes ston to //
translated: Thus the desired conclusion is established.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gal te dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don med pa nyid yin na de la ci zhig slu bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gal te dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don med pa nyid yin na de la ci zhig slu bar 'gyur /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says: If the meaning of the argument of the thesis is nonexistent, then what is there to deceive?

original: cung zad kyang slu bar mi 'gyur te med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva @284b bzhin pas 'dus byas pa rdzun pa zhes gsungs pa'i tshig nyid kyang med do zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /🔽gal te kho bos don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid stong ba yin te zhes dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don khyed zer ba ltar brdzun pa dang med pa nyid yin na de la
analyzed: cung zad kyang slu bar mi 'gyur te med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva @284b bzhin pas 'dus byas pa rdzun pa zhes gsungs pa'i tshig nyid kyang med do zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te / gal te kho bos don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid stong ba yin te zhes dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don khyed zer ba ltar brdzun pa dang med pa nyid yin na de la
translated: Nothing at all is deceived, because it is nonexistent, like the horn of a rabbit. Therefore, the words “Compounded phenomena are false” do not exist.

original: ci zhig slu bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci zhig slu bar 'gyur /
translated: If the meaning of the argument of the thesis “Ultimately, internal things are empty of essence” is false and nonexistent, as you say, then what is there to deceive?

original: cung zad kyang slu bar mi 'gyur te med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin pas de lta na /
analyzed: cung zad kyang slu bar mi 'gyur te med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin pas de lta na /
translated: Nothing at all is deceived, because it is nonexistent, like the horn of a rabbit. Therefore,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa'i tshig nyid kyang med do zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa'i tshig nyid kyang med do zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The Bhagavān’s statement that compounded phenomena are false is also nonexistent.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor bas glags yod pa'i tshig yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor bas glags yod pa'i tshig yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The words of the sūtra are to be applied to the subject, the predicate, the proof, the example, and the application.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva ni med pa'i phyir de la cung zad kyang slu ba yod par mi 'gyur bas ri bong gi rva log par snang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig nyid kyang med pa de bzhin du gal te kho bo'i dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs de'i
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva ni med pa'i phyir de la cung zad kyang slu ba yod par mi 'gyur bas ri bong gi rva log par snang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig nyid kyang med pa de bzhin du gal te kho bo'i dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs de'i
translated: For example, since the horn of a rabbit does not exist, it cannot deceive anyone in the least, and the words “The horn of a rabbit appears falsely” are also nonexistent.

original: don kyang khyed zer ba ltar med pa nyid yin na med pa'i phyir de la cung zad kyang slu ba yod par mi 'gyur bas 'dus byas brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa'i tshigs nyid kyang med pa zhig na de lta ma yin pas glags yod pa'i tshig de dag
analyzed: don kyang khyed zer ba ltar med pa nyid yin na med pa'i phyir de la cung zad kyang slu ba yod par mi 'gyur bas 'dus byas brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa'i tshigs nyid kyang med pa zhig na de lta ma yin pas glags yod pa'i tshig de dag
translated: If the meaning of “false” were as you say, namely, nonexistence, then because it would be nonexistent, it would not be deceptive in the least. Therefore, even the words “false” and “conditioned” would not exist. But this is not the case.

original: las bzlog pa skabs kyi don nyid bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: las bzlog pa skabs kyi don nyid bstan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the context should be explained in a way that avoids these fallacies.

original: de ltar glags yod pa'i tshig de dag las bzlog pas skabs kyi don nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar glags yod pa'i tshig de dag las bzlog pas skabs kyi don nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of the context in a way that avoids these fallacies, the text says:

original: de lta bas na brdzun pa dang slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa'i don ni med pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na brdzun pa dang slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa'i don ni med pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore the meaning of the statement “false and deceptive phenomena” is not nonexistence.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: de gnyis kyi don ni rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / log par snang ba yin pas dam bcas pa'i don ni phyogs gcig pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi don ni rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / log par snang ba yin pas dam bcas pa'i don ni phyogs gcig pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of these two is the emptiness of the imagined nature and the appearance of error. Therefore the meaning of the thesis is not one-sided.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas rnams brdzun pa dang slu ba'i chos yin no zhes gsungs pa'i don ni pha rol po dag zer ba ltar gtan med pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas rnams brdzun pa dang slu ba'i chos yin no zhes gsungs pa'i don ni pha rol po dag zer ba ltar gtan med pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the statement by the Bhagavat that compounded phenomena are false and deceptive phenomena is not that they are utterly nonexistent, as the opponent claims.

original: brdzun pa zhes bya ba'i don ni ngo bo nyid stong pa ste /
analyzed: brdzun pa zhes bya ba'i don ni ngo bo nyid stong pa ste /
translated: The meaning of false is empty of entityness.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus lta bu yin la slu ba zhes bya ba'i don ni log par snang ba ste sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med @285a * //🔽kyi lus log par snang ba lta bu yin pas kho bos don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te zhes dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs su slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes smos pa de dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus lta bu yin la slu ba zhes bya ba'i don ni log par snang ba ste sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med @285a * // kyi lus log par snang ba lta bu yin pas kho bos don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te zhes dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs su slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes smos pa de dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs
translated: The meaning of deceptive is that it appears falsely, like the body of a woman emanated by a magician.

original: gcig nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, we do not commit the fallacy of stating a reason that is only one part of the proposition when we say, “Because they are deceptive phenomena,” as a reason for our proposition, “Ultimately, internal things are empty of entityness.”

original: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid me yin pa'i gtan tshigs de yang rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba'i phyogs gnyi ga la grags pas gtan tshigs nyid du grub pas dbu ma pa'i 'dod pa'i don 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid me yin pa'i gtan tshigs de yang rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba'i phyogs gnyi ga la grags pas gtan tshigs nyid du grub pas dbu ma pa'i 'dod pa'i don 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The reason that fire is the one part of the meaning of the thesis is established as a reason because it is renowned to both parties in the debate, and therefore the meaning that the Madhyamika wishes to prove is established.

original: log par snang ba yang phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i phyir des na gtan tshigs ma tshang ba nyid med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: log par snang ba yang phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i phyir des na gtan tshigs ma tshang ba nyid med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because the appearance of the opposite is also renowned to both parties, therefore the reason is not incomplete, and the meaning that is wished to be proven is established.

original: gzhan yang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de gsungs pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de gsungs pa //
translated: Moreover, the Lord taught that

original: stong nyid yongs su ston pa yin //
analyzed: stong nyid yongs su ston pa yin //
translated: emptiness is the relinquishing of all views.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba de gsungs pa na stong pa nyid kyi don sten par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba de gsungs pa na stong pa nyid kyi don sten par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: When the Lord taught that which is called “deceptive phenomena,” he was teaching the meaning of emptiness.

original: dngos su stong pa nyid bstan pa ma yin pas de'i phyir yang kho bos don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i gtan tshigs su slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes smos pas de dam bcas
analyzed: dngos su stong pa nyid bstan pa ma yin pas de'i phyir yang kho bos don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i gtan tshigs su slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes smos pas de dam bcas
translated: Since emptiness is not actually taught, therefore, in order to state the reason for the thesis “ultimately, internal things are empty of essence,” Candrakīrti says, “because they are deceptive phenomena.”

original: pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig ma yin no zhes ston to//
analyzed: pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig ma yin no zhes ston to//
translated: This shows that it is not a partial thesis.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the valid cognition of that,

original: bcom ldan 'das nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rtsa ba dang bcas pa ma lus par drungs phyung bas slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba de gsungs pa ni stong pa nyid yongs su ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rtsa ba dang bcas pa ma lus par drungs phyung bas slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba de gsungs pa ni stong pa nyid yongs su ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: Candrakīrti says, “The statement ‘deceptive phenomena’ by the Transcendent Lord, who has completely uprooted all afflictive and non-afflictive obstructions along with their roots, is a teaching of emptiness.”

original: slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa ni de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir dper na smra ba pos phyogs 'di du ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes smras pas de me dang bcas pa nyid yin par ston pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa ni de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir dper na smra ba pos phyogs 'di du ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes smras pas de me dang bcas pa nyid yin par ston pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The statement that it is a deceptive phenomenon is like, for example, when a speaker says, This place has smoke, he shows that it has fire because fire is not absent when smoke is present.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are, respectively, the subject, the predicate to be proven, the proving property and the example.

original: dper na smra ba po 'ba' zhig gis sa phyogs 'di du ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes smras pa na /
analyzed: dper na smra ba po 'ba' zhig gis sa phyogs 'di du ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes smras pa na /
translated: For example, when a speaker says, This place has smoke,

original: du ba ni me de med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir tshig des phyogs de me dang bcas pa nyid yin par ston pa yin pa /
analyzed: du ba ni me de med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir tshig des phyogs de me dang bcas pa nyid yin par ston pa yin pa /
translated: because smoke is not absent when fire is present, that statement shows that that place has fire.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das sgrib pa gnyis bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par spangs pas 'du @285b byed rnams slu ba'i chos yin no zhes gsungs pa yang slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de med na mi 'byung ba
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das sgrib pa gnyis bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par spangs pas 'du @285b byed rnams slu ba'i chos yin no zhes gsungs pa yang slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de med na mi 'byung ba
translated: Likewise, the Bhagavān said, “Compounded phenomena are deceptive phenomena,” because he completely abandoned the two obscurations together with their traces.🔽The term “deceptive phenomena” refers to emptiness of essence, because they do not occur without it.

original: yin pa'i phyir slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa de stong pa nyid yongs su ston par byed pa yin pas des na kho bo don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i gtan tshigs su slu
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa de stong pa nyid yongs su ston par byed pa yin pas des na kho bo don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i gtan tshigs su slu
translated: Therefore, since the statement “Compounded phenomena are deceptive phenomena” reveals emptiness, we maintain that ultimately internal things are empty of essence.

original: ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes smos pa dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig ma yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa gtan tshigs ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon med pas kho bo'i 'dod pa'i don grub po //
analyzed: ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes smos pa dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig ma yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa gtan tshigs ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon med pas kho bo'i 'dod pa'i don grub po //
translated: The reason “because they are deceptive phenomena” is not a faulty reason that is incomplete with respect to the proposition, because it is not a part of the proposition.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa de ni yod mod kyi 'on kyang med pa'i don kyang ma yin la chos bdag med pa yongs su ston par byed pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa de ni yod mod kyi 'on kyang med pa'i don kyang ma yin la chos bdag med pa yongs su ston par byed pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Although the Lord did say that compounded phenomena are false, he did not mean that they are nonexistent, nor did he teach selflessness of phenomena.

original: pha rol po dag na re bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed rnams brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa'i lung de ni yod mod kyi /
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed rnams brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa'i lung de ni yod mod kyi /
translated: The opponent says, “Although there is a scripture in which the Lord said that compounded phenomena are false,

original: 'on kyang de'i don ni med pa nyid kyang ma yin la des chos bdag med pa yongs su ston par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i don ni med pa nyid kyang ma yin la des chos bdag med pa yongs su ston par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: the meaning of that scripture is not that they are nonexistent, nor does it teach selflessness of phenomena.

original: des ni dngos po rnams la gang zag ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: des ni dngos po rnams la gang zag ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: It teaches that persons are not inherently existent because

original: skad cig ma re re la gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: they appear to change from one moment to the next.

original: de lta bas na chos bdag med pa'i dngos po ni mi srid pas khyed dbu ma pas don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi
analyzed: de lta bas na chos bdag med pa'i dngos po ni mi srid pas khyed dbu ma pas don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi
translated: Therefore, since things that are the selflessness of phenomena are impossible, you Followers of the Middle Way say that ultimately inner entities are empty of their own entities because they are deceptive phenomena. You say this is similar to, for example, the body of a woman conjured up by a magician.

original: lus bzhin no zhes bya bas 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis de kho na'i don bstan pa mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston to /
analyzed: lus bzhin no zhes bya bas 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis de kho na'i don bstan pa mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston to /
translated: You say that the meaning of this statement is that you Followers of the Middle Way teach the meaning of suchness in an inappropriate way, by teaching that conditioned phenomena are not established from their own side.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs pas ni /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs pas ni /
translated: To teach that point, the Proponents of Consciousness say, “The Buddha said that all things are false,

original: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid med de //
analyzed: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid med de //
translated: Things are devoid of entityness

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //
translated: Because they appear to transform.

original: zhes bstan te gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bstan te gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: They say that this is because things appear to transform.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs pas ni dngos po rnams la gang zag ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs pas ni dngos po rnams la gang zag ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: The Transcendent Lord's statement that they are false indicates that persons are not intrinsically real in things.

original: 'di ltar dngos po rnams skad cig ma re re la gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rnams skad cig ma re re la gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is because it is seen that things change to another state at every moment.

original: de nyid bsnan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bsnan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to add to that,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni @286a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni @286a * //
translated: the Transcendent Lord's statement that they are false indicates that the unreality of things

original: nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: is definitely an unreality that does not endure.

original: brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa'i don ni dngos po rnams la gang zag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de /
analyzed: brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa'i don ni dngos po rnams la gang zag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de /
translated: The meaning of the statement that they are false is that persons are not intrinsically real in things.

original: de yang skad cig ma re re la gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur zhing nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan to//
analyzed: de yang skad cig ma re re la gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur zhing nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan to//
translated: That is taught to be an unreality that does not endure, changing to another state at every moment.

original: 'di ltar brtag par rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar brtag par rigs te /
translated: This is a proper analysis.

original: ngo bo nyid med dngos med de //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med dngos med de //
translated: Things that are unreal are not real.

original: zhes bya bas ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i dngos po ni mi srid pas gang zag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du brtag par rigs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i dngos po ni mi srid pas gang zag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du brtag par rigs so zhes bstan to //
translated: This shows that since it is impossible for things to be devoid of the reality of phenomena, it is reasonable to consider that the person is devoid of reality.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, “Well then, what?”

original: ngo bo nyid dam bcas pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dam bcas pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says, “The reality of phenomena is itself the thesis.”

original: chos kyi ngo bo nyid ni yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽khyed kyi lugs ltar na dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'gyur bas de ni mi rigs te zhes bya bas ni khyed dbu ma pas chos rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de ni chad pa'i mthar 'gyur bas mi rigs so
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo nyid ni yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // khyed kyi lugs ltar na dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'gyur bas de ni mi rigs te zhes bya bas ni khyed dbu ma pas chos rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de ni chad pa'i mthar 'gyur bas mi rigs so
translated: The meaning is that the reality of phenomena does exist.

original: zhes zer ba'i gzhung bstan to //
analyzed: zhes zer ba'i gzhung bstan to //
translated: “In your system, things would be devoid of reality. That is unreasonable” demonstrates the scriptural exegesis that states, “Since your teaching of the realitylessness of things would lead to the extreme of nihilism, it is unreasonable.”

original: ci'i phyir de mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it unreasonable?

original: gang phyir dngos rnams stong pa nyid //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos rnams stong pa nyid //
translated: He says, “Because things are emptiness.”

original: gang gi phyir dngos po rnams bdag dang bdag gi nyid dang bral ba de'i phyir stod pa nyid ces bya'i /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po rnams bdag dang bdag gi nyid dang bral ba de'i phyir stod pa nyid ces bya'i /
translated: Because things are devoid of self and being mine, therefore they are called “empty.”

original: dngos po med pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir dngos po yod par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir dngos po yod par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: But they are not nonexistent, therefore one should understand that things exist.

original: ci ste de ltar mi 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste de ltar mi 'dod na /
translated: But if you do not accept this,

original: gal te ngo bo nyid med na //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid med na //
translated: If they are essenceless,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
translated: whose is this transformation?

original: zhes bya ba ni ci ste chos kyi ngo bo nyid yod par mi 'dod de chos kyi ngo bo nyid med na byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / lod tsho dang / bar ma dang / gnas brtan la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bar mthong ba dag dngos po gang gi yin par brtag ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ci ste chos kyi ngo bo nyid yod par mi 'dod de chos kyi ngo bo nyid med na byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / lod tsho dang / bar ma dang / gnas brtan la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bar mthong ba dag dngos po gang gi yin par brtag ste /
translated: If you do not accept that the essence of things exists, then whose is this transformation that is seen, the transformation of the young, the old, the middle-aged, the child, the youth, the elder, and so on?

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba de dag kyang med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba de dag kyang med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The error would ensue that they are nonexistent.

original: de yang mthong bas zhes bya bas ni gzhan du 'gyur ba de yang mthong bas so //
analyzed: de yang mthong bas zhes bya bas ni gzhan du 'gyur ba de yang mthong bas so //
translated: And that is seen.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams la gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa ni sgrub pa'i chos yin pas rjes su dpag par nus te zhes bya bas ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams la gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa ni sgrub pa'i chos yin pas rjes su dpag par nus te zhes bya bas ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Therefore, since the existence of transformation in things is the property to be established, it can be inferred.

original: gang zag bdag med pa dang chos bdag yod par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs yin pas 'dir de'i rjes su dpag pa 'di ltar bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: gang zag bdag med pa dang chos bdag yod par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs yin pas 'dir de'i rjes su dpag pa 'di ltar bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that since transformation is the reason that establishes the selflessness of persons and the existence of objective self, here it is to be inferred in this way.

original: don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod de gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod de gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Ultimately, things do exist by their own intrinsic reality, because they transform.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni gnan  @286b du 'gyur ba med de dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni gnan  @286b du 'gyur ba med de dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: Here, that which does not exist does not transform, like the son of a barren woman.🔽Since internal things do transform, therefore ultimately things do exist by their own intrinsic reality.

original: nang gi dngos po rnams la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pas de'i phyir don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod do zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang /
analyzed: nang gi dngos po rnams la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pas de'i phyir don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod do zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang /
translated: This is the subject, the property to be established, the property that establishes, and the example of the discordant side.

original: nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The application of the analogy, the application of the conclusion, and the application of the summary are to be applied in order.

original: 'di na mo gsham gyi bu lta bu gang dag med pa de dag la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba med kyi /
analyzed: 'di na mo gsham gyi bu lta bu gang dag med pa de dag la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba med kyi /
translated: Here, those things that do not exist, like the son of a barren woman, do not transform into something else.

original: nang gi dngos po rnams la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pas de'i phyir nang gi dngos po rnams don dam par ngo bo nyid yod do //
analyzed: nang gi dngos po rnams la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pas de'i phyir nang gi dngos po rnams don dam par ngo bo nyid yod do //
translated: But internal things do transform into something else. Therefore internal things ultimately exist by their own intrinsic reality.

original: des na chos bdag med pa'i dngos po mi srid pas khyed dbu ma pas sngar rjes su dpag pas 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis de kho na'i don bstan pa de mi rung ngo zhes zer
analyzed: des na chos bdag med pa'i dngos po mi srid pas khyed dbu ma pas sngar rjes su dpag pas 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis de kho na'i don bstan pa de mi rung ngo zhes zer
translated: Therefore, since things that are the selflessness of phenomena are impossible, you Mādhyamikas previously taught the meaning of the statement that compounded phenomena are essenceless by means of an inference. That teaching of the meaning of reality is not tenable.”

original: ro // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: ro // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: gal te ngo bo nyid yod na /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid yod na /
translated: If things exist by their own intrinsic reality,

original: ji lta bur na gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: How could they transform into something else?

original: ngo bo nyid yod pa la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid mi rigs te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod pa la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that what intrinsically exists transforms into something else.

original: ngo bo nyid ni nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because its intrinsic reality would not change.

original: des ni pha rol po dag gi lugs la glags yod pa'i tshig gis bstan to //
analyzed: des ni pha rol po dag gi lugs la glags yod pa'i tshig gis bstan to //
translated: This is what he says, and he demonstrates that the opponent’s position is untenable.

original: glags yod pa'i tshig de las bzlog pas skabs kyi don nyid bstan pa'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba ni mthong ste /
analyzed: glags yod pa'i tshig de las bzlog pas skabs kyi don nyid bstan pa'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba ni mthong ste /
translated: To demonstrate that the meaning of the context is the opposite of the opponent’s untenable position, he says, Transformation is seen.

original: de yang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid med na mi 'byung bas gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de yang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid med na mi 'byung bas gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: And since that transformation would not occur if intrinsic reality did not exist, he says, The meaning of the reason is contradictory.

original: dngos po rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid mthong ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid mthong ste /
translated: Things are seen to transform into something else.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba de yang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid med na mi 'byung bas de'i phyir pha rol po dag na re don dam par dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yod de gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don 'gal ba nyid
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba de yang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid med na mi 'byung bas de'i phyir pha rol po dag na re don dam par dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yod de gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don 'gal ba nyid
translated: And since that transformation would not occur if intrinsic reality did not exist, therefore the meaning of the reason that the opponent states, “Ultimately things have intrinsic reality because they transform,” is contradictory.

original: yin pas / chos rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub po /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu gcig pa /🔽gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: yin pas / chos rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub po / // / bam po lnga bcu gcig pa / gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Therefore, phenomena are established as lacking entityness.🔽🔽🔽Others say:🔽

original: slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i don ni log par snang ba'i don yin mod kyi dngos po med pa'i don ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar dbu ma pas brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid🔽yin la / de ni log par snang ba yin pas slu ba'i chos yin @287a * //🔽pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te /🔽dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bya bar don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid stong pas chos rnams bdag med pa'i de kho na bstan pa de la /
analyzed: slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i don ni log par snang ba'i don yin mod kyi dngos po med pa'i don ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar dbu ma pas brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid🔽yin la / de ni log par snang ba yin pas slu ba'i chos yin @287a * //🔽pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te /🔽dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bya bar don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid stong pas chos rnams bdag med pa'i de kho na bstan pa de la /
translated: Therefore, phenomena are established as essenceless.

original: 'dir sde pa gzhan dag na re khyed dbu ma pas 'dus byas rnams rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin pas brdzun pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i gtan tshigs su de log par snang ba yin pas
analyzed: 'dir sde pa gzhan dag na re khyed dbu ma pas 'dus byas rnams rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin pas brdzun pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid stong pa yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i gtan tshigs su de log par snang ba yin pas
translated: Here, other schools say that you Madhyamaka say that conditioned phenomena are empty of an essence that is imputed by an essence because they are false, and that you state the reason for that assertion as “because they are deceptive.”

original: slu ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid stong pa yin no zhes smos pa la slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i don ni log par snang ba'i don yin mod kyi /
analyzed: slu ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid stong pa yin no zhes smos pa la slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i don ni log par snang ba'i don yin mod kyi /
translated: The meaning of the term deceptive phenomenon is indeed the meaning of false appearance.

original: dngos po med pa'i don ma yin te 'di ltar gang zag bdag dang bdag gi med pa nyid las bdag dang bdag gir log par snang bas slu ba'i chos yin pa de ni bden no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i don ma yin te 'di ltar gang zag bdag dang bdag gi med pa nyid las bdag dang bdag gir log par snang bas slu ba'i chos yin pa de ni bden no //
translated: But it does not mean nonentity because it is true that the person is a deceptive phenomenon in the sense that the nonexistence of a self and being mine falsely appears as a self and being mine.

original: khyod kyis chos rnams ngo bo nyid med pas dngos po med par bshad pa ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i don dngos po med pa'i don ni ma yin no zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston to
analyzed: khyod kyis chos rnams ngo bo nyid med pas dngos po med par bshad pa ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i don dngos po med pa'i don ni ma yin no zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston to
translated: The meaning of the term “deceptive phenomena” is not the meaning of “nonexistent things.”

original: // ci'i phyir slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i don log par snang ba'i don yin gyi dngos po med pa'i don ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: // ci'i phyir slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i don log par snang ba'i don yin gyi dngos po med pa'i don ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the meaning of the term “deceptive phenomena” the meaning of “false appearances” and not the meaning of “nonexistent things”?

original: de'i phyir brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa des ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ba bdag med pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa des ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ba bdag med pa nyid bstan te /
translated: The term “false” indicates that things are essenceless, that is, that they are selfless.

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni bdag gi tshig yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni bdag gi tshig yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is because the term “essence” is a synonym for “self.”

original: slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs des bsgrub par bya ba chos ni 'dus byas gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa ste zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs des bsgrub par bya ba chos ni 'dus byas gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa ste zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: The predicate of the probandum in the argument “because they are deceptive phenomena” is “whatever is compounded is false.”

original: brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa des ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan la /
analyzed: brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa des ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan la /
translated: The statement “false” indicates that things are essenceless.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ba ni bdag med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ba ni bdag med pa nyid yin te /
translated: “ Essencelessness” means “selflessness.”

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni bdag gi tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni bdag gi tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the term “essence” is a synonym for “self.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas ci'i phyir dngos po rnams la gang zag bdag med ces dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas ci'i phyir dngos po rnams la gang zag bdag med ces dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Why is that? This is a question asked by a Follower of the Middle Way, who is asking, “Why do you say that things are selfless?”

original: de'i lan du pha rol po dag nyid kyis sngar smras pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba /
analyzed: de'i lan du pha rol po dag nyid kyis sngar smras pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba /
translated: In response, the counterparts cite a verse from their root text:

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //
translated: Because transformation is seen.

original: zhes bya ba 'di smras so //🔽de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di smras so // de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is what they say.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba @287b smras te /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba @287b smras te /
translated: To explain this, Bhāviveka says, “Because transformation is seen,” meaning that the counterparts say this because they see transformation.

original: dngos po rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid snang ba'i phyir gang zag bdag med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid snang ba'i phyir gang zag bdag med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the meaning of the statement that the person is selflessness because it is seen that things are transformed into something else.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir de lta bas na brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa ni bdag med pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir bdag med pa nyid ston pa yin gyi stong pa nyid ston pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir de lta bas na brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa ni bdag med pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir bdag med pa nyid ston pa yin gyi stong pa nyid ston pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras
translated: In order to teach that very point, the commentary states, “Therefore, it is false,” because selflessness is taught, since it does not occur if selflessness does not exist, but emptiness is not taught.

original: te // gang zag bdag med pa nyid ston pa yin gyi chos bdag med pa nyid bstan pa ma yin no zhes bye brag tu bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: te // gang zag bdag med pa nyid ston pa yin gyi chos bdag med pa nyid bstan pa ma yin no zhes bye brag tu bshad pa ston to //
translated: This teaches the Abhidharma explanation that the selflessness of the person is taught, but the selflessness of phenomena is not taught.

original: de ltar gang zag bdag med pa'i don de la ci'i phyir brdzun pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar gsungs she na /
analyzed: de ltar gang zag bdag med pa'i don de la ci'i phyir brdzun pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar gsungs she na /
translated: Why is the term “false” used to refer to the meaning of the selflessness of the person?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar 'phags pa'i lam ma skyes pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i drungs ma phyung ba dag la ni nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams bdag dang bdag gir rnam par snang la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar 'phags pa'i lam ma skyes pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i drungs ma phyung ba dag la ni nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams bdag dang bdag gir rnam par snang la /
translated: Therefore, since the ārya path has not arisen, the mountain of the view of the transitory collection has not been uprooted, and internal and external things appear as “I” and “mine.”

original: 'phags pa'i lam yang dag par skyes pa rnams la ni de ltar yul gyi dngos por mi 'gyur bas de ltar bdag dang bdag gir log par snang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yang dag par skyes pa rnams la ni de ltar yul gyi dngos por mi 'gyur bas de ltar bdag dang bdag gir log par snang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: But for those who have correctly generated the ārya path, those things do not appear as objects. Therefore the Bhagavān said that they are false because they appear as “I” and “mine” in a distorted way.

original: de la gal te ngo bo nyid med pa dag mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gis bdag med de zhes bya bar sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya bas ni de ltar na ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya bas
analyzed: de la gal te ngo bo nyid med pa dag mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gis bdag med de zhes bya bar sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya bas ni de ltar na ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya bas
translated: If you argue that the nonexistence of intrinsic reality is established by the nonexistence of the self imagined by the tīrthikas, then you are establishing what is already established.

original: ni gang zag bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo nyid med pa dag yin pas de la gal te khyed dbu ma pas ngo bo nyid med pa de dag gzhan du mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag med pas bdag dang bdag gi med do zhes bya
analyzed: ni gang zag bdag dang bdag gi ngo bo nyid med pa dag yin pas de la gal te khyed dbu ma pas ngo bo nyid med pa de dag gzhan du mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag med pas bdag dang bdag gi med do zhes bya
translated: If you Followers of the Middle Way say that the self and entities connected to the self lack entityness, then you must also say that the self and entities connected to the self are nonexistent.🔽

original: bar sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin te /
analyzed: bar sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin te /
translated: If you Madhyamikas prove that those who are devoid of the self and intrinsic reality of the personal entity are devoid of the self and what pertains to the self by means of the nonexistence of the self imagined by the heterodox, then you have the fault of proving what is already established for us.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang de med par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang de med par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For us, that is already established as nonexistent.

original: ci ste ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya bar sgrub na ni sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci ste ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya bar sgrub na ni sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you prove the so-called emptiness of intrinsic reality, it is like the body of a woman conjured up by a magician.

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid med pas des na gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la yod pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya bas ni ci ste khyed dbu ma pas ngo bo nyid med pa
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid med pas des na gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la yod pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya bas ni ci ste khyed dbu ma pas ngo bo nyid med pa
translated: The so-called emptiness of intrinsic reality is not the characteristic of nonexistence. Therefore, since the reason exists only in the discordant side, it is contradictory.

original: de dag gis theg pa chen po pas chos rnams ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces dam bcas pa de sgrub pa yin na ni khyed kyi dpe sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin @288a * //
analyzed: de dag gis theg pa chen po pas chos rnams ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces dam bcas pa de sgrub pa yin na ni khyed kyi dpe sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin @288a * //
translated: If you were to prove the thesis of the Mahayana that phenomena are empty of intrinsic reality, then your example would be like the body of a woman conjured up by a magician.

original: no zhes bya ba de la khyod kyi bsgrub par bya ba chos ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid de med de /
analyzed: no zhes bya ba de la khyod kyi bsgrub par bya ba chos ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid de med de /
translated: In that case, your probandum, the property of being empty of intrinsic reality, would not exist, because it would have the character of nonexistence.

original: 'di ltar sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus la bud med kyi dngos po med kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus la bud med kyi dngos po med kyang /
translated: This is because, although there is no woman in the body of a woman conjured up by a magician,

original: rtsva dang shing la sogs pa sgyu ma'i yo byad rnams kyi dngos po med pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsva dang shing la sogs pa sgyu ma'i yo byad rnams kyi dngos po med pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not the case that there is no reality of the magician’s props, such as grass and wood.

original: des na khyed kyi chos rnams ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes smos pa de khyed kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa kho bo cag gi phyogs 'ba' zhig la yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na khyed kyi chos rnams ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes smos pa de khyed kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa kho bo cag gi phyogs 'ba' zhig la yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the reason you state, “because your phenomena are deceptive phenomena,” is only a position of ours, which is the opposite of your position,

original: khyed chos rnams ngo bo nyid stong par bsgrub pa dang don 'gal ba nyid yin pas ma grub po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khyed chos rnams ngo bo nyid stong par bsgrub pa dang don 'gal ba nyid yin pas ma grub po zhes zer ro //
translated: then your proof that phenomena are empty of their own entities is contradictory to your own purpose and thus is unestablished.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: khyed ngo bo nyid med pa dag gi ri bong gi rva bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgro btags nas kun du skrag par gyur pa ni dper na byis pa dag mtshan mo rang gi grib ma la 'dri nyid du sgro btags nas skrag pa'i
analyzed: khyed ngo bo nyid med pa dag gi ri bong gi rva bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgro btags nas kun du skrag par gyur pa ni dper na byis pa dag mtshan mo rang gi grib ma la 'dri nyid du sgro btags nas skrag pa'i
translated: You who are empty of entity superimpose nonentity, like the horn of a rabbit, and become frightened. For example, like children who, at night, superimpose a rope on their own shadow and become frightened,

original: skad 'byin pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: skad 'byin pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: they cry out.

original: khyed sde pa gzhan dag kho bos chos bdag med pa bstan pa de'i phyir ri bong gi rva bzhin du gtan med par sems shing stong pa nyid kyis skrag ste /
analyzed: khyed sde pa gzhan dag kho bos chos bdag med pa bstan pa de'i phyir ri bong gi rva bzhin du gtan med par sems shing stong pa nyid kyis skrag ste /
translated: You other schools think that because we teach the selflessness of phenomena, phenomena are utterly nonexistent, like the horns of a rabbit, and you fear emptiness.

original: gya tshom du de skad rgol ba ni dpe de dang 'dra'o //🔽de la gal te ngo bo nyid med pa dag mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gis bdag med do zhes bya bar sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras bsdu ba ci ste ngo bo nyid stong
analyzed: gya tshom du de skad rgol ba ni dpe de dang 'dra'o // de la gal te ngo bo nyid med pa dag mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gis bdag med do zhes bya bar sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras bsdu ba ci ste ngo bo nyid stong
translated: You rashly argue in that way, like the example of the rabbit’s horns.🔽If you prove that things that lack intrinsic existence are selfless because of being imputed by the tīrthikas to be a self, then it is a proof of what is already established.

original: pa nyid ces bya bar sgrub na ni sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pa nyid ces bya bar sgrub na ni sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you prove that things that lack intrinsic existence are empty of intrinsic existence, then it is like the body of an illusory woman conjured by a magician.

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid med pas des na gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la yod pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid do zhes khyed kho bo la gal gnyis po de dag brjod mod kyi /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid med pas des na gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la yod pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid do zhes khyed kho bo la gal gnyis po de dag brjod mod kyi /
translated: Although you have stated these two faults to me,

original: 'on kyang de dag kho bo'i phyogs la mi gnod kyi rigs pa nyon cig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag kho bo'i phyogs la mi gnod kyi rigs pa nyon cig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: nevertheless, they do not harm my position. Listen to the reasoning.

original: de la khyed gal te mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag ni phung po la sogs pa de dag las gzhan na yang med la rang nyid kyang ma yin pas phung po la sogs pa de dag @288b la bdag med pa'i dngos po bdag med pa
analyzed: de la khyed gal te mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag ni phung po la sogs pa de dag las gzhan na yang med la rang nyid kyang ma yin pas phung po la sogs pa de dag @288b la bdag med pa'i dngos po bdag med pa
translated: If you say that the self imagined by the tīrthikas does not exist apart from the aggregates and so on, and since it is not itself, the non-entity of self in those aggregates and so on is called selflessness,

original: nyid ces bya ba de brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa nyid kyis bstan par bya ba yin no zhes zer na de ltar gyur kyang bla ste zhes dbu ma pas khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba de brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa nyid kyis bstan par bya ba yin no zhes zer na de ltar gyur kyang bla ste zhes dbu ma pas khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: and since it is said to be false, it should be taught, the Madhyamika should accept that this is so.

original: ci ltar blang zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar blang zhe na /
translated: How is it accepted?

original: de'i phyir gal te dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes kho bos gtan tshigs sbyar bas gang zag bdag med pa nyid kyang gtan tshigs de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir gtan tshigs des gang zag🔽bdag med pa nyid ston par byed na yang grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur te /🔽dper na mi rtag pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir byas pa nyid ces bya ba'i gtan tshigs sbyar bas sdug bsngal la sogs pa dag kyang gtan tshigs de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes kho bos gtan tshigs sbyar bas gang zag bdag med pa nyid kyang gtan tshigs de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir gtan tshigs des gang zag bdag med pa nyid ston par byed na yang grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur te / dper na mi rtag pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir byas pa nyid ces bya ba'i gtan tshigs sbyar bas sdug bsngal la sogs pa dag kyang gtan tshigs de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, if I use the reason “because they are deceptive phenomena” to teach that things are empty of intrinsic reality, then since the selflessness of persons is not established without that reason,🔽that reason also teaches the selflessness of persons.🔽But if that is so, then there is the fault that you are proving what is already established.🔽For example, if you use the reason “because they are produced” to teach impermanence, then since suffering and so on are not established without that reason,

original: gtan tshigs des sdug bsngal la sogs pa ston par byed pa la grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon med pa dang 'dra la slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs des /
analyzed: gtan tshigs des sdug bsngal la sogs pa ston par byed pa la grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon med pa dang 'dra la slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs des /
translated: that reason also teaches suffering and so on. But there is no fault of proving what is already established.

original: chos bdag med pa ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyang ston par byed pa nyid yin pas kho bo cag la ci gnod ces bya bar sbyar te re zhig de dag gis ni sngar pha rol po dag na re de la gal te ngo bo nyid med pa
analyzed: chos bdag med pa ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyang ston par byed pa nyid yin pas kho bo cag la ci gnod ces bya bar sbyar te re zhig de dag gis ni sngar pha rol po dag na re de la gal te ngo bo nyid med pa
translated: This is the reply to the counterparts’ earlier statement: “If it has no essence,
