original: dag mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gis bdag med do zhes bya bar sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ba'i lan btab po /
analyzed: dag mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gis bdag med do zhes bya bar sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ba'i lan btab po /
translated: if you prove that the self does not exist because of the self that is imagined by the tīrthikas, then you are proving what is already established.”

original: slu ba'i chos nyid kyang ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir kho bo'i dpe sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin pas des na
analyzed: slu ba'i chos nyid kyang ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir kho bo'i dpe sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin pas des na
translated: Since the very emptiness of inherent existence is the reality of deception, and since it is the case that the reality of deception does not occur without emptiness of inherent existence, the example of the illusory woman conjured up by the magician is also emptiness of inherent existence.

original: kho bo'i gtan tshigs slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de phyogs gnyi ga la yod pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bo'i gtan tshigs slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de phyogs gnyi ga la yod pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since the reason “because it is deceptive” is present in both positions, it is not the case that there is a contradiction in meaning.

original: 'gal ba ltar snang ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'gal ba ltar snang ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The phrase “it is as if there were a contradiction” should be supplied.🔽This is the response to the opponent’s earlier objection: “If you are proving that things are empty of intrinsic reality, then your example is similar to the body of a woman conjured up by a magician.”🔽The opponent says that the reason is contradictory because it is only present in the dissimilar instances.

original: des ni sngar pha rol po dag na re ci ste ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya bar sgrub na ni sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des ni sngar pha rol po dag na re ci ste ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya bar sgrub na ni sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the response to the opponent’s earlier objection: “If you are proving that things are empty of intrinsic reality, then your example is similar to the body of a woman conjured up by a magician.”🔽The opponent says that the reason is contradictory because it is only present in the dissimilar instances.🔽The phrase “it is as if there were a contradiction” should be supplied.🔽This is the response to the opponent’s earlier objection: “If you are proving that things are empty of intrinsic reality, then your example is similar to the body of a woman conjured up by a magician.”

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid med pa des na gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la yod pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid do zhes zer ba'i lan btab po //🔽de ni sngar pha rol po dag na re brdzun @289a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid med pa des na gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la yod pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid do zhes zer ba'i lan btab po // de ni sngar pha rol po dag na re brdzun @289a * //
translated: The opponent says that the reason is contradictory because it is only present in the dissimilar instances.🔽The phrase “it is as if there were a contradiction” should be supplied.🔽This is the response to the opponent’s earlier objection: “If you are proving that things are empty of intrinsic reality, then your example is similar to the body of a woman conjured up by a magician.”🔽The opponent says that the reason is contradictory because it is only present in the dissimilar instances.🔽The phrase “it is as if there were a contradiction” should be supplied.

original: pa zhes gsungs pa des ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ba bdag med pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: pa zhes gsungs pa des ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ba bdag med pa nyid bstan te /
translated: This is the response to the opponent’s earlier objection: “If you are proving that things are empty of intrinsic reality, then your example is similar to the body of a woman conjured up by a magician.”🔽The opponent says that the reason is contradictory because it is only present in the dissimilar instances.

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni bdag gi tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni bdag gi tshig yin pa'i phyir ro // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The phrase “it is as if there were a contradiction” should be supplied.🔽This is the response to the opponent’s earlier objection: “If you are proving that things are empty of intrinsic reality, then your example is similar to the body of a woman conjured up by a magician.”

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //
translated: The opponent says that the reason is contradictory because it is only present in the dissimilar instances.🔽The phrase “it is as if there were a contradiction” should be supplied.🔽This is the response to the opponent’s earlier objection: “If you are proving that things are empty of intrinsic reality, then your

original: zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de ma grub par ston pa'i rjes su dpag par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de ma grub par ston pa'i rjes su dpag par bstan par bya ste /
translated: I will demonstrate a syllogism that reveals the reason stated above to be unestablished.

original: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med de /
translated: Therefore compounded phenomena do not transform into something else.

original: lta ba po'i yang dag pa dang log pa'i shes pa skye ba'i dus na shes bya'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs ba'i phyir dper na thag pa la lta ba pos thag pa'am sprul du mthong ba na thag pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa
analyzed: lta ba po'i yang dag pa dang log pa'i shes pa skye ba'i dus na shes bya'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs ba'i phyir dper na thag pa la lta ba pos thag pa'am sprul du mthong ba na thag pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa
translated: When the correct or incorrect consciousnesses of the viewer arise, the entity of the object of consciousness is not completely abandoned, for example, when the viewer sees a rope or a snake, the entity of the rope is not completely abandoned.

original: bzhin pas bdag dang bdag gir snang ba'i 'du byed rnams la gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bzhin pas bdag dang bdag gir snang ba'i 'du byed rnams la gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore compounded phenomena that appear as the self and entities connected to the self do not transform into something else.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na thag pa las lta ba pos thag pa'am /
analyzed: dper na thag pa las lta ba pos thag pa'am /
translated: For example, when the viewer sees a rope or a snake, the entity of the rope is not completely abandoned.

original: sprul du mthong ba na sems g-yengs pa'am /
analyzed: sprul du mthong ba na sems g-yengs pa'am /
translated: When you see a mirage, your mind is distracted.🔽

original: mig yor ram /
analyzed: mig yor ram /
translated: When it is seen as a snake, the mind is distracted.

original: nam mkha' mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan gyis thag pa'am sprul du snang ba'i shes pa skye bar zad kyi /
analyzed: nam mkha' mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan gyis thag pa'am sprul du snang ba'i shes pa skye bar zad kyi /
translated: Or, due to other conditions, such as a mirage, a reflection, or unclear space, a consciousness perceiving a rope or a snake arises.

original: thag pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs shing gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: thag pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs shing gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pa de bzhin du /
translated: But the rope’s own nature is not abandoned and it does not transform into something else.

original: 'du byed rnams lta ba pos bdag dang bdag med par mthong na yang skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i chos thos pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan gyis bdag dang bdag med par snang ba yang dag pa dang log pa'i shes pa skye bar zad kyi /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams lta ba pos bdag dang bdag med par mthong na yang skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i chos thos pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan gyis bdag dang bdag med par snang ba yang dag pa dang log pa'i shes pa skye bar zad kyi /
translated: In the same way, when compounded phenomena are seen by a viewer as a self or as selfless, a correct or an incorrect consciousness perceiving a self or selflessness arises due to other conditions, such as relying on an ignoble person, hearing ignoble teachings, and improper mental activity.

original: shes bya'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs shing gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pas de'i phyir bdag dang bdag gir snang ba'i 'du byed rnams la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med de /
analyzed: shes bya'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs shing gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pas de'i phyir bdag dang bdag gir snang ba'i 'du byed rnams la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med de /
translated: Since the nature of objects of knowledge is not abandoned and does not transform, therefore the formations that appear as I and mine do not transform.

original: phyi nang gi dngos po rnams kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / dri za'i grong khyer bzhin du gnas pas shes pa'i dbang gis shes bya gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs /
analyzed: phyi nang gi dngos po rnams kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / dri za'i grong khyer bzhin du gnas pas shes pa'i dbang gis shes bya gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs /
translated: Since outer and inner things exist conventionally as dependently originated, like illusions, dreams, and the city of gandharvas, objects of knowledge do not transform through the power of consciousness. Therefore the opponent’s reason

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //
translated: “because transformation is seen”

original: zhes bya ba de ma grub po //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ma grub po //
translated: is not established.

original: de ltar @289b bdag dang bdag gir snang ba'i 'du byed rnams la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pas shes pa'i dbang gis shes bya gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin mod kyi glo bur gyi rkyen gyis shes pa 'khrul pa'i dbang gis shes bya gzhan du snang ba
analyzed: de ltar @289b bdag dang bdag gir snang ba'i 'du byed rnams la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pas shes pa'i dbang gis shes bya gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin mod kyi glo bur gyi rkyen gyis shes pa 'khrul pa'i dbang gis shes bya gzhan du snang ba
translated: However, the object of cognition appears to transform by the power of the deluded consciousness that arises from adventitious conditions.🔽Therefore, it is said that the formations are delusion.

original: na 'du byed rnams 'khrul pa yin no zhes nye bar gdags pa'i tha snyad yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: na 'du byed rnams 'khrul pa yin no zhes nye bar gdags pa'i tha snyad yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the convention of designation exists,

original: 'on kyang rab rib can rnams la dbang po nyams pas 'khrul pa'i blo skye ba bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bdag dang bdag gi blo skye ba'i phyir 'khrul pa zhes bya ba nye bar gdags par ni yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras
analyzed: 'on kyang rab rib can rnams la dbang po nyams pas 'khrul pa'i blo skye ba bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bdag dang bdag gi blo skye ba'i phyir 'khrul pa zhes bya ba nye bar gdags par ni yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras
translated: it says, “However, because the mind that arises from the unreal self and entities arises like the deluded mind that arises from a damaged sense faculty of those with eye disease, it is said that delusion is designated.”

original: so // de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir 'dus byas ni brdzun pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: so // de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir 'dus byas ni brdzun pa nyid yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the inference of that, it says, “Because conditioned phenomena are false, they are not real.”

original: shes pa brdzun pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na mngon sum gyi shes pa'i yul gyi don la mngon sum zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: shes pa brdzun pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na mngon sum gyi shes pa'i yul gyi don la mngon sum zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the object of false consciousness is the object of consciousness, like the object of direct perception, which is called direct perception.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And they are the subject, the predicate, the proof, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na dbang po'i mngon sum dang / yid kyi mngon sum dang / rang rig pa'i mngon sum dang / rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum gyi shes pa dag mngon sum yin gyi /🔽de dag gi yul mngon sum ma yin kyang shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir yul gyi don la yang mngon sum zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dus byas rnams kyang gzhan du 'gyur ba med pas brdzun pa nyid ma yin yang shes pa brdzun pa'i yul yin pa'i
analyzed: dper na dbang po'i mngon sum dang / yid kyi mngon sum dang / rang rig pa'i mngon sum dang / rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum gyi shes pa dag mngon sum yin gyi / de dag gi yul mngon sum ma yin kyang shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir yul gyi don la yang mngon sum zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dus byas rnams kyang gzhan du 'gyur ba med pas brdzun pa nyid ma yin yang shes pa brdzun pa'i yul yin pa'i
translated: For example, the consciousnesses of sense direct perception, mental direct perception, reflexive awareness direct perception, and yogic direct perception are direct perception.🔽Although their objects are not direct perception, because they are the objects of consciousness, the object of the sense direct perception is called direct perception.

original: phyir brdzun pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: phyir brdzun pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: In the same way, although compounded phenomena are not false because they do not change into something else, because they are the objects of false consciousness, they are called false.

original: des na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i dbang gis lta ba po'i yang dag pa dang log pa'i shes pa skye bas shes bya yang dag pa dang / log par mthong bar zad kyi /
analyzed: des na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i dbang gis lta ba po'i yang dag pa dang log pa'i shes pa skye bas shes bya yang dag pa dang / log par mthong bar zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, because correct and incorrect mental activity give rise to the correct and incorrect consciousnesses of the viewer, one merely sees the object of knowledge as correct or incorrect.

original: shes pas shes bya skyed pa ni ma yin pas shes bya'i ngo bo nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pas /
analyzed: shes pas shes bya skyed pa ni ma yin pas shes bya'i ngo bo nyid la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pas /
translated: Since consciousness does not generate the object of knowledge, the nature of the object of knowledge does not transform into something else.

original: 'di la bsal ba gang yang med //
analyzed: 'di la bsal ba gang yang med //
translated: There is nothing to be removed from this

original: bsnan par bya ba'ang cung zad med //
analyzed: bsnan par bya ba'ang cung zad med //
translated: and not the slightest thing to be added.

original: yang dag nyid du yang dag lha //
analyzed: yang dag nyid du yang dag lha //
translated: The deity of reality is seen in reality

original: yang dag mthong ba rnam par grol //
analyzed: yang dag mthong ba rnam par grol //
translated: and the one who sees reality is liberated.

original: zhes gsungs pa grub po //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa grub po //
translated: This is established.

original: gang dag gis brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa yin no zhes smras @290a * //
analyzed: gang dag gis brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa yin no zhes smras @290a * //
translated: Those who say that what is called false is the empty nature of things that definitely do not endure are refuted by this.

original: pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs las ni /
analyzed: pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs las ni /
translated: The following is stated for their sake.

original: sngar ni pha rol po dag na re brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa de ni yod mod kyi 'on kyang med pa'i don kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: sngar ni pha rol po dag na re brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa de ni yod mod kyi 'on kyang med pa'i don kyang ma yin la /
translated: Previously, the opponent said, “Although it is said that things are false, they are not nonexistent.

original: chos bdag med pa yongs su ston par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa yongs su ston par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it does not teach the selflessness of phenomena.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs pas ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs pas ni /
translated: Because the Lord said, ‘Things are false.’

original: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid med de //
analyzed: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid med de //
translated: Things do not have intrinsic reality

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //🔽zhes bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro // zhes bstan te /
translated: because they appear to change.

original: brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa ni chos bdag med pa ston pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa ni chos bdag med pa ston pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This teaches that the statement, “Things are false,” does not teach the selflessness of phenomena.🔽It teaches the selflessness of persons because things appear to change.

original: dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba snang ba'i phyir gang zag bdag med pa ston pa yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs sun dbyung ba'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa 'og ma 'di bshad de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽de nyid la ni gzhan 'gyur med //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba snang ba'i phyir gang zag bdag med pa ston pa yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs sun dbyung ba'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa 'og ma 'di bshad de zhes bya bar sbyar ro // de nyid la ni gzhan 'gyur med //
translated: The following verses were composed to refute that position.🔽It does not change into something else

original: gzhan nyid la yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan nyid la yang yod ma yin //
translated: and it does not exist as something else.

original: dngos po gang rang bzhin gang gis gzung ba'i yul du 'gyur ba de nyid la ni rga shi'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba med la /
analyzed: dngos po gang rang bzhin gang gis gzung ba'i yul du 'gyur ba de nyid la ni rga shi'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba med la /
translated: That very thing which becomes the object apprehended by a certain nature does not become characterized by aging and death.🔽Nor does it exist in another.

original: gzhan nyid la yang yod pa ma yin te //🔽de dag ni dam bca' ba gnyis nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya bas ni dngos po gang gzhon nu'i rang bzhin gang gis dbang po'i gzung ba'i yul du 'gyur ba de nyid la yang rga shi'i mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba med la /
analyzed: gzhan nyid la yang yod pa ma yin te // de dag ni dam bca' ba gnyis nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya bas ni dngos po gang gzhon nu'i rang bzhin gang gis dbang po'i gzung ba'i yul du 'gyur ba de nyid la yang rga shi'i mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba med la /
translated: The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”

original: gzhon nu las gzhan pa rgas par gyur pa nyid la yang rga shi'i mtshan nyid du gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa gnyis nye bar gzhag pa bstan to //🔽gang phyir gzhon nu mi rga ste //🔽gang phyir rga ba'ang mi rga'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu las gzhan pa rgas par gyur pa nyid la yang rga shi'i mtshan nyid du gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa gnyis nye bar gzhag pa bstan to // gang phyir gzhon nu mi rga ste // gang phyir rga ba'ang mi rga'o //
translated: The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”🔽The two theses are stated by the words “Nor does it exist in another.”

original: zhes bya ba dag ni go rims bzhin du chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig gnyis yin no zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dag ni go rims bzhin du chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig gnyis yin no zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The two theses are stated by

original: de nyid la ni gzhan 'gyur med //
analyzed: de nyid la ni gzhan 'gyur med //
translated: It does not transform into something else.

original: gzhan nyid la yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan nyid la yang yod ma yin //
translated: Nor does it exist in something else.

original: zhes dam bcas pa gnyis nye bar gzhag pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig gnyis go rims bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: zhes dam bcas pa gnyis nye bar gzhag pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig gnyis go rims bzhin du bstan to //
translated: The two examples are taught in order to demonstrate the two syllogisms that were presented.

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig dag ni re zhig bdag nyid de nyid kyis gnas pa la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba mi 'thad pa nyid de sngon gyi rang bzhin yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir dper na gzhon nu rgan po nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig dag ni re zhig bdag nyid de nyid kyis gnas pa la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba mi 'thad pa nyid de sngon gyi rang bzhin yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir dper na gzhon nu rgan po nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya
translated: The syllogistic reasoning is as follows: “The self does not exist in the present aggregates because it is not tenable that it transforms into something else, just like a young man does not become an old man.”

original: bas ni dam bcas pa snga ma shos bsgrub pa'i tshad ma bstan te /
analyzed: bas ni dam bcas pa snga ma shos bsgrub pa'i tshad ma bstan te /
translated: This demonstrates the valid cognition that establishes the first thesis.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper @290b na gzhon nu ni sngon gyi rang bzhin ma spangs pa'i phyir rgan po nyid du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'o ma la sogs pa bdag nyid de nyid kyis gnas pa yang sngon gyi rang bzhin yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir zho la sogs pa'i🔽bdag nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: dper @290b na gzhon nu ni sngon gyi rang bzhin ma spangs pa'i phyir rgan po nyid du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'o ma la sogs pa bdag nyid de nyid kyis gnas pa yang sngon gyi rang bzhin yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir zho la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: Likewise, milk and so on would not become something else, such as yogurt, because they would not abandon their former nature.

original: sngon gyi mtshan nyid las mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba rgan po'i bdag nyid du gnas pa la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtshan nyid las mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba rgan po'i bdag nyid du gnas pa la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba med de /
translated: Also, an old man who remains with a former nature would not become something else because he would not have a different nature than before.🔽For example, an old man would not become a youth because he would not abandon his former nature.

original: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i gnas skabs thob pa'i phyir dper na rgas po bzhin pas zhes bya ba ni du ma bcas pa gnyis pa sgrub pa'i tshad ma bstan te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i gnas skabs thob pa'i phyir dper na rgas po bzhin pas zhes bya ba ni du ma bcas pa gnyis pa sgrub pa'i tshad ma bstan te /
translated: This is the second syllogism that teaches the proof of the two extremes.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical argument, and the example.

original: dper na rgas pa ni gzhon nu las mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i gnas skabs 'thob pa'i phyir rgan po'i mtshan nyid du gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du zho la sogs pa 'o ma la sogs pa'i sngon gyi mtshan nyid las mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i
analyzed: dper na rgas pa ni gzhon nu las mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i gnas skabs 'thob pa'i phyir rgan po'i mtshan nyid du gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du zho la sogs pa 'o ma la sogs pa'i sngon gyi mtshan nyid las mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i
translated: For example, aging is not a transformation of the old into something else, because it is the attainment of a condition that is different from youth in terms of its characteristics.

original: bdag nyid du gnas pa yang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i gnas skabs thob pa'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid du gnas pa yang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i gnas skabs thob pa'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Similarly, milk and so on are not transformations of the prior entity of milk and so on into something else, because they are the attainment of a condition that is different in terms of its characteristics.

original: rgol ba rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //🔽'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: rgol ba rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no // 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: The phrase “it contradicts your own inference” is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.🔽Here, someone might say, “The reason is not established, because milk and so on become things such as yogurt without relinquishing their nature as milk and so on.”

original: 'o ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa dag kyang zho la sogs pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dir grangs can dag na re dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs sngon gyi rang bzhin yongs
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa dag kyang zho la sogs pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dir grangs can dag na re dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs sngon gyi rang bzhin yongs
translated: Here, the Enumerators say, “The reason of the Madhyamaka is not established.

original: su ma spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba yin te //
analyzed: su ma spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba yin te //
translated: Because the nature of milk and so on is not abandoned, it is not definite that it becomes curd and so on.

original: 'o ma la sogs pa gang dag snying stobs la sogs pa rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa dag kyang zho la sogs pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa gang dag snying stobs la sogs pa rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa dag kyang zho la sogs pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because milk and so on that do not abandon the nature of sattva and so on become the things curd and so on.

original: des na ci re zhig sngon gyi rang bzhin yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir dper na gzhon nu rgan po nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin du 'o ma la sogs pa bdag nyid de nyid kyis gnas yang zho la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan du mi 'gyur ba
analyzed: des na ci re zhig sngon gyi rang bzhin yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir dper na gzhon nu rgan po nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin du 'o ma la sogs pa bdag nyid de nyid kyis gnas yang zho la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan du mi 'gyur ba
translated: Therefore, is it that milk and so on remain in their own nature because their prior nature is not abandoned, like a youth who does not become old, and they do not become the other thing curd and so on?

original: yin nam / 'on te sngon gyi rang bzhin yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir 'o ma zhor 'gyur ba dang / gser gyi sor gdub dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba bzhin du /🔽'o ma la sogs @291a * //
analyzed: yin nam / 'on te sngon gyi rang bzhin yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir 'o ma zhor 'gyur ba dang / gser gyi sor gdub dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba bzhin du /🔽'o ma la sogs @291a * //
translated: Or is it that milk becomes curd and gold becomes bracelets and so on because its prior nature is not abandoned?

original: pa'i dngos po snying stobs la sogs pa rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid de nyid kyis gnas pa dag kyang zho la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: pa'i dngos po snying stobs la sogs pa rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid de nyid kyis gnas pa dag kyang zho la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: The things of milk, courage, etc., which are the nature of sattva, etc., are not definitely transformed into other things such as curd, etc. Therefore, the Madhyamika’s reason is not valid.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /🔽gang gi dngos po de zho yin //
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa / gang gi dngos po de zho yin //
translated: In reply to this, the author of the commentary explains here:🔽What thing is curd?

original: gal te 'o ma'i zho zhe na //
analyzed: gal te 'o ma'i zho zhe na //
translated: If it is the curd of milk,

original: de lta na yang 'o mas 'o ma'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pas sgra tsam gyis zho'i dngos por brtag par mi nus te gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par rtog pa la yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'o mas 'o ma'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pas sgra tsam gyis zho'i dngos por brtag par mi nus te gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par rtog pa la yang /
translated: even so, since milk has not completely abandoned its milk nature, it cannot be imagined to be the thing curd by mere sound.

original: gal te de nyid gzhan gyur na //
analyzed: gal te de nyid gzhan gyur na //
translated: If that very thing were transformed,

original: 'o ma nyid ni zhor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o ma nyid ni zhor 'gyur ro //
translated: milk itself would be curd.

original: 'o ma ro dang mthu dang smin pa dang mthu stobs yongs su ma spangs pa zho'i dngos por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o ma ro dang mthu dang smin pa dang mthu stobs yongs su ma spangs pa zho'i dngos por mi 'gyur te /
translated: Milk, without completely abandoning its taste, potency, digestion, and strength, would not become the thing curd.

original: grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it would be undermined by what is renowned in the world.

original: gal te 'o ma'i dngos po zho yin la 'o mas 'o ma'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs par zhor 'gyur na 'jig rten la grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir de ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te 'o ma'i dngos po zho yin la 'o mas 'o ma'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs par zhor 'gyur na 'jig rten la grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir de ni mi rung ngo //
translated: If milk’s own nature is not abandoned when it becomes curd, then it is not tenable that milk becomes curd, because it would be undermined by what is renowned in the world.

original: gal te de bzhin te 'o ma zho'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin te 'o ma zho'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say, “It is like that, but milk does not become the entity of curd,”

original: gal te pha rol po dag na re de nyid gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhe na'o //
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag na re de nyid gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhe na'o //
translated: if the opponent says, “It does not become something else.”

original: de'i lan du /🔽'o ma las gzhan gang gi ni //
analyzed: de'i lan du / 'o ma las gzhan gang gi ni //
translated: In response to that, it is said:🔽What entity of curd is there

original: dngos po zho ni yin par 'gyur //🔽mi 'gyur ba nyid de zho 'am /🔽de las gzhan pa dag der mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dngos po zho ni yin par 'gyur // mi 'gyur ba nyid de zho 'am / de las gzhan pa dag der mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: that is different from milk?🔽It is not tenable that milk itself becomes curd,🔽or that something else becomes curd.

original: 'o ma nyid zhor mi 'gyur na 'o ma las gzhan pa chu la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: 'o ma nyid zhor mi 'gyur na 'o ma las gzhan pa chu la sogs pa'am /
translated: If milk itself does not become curd, then what entity of curd is there that is different from milk, such as water and so on?

original: zho nyid zho mi 'gyur bas gzhan nyid la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zho nyid zho mi 'gyur bas gzhan nyid la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since yogurt does not transform into yogurt, that which is different does not transform into that which is different.

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'o ma dang de las gzhan pa dag dngos po gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'o ma dang de las gzhan pa dag dngos po gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is untenable that milk and that which is different from it are different things, the reason is not indeterminate. This is the conclusion and the result of the valid knowledge.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: 'o ma zho'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gzhan du 'gyur bas 'o ma'i dngos po zho yin no zhes ni mi smra'i /
analyzed: 'o ma zho'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gzhan du 'gyur bas 'o ma'i dngos po zho yin no zhes ni mi smra'i /
translated: We do not say that the thing that is milk is yogurt because milk transforms into the state that has the characteristics of yogurt.🔽However, we say that milk becomes the thing that is yogurt through the power of the assembly.

original: 'on kyang tshogs pa'i dbang gis 'o ma zho'i dngos por 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni sngar pha rol po dag na re 'o ma yang gzhan la zho yang gzhan pas 'o ma'i dngos po zho ma yin yang tshogs pa'i dbang gis 'o ma zho'i dngos por 'gyur🔽ro zhes zer ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshogs pa'i dbang gis 'o ma zho'i dngos por 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni sngar pha rol po dag na re 'o ma yang gzhan la zho yang gzhan pas 'o ma'i dngos po zho ma yin yang tshogs pa'i dbang gis 'o ma zho'i dngos por 'gyur🔽ro zhes zer ba bstan to //
translated: This teaches the earlier assertion of the opponent that since milk is one thing and yogurt is another, although the thing that is milk is not the thing that is yogurt, through the power of the assembly, milk becomes the thing that is yogurt.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du @291b 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du @291b 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir yang 'o mas 'o ma'i dngos po spangs nas zho'i dngos por 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'o mas 'o ma'i dngos po spangs nas zho'i dngos por 'gyur ram /
translated: Here, does milk become the entity of curd by abandoning the entity of milk?

original: ma spangs par 'gyur grang zhes bya ba gal gnyis smras so //
analyzed: ma spangs par 'gyur grang zhes bya ba gal gnyis smras so //
translated: Or does it become so without abandoning it?🔽What is the point?

original: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is a question.

original: de'i lan du gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni 'o ma zho'i dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i lan du gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni 'o ma zho'i dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: In response, if you assert the former hypothesis, then milk does not become the entity of curd.

original: ci ste brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni dgag pa mi mthun pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /🔽gal te 'o ma yin na ni ji ltar zho yin /
analyzed: ci ste brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni dgag pa mi mthun pa'i skyon du 'gyur te / gal te 'o ma yin na ni ji ltar zho yin /
translated: But if you assert the latter hypothesis, the fault of the contradiction of negation arises.🔽If it is milk, how can it be curd?

original: ci ste zho yin na ni ji ltar 'o ma yin //
analyzed: ci ste zho yin na ni ji ltar 'o ma yin //
translated: But if it is curd, how can it be milk?

original: 'o ma zho yin no zhes smra na ni grags pa'i gnod par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang smras te /
analyzed: 'o ma zho yin no zhes smra na ni grags pa'i gnod par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang smras te /
translated: If you say “Milk is curd,” then it would also be said that it contradicts what is well known.

original: brtag pa gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: brtag pa gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: Thus he says that both hypotheses are untenable.

original: 'dis gang dag 'o ma'i dngos po zho yin par mi 'dod kyi 'o ma zho'i dngos por 'gyur bar 'dod do zhes zer ba de dag gi lan kyang btab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /🔽brtag pa rnam pa gnyis mi 'thad par bstan pa'i tshul 'dis grangs can dag rang bzhin ni gzhan du mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'dis gang dag 'o ma'i dngos po zho yin par mi 'dod kyi 'o ma zho'i dngos por 'gyur bar 'dod do zhes zer ba de dag gi lan kyang btab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni / brtag pa rnam pa gnyis mi 'thad par bstan pa'i tshul 'dis grangs can dag rang bzhin ni gzhan du mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: This also replies to those who say, “We do not assert that the entity of milk is yogurt, but we assert that milk becomes the entity of yogurt.”

original: rkyen gyi dbang gis gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bar 'dod pa'i lan kyang btab pa yin no //
analyzed: rkyen gyi dbang gis gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bar 'dod pa'i lan kyang btab pa yin no //
translated: This method of teaching that the two kinds of analysis are untenable also replies to the Sāṃkhyas, who assert that the nature does not transform but that it transforms into another state through the power of conditions.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dpyad na don dam par dngos po rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ma grub pas pha rol pos dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir gtan tshigs smras pa'i don ma grub pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid do
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dpyad na don dam par dngos po rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ma grub pas pha rol pos dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir gtan tshigs smras pa'i don ma grub pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid do
translated: Therefore, when analyzed in this way, since transformation into another does not exist ultimately, the meaning of the reason that the opponent states in order to demonstrate that things exist essentially is unestablished, or it has a meaning that is contradictory.

original: zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: This is a general summary and the result of the valid knowledge.

original: pha rol po dag brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa chos bdag med pa ston pa ma yin gyi gang zag bdag med pa ston pa yin par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro zhes bya ba de don dam par ni ma grub pa nyid yin
analyzed: pha rol po dag brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa chos bdag med pa ston pa ma yin gyi gang zag bdag med pa ston pa yin par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro zhes bya ba de don dam par ni ma grub pa nyid yin
translated: The reason that the statement “the other side is false” is not a teaching of the selflessness of phenomena but a teaching of the selflessness of persons is not established ultimately.

original: la / kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: la / kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: And it is contradictory conventionally.

original: slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa yang dngos po rnams nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ma yin te /🔽don dam par 'ga' yang gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni ji ltar brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa de chos bdag med pa ston pa'i don yin pa de bzhin du slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa yang dngos po rnams nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ma yin te / don dam par 'ga' yang gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni ji ltar brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa de chos bdag med pa ston pa'i don yin pa de bzhin du slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa yang /
translated: The statement “deceptive phenomena” does not refer to the emptiness of the nature of things that definitely does not endure.🔽Because it is impossible for anything to change into something else ultimately.

original: gang zag bdag med pa 'ba' zhig ston pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zag bdag med pa 'ba' zhig ston pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This shows that just as the statement “false” teaches the selflessness of phenomena, the statement “deceptive phenomena” does not teach only the selflessness of persons.

original: bdag med pa gnyi ga ston pa'i don yin par bstan to //
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyi ga ston pa'i don yin par bstan to //
translated: It teaches both forms of selflessness.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: @292a * // don dam par dngos po rnams stong pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: @292a * // don dam par dngos po rnams stong pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Things are not empty ultimately,

original: dpe'i gnyen po yod pa'i phyir dper na log pa'i shes pa'i gnyen por yang dag pa'i shes pa yod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dpe'i gnyen po yod pa'i phyir dper na log pa'i shes pa'i gnyen por yang dag pa'i shes pa yod pa bzhin no //
translated: because there is an antidote to them, just as there is a correct consciousness that is the antidote to a mistaken consciousness.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni gnyen po med de dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //🔽stong pa nyid ma yin pa la ni gnyen po stong pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus stong pa nyid ma yin pa yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag rigs pa can gyi sgyu thabs kyis /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni gnyen po med de dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no // stong pa nyid ma yin pa la ni gnyen po stong pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus stong pa nyid ma yin pa yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag rigs pa can gyi sgyu thabs kyis /
translated: And if something does not exist, then it has no antidote, just like a sky flower.🔽Since emptiness is the antidote to nonemptiness, the opponent’s argument, “The reason you have stated proves that nonemptiness exists,” is a sophistry.

original: gnyen po stong pa nyid yod pa'i sgo nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs stong pa nyid ma yin pa yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: gnyen po stong pa nyid yod pa'i sgo nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs stong pa nyid ma yin pa yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: The opponent’s argument is a statement that proves the existence of the opposite of emptiness, nonemptiness, on the grounds that the antidote to it, emptiness, exists.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i dpe dang / chos mi mthun pa'i dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i dpe dang / chos mi mthun pa'i dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate to be proven, the proof, the example of similar quality, the example of dissimilar quality, the application of the proof, and the conclusion.

original: 'di ni nam mkha'i me tog lta bu gang med pa de la ni gnyen po med kyi log pa'i shes pa lta bu gang yod pa de la ni gnyen po yod pa de bzhin du dngos po stong pa nyid ma yin pa rnams la yang gnyen po stong
analyzed: 'di ni nam mkha'i me tog lta bu gang med pa de la ni gnyen po med kyi log pa'i shes pa lta bu gang yod pa de la ni gnyen po yod pa de bzhin du dngos po stong pa nyid ma yin pa rnams la yang gnyen po stong
translated: The opponent says: Just as a sky flower, which does not exist, has no antidote, but a mistaken consciousness, which does exist, has an antidote, so too, since emptiness is the antidote to things that are not emptiness, emptiness exists for things that are not emptiness.

original: pa nyid yod pas de'i phyir dngos po rnams chos bdag med pa stong pa nyid ma yin gyi gang zag bdag med pas nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: pa nyid yod pas de'i phyir dngos po rnams chos bdag med pa stong pa nyid ma yin gyi gang zag bdag med pas nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, things are not empty of the selflessness of phenomena, but are definitely not established by nature, since they are empty of the self of persons.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: gal te stong min cung zad yod //
analyzed: gal te stong min cung zad yod //
translated: If something is not empty,

original: stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur //
translated: Emptiness would also slightly exist.

original: 'di la gal te don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa dngos po rang bzhin gyis mi stong pa cung zad cig yod par gyur na ni de la ltos pa'am mi stong pa de bsal bas stong pa zhes brjod pa 'byung ba'i phyir
analyzed: 'di la gal te don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa dngos po rang bzhin gyis mi stong pa cung zad cig yod par gyur na ni de la ltos pa'am mi stong pa de bsal bas stong pa zhes brjod pa 'byung ba'i phyir
translated: Here, if the aggregates, elements, media, and so on were not empty of intrinsic reality, then emptiness would be slightly existent, because it would be said that emptiness arises from the elimination of that which is not empty, which is dependent on that.

original: stong pa yang cung zad yod par 'gyur ba zhig na mi stong pa de yang mi 'thad par bstan zhing ston par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de ltar don dam par /
analyzed: stong pa yang cung zad yod par 'gyur ba zhig na mi stong pa de yang mi 'thad par bstan zhing ston par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de ltar don dam par /
translated: But since it has been shown and will be shown that that which is not empty is not tenable, therefore, in that way, ultimately,

original: mi stong cung zad yod min na //
analyzed: mi stong cung zad yod min na //
translated: Not the slightest non-empty thing exists.

original: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: How could emptiness exist?

original: stong pa nyid du 'thad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du 'thad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The intended meaning is that emptiness is not tenable.

original: des ni don dam par gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtha' gnyi ga spangs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni don dam par gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtha' gnyi ga spangs pa bstan to //
translated: Thus he shows that ultimately both extremes of antidote and counteragent are abandoned.

original: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi stong pa dang stong pa cung zad @292b kyang med do zhes gnyi ga bsdu ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni sgra bsdeb pa'i sgo nas don gnyi ga bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi stong pa dang stong pa cung zad @292b kyang med do zhes gnyi ga bsdu ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni sgra bsdeb pa'i sgo nas don gnyi ga bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: This shows that the meaning of both is included by the arrangement of the words.

original: yang na stong pa dang mi stong pa zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa de dag ni gnyi la brten pas tha snyad pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na stong pa dang mi stong pa zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa de dag ni gnyi la brten pas tha snyad pa yin te /
translated: Or, the discriminations of “empty” and “non-empty” are conventional, because they are based on both.

original: dper na gtsug lag khang sku gzugs kyis mi stong la /
analyzed: dper na gtsug lag khang sku gzugs kyis mi stong la /
translated: For example, a temple is not empty of images,

original: dge slong dag gis stong pa yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag gis stong pa yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: and it is empty of monks.

original: don dam par ni mi stong cung zad yod min na /🔽gnyen por brtag pa gang yin pa'i //
analyzed: don dam par ni mi stong cung zad yod min na / gnyen por brtag pa gang yin pa'i //
translated: But ultimately, since there is not even a little that is non-empty,

original: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could there be an emptiness🔽that is a counteragent?

original: zhes bya bas ni gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi stong pa dang mi stong pa zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa ni kun rdzob tu gzhi la brten pas tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam par gzhi med pas tha snyad gdags su med par bstan🔽to // gang gi phyir 'dzin pa spang ba tsam nyid stong pa nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs pa de'i phyir gnyen po yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi stong pa dang mi stong pa zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa ni kun rdzob tu gzhi la brten pas tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam par gzhi med pas tha snyad gdags su med par bstan to // gang gi phyir 'dzin pa spang ba tsam nyid stong pa nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs pa de'i phyir gnyen po yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: This verse shows that the conceptualization of emptiness and non-emptiness as the antidotes and the counter agents, respectively, is a conventional one, based on the relative, because ultimately, there is no basis for the designation of conventional terms.🔽The conclusion is that the reason, “because the antidote exists,” is not established, because the mere elimination of the apprehension of existence is emptiness.

original: gang gi phyir yod pa dang med par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i phyir stong pa nyid do zhes gsungs par zad kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yod pa dang med par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i phyir stong pa nyid do zhes gsungs par zad kyi /
translated: This is because emptiness is taught to eliminate the conceptualization of the apprehension of existence and nonexistence.

original: gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi tshul du stong pa dang mi stong pa zhes bya ba dngos por yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs gnyen po yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pas bstan bcos mdzad
analyzed: gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi tshul du stong pa dang mi stong pa zhes bya ba dngos por yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs gnyen po yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pas bstan bcos mdzad
translated: Since emptiness and non-emptiness do not exist as entities in the manner of antidotes and objects of abandonment, the meaning of the opponent's argument, because antidotes exist, is unestablished.

original: pas brdzun pa dang / slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba chos bdag med pa ston pa'i don du bshad pa'i 'dod pa grub po //
analyzed: pas brdzun pa dang / slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba chos bdag med pa ston pa'i don du bshad pa'i 'dod pa grub po //
translated: Therefore, the treatise was composed. The assertion that false and deceptive phenomena are explained as having the meaning of teaching the selflessness of phenomena is established.

original: yang na rnal 'byor pa dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dgag pa lhur len pa'i thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa goms par byed pa /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor pa dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dgag pa lhur len pa'i thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa goms par byed pa /
translated: Or, the yogi who is accustomed to the knowledge arisen from hearing, contemplating, and meditating, which is intent on refuting the nature of all things,

original: la la 'di snyam du sems te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni theg pa chen po'i rnal 'byor spyod pa pa /
analyzed: la la 'di snyam du sems te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni theg pa chen po'i rnal 'byor spyod pa pa /
translated: Some think... and so on explain the yogacara of the Mahayana.

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal exists.

original: de la gnyis po yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la gnyis po yod ma yin //
translated: In it, duality does not exist.

original: stong pa nyid ni 'di la yod //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni 'di la yod //
translated: Emptiness exists in it.

original: de la yang ni de yod do //
analyzed: de la yang ni de yod do //
translated: And in that, that exists.

original: zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'dzin pa dag kun brtags kyi ngo bo nyid med kyang kun brtags dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid don dam par yod par sems pa dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'dzin pa dag kun brtags kyi ngo bo nyid med kyang kun brtags dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid don dam par yod par sems pa dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Those who hold this scripture think that although the imagined nature does not exist, emptiness, which is the absence of the imagined, exists ultimately.🔽In order to refute their scripture, the root text says:

original: gal te stong min cung zad yod //
analyzed: gal te stong min cung zad yod //
translated: If something were not empty,

original: stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur //🔽mi stong cung zad @293a * //
analyzed: stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur // mi stong cung zad @293a * //
translated: then something would be empty.

original: yod min na //
analyzed: yod min na //
translated: But if nothing were not empty,

original: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could anything be empty?

original: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa 'di rnam pa gzhan du rnam par bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa 'di rnam pa gzhan du rnam par bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This verse is explained in a different way.

original: de dag gi gzhung bstan pa'i phyir gal te kun brtags pa nyid kyis bdag nyid stong pa'i phyir dngos po de dag las kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid med du zin kyang de dag gi stong pa nyid ni ma byas pa'i phyir dang / ltos pa med pa'i phyir de kho na yin no snyam na zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhung bstan pa'i phyir gal te kun brtags pa nyid kyis bdag nyid stong pa'i phyir dngos po de dag las kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid med du zin kyang de dag gi stong pa nyid ni ma byas pa'i phyir dang / ltos pa med pa'i phyir de kho na yin no snyam na zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: In order to teach the treatises of those, it says, “If you think that because things are empty of the imaginary nature, although the imaginary nature does not exist in those things, their emptiness is suchness because it is not fabricated and is independent.”

original: de yang bzang po ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang bzang po ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that this is also not good, it says,

original: de yang legs par zin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang legs par zin pa ma yin te /
translated: “This is also not well taken.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa ni stong pa nyid yin la de ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pas de la ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa mi rigs pas de dgag pa'i phyir /🔽gal te stong min cung zad yod //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa ni stong pa nyid yin la de ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pas de la ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa mi rigs pas de dgag pa'i phyir / gal te stong min cung zad yod //
translated: Because the essencelessness of all things is emptiness, and since that does not exist substantially, it is not tenable to cling to it as an essence. Therefore, in order to refute that, it says,🔽If there were the slightest nonempty thing,

original: stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur //
translated: Then there would be the slightest empty thing.

original: zhes bya ba smras te stong pa ma yin pa'i shes pa rtog pa can nam rtog pa can ma yin pa'i spyod yul gyi dngos po cung zad cig yod par gyur na de la ltos pas sam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te stong pa ma yin pa'i shes pa rtog pa can nam rtog pa can ma yin pa'i spyod yul gyi dngos po cung zad cig yod par gyur na de la ltos pas sam /
translated: If there were anything at all that is not empty, either a conceptual or a non-conceptual object of activity, then, in dependence on that,

original: blo'i bye brag gis stong pa nyid kyi shes pa'i spyod yul dngos po'i de kho na stong pa'ang cung zad cig yod par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: blo'i bye brag gis stong pa nyid kyi shes pa'i spyod yul dngos po'i de kho na stong pa'ang cung zad cig yod par 'gyur grang na /
translated: or by the distinction of awareness, the object of activity of the cognition of emptiness, the reality of things, emptiness, would also exist to some degree.

original: mi stong cung zad yod min na //
analyzed: mi stong cung zad yod min na //
translated: But since nothing at all is non-empty,

original: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could emptiness exist?

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the inference of that,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: he says, “Well then, what?

original: gang yod pa de ni stong pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir dpe 'di las rjes su dpag pa bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: gang yod pa de ni stong pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir dpe 'di las rjes su dpag pa bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Since that which exists is emptiness, therefore, from this example, an inference is made.”

original: stong pa nyid kyi shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: The cognition of emptiness is either conceptual or non-conceptual.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul dngos po'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul dngos po'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is the nature of an entity that is the domain of nonconceptual consciousness is not real,

original: shes pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir dper na stong pa ma yin pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul bzhin pas dngos po'i de kho na stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir dper na stong pa ma yin pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul bzhin pas dngos po'i de kho na stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: because it is the domain of consciousness, like, for example, the domain of nonempty consciousness. Therefore, how could the reality of entities, emptiness, exist?🔽The example is not established because it is undermined by inference and because it does not have the nature of being uncreated and independent.

original: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir dang / ma byas pa dang ltos pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dpe ma grub po zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir dang / ma byas pa dang ltos pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dpe ma grub po zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the reason,

original: dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba dang / tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba dang / tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the example, the summary, and the result of valid knowledge are applied in order.

original: dper na stong @293b pa ma yin pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni shes pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyis shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'am
analyzed: dper na stong @293b pa ma yin pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni shes pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyis shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'am
translated: For example, the aspect of the object of consciousness that is imagined and is not empty is not real because it is the object of consciousness.🔽Likewise, the reality of things that is the object of consciousness, whether it is conceptual or nonconceptual consciousness, is not real because it is the object of consciousness.

original: / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul dngos po'i de kho na gang yin pa de yang shes pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pas dngos po'i de kho na stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul dngos po'i de kho na gang yin pa de yang shes pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pas dngos po'i de kho na stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, how could the reality of things that is emptiness exist?

original: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir dang / ma byas pa dang ltos pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir pha rol po'i dpe log pa'i shes pa'i gnyen po yang dag pa'i shes pa yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de ma grub po zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir dang / ma byas pa dang ltos pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir pha rol po'i dpe log pa'i shes pa'i gnyen po yang dag pa'i shes pa yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de ma grub po zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The opponent’s example is not established because it is undermined by inference and because it does not have an unfabricated and independent nature, like the existence of a correct consciousness that is the antidote to a mistaken consciousness.

original: yang na / mi stong cung zad yod min na //
analyzed: yang na / mi stong cung zad yod min na //
translated: There is nothing that is not empty.

original: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: How could emptiness exist?

original: ji ltar stong pa nyid ma yin par rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba stong pa nyid mthong ba'i mes bsregs pa'i phyir mi stong pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba yang de nyid kyis
analyzed: ji ltar stong pa nyid ma yin par rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba stong pa nyid mthong ba'i mes bsregs pa'i phyir mi stong pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba yang de nyid kyis
translated: Just as nothing at all is non-empty because the net of conceptual thought that it is not emptiness is burned up by the fire of seeing emptiness, so also the net of conceptual thought that it is emptiness is burned up by that fire.

original: bsregs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni stong pa nyid ma yin pa dang stong pa nyid ces bya bar tha snyad gdags pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis sgro btags pa yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i gags yin
analyzed: bsregs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni stong pa nyid ma yin pa dang stong pa nyid ces bya bar tha snyad gdags pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis sgro btags pa yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i gags yin
translated: Thus, the conventions “not empty” and “empty” are superimpositions by the power of conceptual thought.

original: pa'i phyir stong pa nyid mthong ba'i mes gnyi ga bsregs pa'i dus na mi stong par rnam par rtog pa cung zad kyang med pas stong par rnam par rtog pa yang yod par ga la 'gyur zhes ston to //
analyzed: pa'i phyir stong pa nyid mthong ba'i mes gnyi ga bsregs pa'i dus na mi stong par rnam par rtog pa cung zad kyang med pas stong par rnam par rtog pa yang yod par ga la 'gyur zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, when both are burned up by the fire of seeing emptiness, since there is not the slightest conceptual thought that it is not empty, how could the conceptual thought that it is empty exist?🔽This is taught by “How could emptiness exist?”

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir stong pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir stong pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very inference, he says, “Conceptualization of emptiness is also not in accordance with fact.”

original: rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir dngos por rnam par rtog pa bzhin pas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir dngos por rnam par rtog pa bzhin pas /
translated: Because it is a conceptualization, like conceptualization of entities,

original: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: how could emptiness exist?

original: rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis de ltar 'khrul lo zhes bu bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis de ltar 'khrul lo zhes bu bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The thought is that it is an error due to the power of conceptualization.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Those are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the proof, the example, the conclusion, and the result of valid knowledge, respectively.

original: dper na dngos po rnam par rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir don @294a * //
analyzed: dper na dngos po rnam par rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir don @294a * //
translated: For example, conceptualization of entities is not in accordance with fact because it is a conceptualization. In the same way, conceptualization of emptiness is also not in accordance with fact because it is a conceptualization.

original: ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pas stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pas stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could there be emptiness of what is not as it seems?

original: rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis de ltar 'khrul to zhes bya ba de ltar dgongs so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis de ltar 'khrul to zhes bya ba de ltar dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that it is a mistake due to the power of conceptuality.

original: yang na / mi stong cung zad yod min na //
analyzed: yang na / mi stong cung zad yod min na //
translated: Or, if nothing is empty,

original: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could emptiness exist?

original: gnyis su spyod pa la ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyi yul can gyi blo'i bye brag las sgyu mar byas pa 'di ni rta la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gnyis su spyod pa la ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyi yul can gyi blo'i bye brag las sgyu mar byas pa 'di ni rta la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: For one who engages in duality, the thought occurs that this illusion, which is created by the power of the mind that has the nature of entities, is empty of the nature of horses and so on.

original: yang dag pa 'di ni rta la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong ngo zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa 'di ni rta la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong ngo zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This reality is not empty of the nature of horses and so on.

original: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa de rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa la gnas shing gnyis su med pa la spyod pa de'i tshe na de la don dam par shes bya'i de kho na thams cad 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa de rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa la gnas shing gnyis su med pa la spyod pa de'i tshe na de la don dam par shes bya'i de kho na thams cad 'di lta ste /
translated: When the yogi abides in the practice of nonconceptual wisdom and engages in nonduality, at that time, in terms of the ultimate, all the suchness of objects of knowledge is as follows.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du mtshan nyid gcig pa dang mtshan nyid med par snang ba med pa'i tshul gyis snang bar 'gyur bas mi stong pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du mtshan nyid gcig pa dang mtshan nyid med par snang ba med pa'i tshul gyis snang bar 'gyur bas mi stong pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Since they appear in the manner of not appearing, like space, they are not the slightest bit nonempty.

original: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could emptiness exist?🔽The thought is that since there is no difference in the mind, there is no conception of mutual dependence, and there is no manifest clinging.

original: blo'i bye brag med pas phan tshun ltos par rtog pa'i mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor ba las dang po pa mos pa yid la byed pa stong pa dang stong pa ma yin pa gnyis su
analyzed: blo'i bye brag med pas phan tshun ltos par rtog pa'i mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor ba las dang po pa mos pa yid la byed pa stong pa dang stong pa ma yin pa gnyis su
translated: This is the explanation of the yoga of the beginner who is engaged in the mental contemplation of interest.🔽For the beginner who is engaged in the mental contemplation of interest, there is the yoga of the beginner who is engaged in the mental contemplation of interest.

original: spyod pa la ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyi yul can gyi blo'i bye brag las stong pa dang mi stong par rnam par mi rtog pa gnyis 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: spyod pa la ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyi yul can gyi blo'i bye brag las stong pa dang mi stong par rnam par mi rtog pa gnyis 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: For the beginner who is engaged in the mental contemplation of interest, there is the yoga of the beginner who is engaged in the mental contemplation of interest.

original: rnal 'byor pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa de kho na nyid yid la byed pa gnyis su med par spyod pa la ni blo'i bye brag med par phan tshun ltos par rtog pa'i mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir mi stong par rtog pa cung zad kyang yod🔽pa ma yin pas de la ltos pas sam /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa de kho na nyid yid la byed pa gnyis su med par spyod pa la ni blo'i bye brag med par phan tshun ltos par rtog pa'i mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir mi stong par rtog pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas de la ltos pas sam /
translated: For the yogi who is at the peak of the best, who practices nondual attention to suchness, there is not the slightest conception of nonemptiness because there is no conception of mutual dependence without the differentiation of mind.

original: de bsal bas stong par rnam par rtog pa yang med do zhes bya bar dgongs pa bstan te /
analyzed: de bsal bas stong par rnam par rtog pa yang med do zhes bya bar dgongs pa bstan te /
translated: Therefore, it is explained that there is no conception of emptiness in dependence on that or by eliminating that.

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /🔽'od srungs stong pa nyid ni gang zag rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las / 'od srungs stong pa nyid ni gang zag rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir ma yin zhing /
translated: The Heap of Jewels Sūtra says:🔽Kāśyapa, emptiness is not for the purpose of eliminating the person.

original: gang zag dngos po yod pa bshig nas stong pa nyid du byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zag dngos po yod pa bshig nas stong pa nyid du byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that emptiness is made by eliminating the person as an existent thing.

original: 'od srungs sngon gyi mtha' stong pa nyid dang / phyi ma'i mtha' stong ba nyid dang / da ltar byung ba stong pa nyid la rton par bya'i gang zag stong pa nyid la rton par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs sngon gyi mtha' stong pa nyid dang / phyi ma'i mtha' stong ba nyid dang / da ltar byung ba stong pa nyid la rton par bya'i gang zag stong pa nyid la rton par mi bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, rely on the emptiness of the past, the emptiness of the future, and the emptiness of the present, but do not rely on the emptiness of persons.

original: 'od @294b srungs gang dag stong pa nyid du dmigs pas stong pa nyid la rton cing /
analyzed: 'od @294b srungs gang dag stong pa nyid du dmigs pas stong pa nyid la rton cing /
translated: Kāśyapa, those who rely on emptiness as an object and🔽grasp it as a thing, I say they have fallen from and are lost to this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: dngos por 'dzin pa de dag ni chos 'dul ba 'di nyid las nyams pa dang / rab tu nyams par nga smra'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa stug po bkod pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: dngos por 'dzin pa de dag ni chos 'dul ba 'di nyid las nyams pa dang / rab tu nyams par nga smra'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa stug po bkod pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And similarly, the noble Dense Array Sūtra says,

original: gal te dngos po stong gyur na //
analyzed: gal te dngos po stong gyur na //
translated: If things were empty,

original: gzhig byar 'gyur zhing 'jig pa min //
analyzed: gzhig byar 'gyur zhing 'jig pa min //
translated: they would be destroyed, but they are not destroyed.

original: gang zag lhun po tsam dag gis //
analyzed: gang zag lhun po tsam dag gis //
translated: Even if persons were as large as Mount Meru,

original: bdag tu lta ba mi gnod do //🔽zhes ci skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba mi gnod do // zhes ci skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: the view of self would not be harmed.

original: de'i phyir gang zag tu lta ba bsal nas stong pa nyid yin par blta bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag tu lta ba bsal nas stong pa nyid yin par blta bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, having eliminated the view of the person, do not view it as empty.

original: de phyir rnam par bshad pa'i brnag pa snga ma tha dad pa dag gis gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma 'di'i skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba yin te /🔽gal te stong min cung zad yod //
analyzed: de phyir rnam par bshad pa'i brnag pa snga ma tha dad pa dag gis gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma 'di'i skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba yin te / gal te stong min cung zad yod //
