translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not established by the former different assertions of the explanation. This is the summary of the former verse.🔽If there were the slightest nonempty,

original: stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur //
translated: emptiness would exist.

original: mi stong cung zad yod min na //
analyzed: mi stong cung zad yod min na //
translated: Since there is not the slightest nonempty,

original: stong pa'ang yod par gal 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa 'di rnam par bshad pa'i brnag pa snga ma tha dad pa rnam pa lnga po dag gis pha rol pos don dam par dngos po rnams stong pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par gal 'gyur // zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa 'di rnam par bshad pa'i brnag pa snga ma tha dad pa rnam pa lnga po dag gis pha rol pos don dam par dngos po rnams stong pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: how could emptiness exist?🔽This verse is the summary of the former five different assertions of the explanation.

original: de'i gnyen po yod pa'i phyir zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don de don dam par ni ma grub pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po yod pa'i phyir zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don de don dam par ni ma grub pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of the reason that the opponent stated, “Ultimately, things are not emptiness because its antidote exists,” is not established ultimately.

original: kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: It is taught that it is contradictory conventionally.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid du gyur kyang sla ste yang kho bo cag gi snying ni stong pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir sgrub pa smra bar 'dod pas khyab pa yin la de yang khyed kyis dgag pas 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes bya bas ni de ltar dbu ma
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid du gyur kyang sla ste yang kho bo cag gi snying ni stong pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir sgrub pa smra bar 'dod pas khyab pa yin la de yang khyed kyis dgag pas 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes bya bas ni de ltar dbu ma
translated: It may be easy to show that the reason is not established or that it is contradictory,🔽but we assert that we are proponents of emptiness and that you, by refuting it, have established our desired object.

original: pas stong pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' dgag pa bstan pa dang / 'dir dngos por smra ba dag dga' bar gyur nas de dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag gi stong pa nyid dgag pa'i gtan tshigs ji skad smras pa de dag ma grub pa dang /
analyzed: pas stong pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' dgag pa bstan pa dang / 'dir dngos por smra ba dag dga' bar gyur nas de dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag gi stong pa nyid dgag pa'i gtan tshigs ji skad smras pa de dag ma grub pa dang /
translated: In this way, the Followers of the Middle Way teach the refutation of the extreme elaborations of emptiness, and the Proponents of Things rejoice and say, “The reasons you Proponents of the Middle Way use to refute emptiness are not established and are contradictory.

original: 'gal ba nyid du gyur kyang sla ste /🔽yang kho bo cag ni stong pa nyid dgag pa'i sgrub pa smra bar 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid du gyur kyang sla ste / yang kho bo cag ni stong pa nyid dgag pa'i sgrub pa smra bar 'dod pa yin la /
translated: It may be easy to show that they are not established and are contradictory,🔽but we assert that we are proponents of emptiness.

original: de yang khyed dbu ma pa nyid kyis bkag pas kho bo cag gi 'dod pa'i don grub bo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de yang khyed dbu ma pa nyid kyis bkag pas kho bo cag gi 'dod pa'i don grub bo zhes zer ro //
translated: You Followers of the Middle Way refute emptiness, and thus you have established our desired object.”

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary🔽says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽stong @295a * //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / stong @295a * //
translated: Here it is said:

original: pa nyid shes pa dngos po rnams stong pa nyid du byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: pa nyid shes pa dngos po rnams stong pa nyid du byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The knowledge of emptiness does not make things empty.

original: 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa nyid de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa nyid du gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa nyid de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa nyid du gsal bar byed de /
translated: Rather, it clarifies that the nature of things is not that nature,🔽just as the light of a lamp clarifies that a pot does not exist in a house, but it does not make it nonexistent.

original: dper na mar me'i snang bas khang khyim na bum pa med pa nyid du gsal bar byed kyi med par byed pa ma yin pa bzhin pas de med na de yod par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir de ni ma brtags par smra ba yin no zhes bya🔽ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na mar me'i snang bas khang khyim na bum pa med pa nyid du gsal bar byed kyi med par byed pa ma yin pa bzhin pas de med na de yod par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir de ni ma brtags par smra ba yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, since it is not nonexistent, it is said that this is an unanalyzed statement.

original: stong pa nyid kyis dngos po yod pa zhig stong pa nyid shes pas med par byas shing stong pa nyid de med na dngos po de yod par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis dngos po yod pa zhig stong pa nyid shes pas med par byas shing stong pa nyid de med na dngos po de yod par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The knowledge of emptiness does not make an existent thing empty.

original: stong pa nyid kyi dngos po med pa nyid shes pas rtogs par zad pas stong pa nyid kyi dngos po med par rtog pas dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yod par ma bstan pa'i phyir pha rol po'i tshig de ni ma brtags par gya tshom du smra ba yin
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi dngos po med pa nyid shes pas rtogs par zad pas stong pa nyid kyi dngos po med par rtog pas dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yod par ma bstan pa'i phyir pha rol po'i tshig de ni ma brtags par gya tshom du smra ba yin
translated: Since the nonexistence of the entity of emptiness is fully understood through knowledge of emptiness, the statement of the opponent is a reckless, unanalyzed statement, because it does not teach that the entity of an existent thing is the nonexistence of the entity of emptiness.

original: no // gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: no // gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: stong pa nyid du smra ba dag ni pha rol po'i tshig sun dbyung bar 'dod pas stong pa nyid du smra ba la brten zhing de yang gzhung mi gzugs par sems pa na stong pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes log par sgrub par byed pas
analyzed: stong pa nyid du smra ba dag ni pha rol po'i tshig sun dbyung bar 'dod pas stong pa nyid du smra ba la brten zhing de yang gzhung mi gzugs par sems pa na stong pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes log par sgrub par byed pas
translated: Those who propound emptiness, wishing to refute the statement of the opponent, rely on the statement of emptiness, but when they do not understand the text, they wrongly prove that emptiness does not exist.

original: de'i phyir de dag gis khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gis khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore they undermine their own assertions,🔽because a scripture says:

original: lung las / gang dag stong nyid rab shes pa //
analyzed: lung las / gang dag stong nyid rab shes pa //
translated: Those who fully understand emptiness

original: de dag chos nyid rnam par mthong //
analyzed: de dag chos nyid rnam par mthong //
translated: see the nature of phenomena.🔽And:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang // 'du ba dag ni ma rtogs pa'i //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang // 'du ba dag ni ma rtogs pa'i //
translated: Those who do not understand the collections

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin te //
translated: Things do not exist.

original: de phyir stong dang ma skyes dang // dngos nyid med par nga smra'o //
analyzed: de phyir stong dang ma skyes dang // dngos nyid med par nga smra'o //
translated: Therefore I say they are empty, non-arisen, and essenceless.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re dbu ma pa stong pa nyid du smra ba dag ni pha rol po dngos por smra ba'i tshig sun dbyung bar 'dod pas stong pa nyid du smra ba la
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re dbu ma pa stong pa nyid du smra ba dag ni pha rol po dngos por smra ba'i tshig sun dbyung bar 'dod pas stong pa nyid du smra ba la
translated: The opponent says that the Madhyamikas, who advocate emptiness, wish to refute the statements of the essentialists.🔽When they do so, they do not rely on scripture, and so they think that emptiness does not exist.

original: brten zhing de yang gzhung mi gzugs par sems pa na stong pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes log par sgrub par byed pas de'i phyir de dag gis lung las dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid du gsungs pa khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur
analyzed: brten zhing de yang gzhung mi gzugs par sems pa na stong pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes log par sgrub par byed pas de'i phyir de dag gis lung las dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid du gsungs pa khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur
translated: Therefore, they are proving the opposite of what they intend, and so they undermine their acceptance of the statement in sūtra that all things are empty.

original: te / 'jig rten thams cad ni 'bras bu'i don du 'jug pa yin na dbu ma pa ni rang gi 'bras bu lung las stong pa nyid ces gsungs pa yang sun 'byin par byed pas rang gi las blangs pa la gnod par @295b 'gyur ro zhes zer ba yin no
analyzed: te / 'jig rten thams cad ni 'bras bu'i don du 'jug pa yin na dbu ma pa ni rang gi 'bras bu lung las stong pa nyid ces gsungs pa yang sun 'byin par byed pas rang gi las blangs pa la gnod par @295b 'gyur ro zhes zer ba yin no
translated: The world engages for the sake of results. But the Madhyamaka refutes its own result, emptiness, so it would undermine its own action.

original: // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical.

original: lung las chos kyi rnam grangs gzings lta bur shes pa rnams kyis chos rnams nyid kyang spang bar bya na chos ma yin pa rnams lta ci smos zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gzugs stong zhes bya bar mi brtag mi stong zhes bya bar yang mi brtag go zhes gsungs pas stong pa nyid du lta ba 'dzin pa gzhan bsal ba la dgongs pas yongs su gzung ba yang don spyad zin na yongs su spang bar bya ba
analyzed: lung las chos kyi rnam grangs gzings lta bur shes pa rnams kyis chos rnams nyid kyang spang bar bya na chos ma yin pa rnams lta ci smos zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gzugs stong zhes bya bar mi brtag mi stong zhes bya bar yang mi brtag go zhes gsungs pas stong pa nyid du lta ba 'dzin pa gzhan bsal ba la dgongs pas yongs su gzung ba yang don spyad zin na yongs su spang bar bya ba
translated: The scriptures say, “Those who know the Dharma is like a raft should abandon the Dharma, let alone non-Dharma,” and “Do not conceive of form as empty or not empty.” Since this is stated with the intention of dispelling the view that emptiness is a thing to be grasped, it is like a raft that is to be abandoned once the meaning has been practiced.

original: yin pa'i phyir dang / stong pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa de yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa'i gegs yin pas spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir dang / de la mngon par zhen pa yang skyon chen por 'gyur ba'i phyir de yongs su spangs pa la skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir dang / stong pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa de yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa'i gegs yin pas spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir dang / de la mngon par zhen pa yang skyon chen por 'gyur ba'i phyir de yongs su spangs pa la skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: And because strong attachment to it would be a great fault, there is no fault in completely abandoning it.🔽A sutra states:

original: lung las chos kyi rnams grangs gzings lta bur shes pa rnams kyis chos rnams nyid kyang spang bar bya na chos ma yin pa rnams lta ci smos zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: lung las chos kyi rnams grangs gzings lta bur shes pa rnams kyis chos rnams nyid kyang spang bar bya na chos ma yin pa rnams lta ci smos zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Those who know that the enumeration of phenomena is like a raft should abandon even phenomena, let alone nonphenomena.

original: dper na 'gron pa chu klung rgal bar 'dod pas gzings la brten te /
analyzed: dper na 'gron pa chu klung rgal bar 'dod pas gzings la brten te /
translated: For example, travelers who wish to cross a river rely on a raft.🔽Having crossed the river, they abandon the raft and go on.

original: chu klung rgal nas gzings spangs te 'gro ba de bzhin du rnal 'byor ba dngos por lta ba'i chu klung rgal bar 'dod pas kyang stong pa nyid du lta ba gzings lta bu la brten te /
analyzed: chu klung rgal nas gzings spangs te 'gro ba de bzhin du rnal 'byor ba dngos por lta ba'i chu klung rgal bar 'dod pas kyang stong pa nyid du lta ba gzings lta bu la brten te /
translated: Similarly, yogis who wish to cross the river of the view of entities rely on the raft of the view of emptiness.

original: dngos por lta ba'i chu klung las rgal nas stong pa nyid du lta ba gzings lta bu de spangs te /
analyzed: dngos por lta ba'i chu klung las rgal nas stong pa nyid du lta ba gzings lta bu de spangs te /
translated: Having crossed the river of the view of entities, one should abandon the raft-like view of emptiness and proceed on the path to nonabiding nirvana.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam du 'gro bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / lung las gzugs stong zhes bya bar mi brtag / mi stong zhes bya bar yang mi brtag go zhes gsungs pas rnal 'byor pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa la gnas shing gnyis su med pa la spyod pa'i tshe na stong ba ma yin
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam du 'gro bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / lung las gzugs stong zhes bya bar mi brtag / mi stong zhes bya bar yang mi brtag go zhes gsungs pas rnal 'byor pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa la gnas shing gnyis su med pa la spyod pa'i tshe na stong ba ma yin
translated: And since the scriptures state, “Do not investigate whether form is empty or not empty,” when yogis abide in the conduct of nonconceptual wisdom and engage in the practice of nonduality, they do not engage in emptiness.

original: par rnam par rtog pa dang stong par rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' gnyi ga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i gegs yin pas spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir dang / stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa yang skyon chen por 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir dbu ma pas stong pa nyid du yang gzhung mi gzugs par sems pa na stong pa @296a * //
analyzed: par rnam par rtog pa dang stong par rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' gnyi ga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i gegs yin pas spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir dang / stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa yang skyon chen por 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir dbu ma pas stong pa nyid du yang gzhung mi gzugs par sems pa na stong pa @296a * //
translated: Since both the extreme of conceptualizing things and the extreme of conceptualizing emptiness are obstacles to cultivating the perfection of wisdom, they are to be abandoned. And since even clinging to emptiness is a great fault, when the Followers of the Middle Way think about emptiness, they do not even posit “emptiness.”

original: nyid kyang ma yin no zhes de yongs su spangs pa la skyon med do //
analyzed: nyid kyang ma yin no zhes de yongs su spangs pa la skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault in their completely abandoning the notion of “emptiness.”

original: da ni dngos por lta ba spang ba'i phyir stong pa nyid ces gsungs la /
analyzed: da ni dngos por lta ba spang ba'i phyir stong pa nyid ces gsungs la /
translated: Now, in order to abandon the view of things, the Buddha taught “emptiness.”

original: stong pa nyid du lta ba yang gsor mi rung bas spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul gyis dbu ma'i don bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du lta ba yang gsor mi rung bas spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul gyis dbu ma'i don bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the view of emptiness is also to be abandoned because it is incurable, the text now concludes the teaching on the meaning of the Middle Way by way of abandoning the two extremes.

original: 'di ltar lha dang mi'i bla ma rnams kyis /
analyzed: 'di ltar lha dang mi'i bla ma rnams kyis /
translated: The buddhas, the supreme teachers of gods and humans,

original: srog chags lta ba sna tshogs kyi skyon gyi dug gis sems khyab par gyur pa sdug bsngal mi bzad pa'i nad rgyun mi 'chad pa rnams la thugs rje ba na /
analyzed: srog chags lta ba sna tshogs kyi skyon gyi dug gis sems khyab par gyur pa sdug bsngal mi bzad pa'i nad rgyun mi 'chad pa rnams la thugs rje ba na /
translated: The minds of living beings are pervaded by the poison of the various faults of views, and they are continuously afflicted by the disease of unbearable suffering.

original: rgyal ba rnams kyis stong nyid ni //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyis stong nyid ni //
translated: The Victors have taught that emptiness

original: lta kun des par 'byin par gsungs//
analyzed: lta kun des par 'byin par gsungs//
translated: is the definite release from all views.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: lta kun zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi sa bon gyi lta ba thams cad do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: lta kun zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi sa bon gyi lta ba thams cad do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: In order to explain the meaning of the words “all views,” it is said: “all views are the seeds of various sufferings.”

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir lta ba ni mngon par zhen pa dang 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir lta ba ni mngon par zhen pa dang 'dzin pa ste /
translated: In order to teach that very point in detail, it is said: “Views are the adherence and grasping of the mind to things.

original: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Their divisions are the view of the transitory collection and so on.”

original: stong pa nyid kyis lta ba kun las nges par 'byin par gsungs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis lta ba kun las nges par 'byin par gsungs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that emptiness is said to be the definite release from all views, it is said:

original: de dag gi gnyen po ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Their antidotes are the emptiness of the inner, etc.🔽Thus, he explains the method of teaching emptiness in order to abandon the view of things.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni dngos por lta ba spang ba'i phyir stong pa nyid cas gsungs pa'i tshul bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni dngos por lta ba spang ba'i phyir stong pa nyid cas gsungs pa'i tshul bstan to //
translated: Now, in order to teach the method of abandoning the view of emptiness, which is incurable, he says:

original: da ni stong pa nyid du lta ba yang gsor mi rung bas spang bar bya ba'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po nye bar ma bsags pa bsam yongs su ma smin pa chos zab mo la bzod pa ma skyes pa lam la mi
analyzed: da ni stong pa nyid du lta ba yang gsor mi rung bas spang bar bya ba'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po nye bar ma bsags pa bsam yongs su ma smin pa chos zab mo la bzod pa ma skyes pa lam la mi
translated: Those who do not have a great accumulation of wholesome roots, whose thoughts are not mature, who have not generated the patience for the profound Dharma, who are unskilled in the path,

original: mkhas pa / gang dag stong pa nyid lta ba //
analyzed: mkhas pa / gang dag stong pa nyid lta ba //
translated: and who view emptiness

original: de dag bsgrub tu med par gsungs //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de dag bsgrub tu med par gsungs //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: are said to be incapable of practice.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir 'di nyid yod do zhes stong pa nyid du 'dzin pa gang dag / bkru sman btang ba khong du 'khyil pa'i nad pa bzhin du lta ba sna tshogs kyi skyon gyis sems ma rung bar gyur pa rnams la
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir 'di nyid yod do zhes stong pa nyid du 'dzin pa gang dag / bkru sman btang ba khong du 'khyil pa'i nad pa bzhin du lta ba sna tshogs kyi skyon gyis sems ma rung bar gyur pa rnams la
translated: Those whose minds are corrupted by the faults of various views, like patients whose bodies are filled with the effects of a purgative,

original: de zhi bar nus pa stong pa nyid kyi sman byin pa las skyon chen pos 'khrugs par gyur pa nad pa lta bu de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa sman pa mchog lta bus bsgrub tu med par gsungs pas de'i phyir de spangs pa la skyon med do🔽zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de zhi bar nus pa stong pa nyid kyi sman byin pa las skyon chen pos 'khrugs par gyur pa nad pa lta bu de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa sman pa mchog lta bus bsgrub tu med par gsungs pas de'i phyir de spangs pa la skyon med do🔽zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: who are unable to be cured by the medicine of emptiness, are like patients who are disturbed by a great fault. The Tathāgata, like the supreme doctor, says that they are incurable. Therefore there is no fault in abandoning them.

original: da ni mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul gyis dbu ma'i don bstan pa'i @296b mjug bsdu ba'i phyir 'gron po phal pa shing rta bying pa 'byin pa'i rngan pa ci yang med do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de byin cig ces zer ba sgra'i don mngon
analyzed: da ni mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul gyis dbu ma'i don bstan pa'i @296b mjug bsdu ba'i phyir 'gron po phal pa shing rta bying pa 'byin pa'i rngan pa ci yang med do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de byin cig ces zer ba sgra'i don mngon
translated: Now, in order to conclude the teaching on the meaning of the middle way by way of the avoidance of the two extremes, he says, “Just as one might say, ‘Give the reward to the ordinary traveler for pulling the chariot out of the mud, but not to the expert,’ the experts would be displeased.

original: par mi shes pa lta bur mkhas pa rnams kyis smad par gyur na mi rung bas kho bo stong pa nyid la dngos por mngon par zhen pa mi byed do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: par mi shes pa lta bur mkhas pa rnams kyis smad par gyur na mi rung bas kho bo stong pa nyid la dngos por mngon par zhen pa mi byed do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, I do not assert that emptiness is a thing.”

original: dper na 'gron po shing rta lam du zhugs pa'i shing rta rdzab tu bying ba'i tshe 'gron po phal pa sgra'i don la mi mkhas pa zhig 'ongs pa la shing rta pas /
analyzed: dper na 'gron po shing rta lam du zhugs pa'i shing rta rdzab tu bying ba'i tshe 'gron po phal pa sgra'i don la mi mkhas pa zhig 'ongs pa la shing rta pas /
translated: For example, when the chariot of a traveler who has set out on the road gets stuck in the mud, an ordinary traveler who is ignorant of the meaning of the words might say, “Give the reward to the one who pulls the chariot out of the mud, but not to the expert.”

original: kho bo'i shing rta bying pa 'di phyung shig ces byas pa dang / 'gron po phal pa de na re rngan pa ci yod ces zer ba na shing rta bas rngan pa ci yang med do zhes byas pa dang / 'gron po phal pa des shing rta bying pa de phyung nas de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces rngan pa ci yang med do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de da byin cig ces zer ba de sgra'i don la mi mkhas pa yin par mkhas pa rnams kyis smad
analyzed: kho bo'i shing rta bying pa 'di phyung shig ces byas pa dang / 'gron po phal pa de na re rngan pa ci yod ces zer ba na shing rta bas rngan pa ci yang med do zhes byas pa dang / 'gron po phal pa des shing rta bying pa de phyung nas de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces rngan pa ci yang med do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de da byin cig ces zer ba de sgra'i don la mi mkhas pa yin par mkhas pa rnams kyis smad
translated: The ordinary traveler said, “What is the reward?” The charioteer said, “There is no reward at all.” The ordinary traveler pulled the stuck chariot out of the mud and then said, “Now give me the reward that you said there was none.” The charioteer said, “The reward is that there is no reward at all.” The ordinary traveler was not skilled in the meaning of words and was ridiculed by the wise.

original: par gyur na mi rung ba de bzhin du 'dir yang dngos por lta ba bsal ba'i gnyen por stong pa nyid bstan pa na stong pa nyid yod par lta ba ni mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i don la mkhas pa ma yin par mkhas pa rnams kyis smad
analyzed: par gyur na mi rung ba de bzhin du 'dir yang dngos por lta ba bsal ba'i gnyen por stong pa nyid bstan pa na stong pa nyid yod par lta ba ni mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i don la mkhas pa ma yin par mkhas pa rnams kyis smad
translated: It would be inappropriate to be like that. In the same way, when emptiness is taught as the antidote that dispels the view of things as real, the view that emptiness exists is not skill in the meaning of the abandonment of the two extremes. The wise will ridicule it.

original: par gyur na mi rung bas kho bo stong pa nyid la yang dngos por mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
analyzed: par gyur na mi rung bas kho bo stong pa nyid la yang dngos por mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, we do not reify emptiness as a thing.

original: de'i phyir yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi lan med do zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa gong ma de nyid kyi skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi lan med do zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa gong ma de nyid kyi skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Hence, the response that the meaning of the reason is not established is not relevant. This is the conclusion of the above verse.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos smras pa'i sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa dang / rang dbang rjes su dpag pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pa'i mthus 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos smras pa'i sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa dang / rang dbang rjes su dpag pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pa'i mthus 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang /
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is as follows: The response to the opponent’s refutation and the demonstration of the non-transgression of the autonomous inference through the power of the teaching of the essencelessness of all things in terms of the three natures is the conclusion.

original: tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: This is the result of the valid cognition.

original: de kho na brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur lta ba ni pha rol pos 'du byed rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba snang ba'i gtan tshigs kyis ngo
analyzed: de kho na brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur lta ba ni pha rol pos 'du byed rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur ba snang ba'i gtan tshigs kyis ngo
translated: The opponent has refuted the lack of entityness of compounded phenomena, and in response the author of the treatise has stated that because of the reason of the appearance of transformation,🔽the nonabiding of entityness is established, and he has responded by stating that the person is only the selflessness of phenomena.

original: bo nyid nges par mi gnas pa'i sgo nas gang zag bdag med pa tsam du smra ba'i lan btab ba dang / bstan bcos mdzad pas /
analyzed: bo nyid nges par mi gnas pa'i sgo nas gang zag bdag med pa tsam du smra ba'i lan btab ba dang / bstan bcos mdzad pas /
translated: The treatise states:🔽The Bhagavat has said

original: chos gang slu ba de brdzun zhes //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad @297a * //
analyzed: chos gang slu ba de brdzun zhes // bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad @297a * //
translated: that whatever is deceptive is false.

original: gsungs // 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos //
analyzed: gsungs // 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos //
translated: All compounded phenomena are deceptive phenomena.

original: des na de dag brdzun pa yin //
analyzed: des na de dag brdzun pa yin //
translated: Therefore they are false.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pa'i mthus 'du byed rnams gang zag bdag med pa'i rnam pa las khyad par du 'phags pa chos bdag med pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pa'i mthus 'du byed rnams gang zag bdag med pa'i rnam pa las khyad par du 'phags pa chos bdag med pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, through the power of teaching unassailable independent inferences, he teaches that compounded phenomena are superior to the aspect of the selflessness of persons in being the selflessness of phenomena, which is essencelessness.🔽What is the good of teaching that compounded phenomena are essenceless in terms of aspects?

original: 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: To dispel the claim by others that this teaching is established by mere dry sophistry, it is also established by means of a source of trustworthy testimony.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavatī Prajñāpāramitā Subāhupariprcchāsūtra says:

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa chos thams cad ni phyin ci log gis kun nas bslang ba yang dag pa ma yin pa yod pa ma yin pa log pa brdzun pa ste /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa chos thams cad ni phyin ci log gis kun nas bslang ba yang dag pa ma yin pa yod pa ma yin pa log pa brdzun pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are motivated by error, they are not real, they do not exist, they are false, they are lies.🔽Subhūti, therefore, those who engage in any phenomenon engage in error, engage in what is not real.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa de'i phyir gang chos 'ga' zhig la spyod pa de ni phyin ci log la spyod pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos gang dag brdzun pa dang slu ba de dag
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa de'i phyir gang chos 'ga' zhig la spyod pa de ni phyin ci log la spyod pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos gang dag brdzun pa dang slu ba de dag
translated: All phenomena that are said to be false and deceptive🔽are said to be essenceless.

original: thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And likewise, the noble Brahma’s Net Sutra says:🔽The world is attached to truth, but this phenomenon is not true and is not false.

original: 'jig rten ni bden pa la mngon par zhen pa yin gyi chos 'di ni bden pa yang ma yin brdzun pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de
analyzed: 'jig rten ni bden pa la mngon par zhen pa yin gyi chos 'di ni bden pa yang ma yin brdzun pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de
translated: This is established.

original: dag grub pa ni 'du byed rnams gang zag bdag med pa'i rnam pa las khyad par du 'phags pa chos bdag med pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin te /
analyzed: dag grub pa ni 'du byed rnams gang zag bdag med pa'i rnam pa las khyad par du 'phags pa chos bdag med pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin te /
translated: The perfection of purity is the quality and source of teaching that compounded phenomena are identitylessness in the sense of being devoid of a self of persons and also in the sense of being devoid of a self of phenomena.

original: de'i phyir kho bos rang gi bsam pas rtog ge skam po tsam gyis bsgrubs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bos rang gi bsam pas rtog ge skam po tsam gyis bsgrubs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, I have not established this through mere dry logic of my own thinking.

original: lung de dag kyang yod do //🔽gang gi phyir de ltar theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' yas pa dag las 'du byed rnams gang zag bdag med pa'i rnam pa las khyad par du 'phags pa chos bdag med pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam
analyzed: lung de dag kyang yod do // gang gi phyir de ltar theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' yas pa dag las 'du byed rnams gang zag bdag med pa'i rnam pa las khyad par du 'phags pa chos bdag med pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam
translated: These scriptural quotations do exist.

original: par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob @297b dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob @297b dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because in this way, in the limitless sūtras of the Great Vehicle, compounded phenomena are taught to be identityless in the sense of being devoid of a self of persons and also in the sense of being devoid of a self of phenomena, the master’s great knowledge and skill in composing commentaries have shown that these teachings are the very objects to be explained in this treatise.

original: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las de kho na brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las de kho na brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the thirteenth chapter of the Root Verses of the Middle Way, called “Reality.”🔽This commentary on the thirteenth chapter, “The Examination of Reality,” of the Root Verses of the Middle Way, called The Lamp of Wisdom, was composed by the master Bhāviveka.

original: rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
translated: This commentary on the thirteenth chapter, “The Examination of Reality,” of the Root Verses of the Middle Way, called The Lamp of Wisdom, composed by the master Bhāviveka, is complete.

original: // / da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par bsal bas phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par bsal bas phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, in the same way, in order to teach contactlessness by dispelling the specific faults that are the opposites of emptiness, the fourteenth chapter is begun with the words “the meaning of the power.”

original: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
analyzed: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
translated: The word “power” in this context should be seen as having the meaning of the cause of engagement in the thesis and the meaning of the subject matter that will be presented below.

original: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is the same as before.

original: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With respect to that, from the perspective of the meaning of the cause of engagement in the thesis,

original: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par bsal bas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par bsal bas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Now, in the same way, the treatise states, “The distinctive feature of the negation of emptiness’s antithesis is stated.”

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bcas pa mdzad pas 'dir yang bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas🔽nas de skad smras te /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bcas pa mdzad pas 'dir yang bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
translated: The treatise’s author, in the first chapter of the Treatise on the Middle Way, set forth the thesis that all things are unproduced. Here, the treatise’s author states the above lines in terms of the reason for engaging in that thesis.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa snga ma'i skabs su bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa snga ma'i skabs su bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du'o //
translated: The phrase “in the same way” refers to the system presented in the previous chapter.

original: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
translated: Emptiness is our own position.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol ba'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol ba'i phyogs yin te /
translated: Its antithesis is the position of our opponents.

original: 'di lta ste dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
translated: It is the position that things exist inherently.

original: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa 'og nas khyed phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab
analyzed: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa 'og nas khyed phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab
translated: The “distinction” is the prior position of the opponent, which establishes that things have intrinsic reality.

original: kyi tshul dang 'gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa sun 'byin pa dang rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa smra ba dag yin no //
analyzed: kyi tshul dang 'gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa sun 'byin pa dang rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa smra ba dag yin no //
translated: The refutation and independent inference that will be stated below are as follows: “You who advocate that the aggregates, etc. are devoid of intrinsic reality contradict the scriptures of the Lord Buddha,🔽etc.”

original: de bsal ba zhes bya ba ni de bsal ba'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bsal ba zhes bya ba ni de bsal ba'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “The refutation of that” is to be supplied with the phrase “the fourteenth chapter is begun in order to refute that.”

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of the meaning of the text that will be presented below,

original: phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu phyed pa bcu bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu phyed pa bcu bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said that “the fourteenth chapter is begun in order to demonstrate the lack of intrinsic reality of contact.”

original: phrad pa @298a * //
analyzed: phrad pa @298a * //
translated: Contact

original: brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don tha dad pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pa
analyzed: brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don tha dad pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pa
translated: The meaning of the passage from the fourteenth chapter of the text that is cited below is that because it teaches that contact lacks intrinsic existence, it teaches that dependent origination is not a different object and so on.

original: yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
analyzed: yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
translated: So it is in terms of this that it is said to be so.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
translated: What is the result of this chapter and by what process does one attain that result?

original: phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba don tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The result of this chapter is that because it teaches that contact lacks intrinsic existence, it teaches that dependent origination is not a different object and so on.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs khyad par bsal ba'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs khyad par bsal ba'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
translated: Since one attains that result by means of the special removal of the discordant side of emptiness, therefore the author of the commentary first taught the method, the result that arises from the method, and so on at the juncture of this chapter.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, he said, “The special removal of the discordant side of emptiness,” and so on.

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In response to that, he said, “Here they say,” and so on.

original: phas kyi rgol ba dag don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i gzhung sngar bkag tu zin kyang de dag la mngon par zhen pa kha cig gis de mi bzod pas yang de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba dag don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i gzhung sngar bkag tu zin kyang de dag la mngon par zhen pa kha cig gis de mi bzod pas yang de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro
translated: Although the scriptures of the opponents that state that ultimately things exist by way of their own entities have already been refuted, some who are attached to them cannot bear that refutation. Therefore they say, “Things do exist by way of their own entities.”

original: // de'i phyir khyed phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab kyi tshul dang 'gal te /
analyzed: // de'i phyir khyed phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab kyi tshul dang 'gal te /
translated: Therefore, you who advocate that the aggregates and so on are essenceless contradict the doctrine of the scriptures of the Lord Buddha.

original: gzugs dang rnam par shes pa dang mig gsum phrad pa ni reg pa'o zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir khyed kyis khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gzugs dang rnam par shes pa dang mig gsum phrad pa ni reg pa'o zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir khyed kyis khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Since it says that the contact of form, consciousness, and eye is contact, you contradict your own tenets.

original: de ni sun 'byin pa'i sgo nas khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ba'i skyon 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sun 'byin pa'i sgo nas khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ba'i skyon 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: This is a fault that is to be charged against you, since it is a refutation that undermines your own tenets.

original: don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that ultimately things exist essentially,🔽because contact is taught in dependence on them.

original: de dag la brten nas phrad pa bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: de dag la brten nas phrad pa bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is an autonomous inference.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the proposition, and the reason are to be applied in order.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni ston pas de la brten nas phrad pa nyid ma bstan te /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni ston pas de la brten nas phrad pa nyid ma bstan te /
translated: Here, the Teacher did not teach that one can contact that which does not exist in any way,🔽just as he did not teach that one can contact the hairs of a turtle.

original: dper na rus sbal gyi spu dag bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no /
analyzed: dper na rus sbal gyi spu dag bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no /
translated: This is an example of a dissimilar class.

original: @298b bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab la 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba dag gis kun du sbyar to zhes bya ba de yod pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: @298b bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab la 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba dag gis kun du sbyar to zhes bya ba de yod pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The statement “The Blessed One taught that one is bound by the fetters of attachment, hostility, and ignorance” is an example of a syllogism by way of a direct application.🔽Therefore, because of the power of the reason stated above, things do exist essentially.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smras pa'i mthus dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smras pa'i mthus dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: 'di na bcom ldan 'das kyis rus sbal gyi spu la sogs pa med pa gang dag la brten nas phrad pa ma bstan pa de dag ni don dam bar yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di na bcom ldan 'das kyis rus sbal gyi spu la sogs pa med pa gang dag la brten nas phrad pa ma bstan pa de dag ni don dam bar yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, the Blessed One did not teach that one can contact those things that do not exist in any way, such as the hairs of a turtle.

original: dngos po gang dag la brten nas phrad pa bstan pa de dag ni don dam par yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dngos po gang dag la brten nas phrad pa bstan pa de dag ni don dam par yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Those things in dependence upon which contact is taught exist only ultimately.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: blta bya lta ba lta ba po //
analyzed: blta bya lta ba lta ba po //
translated: The object seen, seeing, and the seer

original: gsum po de dag gnyis gnyis dang // thams cad kyang ni phan tshun du //
analyzed: gsum po de dag gnyis gnyis dang // thams cad kyang ni phan tshun du //
translated: these three

original: phrad par gyur pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: phrad par gyur pa yod ma yin //
translated: do not make mutual contact🔽either in pairs or all together.

original: blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po de dag gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun du phrad par gyur pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po de dag gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun du phrad par gyur pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The object seen, seeing, and the seer do not make mutual contact either in pairs or all together.

original: lta ba po blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang mi phrad do zhes dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: lta ba po blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang mi phrad do zhes dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The thesis is stated: The seer does not make contact with the object seen or seeing.🔽Similarly, desire, the desirous one,

original: de bzhin 'dod chags chags pa dang // chags par 'gyur dang nyon mongs pa //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dod chags chags pa dang // chags par 'gyur dang nyon mongs pa //
translated: and that with which one desires,

original: lhag ma rnams dang skye mched kyi //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams dang skye mched kyi //
translated: and the remaining afflictions🔽and the sense bases,

original: lhag ma 'ang rnam pa gsum gyis blta //
analyzed: lhag ma 'ang rnam pa gsum gyis blta //
translated: The remainder should be viewed in three ways.

original: zhes bya bas ni ji ltar lta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po gsum po de dag gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun du phrad par 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du 'dod chags dang / chags pa dang / chags par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni ji ltar lta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po gsum po de dag gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun du phrad par 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du 'dod chags dang / chags pa dang / chags par gyur pa dang /
translated: This shows that just as the object seen, seeing, and the seer do not make mutual contact in any of the three ways, so also attachment, one who is attached, and that which is attached,

original: nyon mongs pa lhag ma rnams dang skye mched kyi lhag ma rnams kyang gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyi rnam pa gsum gyis phan tshun du phrad pa med par blta bar bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa lhag ma rnams dang skye mched kyi lhag ma rnams kyang gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyi rnam pa gsum gyis phan tshun du phrad pa med par blta bar bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: and the remaining afflictions and the remaining bases should be viewed in three ways as not making mutual contact.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate just that, he says:

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang / chags pa dang chags par 'gyur ba dang / 'dod chags bstan pa las gzhan pa nyon mongs pa lhag ma zhe sdang la sogs pa de dag kyang zhe sdang dang zhe sdang can dang / zhe sdang bar bya ba la sogs par rnam par bzhag nas gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyi rnam pa gsum gyis phan tshun du phrad par 'gyur ba med par @299a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang / chags pa dang chags par 'gyur ba dang / 'dod chags bstan pa las gzhan pa nyon mongs pa lhag ma zhe sdang la sogs pa de dag kyang zhe sdang dang zhe sdang can dang / zhe sdang bar bya ba la sogs par rnam par bzhag nas gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyi rnam pa gsum gyis phan tshun du phrad par 'gyur ba med par @299a * //
translated: the three aspects of each should be stated in the same way as above, i.e., as not mutually contacting each other in any of the three ways.

original: dgag pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: dgag pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The rest should be stated in the same way.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: All the afflictions should be applied as appropriate.

original: de la 'dod chags ni lhag par chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags ni lhag par chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Here, desire has the characteristic of excessive attachment.

original: nyon mongs pa ni sems can rnams kyi rgyud nyon mongs par byed pa'o zhes bya bas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni sems can rnams kyi rgyud nyon mongs par byed pa'o zhes bya bas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: The afflictions afflict the mental continuum of sentient beings. This explains the characteristics of the afflictions such as desire, etc.

original: skye mched bstan pa la ltos nas ma bstan pa lhag ma nyan pa dang snom pa dang lce dang lus dang yid ces bya ba de dag la yang mnyan par bya ba dang nyan pa dang nyan pa po dang de bzhin du bsnam par bya ba dang /
analyzed: skye mched bstan pa la ltos nas ma bstan pa lhag ma nyan pa dang snom pa dang lce dang lus dang yid ces bya ba de dag la yang mnyan par bya ba dang nyan pa dang nyan pa po dang de bzhin du bsnam par bya ba dang /
translated: The remaining faculties of hearing, smelling, tongue, body, and mind, which are not taught in the teaching of the faculties, also do not mutually contact each other in the aspect of the three, such as the object of hearing, hearing, and the hearer, and so on, up to the object of smell, smelling, and the smeller, and so on.

original: snom pa dang / snom pa po la sogs pa dag kyang gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyi rnam pa gsum gyis phan tshun du phrad par 'gyur ba med par dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba yang skye mched thams cad dang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: snom pa dang / snom pa po la sogs pa dag kyang gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyi rnam pa gsum gyis phan tshun du phrad par 'gyur ba med par dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba yang skye mched thams cad dang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The refutation of the non-teaching should be stated in the same way for all the faculties, as appropriate.

original: de la skye mched kyi don ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba'i sgo'i don to zhes bya bas ni skye mched kyi mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de la skye mched kyi don ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba'i sgo'i don to zhes bya bas ni skye mched kyi mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: Here, the meaning of faculty is the meaning of the door for the arising of minds and mental factors. This teaches the definition of the faculties.

original: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dang 'dod chags pa la sogs pa dag gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun du phrad pa med pa de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phrad pa med par bsgrub pa'i phyogs yin
analyzed: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dang 'dod chags pa la sogs pa dag gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun du phrad pa med pa de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phrad pa med par bsgrub pa'i phyogs yin
translated: The thesis is that the object seen and so on, and attachment and so on, do not mutually contact each other in pairs, nor do they all contact each other.

original: no // da ni phrad pa med pa bstan pa'i phyir 'thad pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: no // da ni phrad pa med pa bstan pa'i phyir 'thad pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the nonexistence of contact, the rationale will be explained.

original: gzhan na gzhan du phrad gyur na //
analyzed: gzhan na gzhan du phrad gyur na //
translated: If one thing contacts another,

original: gang phyir blta bya la sogs la //
analyzed: gang phyir blta bya la sogs la //
translated: then the object seen and so on🔽would be different from the seer and so on,

original: gzhan de yod pa ma yin pa //🔽de phyir phrad pa mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan de yod pa ma yin pa // de phyir phrad pa mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but that is not so.

original: phrad pa ni sbyor ba'i rnam grangs te /
analyzed: phrad pa ni sbyor ba'i rnam grangs te /
translated: Contact is a synonym for conjunction.

original: de yang gzhan yod na gzhan dang phrad par 'gyur ba yin na gang gi phyir blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po dang 'dod chags dang chags pa dang chags par 'gyur ba la sogs pa dag la gzhan de yang yod pa ma yin pa
analyzed: de yang gzhan yod na gzhan dang phrad par 'gyur ba yin na gang gi phyir blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po dang 'dod chags dang chags pa dang chags par 'gyur ba la sogs pa dag la gzhan de yang yod pa ma yin pa
translated: If one thing is different from another, then one thing would contact another. But the object seen and so on, the seer and so on, attachment and one who is attached and so on, are not different from each other.

original: de'i phyir phrad par mi 'gyur ro zhes mjug bsdu ba'i tshig yin no zhes bya bas ni phrad pa med par rjes su dpag pa ston to //
analyzed: de'i phyir phrad par mi 'gyur ro zhes mjug bsdu ba'i tshig yin no zhes bya bas ni phrad pa med par rjes su dpag pa ston to //
translated: This is the concluding statement.

original: 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pas phyogs kyi chos ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pas phyogs kyi chos ston to //
translated: This shows the property of the position through the reversal of the counter position.🔽For example, permanence and non-production are related, but that is not the case with sound, which is produced.

original: dper na rtag pa dang ma byas pa nyid du 'brel pa de yang sgra la med la byas pa nyid ni yod pa lta bu'o zhes bya bas ni phrad pa med par sgrub pa'i chos ni gzhan ma yin pa nyid @299b yin par ston te /
analyzed: dper na rtag pa dang ma byas pa nyid du 'brel pa de yang sgra la med la byas pa nyid ni yod pa lta bu'o zhes bya bas ni phrad pa med par sgrub pa'i chos ni gzhan ma yin pa nyid @299b yin par ston te /
translated: This shows that the property that proves the absence of contact is not something else.

original: dper na mi rtag par sgrub pa'i chos ni byas pa nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mi rtag par sgrub pa'i chos ni byas pa nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the property that proves impermanence is production.

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par lta ba po ni blta bar bya ba 'am lta ba dang mi phrad de /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par lta ba po ni blta bar bya ba 'am lta ba dang mi phrad de /
translated: Here is the statement of the syllogism: Ultimately, the seer does not make contact with the seen or seeing,

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not different from them.

original: gang zhig gang las gzhan ma yin pa de ni de dang mi phrad de /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las gzhan ma yin pa de ni de dang mi phrad de /
translated: That which is not different from something does not make contact with it.

original: dper na rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: dper na rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property that proves, the application of the proof, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na lta ba po'i rang gi bdag nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid dang mi phrad pa de bzhin du lta ba po dang / da lta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dag kyang don dam par gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir phrad pa med do /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: dper na lta ba po'i rang gi bdag nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid dang mi phrad pa de bzhin du lta ba po dang / da lta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dag kyang don dam par gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir phrad pa med do / // / bam po lnga bcu gnyis pa /
translated: For example, the self-entity of the seer does not contact its own self-entity because it is not different from its own self-entity. In the same way, the seer, the action of seeing, and the object of seeing do not contact each other ultimately because they are not different.

original: gzhan na gzhan dang phrad 'gyur na //🔽zhes bya ba 'di na gzhan dag na re 'dod chags la sogs pa la phrad pa med de /
analyzed: gzhan na gzhan dang phrad 'gyur na // zhes bya ba 'di na gzhan dag na re 'dod chags la sogs pa la phrad pa med de /
translated: If different things contact each other,

original: yul dang rgyud tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang rgyud tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here some say that attachment and so on do not contact each other because they engage objects and continua that are different.

original: phrad pa ni yul tha dad pa ma yin pa dang rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa dag bar du mchod par 'jug pa nyid yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phrad pa ni yul tha dad pa ma yin pa dang rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa dag bar du mchod par 'jug pa nyid yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what they say.

original: gzhan na gzhan dang phrad 'gyur na //
analyzed: gzhan na gzhan dang phrad 'gyur na //
translated: If one different thing contacts another,

original: gang phyir blta bya la sogs pa //🔽gzhan de yod pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: gang phyir blta bya la sogs pa // gzhan de yod pa ma yin pa //
translated: then the object seen and so on🔽would be different from it.

original: de phyir phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phyir phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But since that does not exist,🔽contact does not exist.🔽This is what they say.

original: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa 'dis 'dod chags la sogs pa phrad pa med par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de la 'grel pa byed pa gzhan dag na re 'dod chags la sogs pa la phrad pa med
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa 'dis 'dod chags la sogs pa phrad pa med par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de la 'grel pa byed pa gzhan dag na re 'dod chags la sogs pa la phrad pa med
translated: Other commentators say that the reason proving that attachment and so on do not contact their objects is not different from that.

original: de yul dang rgyud tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: de yul dang rgyud tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
translated: Because attachment and so on engage objects and continua that are different from them.

original: de dag na re blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po dag la phrad pa med do /
analyzed: de dag na re blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po dag la phrad pa med do /
translated: They say that the object seen, seeing, and the seer do not contact each other.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: blta bar bya ba ni phyi rol gyi yul gzugs la gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba ni phyi rol gyi yul gzugs la gnas pa yin la /
translated: The object seen is external form.

original: lta ba ni nang gi yul dbang po la gnas pa yin lta ba po ni sems kyi rgyud la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba ni nang gi yul dbang po la gnas pa yin lta ba po ni sems kyi rgyud la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The seeing is internal, located in the sense faculty. The seer is located in the mind-stream.

original: phrad pa zhes bya ba ni yul dang rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa dag bar du mchod par 'jug pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: phrad pa zhes bya ba ni yul dang rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa dag bar du mchod par 'jug pa nyid yin na /
translated: Contact is the engagement of different objects and mind-streams.

original: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dag ni yul dang rgyud tha dad par 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phrad pa med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dag ni yul dang rgyud tha dad par 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phrad pa med do zhes zer ro //
translated: But the object seen and so on are not different objects and mind-streams, so they do not contact each other.

original: de la 'dir kha cig na re @300a * //
analyzed: de la 'dir kha cig na re @300a * //
translated: Here, some say:

original: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dag yul tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dag kyang yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir yul dang rgyud tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir de ni legs pa ma yin pa
analyzed: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dag yul tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dag kyang yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir yul dang rgyud tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir de ni legs pa ma yin pa
translated: Because the object seen and so on are not different objects, and because attachment and so on do not abide in objects, it is not tenable to state that they engage objects and mindstreams that are different.

original: 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word “too” indicates that

original: 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'grel pa byed pa snga ma dag gi rnam par bshad pa de'i gtan tshigs yul dang rgyud tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dpe med pa'i phyir mi rung ngo zhes sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'grel pa byed pa snga ma dag gi rnam par bshad pa de'i gtan tshigs yul dang rgyud tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dpe med pa'i phyir mi rung ngo zhes sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: the present author’s refutation of the former commentator’s explanation is as follows: The reason “because they engage objects and mindstreams that are different” is not established and there is no example.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe lta ba po dang lta ba dang blta bar bya ba dang ldan pa de'i tshe na gang zag kyang lta ba po zhes bya ba mig dang gzugs kyang lta ba dang blta bar bya ba zhes bya ba yin pas de'i dus na yul
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe lta ba po dang lta ba dang blta bar bya ba dang ldan pa de'i tshe na gang zag kyang lta ba po zhes bya ba mig dang gzugs kyang lta ba dang blta bar bya ba zhes bya ba yin pas de'i dus na yul
translated: Thus, when the seer, seeing, and the object seen exist, then the person is called the seer, the eye is called seeing, and form is called the object seen.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dag kyang gzugs can ma yin pas yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dag kyang gzugs can ma yin pas yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: At that time, since the object is not different, and since attachment and so on are not physical, they do not abide in a place.

original: snga ma dag gis gtan tshigs yul dang rgyud tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: snga ma dag gis gtan tshigs yul dang rgyud tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore the meaning of the reason stated by the opponent, “because they engage objects and mindstreams that are different,” is not established.

original: gzhan yang de dag gi gtan tshigs la 'dod chags la sogs pa la phrad pa med de yul dang rgyud tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe med pa'i phyir yang de ni legs pa ma yin
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag gi gtan tshigs la 'dod chags la sogs pa la phrad pa med de yul dang rgyud tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe med pa'i phyir yang de ni legs pa ma yin
translated: Moreover, their reason is not good because there is no example for the statement, “Attachment and so on do not contact their objects because they engage objects and mindstreams that are different, like so and so.”

original: pa 'dra'o zhes 'grel pa byed pa nyid zer ro //
analyzed: pa 'dra'o zhes 'grel pa byed pa nyid zer ro //
translated: The Commentary itself says that this is similar.

original: da ni skye mched lhag ma rnams dang / nyon mongs pa lhag ma rnams la yang phrad pa med par 'dra ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul gyis /🔽blta bya la sogs 'ba' zhig la //
analyzed: da ni skye mched lhag ma rnams dang / nyon mongs pa lhag ma rnams la yang phrad pa med par 'dra ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul gyis / blta bya la sogs 'ba' zhig la //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the remaining bases and the remaining afflictions are also similar in that they do not make contact, the following verse is stated.🔽The seen and so on are not different.

original: gzhan nyid med par ma zad kyi //
analyzed: gzhan nyid med par ma zad kyi //
translated: Not only that,

original: gang yang gang dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: gang yang gang dang lhan cig tu //
translated: it is also untenable that anything

original: gzhan pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: is different from anything else.

original: mnyan par bya ba dang / nyan pa dang / nyan pa po la sogs pa dang / zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang can dang / zhe sdang bar bya ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba dang / nyan pa dang / nyan pa po la sogs pa dang / zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang can dang / zhe sdang bar bya ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning of “the heard, the hearer, the hearer of the heard, and so on, and the angry, the angry one, the object of anger, and so on” is as follows.

original: de'i phyir de dag la phrad pa med do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la phrad pa med do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, they do not make contact.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang / lta ba po la sogs pa dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes @300b bya ba ni pha rol po dag sngar dbu ma pas don dam par lta ba🔽po ni blta bar bya ba 'am /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang / lta ba po la sogs pa dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes @300b bya ba ni pha rol po dag sngar dbu ma pas don dam par lta ba po ni blta bar bya ba 'am /
translated: This is the opponent’s statement refuting the meaning of the reason in the previous🔽inference presented by the Mādhyamika:

original: lta ba dang mi phrad de /
analyzed: lta ba dang mi phrad de /
translated: The seer does not contact the object seen

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes rjes su dpag pa bstan pa de'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes rjes su dpag pa bstan pa de'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: because it is not different from that.

original: de dag na re blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang / lta ba po la sogs pa dag mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod de zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag na re blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang / lta ba po la sogs pa dag mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod de zhes zer ro //
translated: This is because they say that the object seen, seeing, the seer, and so on are not established as not being different because they have different characteristics.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not the response to that objection, as explained by the author of this commentary.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gzhan ni gzhan la brten te gzhan //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan la brten te gzhan //
translated: The other is other in dependence on the other.

original: gzhan med gzhan las gzhan mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan med gzhan las gzhan mi 'gyur //
translated: Without the other, the other would not be other.

original: gzhan ni gzhan la ltos nas gzhan //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan la ltos nas gzhan //
translated: The other is other in dependence on the other.

original: zhes bya na gzhan med pas de'i phyir gzhan la brten te gzhan zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya na gzhan med pas de'i phyir gzhan la brten te gzhan zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But without the other, it is untenable to say that the other is other in dependence on the other.

original: rigs pa'i bstan bcos las gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa dang / the tshom yod pa ni gang bsgrub pa la ltos par bya'o zhes 'byung bas 'dir yang de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de pha rol po la ma grub pa'am /
analyzed: rigs pa'i bstan bcos las gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa dang / the tshom yod pa ni gang bsgrub pa la ltos par bya'o zhes 'byung bas 'dir yang de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de pha rol po la ma grub pa'am /
translated: Since the treatise on logic states, “In any argument, the unestablished and the doubtful are to be considered in relation to the probandum,” the reason “because it is not different from that” is either unestablished or doubtful for the opponent.

original: the tshom za ba bsal ba'i phyir yang rnam pa gzhan gyis bsnan te bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom za ba bsal ba'i phyir yang rnam pa gzhan gyis bsnan te bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate that, the proof is supplemented in another way.

original: gzhan med gzhan las gzhan mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan med gzhan las gzhan mi 'gyur //
translated: Without the other, the other would not be other.

original: zhes smos na 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: zhes smos na 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If you say this, then what?

original: gzhan ni gzhan la brten te gzhan //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan la brten te gzhan //
translated: The other is the other in dependence on the other.🔽This means that the other is merely imputed as the other in dependence on the other thing.

original: zhes tha snyad gdags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bas ni gzhan zhes bya ba ni dngos po gzhan 'ba' zhig la brten nas gzhan zhes tha snyad gdags par zad kyi dngos po gzhan de don dam par mi 'thad pas gzhan spangs nas
analyzed: zhes tha snyad gdags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bas ni gzhan zhes bya ba ni dngos po gzhan 'ba' zhig la brten nas gzhan zhes tha snyad gdags par zad kyi dngos po gzhan de don dam par mi 'thad pas gzhan spangs nas
translated: This shows that since the other thing is not tenable in the ultimate, having eliminated the other,

original: gzhan la brten te /
analyzed: gzhan la brten te /
translated: the other is not tenable in dependence on the other.

original: gzhan zhes tha snyad gdags par yang mi 'thad do zhes ston to //
analyzed: gzhan zhes tha snyad gdags par yang mi 'thad do zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that the other is not tenable in dependence on the other.🔽This shows that the predicate of the probandum is the mere reliance on the expression of the distinction.

original: 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba chos brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma shos 'dis ni blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang /
