analyzed: 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba chos brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma shos 'dis ni blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang /
translated: This first half-verse shows that the object of seeing, seeing, and the🔽seer are not tenable in dependence on the other.

original: lta ba po la sogs pa dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin par bstan to //🔽gang la brten te gang yin pa //
analyzed: lta ba po la sogs pa dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin par bstan to // gang la brten te gang yin pa //
translated: The reason that proves the probandum, that the seer and so on are not different, is the dependence on the special expression.

original: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad//
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad//
translated: The statement “That which is dependent on this is not tenable as different from this” is the thesis.

original: @301a * // ces bya ba ni dam bca' bnye  bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs des bsgrub pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: @301a * // ces bya ba ni dam bca' bnye  bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs des bsgrub pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: The statement “The reason ‘because they are not different’ proves this” is the probandum.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Here the inference is this: Ultimately, seeing is not different from the seen,

original: brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir blta bar bya ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang /
analyzed: brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir blta bar bya ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang /
translated: The subject is “like the object of seeing itself,” the predicate is “it is not different from the object of seeing,” the reason is “because it is dependent on the special expression ‘seeing,’” and the example is “like the object of seeing itself.”

original: dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /🔽dper na blta bar bya ba'i rang gi bdag nyid ni blta bar bya ba zhes brjod pa khyad par can ston pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du lta ba yang lta ba
analyzed: dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na blta bar bya ba'i rang gi bdag nyid ni blta bar bya ba zhes brjod pa khyad par can ston pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du lta ba yang lta ba
translated: They are to be applied in order.🔽For example, the object of seeing itself is not different from itself because it is dependent on the special expression “object of seeing.”

original: zhas brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir blta bar bya ba las gzhan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: zhas brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir blta bar bya ba las gzhan nyid ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, seeing is not different from the object of seeing because it is dependent on the special expression “seeing.”

original: de'i phyir bsgrubs pa sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir don ma grub pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrubs pa sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir don ma grub pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, because the proof is a reason that proves the predicate, it is not the case that the meaning is not established.

original: brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs kyi don kyang ma grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs kyi don kyang ma grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: The meaning of the reason is also not established because it depends on the special expression itself.

original: ltos pa med pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The conclusion and the result of the valid knowledge are that it is not established that it is independent.

original: rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pa 'dis na sngar don dam par lta ba po ni blta bar bya ba'am lta ba dang mi phrad de zhes bsgrubs pa de sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang gtan tshigs yin
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pa 'dis na sngar don dam par lta ba po ni blta bar bya ba'am lta ba dang mi phrad de zhes bsgrubs pa de sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang gtan tshigs yin
translated: This is because the reason that was previously established, “The ultimate seer does not see the seen, because of not touching,” is not different from that reason.

original: pa'i phyir don ma grub pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: pa'i phyir don ma grub pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the meaning is not not established.

original: 'dir don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te zhes bya ba bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don kyang ma grub pa nyid ma yin te ltos pa med pa nyid🔽ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te zhes bya ba bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don kyang ma grub pa nyid ma yin te ltos pa med pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the meaning of “because of the special use of the reason that proves the statement, ‘In reality, the seer is not different from the seen’” is not unestablished, because the absence of dependence is not established.🔽How is that?

original: ci lta zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re ji ltar ltos pa med pa nyid ma grub ces 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: ci lta zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re ji ltar ltos pa med pa nyid ma grub ces 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is a question asked by the opponent, “How is the absence of dependence not established?”

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that, the root text says:

original: gal te gzhan ni gzhan las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te gzhan ni gzhan las gzhan //
translated: If one thing were different from another,

original: gzhan med par yang rung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan med par yang rung bar 'gyur //
translated: it would be different even without another.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smas te /🔽des ni de gzhan zhes bya ba dngos po gzhan la ma ltos par ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan par gyur na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smas te / des ni de gzhan zhes bya ba dngos po gzhan la ma ltos par ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan par gyur na /
translated: This is the response.🔽If that were different by itself,🔽without depending on another thing called “different,”🔽then in that case, even without another thing, it would be different.

original: de lta na dngos po gzhan med par yang gzhan du 'gyur @301b ro zhes glags yod pa'i tshig ston to /
analyzed: de lta na dngos po gzhan med par yang gzhan du 'gyur @301b ro zhes glags yod pa'i tshig ston to /
translated: This shows that the opponent’s statement is open to dispute.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir gal te gzhan zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan las gzhan yin par gyur na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir gal te gzhan zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan las gzhan yin par gyur na /
translated: In order to demonstrate the inference of that, it says: If the so-called other were inherently other than that other,

original: de lta na gzhan med par yang gzhan du rung bar 'gyur te de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: de lta na gzhan med par yang gzhan du rung bar 'gyur te de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: then in that case, it would be possible for the other to be other even without that other, because it would be its essence.

original: tha snyad kyi bden par grags pa'i mi dngos po gzhan la mi ltos par yang tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden par grags pa'i mi dngos po gzhan la mi ltos par yang tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, a person who is renowned as a conventional truth would be hot by his very essence without depending on another thing.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na tha snyad kyi bden par grags pa'i mi ngo bo nyid kyis tsha ba yin pa ni ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po gzhan la ma ltos par yang me'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du gal te gzhan zhes bya ba yang ngo
analyzed: dper na tha snyad kyi bden par grags pa'i mi ngo bo nyid kyis tsha ba yin pa ni ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po gzhan la ma ltos par yang me'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du gal te gzhan zhes bya ba yang ngo
translated: For example, a person who is renowned as a conventional truth is hot by his very essence. Because he is hot by his very essence, he would be hot by the essence of fire without depending on another thing.

original: bo nyid kyis gzhan las gzhan yin par gyur na de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po gzhan la ma ltos pa yang gzhan yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: bo nyid kyis gzhan las gzhan yin par gyur na de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po gzhan la ma ltos pa yang gzhan yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: If it were different from another by its own intrinsic reality, then because of being its intrinsic reality, it would be different without depending on another thing. But that is unacceptable.

original: gzhan las gzhan pa'i gzhan med de /
analyzed: gzhan las gzhan pa'i gzhan med de /
translated: There is no difference from another that is different.

original: med na med pas de phyir med //
analyzed: med na med pas de phyir med //
translated: If it does not exist, it does not exist. Therefore it does not exist.

original: gzhan nyid ces bya ba de'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ces bya ba de'o //
translated: This is called “difference.”

original: zhes bya bas ni glags yod pa'i tshig snga ma las bzlog pas skabs kyi don nyid ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni glags yod pa'i tshig snga ma las bzlog pas skabs kyi don nyid ston to //
translated: This shows that the meaning of the context is the opposite of the previous statement that has an opportunity for objection.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan las gzhan yin par gyur pa de med na /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan las gzhan yin par gyur pa de med na /
translated: If that which is called “different” does not exist as different from another by its own intrinsic reality,

original: gzhan med pas de'i phyir gzhan zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan nyid ces bya ba de med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: gzhan med pas de'i phyir gzhan zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan nyid ces bya ba de med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: then because of the nonexistence of difference, therefore that which is called “difference” does not exist. This is what is meant by the statement, “This is called ‘difference.’”

original: de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: That is unacceptable.

original: lta ba po dang nyan pa po la sogs pa dag blta bar bya ba dang mnyan par bya ba la sogs pa la mi ltos par gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba med la /
analyzed: lta ba po dang nyan pa po la sogs pa dag blta bar bya ba dang mnyan par bya ba la sogs pa la mi ltos par gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba med la /
translated: The seer, the hearer, and so on do not become different without depending on the seen, the heard, and so on.

original: chags pa la sogs pa dag kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa la mi ltos par gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa dag kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa la mi ltos par gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba med de /
translated: Attachment and so on are not established as different from attachment and so on without depending on attachment and so on.🔽For example, conventionally, fire is not hot by its own intrinsic reality without depending on something cold.🔽This is the first possible response.

original: dper na tha snyad du yang me grang ba la mi ltos par rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis tsha ba nyid med pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni glags yod pa'i tshig snga ma de mi 'dod de glags yod pa'i tshig de las bzlog pa skabs kyi don
analyzed: dper na tha snyad du yang me grang ba la mi ltos par rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis tsha ba nyid med pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni glags yod pa'i tshig snga ma de mi 'dod de glags yod pa'i tshig de las bzlog pa skabs kyi don
translated: The second possible response is that the latter is the meaning of the context.🔽The second possible response is that the latter is the meaning of the context.

original: phyi ma shos ltar bsgrub pa dper dang bcas pa bstan te /
analyzed: phyi ma shos ltar bsgrub pa dper dang bcas pa bstan te /
translated: This is taught by the example.

original: des na sngar /
analyzed: des na sngar /
translated: Therefore the earlier🔽proposition

original: gang la brten te gang yin pa //
analyzed: gang la brten te gang yin pa //
translated: That which depends on this and that

original: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad //🔽ces dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa de legs par gsungs pa yin pas ltos pa med pa nyid ma grub cing /
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad // ces dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa de legs par gsungs pa yin pas ltos pa med pa nyid ma grub cing /
translated: It is untenable that it is different from this and that

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du grub par bstan to //🔽ci ste lta ba @302a * //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du grub par bstan to // ci ste lta ba @302a * //
translated: is well stated. Therefore it is not established that they are not dependent. It is taught that it is established that they are dependent.🔽If you say that the seer is different from seeing and so on without depending on seeing and so forth,

original: po ni lta ba la sogs pa la ltos pa med par yang gzhan nyid yin te /
analyzed: po ni lta ba la sogs pa la ltos pa med par yang gzhan nyid yin te /
translated: then it follows that the seer would see without seeing.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta bzhin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag ltos pa med kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yod par bsgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta bzhin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag ltos pa med kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yod par bsgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the opponent’s statement that proves difference exists because they have different characteristics, even though they are not mutually dependent.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And those are the subject, the predicate of the thesis, the reason, and the example, respectively.🔽For example, even though an ox and a horse are not mutually dependent, they are different because they have different characteristics.

original: dper na ba lang dang rta ni phan tshun ltos pa med du zin kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin pa de bzhin du lta ba po dang lta ba la sogs pa dag kyang phan tshun ltos pa med du zin kyang mtshan nyid tha dad🔽pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang dang rta ni phan tshun ltos pa med du zin kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin pa de bzhin du lta ba po dang lta ba la sogs pa dag kyang phan tshun ltos pa med du zin kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: In the same way, even though the seer and seeing and so on are not mutually dependent, they are different because they have different characteristics.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa bstan pa'i phyir mtshan nyid tha dad pa 'di lta bu yang yod de /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa bstan pa'i phyir mtshan nyid tha dad pa 'di lta bu yang yod de /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they have different characteristics, he says, There is also a difference in their characteristics.

original: lta ba po ni yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: lta ba po ni yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The seer is the consciousness characterized by the appearance of an object,

original: de dang ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi tshogs yin no //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi tshogs yin no //
translated: or it is the collection of formations associated with that consciousness.

original: lta ba ni yul kha dog gzugs dang ba mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: lta ba ni yul kha dog gzugs dang ba mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: Seeing is the object, the clear form of color that is the basis of eye consciousness.

original: gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Form is the essence of color and shape that is characterized by suitability as form.

original: da ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: da ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Now, the application of the syllogism is as follows.🔽Therefore, since the seer is different from seeing and so on, it is undermined by the subsequent reasoning and by the independent inference.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus lta ba po ni lta ba la sogs pa dag las gzhan nyid yin pas rtog ge phyi ma dang rang dbang du rjes su dpag pas gnod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras🔽bu yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus lta ba po ni lta ba la sogs pa dag las gzhan nyid yin pas rtog ge phyi ma dang rang dbang du rjes su dpag pas gnod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras🔽bu yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition, which should be applied in order.

original: kho bo cag rtog ge bas mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ltos pa med du zin kyang gzhan nyid yod par bsgrubs pa'i rtog ge phyi ma 'di dang khyed dbu ma pa la gzhan nyid med par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa gzhan med pas kho bo cag
analyzed: kho bo cag rtog ge bas mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ltos pa med du zin kyang gzhan nyid yod par bsgrubs pa'i rtog ge phyi ma 'di dang khyed dbu ma pa la gzhan nyid med par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa gzhan med pas kho bo cag
translated: We may be logicians who, because of the difference in their definitions, establish that the two are not related, but this later logician who establishes that they are different and you, the Madhyamika, have no other inference that establishes that they are not different.

original: gi rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa 'dis khyed dbu ma pa la gnod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gi rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa 'dis khyed dbu ma pa la gnod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, this independent inference of ours harms you, the Madhyamika.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says, “That is illogical.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir ba lang dang rta dag gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ba lang dang rta dag gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because of that, he says, “Cows and horses are not established as different.”

original: des ni pha rol po'i dpe ba lang dang rta bzhin no zhes bya ba de ma grub par ston te /
analyzed: des ni pha rol po'i dpe ba lang dang rta bzhin no zhes bya ba de ma grub par ston te /
translated: This shows that the opponent’s example, “Like cows and horses,” is not established.

original: gang gi phyir ba lang gi mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag kyang rta'i mtshan nyid la ltos nas gzhan nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ba lang gi mtshan nyid lkog shal la sogs pa dag kyang rta'i mtshan nyid la ltos nas gzhan nyid yin la /
translated: Because the characteristics of a cow, such as a dewlap, are different in dependence on the characteristics of a horse.

original: rta'i mtshan @302b nyid rngog mjug la sogs pa dag kyang ba lang gi mtshan nyid la ltos nas gzhan nyid yin gyi de dag phan tshun ltos pa med na gzhan nyid du mi 'grub pas kun rdzob tu yang ltos pa med na mtshan nyid du grub pa'i phyir
analyzed: rta'i mtshan @302b nyid rngog mjug la sogs pa dag kyang ba lang gi mtshan nyid la ltos nas gzhan nyid yin gyi de dag phan tshun ltos pa med na gzhan nyid du mi 'grub pas kun rdzob tu yang ltos pa med na mtshan nyid du grub pa'i phyir
translated: Also, the characteristics of a horse, such as its mane, tail, and so on, are different from the characteristics of an ox, but if they were not mutually dependent, they would not be established as different. Therefore, if they were not mutually dependent even conventionally, they would be established as characteristics.

original: pha rol po dag gis bsgrub pa'i dpe mtshang ba'i skyon yod la /
analyzed: pha rol po dag gis bsgrub pa'i dpe mtshang ba'i skyon yod la /
translated: Therefore, the example that the opponent posits has the fault of being flawed.

original: don dam par ni ba lang dang rta dag ma skyes pa'i phyir dpe'i chos can yang ma grub pas /
analyzed: don dam par ni ba lang dang rta dag ma skyes pa'i phyir dpe'i chos can yang ma grub pas /
translated: But ultimately, since the ox and the horse are not produced, the example subject is not established.

original: pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa lta ba po ni lta ba la sogs pa la ltos pa med par yang gzhan nyid yin te /
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa lta ba po ni lta ba la sogs pa la ltos pa med par yang gzhan nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, the opponent’s proof, “The seer is different from seeing and so on,

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta bzhin no zhes bya ba de ma grub bo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta bzhin no zhes bya ba de ma grub bo //
translated: because they have different characteristics, like an ox and a horse,” is not established.

original: 'dis ming tha dad pa'i phyir dang rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis lan kyang btab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ltos pa med na mtshan nyid tha dad par mi 'grub par sun phyung ba'i rigs
analyzed: 'dis ming tha dad pa'i phyir dang rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis lan kyang btab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ltos pa med na mtshan nyid tha dad par mi 'grub par sun phyung ba'i rigs
translated: This reasoning refutes the idea that if they do not rely on each other, they cannot be established as having different characteristics.

original: pa 'dis gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces /
analyzed: pa 'dis gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces /
translated: This also responds to the argument that the opponent might make, namely,

original: lta ba po ni lta ba la sogs pa la ltos pa med par yang gzhan nyid yin te /
analyzed: lta ba po ni lta ba la sogs pa la ltos pa med par yang gzhan nyid yin te /
translated: that the seer is different from seeing and so on even without relying on seeing and so on,

original: ming tha dad pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta bzhin no zhe'am /🔽rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta bzhin no zhe'am /
analyzed: ming tha dad pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta bzhin no zhe'am / rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta bzhin no zhe'am /
translated: because they have different names, like a cow and a horse,🔽because they have different causes, like a cow and a horse,

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta bzhin no zhe'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta bzhin no zhe'am /
translated: because they have different effects, like a cow and a horse,

original: sogs pa'i sgras ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta bzhin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs dag gi lan kyang btab pa yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta bzhin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs dag gi lan kyang btab pa yin te /
translated: and because they have different natures, like a cow and a horse.

original: gang gi phyir ming dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dang ngo bo nyid tha dad pa dag kyang phan tshun ltos pa las gzhan nyid ces tha snyad gdags par zad kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ming dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dang ngo bo nyid tha dad pa dag kyang phan tshun ltos pa las gzhan nyid ces tha snyad gdags par zad kyi /
translated: Because even though names, causes, effects, and entities are different, they are designated as different only in mutual dependence.

original: phan tshun ltos pa med na gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pas de'i phyir pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe ma grub pa nyid yin no ;
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa med na gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pas de'i phyir pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe ma grub pa nyid yin no ;
translated: If they were not mutually dependent, difference would not be tenable. Therefore the reason and example that the opponent adduces are not established.

original: / gzegs zan pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: / gzegs zan pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: The followers of Kanada say:

original: blta bar bya ba la gzhan nyid nges par gnas pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir gzhan nyid grub pas brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do
analyzed: blta bar bya ba la gzhan nyid nges par gnas pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir gzhan nyid grub pas brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do
translated: The object seen definitely exists as different from the seer. Therefore difference is established. The meaning of the reason, “because it is dependent on the mere engagement of the object,” is not established.

original: zhes bya ba ni mu stegs gzegs zan gyi slob ma bye brag pa dag na re /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mu stegs gzegs zan gyi slob ma bye brag pa dag na re /
translated: This is the assertion of the Vaiśeṣika, a follower of the tīrthika Kanada.

original: gang gi phyir tshig gi don drug po dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su grub pa yin pa de'i phyir blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang / lta ba po la sogs pa'i dngos po dag ni gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshig gi don drug po dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su grub pa yin pa de'i phyir blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang / lta ba po la sogs pa'i dngos po dag ni gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Because the six topics are established by their own intrinsic reality, therefore such things as the seen, seeing, and the seer cannot be said to be identical or different.

original: de dag la @303a * //
analyzed: de dag la @303a * //
translated: However, from among the six topics,

original: tshig gi don drug gi nang nas gzhan nyid ces bya ba de nges par gnas pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir gzhan nyid dang ldan na dngos po rnams kyang gzhan nyid du grub pas des na khyed dbu ma pas sngar 'di skad ces /
analyzed: tshig gi don drug gi nang nas gzhan nyid ces bya ba de nges par gnas pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir gzhan nyid dang ldan na dngos po rnams kyang gzhan nyid du grub pas des na khyed dbu ma pas sngar 'di skad ces /
translated: difference definitely exists for them. Therefore, since things that possess difference are established as different, you Followers of the Middle Way should not say the following:

original: don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: “Ultimately, seeing is not different from the seen.

original: brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir blta bar bya ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig
analyzed: brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir blta bar bya ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig
translated: Because it depends on the special expression itself, it is like the object itself that is seen. The meaning of the reason that you state is not established with respect to any of the three modes.

original: yin no // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de lta na yang gzhan nyid ces bya bar brjod pa'i chos can gzhan nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / phyogs kyi chos spyir brjod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yin no // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de lta na yang gzhan nyid ces bya bar brjod pa'i chos can gzhan nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / phyogs kyi chos spyir brjod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says, “Even so, the reason is not not established with respect to its meaning because otherness, the subject expressed by the term otherness, depends on another and because the property of the subject is stated in a general way.”

original: bye brag pa dag gi gzhung ltar gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dag gzhan nyid ces bya bar brjod pa de lta na yang gzhan nyid ces bya bar brjod pa'i chos can blta bar bya ba la
analyzed: bye brag pa dag gi gzhung ltar gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dag gzhan nyid ces bya bar brjod pa de lta na yang gzhan nyid ces bya bar brjod pa'i chos can blta bar bya ba la
translated: In particular, because the terms “object of seeing” and so on have the meaning of the term “otherness,” even though they are described as “other,” the subject, the object of seeing and so on,

original: sogs pa dag gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / kho bos brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyi chos kyang ba lang dang /
analyzed: sogs pa dag gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / kho bos brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyi chos kyang ba lang dang /
translated: that is described as “other” is still dependent on the meaning of the term “other,” and the property of the subject, “because it is dependent on the special reliance that I have described,” is also dependent.

original: rta dang / lhas byin dang / mchod sbyin dang / blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang / bye brag ba'i gzhan nyid la sogs pa spyir brjod pa'i phyir des na ci tsam du ltos pa dang bcas pa dag la ni gzhan zhes tha snyad gdags kyi ltos pa med pa dag ni gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pas de dag la phrad pa yang med pa'i
analyzed: rta dang / lhas byin dang / mchod sbyin dang / blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang / bye brag ba'i gzhan nyid la sogs pa spyir brjod pa'i phyir des na ci tsam du ltos pa dang bcas pa dag la ni gzhan zhes tha snyad gdags kyi ltos pa med pa dag ni gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pas de dag la phrad pa yang med pa'i
translated: Because horse, Devadatta, sacrifice, object of seeing, seeing, and difference are generally expressed, therefore, as long as they are dependent, they are designated as other. But it is untenable that those that are not dependent are other. Therefore, since they do not contact each other,

original: phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: my reason is not unestablished.

original: gzhan yang gzhan nyid dang ldan pas gzhan nyid du 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bye brag pa dag gi gzhung ltar gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas blta bar bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan nyid du 'dod na
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan nyid dang ldan pas gzhan nyid du 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bye brag pa dag gi gzhung ltar gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas blta bar bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan nyid du 'dod na
translated: Moreover, if you assert that things are other because they possess otherness, etc. is stated.

original: / de lta na blta bar bya ba'i dngos po yang lta ba la sogs pa'i dngos po gnyis pa med par yang gzhan nyid du thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas mi rung bar ston to //
analyzed: / de lta na blta bar bya ba'i dngos po yang lta ba la sogs pa'i dngos po gnyis pa med par yang gzhan nyid du thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas mi rung bar ston to //
translated: Thus, it is shown that it is not tenable that the object seen is different from the two things, the seer and so on, without a second.

original: de nyid rjes @303b su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir gnyis pa med par yang rang las gzhan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid rjes @303b su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir gnyis pa med par yang rang las gzhan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is inferred, it is said that even without a second, it would be different from itself,

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me grang ba la sogs pa la ma ltos par yang rang gi bdag nyid kyis tsha ba nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me grang ba la sogs pa la ma ltos par yang rang gi bdag nyid kyis tsha ba nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is of the nature of itself, just as, for example, fire, without depending on anything cold, would be hot by itself.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na me ni tsha ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gis tsha ba nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na me ni tsha ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gis tsha ba nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, fire is hot by itself because it is of the nature of heat.

original: dngos po gnyis pa med pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas gzhan nyid du 'dod pa yang gzhan nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rang las gzhan nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas mi 'dod do //
analyzed: dngos po gnyis pa med pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas gzhan nyid du 'dod pa yang gzhan nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rang las gzhan nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas mi 'dod do //
translated: Since the word “otherness” has the meaning of a second thing, and since it is asserted that otherness is the nature of otherness, it follows that it would be other than itself.🔽But that is unacceptable.

original: gnyis pa med pas dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la gzhan nyid du rtog na yang rtog pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: gnyis pa med pas dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la gzhan nyid du rtog na yang rtog pa tsam du zad de /
translated: Since a second thing does not exist, if you imagine that the phenomenon that does not rely on another thing is otherness, that is just imagination.🔽The reliance on another thing is not the cause of the cognition of otherness, but otherness is the cause of that cognition.

original: dngos po gzhan la ltos pa nyid gzhan nyid kyi blo'i rgyu ma yin la gzhan nyid ni blo de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni ci ste bye brag pa dag 'dod pa ltar blta bar bya ba'i dngos po lta ba la sogs pa gnyis pa
analyzed: dngos po gzhan la ltos pa nyid gzhan nyid kyi blo'i rgyu ma yin la gzhan nyid ni blo de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni ci ste bye brag pa dag 'dod pa ltar blta bar bya ba'i dngos po lta ba la sogs pa gnyis pa
translated: In this way, the Vaiśeṣika assertion that the object of seeing, such as blue, is other than the seer, such as the eye, is refuted.

original: med pa / dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas gzhan nyid du rtog na /
analyzed: med pa / dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas gzhan nyid du rtog na /
translated: If you imagine that the phenomenon that does not rely on another thing is otherness, since the word “otherness” has the meaning of a second thing, and since it is asserted that otherness is the nature of otherness, it follows that it would be other than itself.

original: de lta na yang de ni gyi na rtog pa tsam du zad kyi dngos su gzhan nyid yin par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang de ni gyi na rtog pa tsam du zad kyi dngos su gzhan nyid yin par mi 'grub ste /
translated: However, this is mere idle speculation, for it is not established that they are actually different.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na gzhan nyid kyi blo skye ba'i rgyu ni dngos po gzhan la ltos pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na gzhan nyid kyi blo skye ba'i rgyu ni dngos po gzhan la ltos pa nyid yin te /
translated: The cause for the conception of difference in the world is the dependence of one thing on another.🔽For example, it is well known that such things as a cloth that is different from a pot are not the cause for the conception of difference.

original: dper na bum pa la ltos nas snam bu gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag ni gzhan nyid kyi blo skye ba'i rgyu ma yin par grags pa de dag bye brag pa dag gi gzhan nyid kyi blo skye ba'i rgyu ma yin par gsal la /
analyzed: dper na bum pa la ltos nas snam bu gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag ni gzhan nyid kyi blo skye ba'i rgyu ma yin par grags pa de dag bye brag pa dag gi gzhan nyid kyi blo skye ba'i rgyu ma yin par gsal la /
translated: It is clear that they are not the cause for the conception of difference for Vaiseikas.

original: gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don ni gzhan nyid kyi blo de'i rgyu yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don ni gzhan nyid kyi blo de'i rgyu yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of the term difference is accepted as being the cause of the conception of difference.

original: des na bye brag pa dag gis gnyis pa med pa dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la gzhan nyid du brtags pa de ni 'jig rten la grags pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir gyi na la rtog pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: des na bye brag pa dag gis gnyis pa med pa dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la gzhan nyid du brtags pa de ni 'jig rten la grags pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir gyi na la rtog pa tsam du zad do //
translated: Therefore, since the conception of difference imputed by the Vaiseikas to a nondependent phenomenon that is not a second thing contradicts what is renowned in the world, it is mere idle speculation.

original: gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid gzhan nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid gzhan nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang /
translated: If you imagine that something that is not different from another possesses difference,🔽then it would be pointless and the negation would be inconsistent.

original: don med pa nyid dang dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag 'dod pa'i gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan @304a * //🔽pas gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de yang /🔽dngos po snga nas gzhan nyid yin pa zhig gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan par rtog gam /
analyzed: don med pa nyid dang dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag 'dod pa'i gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan @304a * // pas gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de yang / dngos po snga nas gzhan nyid yin pa zhig gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan par rtog gam /
translated: This is the meaning of the term difference that the Vaiśeṣikas assert.🔽If you imagine that something that is not different from another possesses difference,

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid gcig gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan par rtog grang na /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid gcig gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan par rtog grang na /
translated: then either a thing that is already different possesses the meaning of the term difference,🔽or something that is not different possesses the meaning of the term difference.

original: brtag pa snga ma ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur te dngos po snga nas gzhan nyid yin pa la yang gzhan nyid dang ldan par rtog pa don med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtag pa snga ma ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur te dngos po snga nas gzhan nyid yin pa la yang gzhan nyid dang ldan par rtog pa don med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The former conception is pointless because it is pointless to imagine that a thing that is already different possesses difference.

original: brtag pa phyi ma ni dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: brtag pa phyi ma ni dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The latter conception is inconsistent with the negation.

original: dngos po snga na gzhan nyid ma yin pa phyis gzhan nyid dang ldan par rtog pa mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po snga na gzhan nyid ma yin pa phyis gzhan nyid dang ldan par rtog pa mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you think that a thing is not different prior to the difference, but later possesses difference, then that is inconsistent.

original: dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dus phyis gzhan nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dus phyis gzhan nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: If you think that a thing is not to be expressed prior to the difference, but later possesses difference, then that is also inconsistent.

original: bye brag pa dag 'dod pa ltar blta bar bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po snga na gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dus phyis gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas gzhan nyid yin par rtog na
analyzed: bye brag pa dag 'dod pa ltar blta bar bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po snga na gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dus phyis gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas gzhan nyid yin par rtog na
translated: If you think that a thing, such as a visible form, is not to be expressed as either the same or different prior to the difference, but later possesses the meaning of the term “difference,” then

original: yang dngos po ni gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan par mi 'gyur bas de yang mi rung bar ston to //
analyzed: yang dngos po ni gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan par mi 'gyur bas de yang mi rung bar ston to //
translated: that also is not tenable, because a thing does not possess the meaning of the term “difference.”

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir dngos po ni gzhan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir dngos po ni gzhan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point, he says, A thing does not possess difference because🔽it is not tenable that a thing is different from itself.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi skad cig ma bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi skad cig ma bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is a thing, like the momentariness of that which is inexpressible, your own inference is undermined.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /🔽dper na dngos po gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi skad cig ma ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na dngos po gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi skad cig ma ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the proving property, the example, and the conclusion are applied in order.🔽For example, the momentariness of that which is inexpressible as either the same or different is a thing, and it does not have the meaning of the term “different.”

original: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po dang / yang dngos po yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po dang / yang dngos po yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pa ma yin pas /
translated: In the same way, the thing that is the object of seeing and so on is a thing, and it does not have the meaning of the term “different.”

original: des na bye brag pa dag rang gi dngos po nyid du rjes su dpag pas gzhan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin pas gzhan nyid dang ldan pa bsal ba'i phyir rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na bye brag pa dag rang gi dngos po nyid du rjes su dpag pas gzhan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin pas gzhan nyid dang ldan pa bsal ba'i phyir rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the Particularists’ inference of their own thing does not invalidate their inference of the other, because it is not endowed with the other, since it is not endowed with the other.

original: bye brag pa gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: bye brag pa gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Other Particularists say:

original: don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las @304b gzhan ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las @304b gzhan ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The meaning of the thesis “ultimately, seeing is not different from the seen” and so on is as follows.

original: sngar dbu ma pas don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar dbu ma pas don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Previously the Follower of the Middle Way said, “ultimately, seeing is not different from the seen.

original: brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir blta bar bya ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas zhes dam bcas pa de la /
analyzed: brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir blta bar bya ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas zhes dam bcas pa de la /
translated: It is like the seen’s own nature, because it is dependent on the mere reliance on the special expression.”

original: 'dir bye brag pa dag las gzhan kha cig na re dbu ma pas dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes gal rnam pa gnyis su rtog bston to //
analyzed: 'dir bye brag pa dag las gzhan kha cig na re dbu ma pas dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes gal rnam pa gnyis su rtog bston to //
translated: Here, someone other than the Vaiśeṣika says, “The meaning of the statement of the Mādhyamika is to be analyzed in two ways.

original: de la gal dang po bstan pa'i phyir gal te gzhan nyid de la mi 'jug go zhe na ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid de mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la gal dang po bstan pa'i phyir gal te gzhan nyid de la mi 'jug go zhe na ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid de mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the first, he says, ‘If you say that difference does not apply to that, the reason is not established because it applies to that which is discordant, that is, to that which is dependent.’

original: dbu ma pas don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don gal te kho bo cag bye brag pa'i gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de lta ba de la mi 'jug go zhes bya ba
analyzed: dbu ma pas don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don gal te kho bo cag bye brag pa'i gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de lta ba de la mi 'jug go zhes bya ba
translated: The meaning of the statement of the Mādhyamika, ‘In the ultimate truth, seeing is not different from the seen,’ is this: If you say that the meaning of the word difference of the Vaiśeṣika is not applied to that seeing,

original: yin na ni /
analyzed: yin na ni /
translated: then

original: des na dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: des na dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: the reason stated by the Mādhyamika, ‘because it is dependent,’ is not established because it applies to that which is discordant, that is, to that which is dependent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: khyed kyis gzhan ma yin par dam bcas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan yin pa'i dngos po la yang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba de 'jug ste /
analyzed: khyed kyis gzhan ma yin par dam bcas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan yin pa'i dngos po la yang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba de 'jug ste /
translated: Because that which you have asserted to be not different, that is, the thing that is the opposite of the other, is said to be related to that other.

original: 'di ltar gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don la ltos nas dngos po de yang gzhan zhes brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don la ltos nas dngos po de yang gzhan zhes brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because in dependence on the meaning of the word other, that thing is also called other.

original: des na ci re zhig brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir blta bar bya ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du lta ba de la gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de 'jug par mi 'gyur ba
analyzed: des na ci re zhig brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir blta bar bya ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du lta ba de la gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de 'jug par mi 'gyur ba
translated: Therefore, just as the object of seeing does not engage the meaning of the word other in relation to itself, in the same way, the seer also does not engage the meaning of the word other in relation to itself.🔽Why is this?

original: yin nam / 'on te brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan nyid du lta ba de la yang gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de 'jug par 'gyur ba ma nges pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yin nam / 'on te brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan nyid du lta ba de la yang gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de 'jug par 'gyur ba ma nges pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Or is it that the meaning of the word “other” is not ascertained to apply to that view, since it is dependent on the special expression “otherness” itself?

original: / gal gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir ci ste gzhan nyid rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: / gal gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir ci ste gzhan nyid rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If you say, “Otherness is not the nature of a substance,” then that is proving what is already established,

original: gzhan nyid ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because otherness is its nature.

original: dbu ma pas don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don ci ste kho bo @305a * //
analyzed: dbu ma pas don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don ci ste kho bo @305a * //
translated: What is the meaning of the statement by the Mādhyamika, “The ultimate view is not other than the object of view”?

original: cag bye brag pa'i gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de lta ba la sogs pa rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba yin na ni des na dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang
analyzed: cag bye brag pa'i gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de lta ba la sogs pa rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba yin na ni des na dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang
translated: If you say that the meaning of the word “otherness” of the Vaiśeṣika is not the intrinsic reality of such things as seeing, then your argument that “because it is dependent on the specific expression of the Madhyamaka reason”

original: bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: is a proof of what is already established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kho bo cag bye brag pa'i gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de ni gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag bye brag pa'i gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de ni gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi /
translated: Because for us the meaning of the word “otherness” is the intrinsic reality of the meaning of the word “otherness.”

original: lta ba la sogs pa rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin par kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin par kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And for our position, it is established that the meaning of the word “otherness” is not the intrinsic reality of such things as seeing.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says here:

original: de la 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid dang / grub pa la sgrub pa nyid bsal ba'i lan go rims bzhin du ston to //🔽de la re zhig gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir brtag pa snga ma la yang ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te gal te gzhan
analyzed: de la 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid dang / grub pa la sgrub pa nyid bsal ba'i lan go rims bzhin du ston to // de la re zhig gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir brtag pa snga ma la yang ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te gal te gzhan
translated: Here, the response to the objection that the reason is indeterminate and the response to the objection that it is an establishment of what is already established are presented respectively by “Here, etc.”🔽To begin with, in order to dispel the objection that the reason is indeterminate, he says, “Since difference is refuted in the manner explained in the previous chapter, there is no discordant side, so it is not indeterminate.” If difference existed, then since it would operate in dependence on that difference, there would be a discordant side, so it would be indeterminate.

original: nyid yod na ni nges gzhan de la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pas ma nges pa nyid du yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: nyid yod na ni nges gzhan de la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pas ma nges pa nyid du yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: But since difference is not established,🔽there is no discordant side.

original: gang la brten te gang yin pa //
analyzed: gang la brten te gang yin pa //
translated: If something exists in dependence on something else,

original: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad //
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad //
translated: it is not tenable that it is different from that.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i 'thad pa ci skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i 'thad pa ci skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: In this way, since otherness is refuted by the method of teaching such as “the seer is not the hearer,” the discordant position does not exist. Therefore it is not the case that the reason is not established.

original: grub pa la sgrub pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the fact that the reason is established,

original: brtag pa gnyis pa la yang don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa la yang don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: in the second chapter, “Examination of Seeing,” it is said, “Ultimately, seeing is not different from the seen.”

original: kho bo cag gi de la gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra'i spyod yul nyid kyi chos med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir pha rol po la sgrub pa de lta bu med pas grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi de la gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra'i spyod yul nyid kyi chos med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir pha rol po la sgrub pa de lta bu med pas grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that, in order to teach that in our system the object of activity of the mind and term “difference” does not exist, it is said, “Since such an establishment does not exist for the opponent, it is not the case that the reason is established.”

original: kho bo cag gi sngar don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don ni khyed kyi gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de lta ba la sogs pa rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no🔽zhes bya bar dam bcas pa ma yin gyi /🔽lta ba de la khyed bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra'i spyod yul nyid kyi chos med do zhes dam bcas pa @305b bstan pa'i phyir khyed pha rol po dag la sgrub pa
analyzed: kho bo cag gi sngar don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don ni khyed kyi gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de lta ba la sogs pa rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar dam bcas pa ma yin gyi / lta ba de la khyed bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra'i spyod yul nyid kyi chos med do zhes dam bcas pa @305b bstan pa'i phyir khyed pha rol po dag la sgrub pa
translated: The meaning of our previous thesis, “The ultimate view is not different from that which is viewed,” is not the thesis, “The meaning of the word ‘difference’ is not the viewing of such things as seeing that are the substantial nature of things.”🔽But in order to teach that the meaning of the word “difference” that you Vaiseikas impute to that view does not exist as a phenomenon that is the domain of the mind and words, we posit the proof to you, the opponent.

original: de lta bu med pas khyed kyis lta ba la sogs pa dngos po gang la yang gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra'i spyod yul nyid kyi chos med do zhes ston par mi nus pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs
analyzed: de lta bu med pas khyed kyis lta ba la sogs pa dngos po gang la yang gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra'i spyod yul nyid kyi chos med do zhes ston par mi nus pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs
translated: Since such a thing does not exist, you cannot demonstrate that the word “difference” does not exist as a phenomenon that is the domain of the mind and words with respect to any thing, such as seeing.

original: de grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin no //🔽de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir don dam par gzhan nyid la gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: de grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin no // de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir don dam par gzhan nyid la gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: And it is not established by that proof.

original: spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na gzugs nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na gzugs nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very proof, he says: Ultimately, otherness does not exist because of possessing generality and particularity, just like form itself.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the proposition, the proposition, and the example should be applied in order.

original: dper na gzugs nyid ni gzugs zhes bya ba nyi tshe'i spyi dang spyi chen po dang bum pa'i gzugs dang snam bu'i gzugs zhes bya ba'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na gzugs nyid ni gzugs zhes bya ba nyi tshe'i spyi dang spyi chen po dang bum pa'i gzugs dang snam bu'i gzugs zhes bya ba'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, form itself possesses the limited generality called “form” and the great generality called “particularity,” and it possesses the particularities called “the form of a vase” and “the form of a cloth.”

original: de la gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don gyi ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de la gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don gyi ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du /
translated: In that, the entity of the word-meaning called “otherness” does not exist.

original: bye brag pas brtags pa'i gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de yang gzhan ma yin pa las log cing gzhan zhes bya ba'i spyi dang bum pa dang ldan pa'i gzhan dang / snam bu dang ldan pa'i gzhan zhes bya ba'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir de la yang gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: bye brag pas brtags pa'i gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de yang gzhan ma yin pa las log cing gzhan zhes bya ba'i spyi dang bum pa dang ldan pa'i gzhan dang / snam bu dang ldan pa'i gzhan zhes bya ba'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir de la yang gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: The meaning of the word “otherness” imagined by the Vaise~ika is also not other than non-otherness, because it is endowed with the generality called “other” and it is endowed with the particulars called “otherness in the relation of the pot” and “otherness in the relation of the cloth.”🔽Therefore, it also does not have the nature of otherness.

original: des ni gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don gyi ngo bo nyid kyi dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don gyi ngo bo nyid kyi dgag pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, he demonstrates the negation of the nature of the meaning of the word “otherness.”

original: yang na don dam par gzhan nyid ni gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra skye ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na don dam par gzhan nyid ni gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra skye ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin te /
translated: Or, ultimately, otherness is not the cause of the arising of the cognition and word “otherness,”

original: blo dang sgra khyad par can gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: blo dang sgra khyad par can gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: because it is the cause of the cognition and word that is qualified, like form itself. The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the reason, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na gzugs nyid ni gzugs mthong na gzugs kyi blo dang sgra khyad par can skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra skye ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du bye brag pa dag
analyzed: dper na gzugs nyid ni gzugs mthong na gzugs kyi blo dang sgra khyad par can skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra skye ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du bye brag pa dag
translated: For example, form itself is not the cause of the cognition and term other, which are imagined by the Vaiśeṣikas, because it is the cause of the cognition and term form when form is seen.

original: gis yongs su brtags pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don kyang gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra khyad par can skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra skye ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gis yongs su brtags pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don kyang gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra khyad par can skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra skye ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the meaning of the term other, which is imagined by the Vaiśeṣikas, is not the cause of the cognition and term other because it is the cause of the cognition and term other.

original: des ni bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra skye ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra skye ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin par bstan to //
translated: This teaches that the meaning of the term other, which is imagined by the Vaiśeṣikas, is not the cause of the cognition and term other.

original: yang na @306a * //
analyzed: yang na @306a * //
translated: Or else,🔽🔽

original: don dam par gzhan nyid kyi blo ni gzhan nyid dang ldan pa'i blta bar bya ba la sogs pa'i yul dngos dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par gzhan nyid kyi blo ni gzhan nyid dang ldan pa'i blta bar bya ba la sogs pa'i yul dngos dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the mind of difference does not possess an object that is a real entity that possesses difference,🔽because it is a mind of difference, just as the mind of difference does not possess difference as its object.

original: gzhan nyid kyi blo yin pa'i phyir dper na gzhan nyid blo gzhan nyid kyi yul can ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyi blo yin pa'i phyir dper na gzhan nyid blo gzhan nyid kyi yul can ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the proposition, the reason, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don gyi blo ni gzhan nyid kyi blo yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de nyid kyi yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don gyi blo ni gzhan nyid kyi blo yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de nyid kyi yul can ma yin te /
translated: For example, the mind that is the meaning of the word difference imputed by the Vaiśeṣikas is not the mind that possesses difference because it is a mind of difference.

original: yon tan ni yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yon tan ni yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin la /
translated: The reason is established because a quality does not possess a quality,

original: spyi yang spyi dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: spyi yang spyi dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa de bzhin du /
translated: and a universal does not possess a universal.

original: lta ba blta bar bya ba las gzhan yin no snyam pa'i blo yang gzhan nyid kyi blo yin pa'i phyir bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i gzhan nyid ces bya ba dang ldan pas blta bar bya ba la sogs pa'i yul dngos dang ldan pa ma
analyzed: lta ba blta bar bya ba las gzhan yin no snyam pa'i blo yang gzhan nyid kyi blo yin pa'i phyir bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i gzhan nyid ces bya ba dang ldan pas blta bar bya ba la sogs pa'i yul dngos dang ldan pa ma
translated: The cognition that thinks “the view is different from the object viewed” is a cognition of difference, and therefore the object viewed does not possess the difference imagined by the Vaiśeṣikas.

original: yin te / des ni gzhan no snyam pa'i blo ni bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pa'i yul can ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: yin te / des ni gzhan no snyam pa'i blo ni bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pa'i yul can ma yin par bstan to //
translated: This demonstrates that the cognition that thinks “it is different” is not a subject that possesses the referent object called “difference” imagined by the Vaiśeṣikas.

original: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sngar gzhan yang gzhan nyid dang ldan pas gzhan nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sngar gzhan yang gzhan nyid dang ldan pas gzhan nyid du 'dod na /
translated: The rest is as before means that if difference is asserted to be different from the different,

original: gnyis pa med par yang rang las gzhan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyis pa med par yang rang las gzhan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then difference would exist without a second,

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me grang ba la sogs pa la ma ltos par rang gi bdag nyid kyis tsha ba nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me grang ba la sogs pa la ma ltos par rang gi bdag nyid kyis tsha ba nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: because it would be its own nature. For example, like heat, which would be heat by its own nature without relying on fire and so on.

original: gnyis pa med par dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la gzhan nyid du rtog na yang rtog pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: gnyis pa med par dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la gzhan nyid du rtog na yang rtog pa tsam du zad de /
translated: If you imagine that a thing that does not depend on another thing is different, that is just imagination.

original: dngos po gzhan la ltos pa nyid gzhan nyid kyi blo'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan la ltos pa nyid gzhan nyid kyi blo'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: Because the dependence on another thing is not the cause of the cognition of difference,

original: gzhan nyid kyi blo de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyi blo de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the cognition of difference is the cause of that.

original: gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid gzhan nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang don med pa nyid dang dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid gzhan nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang don med pa nyid dang dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you imagine that difference and non-difference are possessed by difference, then it would be pointless and contradictory.

original: dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dus phyis gzhan nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang /
analyzed: dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dus phyis gzhan nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang /
translated: If you imagine that a thing that is inexpressible later becomes possessed of difference,🔽then a thing does not become possessed of difference because it is a thing, like the inexpressible itself in the prior moment.

original: dngos po ni gzhan nyid dang ldan pa yang ma yin te dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi skad cig ma bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bstan pa de dag thams cad rgyas
analyzed: dngos po ni gzhan nyid dang ldan pa yang ma yin te dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi skad cig ma bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bstan pa de dag thams cad rgyas
translated: All of these arguments are extensive in Candrakīrti’s Clear Words.

original: par 'dir yang sbyar bar bya ba yin no //🔽yang gzhan yang 'di la gzhan nyid @306b ces bya ba de gzhan la yod dam //
analyzed: par 'dir yang sbyar bar bya ba yin no // yang gzhan yang 'di la gzhan nyid @306b ces bya ba de gzhan la yod dam //
translated: This is also to be applied here.🔽Moreover, here, that which is called “difference” exists in another,🔽or it exists in what is not another?

original: gzhan ma yin pa la yod grang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa la yod grang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Thus,

original: bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de gzhan nyid kyi dngos po la yod dam /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de gzhan nyid kyi dngos po la yod dam /
translated: the meaning of the word “difference” imagined by the Vaiśeṣikas exists in the entity of difference,

original: gzhan ma yin pa la yod grang na /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa la yod grang na /
translated: or it exists in what is not different.

original: brtag pa de gnyi ga yang mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: brtag pa de gnyi ga yang mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: Both of these two investigations are untenable.🔽What is the point of that?

original: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de gnyis la skyon ci yod ces pha rol po 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de gnyis la skyon ci yod ces pha rol po 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is a question of the opponent asking, “What is the error in those two?”

original: de la re zhig brtag pa snga ma mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa snga ma mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In response to that, in order to demonstrate that the former investigation is untenable,

original: gal te gzhan la yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan la yod do zhe na /
translated: if you say, “It exists in another,”

original: gzhan nyid gzhan la yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan nyid gzhan la yod ma yin //
translated: difference does not exist in another.

original: de 'jug pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gzhan ni gzhan nyid dang bral bar pha rol po'i phyogs la yang grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de 'jug pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gzhan ni gzhan nyid dang bral bar pha rol po'i phyogs la yang grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it would be meaningless for it to engage that, and because the other is devoid of difference in the system of the opponent.

original: bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de ni gzhan nyid kyi dngos po la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de ni gzhan nyid kyi dngos po la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the term difference that is imputed by the Vaiśeṣika does not exist in the entity of difference.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan nyid kyi dngos po la gzhan nyid ces bya ba de 'jug pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / bye brag pa nyid kyi phyogs la yang yon tan ni rdzas la 'jug gi yon tan nyid la mi 'jug pas /
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyi dngos po la gzhan nyid ces bya ba de 'jug pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / bye brag pa nyid kyi phyogs la yang yon tan ni rdzas la 'jug gi yon tan nyid la mi 'jug pas /
translated: Because it would be meaningless for the term difference to engage the entity of difference, and because in the system of the Vaiśeṣika itself, qualities engage substances but do not engage qualities.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba'i yon tan ni gzhan nyid dang bral bar grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba'i yon tan ni gzhan nyid dang bral bar grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The quality called difference is renowned as being devoid of difference.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir ci ste gzhan ma yin pa la yod do zhe na /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir ci ste gzhan ma yin pa la yod do zhe na /
translated: To demonstrate that the second conception is untenable, the text says, “If it exists in what is not different, then what is the point of saying ‘it is different’?”

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: Even if that were the case,

original: gzhan ma yin la'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin la'ang yod ma yin //
translated: Nor does it exist in what is not different.

original: rang las kyang gzhan nyid yin par gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rang las kyang gzhan nyid yin par gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If it were different from itself, that would not be tenable.

original: bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de ni gzhan ma yin pa'i dngos po la yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don de ni gzhan ma yin pa'i dngos po la yang yod pa ma yin te /
