translated: The meaning of the term “difference” imagined by the Vaiśeṣikas does not exist in things that are not different.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i dngos po gnyis pa med pa de gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas gzhan nyid du brtag na gnyis pa med pa gcig pu de rang las gzhan nyid yin par gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i dngos po gnyis pa med pa de gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas gzhan nyid du brtag na gnyis pa med pa gcig pu de rang las gzhan nyid yin par gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that which is not different from itself were to possess the meaning of the term “difference,” then that which is not different from itself would be different from itself, but that is not tenable.

original: yang gzhan yang gzhan nyid dang ldan pa ni de dang ldan du zin kyang de'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'thad de ba lang dang ldan pa ba lang dang ldan du zin kyang ba lang nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'thad pa bzhin no zhes bya bas🔽ni / bye brag pa dag 'dod pa ltar dngos po ni gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin mod kyi /🔽gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan na dngos @307a * //🔽po yang gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de mi 'thad par ston te /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang gzhan nyid dang ldan pa ni de dang ldan du zin kyang de'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'thad de ba lang dang ldan pa ba lang dang ldan du zin kyang ba lang nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'thad pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni / bye brag pa dag 'dod pa ltar dngos po ni gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin mod kyi / gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan na dngos @307a * // po yang gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de mi 'thad par ston te /
translated: Moreover, it is untenable that that which possesses difference has the nature of that, even though it possesses that, just as it is untenable that that which possesses a cow has the nature of a cow, even though it possesses a cow.🔽This is the second chapter, called “Examination of Difference.”

original: 'dir dngos po gzhan nyid dang ldan du zin kyang gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir dngos po gzhan nyid dang ldan du zin kyang gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Translation: Moreover, it is untenable that that which possesses difference has the nature of that, even though it possesses that, just as it is untenable that that which possesses a cow has the nature of a cow, even though it possesses a cow.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs yin no //
translated: This is the second chapter, called “Examination of Difference.”

original: dper na lhas byin pa lang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa ba lang dang ldan pa ni ba lang dang ldan du zin kyang ba lang nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: dper na lhas byin pa lang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa ba lang dang ldan pa ni ba lang dang ldan du zin kyang ba lang nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'thad de /
translated: For example, Devadatta, who is not by nature an ox, is not tenable as an ox even though he is endowed with an ox,

original: lhas byin ba lang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhas byin ba lang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because Devadatta is not by nature an ox.

original: de bzhin du dngos po gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa gzhan nyid dang ldan pa yang gzhan nyid dang ldan du zin kyang gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa gzhan nyid dang ldan pa yang gzhan nyid dang ldan du zin kyang gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, that which is not by nature another is not another even though it is endowed with another,

original: dngos po gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: because that thing is not by nature another.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: de dang ldan pas de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang de'i blo dang sgra'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag na re dbu ma pas gzhan nyid dang ldan pa ni de dang ldan du zin kyang de'i ngo
analyzed: de dang ldan pas de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang de'i blo dang sgra'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag na re dbu ma pas gzhan nyid dang ldan pa ni de dang ldan du zin kyang de'i ngo
translated: Although it is not the case that it becomes that by possessing that, still it is the cause of the cognition and term of that.🔽The Vaiśeṣikas say: Although the Madhyamaka say that that which is endowed with another is not that by possessing another, still it is that by nature.

original: bo nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'thad de zhes bshad pa de grub pa nyid sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: bo nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'thad de zhes bshad pa de grub pa nyid sgrub pa yin te /
translated: This is because it is not tenable that a thing becomes another through possessing another.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽kho bo cag kyang dngos po gzhan de dang ldan pas gzhan de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'dod de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / kho bo cag kyang dngos po gzhan de dang ldan pas gzhan de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'dod de /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We also do not assert that a thing becomes another through possessing another, because it is not the essence of that.

original: 'on kyang dngos po gzhan nyid de dang ldan na gzhan de'i blo dang sgra'i rgyu nyid yin par 'dod do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po gzhan nyid de dang ldan na gzhan de'i blo dang sgra'i rgyu nyid yin par 'dod do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: However, we do say that if a thing possesses another, it is the cause of the cognition and term of that other.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being said.🔽If a thing does not have the essence of another, it does not become the essence of that other through possessing that other, because it is not the essence of that.

original: dngos po gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de gzhan nyid ces bya ba de dang ldan pas gzhan nyid ces bya ba de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin gyi dngos po gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de gzhan nyid ces bya
analyzed: dngos po gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de gzhan nyid ces bya ba de dang ldan pas gzhan nyid ces bya ba de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin gyi dngos po gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de gzhan nyid ces bya
translated: However, if a thing possesses another, it is the cause of the cognition and term of that other.

original: ba de dang ldan na gzhan nyid ces bya ba de'i blo dang sgra'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ba de dang ldan na gzhan nyid ces bya ba de'i blo dang sgra'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //
translated: If it did, then the so-called other would be the cause of the cognition and term of the other.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni dgag pa smras zin pa'i phyir lan du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /🔽de ni sngar yang don dam par gzhan nyid ni gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra skye ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni dgag pa smras zin pa'i phyir lan du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te / de ni sngar yang don dam par gzhan nyid ni gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra skye ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin te /
translated: This is not a proper response because the refutation has already been stated.

original: blo dang sgra khyad par can gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs nyid bzhin no zhes ba shad pas dgag pa smras zin pa'i phyir lan du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: blo dang sgra khyad par can gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs nyid bzhin no zhes ba shad pas dgag pa smras zin pa'i phyir lan du mi rung ngo //
translated: This is because the refutation has already been stated previously: ultimately, otherness is not the cause of the cognition and term of otherness because it is the cause of the cognition and term of the specific, just as, for example, form itself is.🔽This is not a proper response because the refutation has already been stated.

original: gal te gzhan nyid kyis gzhan 'di ni gzhan no zhes gsal bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te gzhan nyid kyis gzhan 'di ni gzhan no zhes gsal bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: If otherness makes this other clear,

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la de dang ldan pa don med pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag gzhan nyid ces bya @307b ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas dngos po gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la de dang ldan pa don med pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag gzhan nyid ces bya @307b ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas dngos po gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid
translated: But if it is not the entity of that, it would be meaningless to possess it.

original: ma yin pa yang gzhan zhes bya ba'i blo dang sgra'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur bar 'dod pa dbu ma pas sun phyung ba de'i lan 'debs pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: ma yin pa yang gzhan zhes bya ba'i blo dang sgra'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur bar 'dod pa dbu ma pas sun phyung ba de'i lan 'debs pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is a response to the objection by the Vaiśeṣikas that the word other has a meaning that is a property of another thing,🔽and that although it is not the entity of another thing, it is the cause of the cognition and word other.

original: de dag na re dngos po gzhan yin yang 'di ni gzhan yin no zhes bya bar mi gsal ba gang yin pa de gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pa na /
analyzed: de dag na re dngos po gzhan yin yang 'di ni gzhan yin no zhes bya bar mi gsal ba gang yin pa de gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pa na /
translated: They say that although it is another thing, that which is not clear as this is another is the meaning of the word other.

original: gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don des dngos po gzhan 'di ni gzhan yin no zhes gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dngos po ni gzhan nyid ces bya ba de'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la gzhan nyid ces bya ba de dang ldan pa don med pa🔽nyid du yang mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don des dngos po gzhan 'di ni gzhan yin no zhes gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dngos po ni gzhan nyid ces bya ba de'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la gzhan nyid ces bya ba de dang ldan pa don med pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur bas /
translated: The meaning of the term “otherness” clarifies that this other thing is other. Therefore, it is not that a thing is the entity of otherness, nor is it that it is meaningless to possess otherness.

original: khyed dbu ma pa dag gis dngos po gzhan yin pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan par rtog na don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pa dag gis dngos po gzhan yin pa gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan par rtog na don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, it is meaningless to say that you Mādhyamikas conceive things to possess the meaning of the term “otherness” that is, to be other.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to such statements, the author of the commentary here says:

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: gsal bar byed mas gsal bar bya ba'i don gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du gsal bar byed pa'i phyir gzhan nyid kyis gzhan nyid 'di ni gzhan yin no zhes gsal bar byed pas gzhan nyid kyis de gsal bar byed pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir
analyzed: gsal bar byed mas gsal bar bya ba'i don gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du gsal bar byed pa'i phyir gzhan nyid kyis gzhan nyid 'di ni gzhan yin no zhes gsal bar byed pas gzhan nyid kyis de gsal bar byed pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir
translated: Because the illuminator illuminates the object of illumination as having the essence of illumination, it is other.

original: dang / gzhan nyid ma yin pas ni 'di gzhan yin no zhes gsal bar byar mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dang / gzhan nyid ma yin pas ni 'di gzhan yin no zhes gsal bar byar mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But it is meaningless for the illuminator to illuminate that object by means of otherness, because it is not tenable to say that the illuminator illuminates that object by means of otherness.

original: dper na gsal bar byed pas mar me lta bus gsal bar bya ba bum pa lta bu yod pa'i don dbang po'i mngon sum la sogs par gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du gsal bar byed pa'i phyir 'dir yang gsal bar byed pa mar me lta bu ni gzhan🔽nyid zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don yin la /
analyzed: dper na gsal bar byed pas mar me lta bus gsal bar bya ba bum pa lta bu yod pa'i don dbang po'i mngon sum la sogs par gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du gsal bar byed pa'i phyir 'dir yang gsal bar byed pa mar me lta bu ni gzhan🔽nyid zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don yin la /
translated: For example, the illuminator, such as a lamp, illuminates the object of illumination, such as a pot, as having the essence of illumination that is directly perceived by the sense faculties.🔽Here the illuminator, such as a lamp, is other.

original: gsal par byed pa bum pa lta bu ni dngos po gzhan zhes bya ba yin pas gsal bar byed pa gzhan nyid kyis gsal bar bya ba dngos po gzhan 'di ni gzhan yin no zhes blo dang sgra'i sbyong yul nyid du gsal bar byed pas /
analyzed: gsal par byed pa bum pa lta bu ni dngos po gzhan zhes bya ba yin pas gsal bar byed pa gzhan nyid kyis gsal bar bya ba dngos po gzhan 'di ni gzhan yin no zhes blo dang sgra'i sbyong yul nyid du gsal bar byed pas /
translated: A vase, for example, is a thing that is made manifest. Since it is called “another thing,” it is made manifest by another thing that is different from it.🔽Thus, since it is made manifest as the object of the activity of the mind and words, the statement “This other thing is different because of being different from that” is meaningless.

original: de lta na gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don des dngos po gzhan ni gzhan yin no zhes gsal bar byed pa ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gzhan nyid ma yin pas ni dngos po 'di gzhan yin no zhes gsal bar bya bar mi rung ba'i phyir bye brag pa'i tshig de ni rigs pa ma yin no /
analyzed: de lta na gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don des dngos po gzhan ni gzhan yin no zhes gsal bar byed pa ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gzhan nyid ma yin pas ni dngos po 'di gzhan yin no zhes gsal bar bya bar mi rung ba'i phyir bye brag pa'i tshig de ni rigs pa ma yin no /
translated: And since it is not different, it is not suitable to state, “This thing is different because of being different.” Therefore the statement of the Vaiśeṣika is illogical.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽gzhan nyid kyis gsal bar bya ba'i dngos po gzhan de @308a * //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / gzhan nyid kyis gsal bar bya ba'i dngos po gzhan de @308a * //
translated: This is taught by the following:🔽That other thing that is made manifest by difference

original: gzhan nyid du gsal ba zhig gzhan nyid kyis gsal bar byed dam /
analyzed: gzhan nyid du gsal ba zhig gzhan nyid kyis gsal bar byed dam /
translated: is it made manifest by difference as different?

original: 'on te gzhan nyid du mi gsal ba zhig gzhan nyid kyis gsal bar byed grang na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan nyid du mi gsal ba zhig gzhan nyid kyis gsal bar byed grang na /
translated: But if it is not manifest as different, then it is manifested as different by another difference.

original: brtag pa snga ma ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur la brtag pa phyi ni dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtag pa snga ma ni don med pa nyid du 'gyur la brtag pa phyi ni dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the former case, the difference would be pointless, and in the latter case, the refutation would be inconsistent.🔽In the same way, the meaning of the term “difference” that manifests another thing is either manifested as different or it is manifested as not different.

original: de bzhin du dngos po gzhan gsal bar byed pa'i tshig gi don gzhan nyid ces bya ba de yang gzhan nyid du gsal ba zhig gis dngos po gzhan gsal bar byed dam /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po gzhan gsal bar byed pa'i tshig gi don gzhan nyid ces bya ba de yang gzhan nyid du gsal ba zhig gis dngos po gzhan gsal bar byed dam /
translated: If it is manifested as different, then it manifests another thing as different by another difference.🔽But in the former case, the manifestation would be pointless, and in the latter case, the refutation would be inconsistent.

original: 'on te gzhan nyid du mi gsal ba zhig gis dngos po gzhan gsal bar byed grang na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan nyid du mi gsal ba zhig gis dngos po gzhan gsal bar byed grang na /
translated: But if it is manifested as not different, then it manifests another thing as not different by another difference.

original: de la yang brtag pa snga ma la ni gsal bar byed pa bdag nyid dang gang dag la de yod pa na mi gsal ba med pas gsal bar bya mi dgos pa'i phyir dang / brtag pa phyi ma la ni bdag nyid mi gsal bas gzhan gsal bar byed mi nus pa'i phyir bye brag pa dag gi tshig de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang brtag pa snga ma la ni gsal bar byed pa bdag nyid dang gang dag la de yod pa na mi gsal ba med pas gsal bar bya mi dgos pa'i phyir dang / brtag pa phyi ma la ni bdag nyid mi gsal bas gzhan gsal bar byed mi nus pa'i phyir bye brag pa dag gi tshig de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But in the former case, the manifestation would be pointless, and in the latter case, it would be impossible for that which is not manifest by itself to manifest another thing, because it would not be manifest. Therefore the Vaiśeṣika statement is illogical.

original: 'di ni phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag gis brtags pa'i gzhan nyid mi 'thad pas /🔽phrad pa med par bsgrubs pa ci skad smos pa 'di ni phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag gis brtags pa'i gzhan nyid mi 'thad pas / phrad pa med par bsgrubs pa ci skad smos pa 'di ni phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is just a brief indication is a response to the assertion that because the otherness imputed by the Vaiśeṣikas is untenable,🔽the refutation of contact is established.🔽This is just a brief indication of the refutation of the remaining topics asserted by the Vaiśeṣikas.

original: phyogs 'dis bye brag pa dag 'dod pa'i tshig gi don lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin du dgag pa ston to //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis bye brag pa dag 'dod pa'i tshig gi don lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin du dgag pa ston to //
translated: By this approach, the remaining refutations are taught.

original: phyogs 'dis dgag pa lhag ma dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs 'dis dgag pa lhag ma dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the remaining refutations by this approach?

original: de'i phyir 'dis spyi dang khyad par dang yod pa nyid dang tshad ma la sogs pa dag kyang dgag par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis spyi dang khyad par dang yod pa nyid dang tshad ma la sogs pa dag kyang dgag par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said that by this approach, universals, instances, existence, valid knowledge, and so on should be refuted.

original: bye brag pa'i gzhung las dngos po gang la spyi dang khyad par yod pa de ni spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: bye brag pa'i gzhung las dngos po gang la spyi dang khyad par yod pa de ni spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa yin par 'dod de /
translated: In the Vaiśeṣika texts, any thing that has a universal and an instance is asserted to possess a universal and an instance.

original: dper na ba lang zhes bya ba ni spyi yin la ba lang la gzhan las khyad par du gyur pa ni khyad par yin te /
analyzed: dper na ba lang zhes bya ba ni spyi yin la ba lang la gzhan las khyad par du gyur pa ni khyad par yin te /
translated: For example, “ox” is a universal, and that which is distinguished from others is a particular.

original: de la yang ba lang gi dngos po nyid ni spyi yang ma yin khyad par yang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de la yang ba lang gi dngos po nyid ni spyi yang ma yin khyad par yang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, the state of being an ox is neither a universal nor a particular.

original: spyi dang khyad par zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas ba lang gi dngos po nyid la yang spyi dang khyad par yod par brjod do zhes zer te /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas ba lang gi dngos po nyid la yang spyi dang khyad par yod par brjod do zhes zer te /
translated: However, since it possesses the meaning of the words “universal” and “particular,” the state of being an ox is said to possess a universal and a particular.

original: de dgag pa yang spyi dang / khyad par dang ldan pas spyi dang khyad par nyid du 'dod na spyi dang khyad par med pa yang rang las spyi dang khyad par nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dgag pa yang spyi dang / khyad par dang ldan pas spyi dang khyad par nyid du 'dod na spyi dang khyad par med pa yang rang las spyi dang khyad par nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that a universal and a particular exist because they possess a universal and a particular, then even that which is not a universal and a particular would be a universal and a particular because of itself,

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me grang ba la sogs pa la ma ltos par yang rang gi bdag nyid kyis tsha ba nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me grang ba la sogs pa la ma ltos par yang rang gi bdag nyid kyis tsha ba nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: because it would be its own nature, just as, for example, fire would be hot by its own nature even without depending on cold things and so on.

original: spyi dang khyad par med pa @308b dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la spyi dang khyad par nyid du rtog na yang rtog pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par med pa @308b dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la spyi dang khyad par nyid du rtog na yang rtog pa tsam du zad de /
translated: If you imagine that a thing which is neither a universal nor a particular has the nature of a universal or particular, that is just imagination,

original: dngos po gzhan la ltos pa nyid spyi dang khyad par nyid kyi blo'i rgyu ma yin la spyi dang khyad par nyid ni blo de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan la ltos pa nyid spyi dang khyad par nyid kyi blo'i rgyu ma yin la spyi dang khyad par nyid ni blo de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because dependence on another thing is not the cause of the cognition of universal and particular, but the universal and particular are the cause of that cognition.

original: spyi dang khyad par ram spyi dang khyad pa ma yin pa nyid spyi dang khyad par nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang don med pa nyid dang dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par ram spyi dang khyad pa ma yin pa nyid spyi dang khyad par nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang don med pa nyid dang dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you imagine that a universal or particular or that which is neither a universal nor a particular has the nature of a universal or particular, then it would be meaningless and contradictory.

original: dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dus phyis spyi dang khyad par nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang /
analyzed: dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dus phyis spyi dang khyad par nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang /
translated: If you imagine that a thing which is inexpressible at an earlier time later has the nature of a universal or particular,

original: dngos po ni spyi dang khyad par nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po ni spyi dang khyad par nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: then a thing does not have the nature of a universal or particular.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi skad cig ma bzhin pas /
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi skad cig ma bzhin pas /
translated: Because it is a thing, like the inexpressible itself, which is a moment.

original: rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar ji skad bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du ci rigs par dgag par bya'o //🔽de bzhin du yod pa nyid ces bya ba yang rdzas dang yon tan la sogs pa dngos po rnams ni yod pa zhes mi bya mod kyi /🔽yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas rdzas dang yon tan dang las la sogs pa'i dngos po dag la yod pa nyid kyi blo skye bas de'i phyir yod pa nyid dang ldan pas /
analyzed: rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar ji skad bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du ci rigs par dgag par bya'o // de bzhin du yod pa nyid ces bya ba yang rdzas dang yon tan la sogs pa dngos po rnams ni yod pa zhes mi bya mod kyi / yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas rdzas dang yon tan dang las la sogs pa'i dngos po dag la yod pa nyid kyi blo skye bas de'i phyir yod pa nyid dang ldan pas /
translated: Thus, as previously explained, one should refute the opponent’s position in accordance with the system of reasoning that is appropriate.🔽Likewise, the term existence does not refer to things such as substance and quality.

original: rdzas dang yon tan dang las la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyang yod pa nyid ces bya bar 'dod la /
analyzed: rdzas dang yon tan dang las la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyang yod pa nyid ces bya bar 'dod la /
translated: However, because the term existence is meaningful, the cognition of existence arises in relation to things such as substance, quality, and action. Therefore, because they possess existence, things such as substance, quality, and action are asserted to be existent.

original: tshad ces bya ba yang dngos po'i ngo bo nyid la ni ring thung la sogs pa'i tshad yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: tshad ces bya ba yang dngos po'i ngo bo nyid la ni ring thung la sogs pa'i tshad yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Also, with respect to the entity itself, there is no length or shortness, etc.

original: tshad ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas dngos po rnams la ni ring thung la sogs pa'i blo skye bas de'i phyir tshad dang ldan pas dngos po rnams la ring thung la sogs pa'i blo skye bar 'dod ces grag go //
analyzed: tshad ces bya ba'i tshig gi don dang ldan pas dngos po rnams la ni ring thung la sogs pa'i blo skye bas de'i phyir tshad dang ldan pas dngos po rnams la ring thung la sogs pa'i blo skye bar 'dod ces grag go //
translated: However, since it possesses the meaning of the term “length,” etc., the cognition of length, shortness, etc., arises with respect to things. Therefore, it is well known that the cognition of length, shortness, etc., arises with respect to things because they possess length, etc.

original: de dgag pa yang yod pa nyid dang tshad dang ldan pas yod pa nyid dang tshad nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: de dgag pa yang yod pa nyid dang tshad dang ldan pas yod pa nyid dang tshad nyid du 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that they exist because they possess existence and they possess length, etc.,

original: yod pa nyid dang tshad med pa yang rang las yod pa nyid dang tshad nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang tshad med pa yang rang las yod pa nyid dang tshad nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then existence and length, etc., would exist without a basis, because they would exist by way of their own nature.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me grang ba la sogs pa la ma ltos par yang rang gi bdag nyid kyis tsha ba nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me grang ba la sogs pa la ma ltos par yang rang gi bdag nyid kyis tsha ba nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, like heat, without depending on cold, etc., would exist as heat by way of its own nature.

original: yod pa nyid dang tshad med pa dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la yod pa nyid dang tshad nyid du rtog na yang rtog pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang tshad med pa dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la yod pa nyid dang tshad nyid du rtog na yang rtog pa tsam du zad de /
translated: If you imagine that existence and measure exist in a phenomenon that does not depend on other things, that is just imagination.

original: dngos po gzhan la ltos pa nyid dang tshad nyid kyi blo'i rgyu ma yin la yod pa nyid dang tshad nyid ni blo de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan la ltos pa nyid dang tshad nyid kyi blo'i rgyu ma yin la yod pa nyid dang tshad nyid ni blo de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because dependence on other things and measure are not the cause of the cognition of existence and measure, but existence and measure are the cause of that cognition.

original: yod pa nyid dang tshad dam yod pa nyid dang tshad med pa nyid yod pa @309a * //🔽nyid tshad nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang don med pa nyid dang / dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro /
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang tshad dam yod pa nyid dang tshad med pa nyid yod pa @309a * // nyid tshad nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang don med pa nyid dang / dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro /
translated: If you imagine that existence and measure exist in existence and measure,🔽that is meaningless and contradictory.

original: dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dus phyis yod pa nyid dang tshad nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang dngos po ni yod pa nyid dang tshad dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dus phyis yod pa nyid dang tshad nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang dngos po ni yod pa nyid dang tshad dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: If you imagine that an inexpressible thing later has existence and measure, that thing does not have existence and measure.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi skad cig ma bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar ji skad bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du ci rigs par dgag par bya'o
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi skad cig ma bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar ji skad bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du ci rigs par dgag par bya'o
translated: Thus, as previously explained, one should refute the opponent’s position in accordance with the system of the Madhyamaka.

original: / sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa bye brag pa'i tshig gi don drug po dag gi yan lag gzhan dag dgag pa'i rim pa yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar te brjod par bya'o /
analyzed: / sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa bye brag pa'i tshig gi don drug po dag gi yan lag gzhan dag dgag pa'i rim pa yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar te brjod par bya'o /
translated: The words “and so on” in the root verse include the other parts of the six categories of the Vaiśeṣikas.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gzhan nyid mi 'thad pas gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa ma grub pa med do zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gzhan nyid mi 'thad pas gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa ma grub pa med do zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: The phrase “Therefore, since difference is not tenable” concludes the section.

original: de ltar bye brag pa dag gi gzhan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi don mi 'thad pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don
analyzed: de ltar bye brag pa dag gi gzhan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi don mi 'thad pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don
translated: Thus, since the meaning of the words “otherness” and so on of the Vaiśeṣika is untenable, the meaning of the reason “because it is dependent on the Madhyamaka’s special statement of a reason” is established.

original: grub po // gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: grub po // gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: gzhan nyid kyi mtha' dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi mtha' gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyi mtha' dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi mtha' gnyis te /
translated: There are two extremes: the extreme of otherness and the extreme of nonotherness.🔽If you refute the extreme of otherness, saying, “The extreme of otherness does not exist,” then by accepting the extreme of nonotherness, you would be harmed by the extreme of nihilism.

original: de la gal te khyed kyis gzhan nyid kyi mtha' med do zhes de dgag pa yin pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi mtha' yongs su gzung ba byas pa des na mdzad pa'i mtha' la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag rigs pa
analyzed: de la gal te khyed kyis gzhan nyid kyi mtha' med do zhes de dgag pa yin pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi mtha' yongs su gzung ba byas pa des na mdzad pa'i mtha' la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag rigs pa
translated: This is the opponent’s🔽reasoning.

original: can gyi sgyu thabs kyis dbu ma pas gzhan nyid kyi mtha' bkag pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi mtha' bzung bas mtha' gnyis spang ba'i tshul la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: can gyi sgyu thabs kyis dbu ma pas gzhan nyid kyi mtha' bkag pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi mtha' bzung bas mtha' gnyis spang ba'i tshul la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: The opponent says that the Centrist’s refutation of the extreme of difference through the method of “not being different” implies the extreme of non-difference. Thus, the Centrist’s method of avoiding the two extremes is undermined.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to this, the commentator explains:

original: ci skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis re zhig gzhan nyid med do zhes bya ba de bstan zin pas /
analyzed: ci skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis re zhig gzhan nyid med do zhes bya ba de bstan zin pas /
translated: “As taught, the statement ‘difference does not exist’ has already been made.

original: gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If difference does not exist,

original: gzhan nam de nyid yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan nam de nyid yod ma yin //
translated: neither difference nor identity exist.”

original: gzhan la ltos pas sam de bkag pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid grub pas tha snyad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan nyid ma grub pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pas sam de bkag pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid grub pas tha snyad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan nyid ma grub pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since difference is dependent on another and since non-difference is established by the negation of difference, it is a convention. And since difference is not established, non-difference does not exist either. This is the intended meaning.

original: kho bos med par dgag pa'i tshul gyis gzhan @309b nyid bkag pas ma yin par bkag pa'i tshul du gzhan ma yin pa nyid yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na gzhan nam gzhan ma yin pa de nyid kyang yod pa ma yin
analyzed: kho bos med par dgag pa'i tshul gyis gzhan @309b nyid bkag pas ma yin par bkag pa'i tshul du gzhan ma yin pa nyid yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na gzhan nam gzhan ma yin pa de nyid kyang yod pa ma yin
translated: Since we refute otherness by the mode of nonaffirming negation, we do not accept nonotherness by the mode of affirming negation. Since otherness does not exist, neither otherness nor nonotherness exist.

original: no // ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: no // ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gzhan la ltos pas sam gzhan de bkag pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid tha snyad du grub pas /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pas sam gzhan de bkag pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid tha snyad du grub pas /
translated: Since nonotherness is established in dependence on otherness, and since nonotherness is established by refuting otherness,

original: de ni dper na ring po la ltos nas thung ngur gdags pa tha snyad pa yin pa bzhin du tha snyad pa yin pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa ma yin pa dang / gzhan nyid ma grub pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang med pa'i phyir dper na bram ze ma grub pas bram ze las gzhan pa nyid kyang ma grub pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de ni dper na ring po la ltos nas thung ngur gdags pa tha snyad pa yin pa bzhin du tha snyad pa yin pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa ma yin pa dang / gzhan nyid ma grub pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang med pa'i phyir dper na bram ze ma grub pas bram ze las gzhan pa nyid kyang ma grub pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: it is like the conventional imputation of short in dependence on long. Since it is conventional, it does not exist ultimately, and since otherness is not established, nonotherness also does not exist. For example, since a brahmin is not established, that which is other than a brahmin is not established.

original: ci ltar de dgag ce na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid ci ltar dgag ces dri ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar de dgag ce na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid ci ltar dgag ces dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: “How could that be refuted?” is a question asking, “How could you refute that the seer is not different from the seen?”

original: de'i lan du don dam par lta ba po ni blta bar bya ba dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i lan du don dam par lta ba po ni blta bar bya ba dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: In response to that, it is said: Ultimately, the seer is not not different from the seen,

original: brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na blta bar bya ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na blta bar bya ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is dependent on the special use of the term, like the seen itself.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example should be applied in order.

original: dper na blta bar bya ba ni brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du lta ba po yang brjod pa khyad par can sten
analyzed: dper na blta bar bya ba ni brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du lta ba po yang brjod pa khyad par can sten
translated: For example, just as the seen is not not different from itself because it is dependent on the special use of the term, in the same way, the seer is not not different from the seen because it is dependent on the special use of the term.

original: pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir blta bar bya ba dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin no //🔽de bzhin du yod pa nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid dang / lan 'ga' shes pa log pa'am /
analyzed: pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir blta bar bya ba dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin no // de bzhin du yod pa nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid dang / lan 'ga' shes pa log pa'am /
translated: because it is dependent on the very nature of the object, it is not non-different from the object.🔽In the same way, one should state the inference in detail by means of the reasons: “because of the difference of existence, cause, effect, and the object of the cognition that is sometimes erroneous or doubtful,🔽and because of the difference of conditions.”

original: the tshom can gyi yul nyid dang / rkyen gyi dbye bas tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par bstan par bya'o zhes bya bas ni dam bcas pa dang / dpe snga ma'i gtan tshigs ni 'di dag kyang yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: the tshom can gyi yul nyid dang / rkyen gyi dbye bas tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par bstan par bya'o zhes bya bas ni dam bcas pa dang / dpe snga ma'i gtan tshigs ni 'di dag kyang yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The former example and the reason are also to be applied to this.

original: de'i phyi de ltar gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang bkag pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i mtha' la gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa de nyid kyi mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyi de ltar gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang bkag pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i mtha' la gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa de nyid kyi mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Thus, because non-difference is also refuted, the conclusion is not contradicted. This is the conclusion of that very inference.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gcig pa nyid la sogs pa dag ma grub pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gcig pa nyid la sogs pa dag ma grub pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because singularity and so on are not established in that way,

original: de ni de dang phrad pa med //
analyzed: de ni de dang phrad pa med //
translated: Therefore it does not contact itself.

original: gzhan yang gzhan dang phrad mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan dang phrad mi 'gyur /
translated: Nor does it contact another.

original: @310a * // zhes rab tu byed pa bstan pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i dbang gis mjug bsdu'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //🔽da ni rtog ge ba kha cig da ltar phrad bzhin pa dang / sngar phrad zin pa dang / phrad pa po yod pa'i sgo nas phrad pa yod par bsgrub pa dgag par bya ste /
analyzed: @310a * // zhes rab tu byed pa bstan pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i dbang gis mjug bsdu'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no // da ni rtog ge ba kha cig da ltar phrad bzhin pa dang / sngar phrad zin pa dang / phrad pa po yod pa'i sgo nas phrad pa yod par bsgrub pa dgag par bya ste /
translated: This is the general conclusion and the result of valid knowledge.🔽Now, in order to refute the assertion that contact exists because that which is in the process of contact, that which has already contacted, and the contactor exist,

original: de la re zhig de dag gi phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir gang la la 'di skad ces 'dod chags dang chags pa dag phrad pa yod pa nyid de phrad bzhin pa yod pa'i phyir dper na 'o ma dang chu dag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te
analyzed: de la re zhig de dag gi phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir gang la la 'di skad ces 'dod chags dang chags pa dag phrad pa yod pa nyid de phrad bzhin pa yod pa'i phyir dper na 'o ma dang chu dag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te
translated: First, in order to demonstrate their position, some say: Attachment and one who is attached exist in contact because that which is in the process of contact exists, for example, like milk and water.

original: / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na 'o ma dang chu dag la ni da ltar phrad bzhin pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na 'o ma dang chu dag la ni da ltar phrad bzhin pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, since milk and water are now in contact,

original: phrad pa yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la yang da ltar phrad bzhin pa yod pa'i phyir phrad pa nyid de des ni de ltar phrad bzhin pa yod pa'i sgo nas phrad pa yod par sgrub po //
analyzed: phrad pa yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la yang da ltar phrad bzhin pa yod pa'i phyir phrad pa nyid de des ni de ltar phrad bzhin pa yod pa'i sgo nas phrad pa yod par sgrub po //
translated: contact exists. In the same way, since attachment and one who is attached are now in contact, contact exists. Thus, he proves that contact exists in terms of the existence of that which is now in contact.

original: yang na phrad pa de dang ldan pa'i phrad pa yod pa nyid de mthar thug pa'i sgrar brjod pa'i phyir dper na lcags sgrog la sogs pas bcings pa bzhin pas phrad pa phrad pa dang ldan pa'i phrad pa mthar thug pa'i sgrar brjod pa de yang yod do
analyzed: yang na phrad pa de dang ldan pa'i phrad pa yod pa nyid de mthar thug pa'i sgrar brjod pa'i phyir dper na lcags sgrog la sogs pas bcings pa bzhin pas phrad pa phrad pa dang ldan pa'i phrad pa mthar thug pa'i sgrar brjod pa de yang yod do
translated: Alternatively, contact exists in terms of the existence of contact that possesses contact, because the term “ultimately” is expressed. For example, it is like a chain, etc., that binds. Thus, contact exists in terms of the existence of contact that possesses contact and is expressed by the term “ultimately.”

original: zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /🔽dper na lcags sgrog la sogs pas bcings pa ni bcings zin to zhes mthar thug pa'i sgrar brjod pa'i phyir de la phrad pa yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du phrad zin pa phrad pa de dang ldan pa la yang phrad zin no zhes mthar thug pa'i
analyzed: zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na lcags sgrog la sogs pas bcings pa ni bcings zin to zhes mthar thug pa'i sgrar brjod pa'i phyir de la phrad pa yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du phrad zin pa phrad pa de dang ldan pa la yang phrad zin no zhes mthar thug pa'i
translated: The subject, the object to be established, the means of establishing, the example and the conclusion are applied in order.🔽For example, since the expression “bound by iron fetters and so on” is a final expression, it is said that they exist in contact.🔽Similarly, since the expression “having contact with contact” is a final expression, it is said that contact exists in that which has contact with contact.

original: sgrar brjod pa'i phyir phrad pa yod pa nyid yin pas phrad zin pa phrad pa dang ldan pa'i phrad pa mthar thug pa'i sgrar brjod pa de yang yod de /
analyzed: sgrar brjod pa'i phyir phrad pa yod pa nyid yin pas phrad zin pa phrad pa dang ldan pa'i phrad pa mthar thug pa'i sgrar brjod pa de yang yod de /
translated: Therefore, contact is said to be a final expression that has contact with contact that has contact.

original: des ni phrad zin pa yod pa'i sgo nas phrad pa yod par sgrub po //
analyzed: des ni phrad zin pa yod pa'i sgo nas phrad pa yod par sgrub po //
translated: This proves that contact exists because that which has contact exists.

original: de bzhin du don dam par phrad pa po de dang ldan pa'i phrad pa yod pa nyid de brjod pa khyad par can gyis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na zas dang 'brel pas brjod pa khyad par can gyi cha la brten pa'i za ba po
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par phrad pa po de dang ldan pa'i phrad pa yod pa nyid de brjod pa khyad par can gyis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na zas dang 'brel pas brjod pa khyad par can gyi cha la brten pa'i za ba po
translated: For example, the one who eats is the one who is expressed by the expression “the one who eats” in dependence on the special aspect that is related to food.

original: bzhin pas phrad pa po brjod pa khyad par can gyis brjod par bya ba'i phrad pa po de yang yod pas zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / @310b sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: bzhin pas phrad pa po brjod pa khyad par can gyis brjod par bya ba'i phrad pa po de yang yod pas zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / @310b sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The one who meets is the one who is expressed by the special expression “the one who meets.” Therefore, the one who meets exists. The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the probandum, the example, and the conclusion are applied in order.

original: dper na zas za ba'i za ba po ni zas za bas za ba po yin no zhes brjod pa khyad par can gyis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de la zas dang phrad pa yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du phrad pa de dang ldan pa'i
analyzed: dper na zas za ba'i za ba po ni zas za bas za ba po yin no zhes brjod pa khyad par can gyis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de la zas dang phrad pa yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du phrad pa de dang ldan pa'i
translated: For example, the one who eats is the one who is expressed by the special expression “the one who eats” because he is the one who eats food. Therefore, he exists in meeting with food. In the same way, the one who meets exists in meeting with the other.

original: phrad pa de dang ldan pa'i phrad pa po yang phrad pa po yin no zhes brjod pa khyad par can gyis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de la yang phrad pa yod pa nyid yin pas phrad pa po brjod pa khyad par can gyis brjod par bya
analyzed: phrad pa de dang ldan pa'i phrad pa po yang phrad pa po yin no zhes brjod pa khyad par can gyis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de la yang phrad pa yod pa nyid yin pas phrad pa po brjod pa khyad par can gyis brjod par bya
translated: And the one who is the agent of that contact, who is qualified by contact, is also the agent of contact.🔽Since contact exists for that one, the agent of contact, who is qualified by the statement “the agent of contact,” exists.

original: ba'i phrad pa po de yang yod de des ni phrad pa po yod pa'i sgo nas phrad pa yod par sgrub po //
analyzed: ba'i phrad pa po de yang yod de des ni phrad pa po yod pa'i sgo nas phrad pa yod par sgrub po //
translated: Since the agent of contact exists, contact exists.

original: de'i phyir phrad pa yod pa nyid do zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa gsum char gyi mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phrad pa yod pa nyid do zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa gsum char gyi mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion of the three inferences and the result of the valid knowledge.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary himself says:

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽That now being contacted, contact,

original: phrad bzhin pa dang phrad pa dang // phrad pa po yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: phrad bzhin pa dang phrad pa dang // phrad pa po yang yod ma yin //
translated: And the one who contacts do not exist.

original: sgrub pa ci skad bstan pas gzhan nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sgrub pa ci skad bstan pas gzhan nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The intended meaning is that since the proof is stated, otherness is impossible.

original: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du gzhan nyid mi 'thad pas phrad pa bzhin pa dang phrad zin pa dang phrad pa po yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du gzhan nyid mi 'thad pas phrad pa bzhin pa dang phrad zin pa dang phrad pa po yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Here, as before, since otherness is untenable, the one who has met, the one who has already met, and the one who is meeting do not exist.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por sgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pas phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por sgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pas phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is that the opponent’s error in stating the proof in the first chapter is stated, and thus it is shown that meeting lacks intrinsic existence. This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: te / phrad pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur lta ba ni pha rol pos sngar rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por dngos po rnams don dam par yod par sgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma don dam🔽par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: te / phrad pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur lta ba ni pha rol pos sngar rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por dngos po rnams don dam par yod par sgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par shes par bya ste /
translated: The opponent previously argued in the first chapter that things ultimately exist, and that things ultimately exist by way of their own intrinsic nature.🔽In response to this, Candrakīrti says, “Things should be understood to exist by way of their own intrinsic reality, and contact is taught in dependence on them.”

original: de dag la brten nas phrad pa bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pas phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag la brten nas phrad pa bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pas phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: By pointing out the faults in this argument, Candrakīrti demonstrates how contact is devoid of intrinsic existence.

original: phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /🔽de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab @311a * //
analyzed: phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ste / de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab @311a * //
translated: To dispel the claim by others that this teaching is merely a dry treatise of sophistry, it is established here by means of a source of trustworthy scripture.

original: kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: Thus the Questions of Subāhu Prajñāpāramitā Sūtra says:

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la phrad pa'am 'bral ba med do //
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la phrad pa'am 'bral ba med do //
translated: Subāhu, form is neither contacted nor separated.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yang phrad pa'am 'bral ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yang phrad pa'am 'bral ba med do //
translated: Similarly, feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, and consciousness are neither contacted nor separated.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yang phrad pa'am 'bral ba med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yang phrad pa'am 'bral ba med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the non-contact and non-separation of form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness.

original: 'di ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag la sogs pa grub pa ni phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag la sogs pa grub pa ni phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin te /
translated: The establishment of those statements and so on is the quality and source of the teaching of the intrinsic realitylessness of contact.

original: de'i phyir kho bos rang gi bsam pas rtog ge skam po tsam gyis bsgrubs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bos rang gi bsam pas rtog ge skam po tsam gyis bsgrubs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, I do not establish this merely by dry logic with my own imagination.

original: lung de dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: lung de dag kyang yod do //
translated: Those scriptures exist.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' yas pa dag las phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' yas pa dag las phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi
translated: words teach that they are the very objects to be explained by this treatise.

original: mkhyen rlabs dang / 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //🔽slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /🔽dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las phrad pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: mkhyen rlabs dang / 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las phrad pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: This is the skill of the author of the commentary.

original: slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu gsum pa /
analyzed: slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu gsum pa /
translated: The fourteenth chapter, the “Examination of Contact,” in the Root Commentary on the Middle Way, Wisdom Lamp, composed by the master Bhāviveka, is completed.🔽The commentary is finished.

original: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang rtag pa med pa bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bco lnga pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba
analyzed: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang rtag pa med pa bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bco lnga pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba
translated: Now, in the same way, chapter fifteen is composed in order to teach dependent arising as free from annihilation and permanence by refuting the specific counterparts of emptiness.

original: la dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: la dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The term “in order to” in this context should be viewed as having the meaning of cause that engages the promise and the meaning of the object that is connected to the passages that follow. The meaning of the words is the same as before.

original: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: In this regard, in terms of the meaning of cause that engages the promise,

original: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: now, in the same way, chapter fifteen is composed in order to teach dependent arising as free from annihilation and permanence by refuting the specific counterparts of emptiness.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su /
translated: In the context of composing the treatise, in the first chapter, the chapter on conditions,

original: dngos po thams cad skye ba med @311b par dam bcas pa mdzad pas /🔽'dir yang sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas ci ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad skye ba med @311b par dam bcas pa mdzad pas / 'dir yang sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas ci ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
translated: Since he has made the assertion that all things are not produced,🔽here too he speaks from the perspective of the meaning of the cause for engaging in that assertion, just as he made it when he composed the treatise earlier.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa snga ma'i skabs su bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa snga ma'i skabs su bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as means in accordance with the system presented in the earlier chapter.

original: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
translated: Emptiness is his own position.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The position of the opponent is the position that is contrary to that.

original: 'di lta ste dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
translated: That is to say, he is an advocate of the existence of the essence of things.

original: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa 'og nas /
analyzed: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa 'og nas /
translated: The distinction of that is the prior position of the opponent that establishes the existence of the essence of things.

original: khyed dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med do zhes smra ba'i dam bcas pa la rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs bdag gi dngos po dang /
analyzed: khyed dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med do zhes smra ba'i dam bcas pa la rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs bdag gi dngos po dang /
translated: You say that things are essenceless, but your thesis is flawed by the contradiction of your own words.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa dag yod par gzhung 'dzugs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa dag yod par gzhung 'dzugs pa yin no //
translated: We establish that things do have essence by means of the arguments of the existence of things, the existence of other things, the existence of existent things, and the existence of nonexistent things.

original: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa bco lnga pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa bco lnga pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The refutation of those is the refutation of the specific counter positions to emptiness. The fifteenth chapter is composed from the perspective of that refutation.

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang rtag pa med pa bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bco lnga pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /🔽dngos po dang dngos po med pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bco lnga pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang rtag pa med pa bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bco lnga pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te / dngos po dang dngos po med pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bco lnga pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: The fifteenth chapter is composed in terms of the meaning of the dependent origination that is devoid of annihilation and devoid of permanence, in terms of the meaning of the passages that will be cited below.🔽The meaning of the passages that will be cited below in the fifteenth chapter, the analysis of things and nonthings, is explained by commenting on the meaning of the following passage from the perfection of wisdom:

original: bdag gi dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po stong pa nyid dang dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces gsungs pa'i don rnam par bshad pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang /
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po stong pa nyid dang dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces gsungs pa'i don rnam par bshad pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang /
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of nonrepudiation, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of nonobservation, the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of other phenomena, and the emptiness of the nature of nonexistence.

original: rtag pa med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
analyzed: rtag pa med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
translated: Since this chapter teaches the special feature of dependent origination as devoid of permanence and annihilation, it is said from this point of view.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
translated: What is the result of this chapter?

original: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
translated: By what aspects is that result obtained?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /🔽stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i @312a * //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la / stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i @312a * //
translated: The result of this chapter is the teaching of the special feature of dependent origination as devoid of permanence and annihilation.

original: mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir yang thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir yang thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
translated: Since the result is obtained by the aspect of the negation of the special feature that is the antithesis of emptiness, the author of the commentary first teaches the result as the means and that which arises from the means at the juncture of this chapter.

original: gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ci ltar bdag gi dngos po dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa dgag pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa nyid bstan par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ci ltar bdag gi dngos po dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa dgag pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa nyid bstan par bya zhe na /
translated: If the opponent says, “How can you teach that dependent origination is devoid of annihilation and devoid of permanence by refuting the entity of self, the entity of other, existence, and nonexistence?”

original: gang gi phyir bdag gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag la yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid pas dngos po de dag ma skyes pa'i phyir rtag pa med la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag la yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid pas dngos po de dag ma skyes pa'i phyir rtag pa med la /
translated: Because the entity of self and the entity of other are not real, those entities are not produced, and therefore they are not permanent.

original: ma skyes pa la 'jig pa med pa'i phyir chad pa med pas de'i phyir de ltar bdag gi dngos po dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa dgag pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang /🔽rtag pa med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa nyid grub po //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la 'jig pa med pa'i phyir chad pa med pas de'i phyir de ltar bdag gi dngos po dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa dgag pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang /🔽rtag pa med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa nyid grub po //
translated: Because that which is not produced does not perish, they are not annihilated. Therefore, in this way, the special quality of dependent origination being devoid of annihilation and devoid of permanence is established by refuting the entity of self, the entity of other, existence, and nonexistence.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the specific counter-correlate of emptiness, the root text says, “Here, they say…”

original: rang gi sde pa la sogs pa dag de ltar don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa la sogs pa dag de ltar don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par shes par bya ste /
translated: Our own schools and so on say, “Things should be understood to ultimately exist by way of their own entity because contact is taught in dependence on them.”

original: de dag la brten nas phrad pa bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs sun phyung ba dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan kyang de dag la mngon par zhen pa kha cig gis de mi bzod pas yang de dag 'di skad ces🔽zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag la brten nas phrad pa bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs sun phyung ba dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan kyang de dag la mngon par zhen pa kha cig gis de mi bzod pas yang de dag 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Although the argument that things do not exist by way of their own entity has been refuted, some who are attached to those things cannot bear that and say this:

original: de'i phyir khyed dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med do zhes smra ba'i dam bcas pa la rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon yod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med do zhes smra ba'i dam bcas pa la rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon yod de /
translated: “Therefore, you who say that things do not exist by way of their own entity have the fault of contradiction in your own words.”

original: de nyid kyis don de la skur pa btab pa'i phyir dper na smras pa thams cad brdzun no zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis don de la skur pa btab pa'i phyir dper na smras pa thams cad brdzun no zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it itself refutes the meaning of that, it is like saying, for example, all speech is false.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the proof, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na drang srong bha ra ta sa rang gi tshig 'ba' zhig bden gyi gzhan gyis smras pa thams cad brdzun par sgrub pa'i phyir smras pa thams cad brdzun no zhes smras pa de nyid kyi sa rang gi tshig bden par sgrub pa'i don de la skur pa
analyzed: dper na drang srong bha ra ta sa rang gi tshig 'ba' zhig bden gyi gzhan gyis smras pa thams cad brdzun par sgrub pa'i phyir smras pa thams cad brdzun no zhes smras pa de nyid kyi sa rang gi tshig bden par sgrub pa'i don de la skur pa
translated: For example, when the rishi Bharadvaja said, “All speech is false,” in order to prove that his own words alone are true and that all speech by others is false, he himself refuted the meaning of that,

original: btab pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: btab pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: because he contradicted his own words.

original: smras pa thams cad ces bya ba'i nang du rang gis smras pa yang 'dus pas des na rang gi tshig kyang brdzun par 'gyur pa de bzhin du khyed dbu @312b ma pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med do zhes smras pa'i tshig gis kyang /
analyzed: smras pa thams cad ces bya ba'i nang du rang gis smras pa yang 'dus pas des na rang gi tshig kyang brdzun par 'gyur pa de bzhin du khyed dbu @312b ma pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med do zhes smras pa'i tshig gis kyang /
translated: Objection: Since “everything” includes what you yourself have said, your words are also false.🔽In the same way, because of the words of you Mādhyamikas, “Things are essenceless,”

original: dngos po rnams zhes bya ba de nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i don de la skur pa btab pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: dngos po rnams zhes bya ba de nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i don de la skur pa btab pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: since that very phrase “things” repudiates the meaning of “essenceless,” you have the fault of contradicting your own words.

original: 'dir yang gal te ngo bo nyid med pa yin na ni ci ltar dngos po yin /
analyzed: 'dir yang gal te ngo bo nyid med pa yin na ni ci ltar dngos po yin /
translated: Here, if things are essenceless, how could they be things?

original: ci ste dngos po yin na ni ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: ci ste dngos po yin na ni ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin te /
translated: But if they are things, they are not essenceless. This is the application of the reductio.

original: dngos po zhes bya ba dang ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba ni dgag pa mi mthun pa yin pas khyed kyis dngos po zhes smras pa de nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba'i don de la skur ba btab pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba dang ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba ni dgag pa mi mthun pa yin pas khyed kyis dngos po zhes smras pa de nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba'i don de la skur ba btab pa yin no //
translated: The term “entity” and the term “essenceless” are mutually exclusive, and so by your saying “entity,” you have denied the meaning of “essenceless.”

original: dam bcas pa la de nyid kyis don de la skur pa btab pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa la de nyid kyis don de la skur pa btab pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: The phrase “in that case, your thesis would be undermined by your own words” is the conclusion.

original: dngos po zhes smras pa de nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba'i don de la skur pa btab pa'i phyir khyed kyis dam bcas pa la rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dngos po zhes smras pa de nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba'i don de la skur pa btab pa'i phyir khyed kyis dam bcas pa la rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “in that case, your thesis would be undermined by your own words” is this: because by saying “entity” you have denied the meaning of “essenceless,” you have undermined your own thesis.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says, “Here, we say . . .”

original: pha rol po la dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir dang / dbu ma pas dam bcas pa la skur ba ma btab pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad kyi dngos po ma bkag pa'i phyir dang / dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa'i lan btab zin pa'i phyir kho bo'i sgrub pa 'di la skyon med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: pha rol po la dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir dang / dbu ma pas dam bcas pa la skur ba ma btab pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad kyi dngos po ma bkag pa'i phyir dang / dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa'i lan btab zin pa'i phyir kho bo'i sgrub pa 'di la skyon med do zhes ston to //
