translated: Because the opponent has no example to prove that things exist inherently, because the Madhyamika does not deny the thesis, because he does not refute conventional things, and because he has already responded to the argument that things are essenceless, our argument is not faulty.

original: de la pha rol po la dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i dpe med par bstan pa'i phyir don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la pha rol po la dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i dpe med par bstan pa'i phyir don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa yin te /
translated: To show that the opponent has no example to prove that things exist inherently, it is said that ultimately things do exist inherently,

original: dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir 'di la skyon med do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir 'di la skyon med do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: because there is no such thing as a non-homologous example, as in the case of “x,” and so there is no fault in our argument.

original: dbu ma pas dam bcas pa la skur pa ma btab par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbu ma pas dam bcas pa la skur pa ma btab par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that the Madhyamika does not deny the thesis, it is said that

original: don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du khas blangs nas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam bcas pa'i phyir des na dam bcas pa'i don la skur pa ma btab pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin pas 'di
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du khas blangs nas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam bcas pa'i phyir des na dam bcas pa'i don la skur pa ma btab pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin pas 'di
translated: Because ultimately, having accepted that things exist by their own intrinsic reality, we have a thesis of their lack of intrinsic reality, therefore, since we do not deprecate the meaning of our thesis, the meaning of our reason is not unestablished.

original: la skyon med do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: la skyon med do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, we say that there is no fault in our argument.

original: dbu ma pas tha snyad kyi dngos po ma bkag par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbu ma pas tha snyad kyi dngos po ma bkag par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the Madhyamikas do not refute conventional things,

original: tha snyad du yang dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid sgyu ma'i ngo bo nyid bzhin du dam bcas pa la de bzhin du skur pa ma btab pa'i phyir 'di la skyon med @313a * //🔽do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: tha snyad du yang dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid sgyu ma'i ngo bo nyid bzhin du dam bcas pa la de bzhin du skur pa ma btab pa'i phyir 'di la skyon med @313a * // do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: we say that conventionally, the essence of things is like the essence of an illusion, and since we do not deprecate the meaning of our thesis in that way, there is no fault in our position.

original: dbu ma pas dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa'i lan btab zin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbu ma pas dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa'i lan btab zin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the Madhyamikas have already responded to the argument that things lack intrinsic reality,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni skye ba med do zhes bya bas lan btab zin pa'i phyir 'di la skyon med do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni skye ba med do zhes bya bas lan btab zin pa'i phyir 'di la skyon med do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Since it has already been answered that dependent origination is non-arisen, he says, “There is no fault here.”

original: mkhas par rlom pa gzhan dag gzhan du phyir zlog par byed de //
analyzed: mkhas par rlom pa gzhan dag gzhan du phyir zlog par byed de //
translated: Other conceited scholars refute in a different way:

original: de dag ngo bo nyid gang gis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: de dag ngo bo nyid gang gis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'dod de /
translated: By what nature do you assert that they are natureless?

original: gal te rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i bzos sbyar ba'i ngo bo nyid sgro btags nas ma grub po zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i bzos sbyar ba'i ngo bo nyid sgro btags nas ma grub po zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If you impute a nature fabricated by your own conception, then it is an establishment of what is already established.

original: ci ste de dag rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa des ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhe na ni de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste de dag rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa des ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhe na ni de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that they are natureless by the nature that arises from causes and conditions, that is not logical.

original: mngon sum dang grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir rang gi sde pa gang zag bdag med pa'i tshul tsam la mkhas su re ba dag 'di skad ces khyed dbu ma pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid
analyzed: mngon sum dang grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir rang gi sde pa gang zag bdag med pa'i tshul tsam la mkhas su re ba dag 'di skad ces khyed dbu ma pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid
translated: Here, those who are skilled in the mere mode of the selflessness of persons in our own schools say, “You Followers of the Middle Way assert that things are essenceless.

original: du 'dod pa de gal te gzhan mu stegs can dag gi rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i bzos sbyar ba'i gang zag ngo bo nyid sgro btags nas ma grub po zhes bya bar sgrub na ni kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang grub pas grub pa la sgrub🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: du 'dod pa de gal te gzhan mu stegs can dag gi rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i bzos sbyar ba'i gang zag ngo bo nyid sgro btags nas ma grub po zhes bya bar sgrub na ni kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang grub pas grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If you are proving to non-Buddhists, who are fabricating the self of persons through their own conceptual thoughts, that the self of persons is not established, then you are proving what is already established for us.

original: ci ste chos kyi ngo bo nyid rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba bsgrub na ni mngon sum dang grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: ci ste chos kyi ngo bo nyid rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba bsgrub na ni mngon sum dang grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: If you are proving to us that the essence of phenomena, which arises from causes and conditions, is essenceless, then your proof is illogical because it is undermined by direct perception and what is commonly acknowledged.”

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: don med par rnam par shes pa rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po'i gzugs la dmigs pa'i skye ba khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / dngos po yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ma spangs pa'i phyir mngon sum dang grags pa'i gnod pa med pas kho bo cag gi phyogs la /
analyzed: don med par rnam par shes pa rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po'i gzugs la dmigs pa'i skye ba khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / dngos po yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ma spangs pa'i phyir mngon sum dang grags pa'i gnod pa med pas kho bo cag gi phyogs la /
translated: Since we do not accept the arising of consciousness that observes the form of an imputed thing as meaningless, since we refute the existence of things, and since we do not abandon worldly conventions, we are not harmed by direct perception and what is renowned.

original: gang gis gang la gnod pa yang med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang gis gang la gnod pa yang med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, we say that there is no harm to our position.

original: gzhan mu stegs can dag gi rnam par rtog pa'i bzos sbyar ba'i gang zag ngo bo nyid sgro btags pa ma grub po zhes bya bar mi sgrub pas grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon gyi lan ni gdab mi dgos so //
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can dag gi rnam par rtog pa'i bzos sbyar ba'i gang zag ngo bo nyid sgro btags pa ma grub po zhes bya bar mi sgrub pas grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon gyi lan ni gdab mi dgos so //
translated: Since we do not prove that the imputed person, which is fabricated by the imagination of other tīrthikas, is not established as an entity, we do not need to respond to the error of proving what is already established.

original: chos kyi ngo bo nyid rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya bar sgrub na mngon sum dang grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de'i lan du dbu ma pas don dam par rnam par @313b shes pa rnam par
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo nyid rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya bar sgrub na mngon sum dang grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de'i lan du dbu ma pas don dam par rnam par @313b shes pa rnam par
translated: In response to that, the Madhyamaka asserts that ultimately consciousness does not arise from itself, nor from another, nor from both, nor without cause.

original: brtags po'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i skye ba yang khas ma blangs la /
analyzed: brtags po'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i skye ba yang khas ma blangs la /
translated: And since we do not accept that consciousness arises in dependence on an object that is a conceptually imputed entity,

original: dngos po thams cad kyi yod pa nyid kyang bkag pa'i phyir dang / kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du dngos po brjod pa yang ma spangs pa'i phyir gang gis gang la gnod pa yang med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi yod pa nyid kyang bkag pa'i phyir dang / kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du dngos po brjod pa yang ma spangs pa'i phyir gang gis gang la gnod pa yang med do zhes bstan to //
translated: and since we refute the existence of all things, and since we do not abandon the expression of things in conventional terms, there is nothing that undermines anything.

original: mngon sum gyi gnod pa yod par rtog par 'dod na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi gnod pa yod par rtog par 'dod na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think that there is the fault of contradicting direct perception, that also is not a correct objection.

original: mngon sum du dmigs pa'i dngos po mngon sum du yod pa nyid du bstan par bya dgos na de yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces dbu ma pa chos kyi ngo bo nyid rgyu dang rkyen las
analyzed: mngon sum du dmigs pa'i dngos po mngon sum du yod pa nyid du bstan par bya dgos na de yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces dbu ma pa chos kyi ngo bo nyid rgyu dang rkyen las
translated: If you say that you must demonstrate that the object that is directly perceived exists in direct perception, but that is not established,

original: byung ba ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya bar bsgrubs pas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ma spangs pa'i phyir grags pa'i gnod pa med kyang mngon sum gyi gnod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: byung ba ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya bar bsgrubs pas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ma spangs pa'i phyir grags pa'i gnod pa med kyang mngon sum gyi gnod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: if the opponent says, “The Mādhyamika proves that the entity of phenomena arises from causes and conditions and is essenceless, and because of that he does not abandon worldly conventions, therefore there is no invalidation by what is renowned, but there is invalidation by direct perception,”

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te don dam par dngos po mngon sum du dmigs pa zhig yod na ni de skad byar yang rung grang na /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te don dam par dngos po mngon sum du dmigs pa zhig yod na ni de skad byar yang rung grang na /
translated: that also is not correct. If in the ultimate sense there were direct perception of an entity, then it would be suitable to say that.

original: de yang ma grub pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi gnod pa yang med do //
analyzed: de yang ma grub pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi gnod pa yang med do //
translated: But because that is not established, there is also no invalidation by direct perception.

original: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces da ltar dngos po ngo bo nyid yod pa rgyu dang rkyen las skye ba mngon sum du snang bas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ma yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan
analyzed: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces da ltar dngos po ngo bo nyid yod pa rgyu dang rkyen las skye ba mngon sum du snang bas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ma yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan
translated: Here, the earlier position that the opponent might say, “Since things that exist by way of their own entities are manifestly seen to arise from causes and conditions, they are not devoid of their own entities,” is drawn out from within the root text.

original: du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gal te don dam par dngos po 'ga' zhig rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis yod par gyur na rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod pa de'i skye ba don med par 'gyur te /🔽ngo bo nyid ni rgyu rkyen las //
analyzed: du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gal te don dam par dngos po 'ga' zhig rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis yod par gyur na rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod pa de'i skye ba don med par 'gyur te / ngo bo nyid ni rgyu rkyen las //
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says, “If ultimately things existed in some way, then the arising of that which exists by way of its own entity would be pointless.”🔽It is not tenable that an entity

original: 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: arises from causes and conditions.

original: ngo bo nyid med par smra ba'i phyogs la zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med par smra ba'i phyogs la zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The phrase “in the system of the proponents of nonentityness” is left out.

original: ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i phyogs la ngo bo nyid ni mi 'gyur ba bcos ma ma yin pas rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung bar mi rigs so zhes glags yod pa'i tshig tu bstan to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i phyogs la ngo bo nyid ni mi 'gyur ba bcos ma ma yin pas rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung bar mi rigs so zhes glags yod pa'i tshig tu bstan to //
translated: In the position that maintains that entities exist by their own intrinsic reality, intrinsic reality is unchanging and not fabricated, so it is not reasonable that it arise from causes and conditions.

original: ngo bo nyid dang 'byung ba'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid ni rang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang 'byung ba'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid ni rang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the words intrinsic reality and arising, he said, “Intrinsic reality is one’s own nature.”

original: rang gi bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “one’s own nature” means one’s own essence.

original: 'byung ba ni skye'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni skye'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Arising is origination.

original: ci ste 'byung bar mthong bas bsnyon par mi nus so zhe na zhes bya ba ni /🔽ci ste pha rol po dag na re da ltar phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung bar mthong bas /
analyzed: ci ste 'byung bar mthong bas bsnyon par mi nus so zhe na zhes bya ba ni / ci ste pha rol po dag na re da ltar phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung bar mthong bas /
translated: If you say, “We cannot deny arising because it is seen,”

original: ngo bo nyid med do zhes bsnyon par mi nus so zhes zer na'o //🔽de'i @314a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med do zhes bsnyon par mi nus so zhes zer na'o // de'i @314a * //
translated: if you say, “We cannot deny that entities lack intrinsic reality because we see that all outer and inner entities arise from causes and conditions.”

original: lan du de yang rgyu dang rkyen gzhan la rag las pa yin pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lan du de yang rgyu dang rkyen gzhan la rag las pa yin pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that, he said, “That also depends on other causes and conditions.”

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni bcos ma yin pas ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes skabs kyi don bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni bcos ma yin pas ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes skabs kyi don bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the passage is this: That which arises from causes and conditions is a product, and what is a product is not an intrinsic reality.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the characteristics of a cause, he says:

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yi //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yi //
translated: That which arises from causes and conditions

original: ngo bo nyid ni byas par 'gyur //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni byas par 'gyur //
translated: has an intrinsic reality that is a product.

original: de la rgyu ni thun mong ma yin pa dang / rang gi don dang de ma thag pa dang cha mthun pa skyed pa gcig pu gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la rgyu ni thun mong ma yin pa dang / rang gi don dang de ma thag pa dang cha mthun pa skyed pa gcig pu gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here, a cause is said to be that which is not shared, which is one’s own object, which is immediate, and which generates a homogeneous continuum.

original: gang gis 'bras bu de nyid skyed kyi gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa dang / rdzas kyi rgyud de nyid skyed cing rang gi byed pa dang / rang gi ngo bo zhi gos ma thag tu 'bras bu skyed pas de ma thag pa dang 'bras bu cha mthun pa skyed pa khams drug lta bu ma yin pa gcig pu gang yin pa de ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang gis 'bras bu de nyid skyed kyi gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa dang / rdzas kyi rgyud de nyid skyed cing rang gi byed pa dang / rang gi ngo bo zhi gos ma thag tu 'bras bu skyed pas de ma thag pa dang 'bras bu cha mthun pa skyed pa khams drug lta bu ma yin pa gcig pu gang yin pa de ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of cause is that which produces a specific result, not shared with others, and which produces its own continuum of substantial entities, its own activity, and its own nature, and which produces its result immediately after it arises, and which produces a result that is similar to itself, unlike the six elements.

original: rkyen gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rkyen gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the definition of condition, he says:

original: rkyen ni de las bzlog pa ste //
analyzed: rkyen ni de las bzlog pa ste //
translated: Condition is the opposite of that.

original: lhan cig byed pa dag go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa dag go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is a co-originator.

original: rgyu'i mtshan nyid las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The opposite of the definition of cause.

original: byas pa ni bcos ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byas pa ni bcos ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The created is synonymous with the fabricated, which means it is not intrinsic.

original: de la 'dir mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog pas phyogs kyi chos mngon no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog pas phyogs kyi chos mngon no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ste /
translated: Here, the meaning of the words “the property of the position is clearly seen as the opposite of the discordant side” is as follows: The discordant side of realitylessness is the existence of reality.

original: de las bzlog pas ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs ni rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yin par mngon no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: de las bzlog pas ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs ni rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yin par mngon no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The property of the position of realitylessness is the reason, which is clearly seen as arising from causes and conditions.

original: de shes par byed pa'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de shes par byed pa'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the example that makes that known,

original: dper na sgra ni rtag pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra ni rtag pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: it says, for example, sound is endowed with permanence.

original: rtag pa ni byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Permanence is not a product.

original: rtag pa la ni byas pa nyid med la sgra la ni byas pa nyid yod pas de'i phyir sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: rtag pa la ni byas pa nyid med la sgra la ni byas pa nyid yod pas de'i phyir sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: Permanence does not have the nature of being a product, but sound does have the nature of being a product. Therefore, sound is impermanent, because it is a product.

original: 'dir yang ngo bo nyid ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'byung bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'dir yang ngo bo nyid ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'byung bar mi rigs te /
translated: In the same way, here also, it is not reasonable that reality arise from causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ni byas pa yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ni byas pa yin par 'gyur la /
translated: An entity that arises from causes and conditions is a product.

original: ngo bo nyid la ni byas pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la ni byas pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But an entity does not exist as a product.

original: ngo bo nyid ni ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /🔽brda sprod pa pa 'ga' zhig gis sgra ni rtag go zhes smras pa na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te / brda sprod pa pa 'ga' zhig gis sgra ni rtag go zhes smras pa na /
translated: Because an entity is not a product.🔽When some grammarians say that sound is permanent,

original: la la zhig na re sgra ni rtag pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: la la zhig na re sgra ni rtag pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: someone else says, Sound is not endowed with permanence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rtag pa ni byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag pa ni byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because permanence is not a product.

original: rtag pa la ni byas pa nyid med la /
analyzed: rtag pa la ni byas pa nyid med la /
translated: Because permanence does not exist as a product.

original: sgra la ni byas pa nyid yod pas de'i phyir sgra mi rtag pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rtag pa las bzlog @314b pas sgra mi rtag par bsgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos byas pa nyid mngon pa'i phyir sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba
analyzed: sgra la ni byas pa nyid yod pas de'i phyir sgra mi rtag pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rtag pa las bzlog @314b pas sgra mi rtag par bsgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos byas pa nyid mngon pa'i phyir sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba
translated: But sound exists as a product. Therefore, because the property of the subject, being a product, is stated as the reason proving that sound is impermanent, the opposite of the discordant side, permanence, is stated. Therefore sound is impermanent because it is a product.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ste /
translated: So too, here, the opposite of realitylessness is the existence of reality.

original: ngo bo nyid yod pa ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'byung bar mi rigs la dngos po 'di la ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis byas pa nyid yod pas ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa yin par me
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod pa ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'byung bar mi rigs la dngos po 'di la ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis byas pa nyid yod pas ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa yin par me
translated: It is not reasonable that what exists by way of intrinsic reality should arise from causes and conditions, but since this entity has the very existence that is created by causes and conditions, the property of the position that proves realitylessness is the fact that it is created by causes and conditions.

original: don no zhes ston to //
analyzed: don no zhes ston to //
translated: This is what is shown.

original: de'i phyir 'di la ni byas pa nyid yod pas 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni 'di ltar bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la ni byas pa nyid yod pas 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni 'di ltar bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, since it has the very existence that is created by causes and conditions, the syllogism is to be applied in this way.

original: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the internal sense bases do not exist by way of intrinsic reality,

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir dper na sgyu mar byas pa'i mi dang phyugs dang ri dags dang bya la sogs pa'i rdzas dag bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir dper na sgyu mar byas pa'i mi dang phyugs dang ri dags dang bya la sogs pa'i rdzas dag bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang /
translated: The subject is “because they arise from causes and conditions,” the predicate is “like the substances of illusory men, cattle, deer, birds, and so on,” and the example is “that are created by magic.”

original: dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are applied in order.

original: dper na sgyu mar byas pa'i mi la sogs pa'i rdzas ni rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du nang gi skye mched rnams kyang rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin no
analyzed: dper na sgyu mar byas pa'i mi la sogs pa'i rdzas ni rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du nang gi skye mched rnams kyang rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin no
translated: For example, the substances of illusory men and so on are not intrinsically existent because they arise from causes and conditions. In the same way, the internal sense sources are not intrinsically existent because they arise from causes and conditions.

original: // gang la ngo bo nyid yod pa de ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog go zhes bya bas ni dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs snga ma de mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pas /
analyzed: // gang la ngo bo nyid yod pa de ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog go zhes bya bas ni dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs snga ma de mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pas /
translated: Since that which intrinsically exists does not arise, the thesis and the previous reason are reversed from the discordant side.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul bstan to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid du nges pa'i tshul bstan to //
translated: The existence of the object of inference, the existence of the similar instance, and the nonexistence of the dissimilar instance are taught.

original: 'dir tshig gi don la rtogs pa sun 'byin par 'dod pa kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshig gi don la rtogs pa sun 'byin par 'dod pa kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Here, someone who wishes to refute the understanding of the meaning of the words says,

original: sgyu ma ni gsang sngags dang sman yongs su bzung ba'i dbang gis 'jim pa dang sa dang rtsva dang 'bras bu dang lo ma la sogs pa yod pa nyid las glang po che la sogs pa'i gzugs su snang ba'i phyir dpe bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi
analyzed: sgyu ma ni gsang sngags dang sman yongs su bzung ba'i dbang gis 'jim pa dang sa dang rtsva dang 'bras bu dang lo ma la sogs pa yod pa nyid las glang po che la sogs pa'i gzugs su snang ba'i phyir dpe bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi
translated: “The example is flawed in that it does not accord with the probandum because an illusion appears in the form of an elephant and so on from the existence of clay, earth, grass, fruit, leaves, and so on, through the power of the mantra and medicine being employed.”

original: mthun pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dngos po rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub pa'i tshig gi don ma rtogs pa dbu ma pa sun 'byin par 'dod pa kha cig sngar dbu ma pas don dam par nang
analyzed: mthun pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dngos po rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub pa'i tshig gi don ma rtogs pa dbu ma pa sun 'byin par 'dod pa kha cig sngar dbu ma pas don dam par nang
translated: This is said by someone who wishes to refute the Mādhyamika and does not understand the meaning of the words that prove that things arise from causes and conditions and are essenceless. The Mādhyamika first states the thesis that ultimately the inner and outer are not arisen.

original: gi skye mched rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gi skye mched rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The sense bases do not exist inherently.🔽

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir dper na sgyu mar byas pa'i mi dang @315a * //🔽phyugs dang ri dvags dang bya la sogs pa'i rdzas dag bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir dper na sgyu mar byas pa'i mi dang @315a * // phyugs dang ri dvags dang bya la sogs pa'i rdzas dag bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: The sense bases do not exist inherently because they arise from causes and conditions, like the substances of illusory men, cattle, deer, birds, and so on.🔽This is the refutation of the example.🔽They say that although the elephant and so on do not exist as the nature of the illusion, the substances of the props of the illusion, such as grass and so on, do exist by their own nature.

original: de dag na re sgyu ma ni glang po che la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du med kyang sgyu ma'i yo byang rtsva la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa'i phyir khyed dbu ma pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med par sgrub pa'i dpe sgyu ma🔽las blangs pa de bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pa'i skyon yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag na re sgyu ma ni glang po che la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du med kyang sgyu ma'i yo byang rtsva la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa'i phyir khyed dbu ma pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med par sgrub pa'i dpe sgyu ma las blangs pa de bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pa'i skyon yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the example that you Mādhyamikas use to prove that things lack intrinsic existence is faulty because it does not share the properties of the thesis.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: glang po cher snang ba la glang po che'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dpe nyid du 'dod kyi /🔽rtsva la sogs pa dag mi 'dod pa'i phyir dang / de dag ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: glang po cher snang ba la glang po che'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dpe nyid du 'dod kyi / rtsva la sogs pa dag mi 'dod pa'i phyir dang / de dag ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: We assert that the appearance as an elephant in the illusion of an elephant is the example of the nonexistence of the reality of an elephant.

original: de dag gi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang sa la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang sa la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: We do not assert that the grass and so on are the example, because they are existent things, and because their reality also exists.🔽We assert that the appearance as an elephant in the illusion of an elephant is the example of the nonexistence of the reality of an elephant.

original: kho bo sgrub pa'i glang po cher snang ba la glang po che'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dpe nyid du 'dod kyi rtsva la sogs pa dngos po yod pa dag dpe nyid du mi 'dod pa'i phyir kho bo'i dpe bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan🔽pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo sgrub pa'i glang po cher snang ba la glang po che'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dpe nyid du 'dod kyi rtsva la sogs pa dngos po yod pa dag dpe nyid du mi 'dod pa'i phyir kho bo'i dpe bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: We do not assert that the grass and so on are the example, because they are existent things.🔽Therefore, the example does not lack the property to be proven.

original: sgyu ma'i yo byad rtsva la sogs pa de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i yo byad rtsva la sogs pa de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The reality of those illusory things, such as grass, also does not exist.

original: de dag gi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang sa la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan dag gis smras pa zhes bya bas ni pha rol po gzhan dag sngar dbu ma pas don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang sa la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro // gzhan dag gis smras pa zhes bya bas ni pha rol po gzhan dag sngar dbu ma pas don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because they refute the arising of those and because they refute the substantial existence of earth and so on.🔽Others say means that others, the opponents, previously said to the Mādhyamika, “The ultimate existence of the internal sense bases is not tenable because they arise from causes and conditions, like, for example, the substances of illusory men, cattle, deer, birds, and so on.”

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams las byung ba'i phyir dper na sgyu mar byas pa'i mi dang phyugs dang ri dags dang bya la sogs pa'i rdzas dag bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don 'gal ba nyid dang ma nges pa nyid dang ma grub pa nyid du sun🔽'byin pa ston to //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams las byung ba'i phyir dper na sgyu mar byas pa'i mi dang phyugs dang ri dags dang bya la sogs pa'i rdzas dag bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don 'gal ba nyid dang ma nges pa nyid dang ma grub pa nyid du sun🔽'byin pa ston to //
translated: This shows that they are refuting the reason that the Madhyamika gave, demonstrating that it is contradictory, uncertain, and not established.

original: de la gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid du sun 'byin pa bstan pa'i phyir ci tsam du gang dag rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba dag thams cad dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid du sun 'byin pa bstan pa'i phyir ci tsam du gang dag rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba dag thams cad dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te
translated: To the extent that you say that whatever arises from causes and conditions is an entity, the meaning of the reason is contradictory.

original: / 'jig rten na ci tsam du dngos po gang dag rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba de dag thams cad ngo bo nyid yod par mthong bas des na khyed dbu ma pas nang gi skye mched rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / 'jig rten na ci tsam du dngos po gang dag rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba de dag thams cad ngo bo nyid yod par mthong bas des na khyed dbu ma pas nang gi skye mched rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Whatever things in the world arise from causes and conditions are seen to exist inherently. Therefore, since you Followers of the Middle Way say that the inner sense sources do not exist inherently

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: because they arise from causes and conditions, the meaning of your reason is contradictory.🔽To demonstrate that the meaning of the reason is indeterminate, the text says:

original: gtan @315b tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid du sun 'byin pa bstan pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: gtan @315b tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid du sun 'byin pa bstan pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: Indeterminacy is also a problem.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa kha cig mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /🔽sgyu ma dang sgyu ma'i yo byad dag dang rgyu rkyen las byung bas 'dra yang sgyu ma ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs la yod la sgyu ma'i yo byad dag ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa'i phyir des🔽na ci re zhig rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa kha cig mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te / sgyu ma dang sgyu ma'i yo byad dag dang rgyu rkyen las byung bas 'dra yang sgyu ma ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs la yod la sgyu ma'i yo byad dag ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa'i phyir des na ci re zhig rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Some say: Because some things such as illusions exist in both the class of things that are similar and the class of things that are not similar.🔽Although illusions and the articles used in the illusion are similar in arising from causes and conditions, illusions exist in the class of things that are similar to things that lack intrinsic reality and the articles used in the illusion exist in the class of things that are not similar to things that lack intrinsic reality.

original: sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur ram 'on te rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir sgyu ma'i yo byad dag bzhin du ngo bo nyid yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid med par 'gyur ram 'on te rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir sgyu ma'i yo byad dag bzhin du ngo bo nyid yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, is it that because they arise from causes and conditions, they lack intrinsic reality like an illusion? Or is it that because they arise from causes and conditions, they possess intrinsic reality like the articles used in the illusion?🔽It is uncertain.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du sun 'byin pa bstan pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du sun 'byin pa bstan pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the meaning of the reason is not established, he says, “The meaning of the reason is not established because it does not pervade all similar instances.”

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas dag rgyu dang rkyen las ma byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas dag rgyu dang rkyen las ma byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says, “Uncompounded phenomena such as space do not arise from causes and conditions.”

original: khyed dbu ma pas ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs phyi nang gi skye mched la sogs pa 'dus byas dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam 'cha' ba yin pa las de'i gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de phyi nang gi skye mched la sogs pa 'dus byas rnams la yod
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pas ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs phyi nang gi skye mched la sogs pa 'dus byas dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam 'cha' ba yin pa las de'i gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de phyi nang gi skye mched la sogs pa 'dus byas rnams la yod
translated: You Mādhyamikas assert that all compounded phenomena, such as the inner and outer sense sources, and all uncompounded phenomena, such as space, are devoid of entityness. The reason you give for that is “because they arise from causes and conditions.” That reason exists for compounded phenomena such as the inner and outer sense sources.

original: kyang / nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas pa dag la med pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kyang / nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas pa dag la med pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But since it does not pervade all similar instances, since it does not exist in unconditioned phenomena such as space, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de yang bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / smig rgyu lta bu dag rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas su zin kyang gzhan la med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid ces brjod de /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / smig rgyu lta bu dag rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas su zin kyang gzhan la med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid ces brjod de /
translated: Although the nature of things is like an illusion, a dream, or a mirage, and is produced by causes and conditions, it is called “nature” because it does not exist elsewhere.

original: dper na me'i tsha ba nyid bzhin pas de'i phyir ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de ni tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na me'i tsha ba nyid bzhin pas de'i phyir ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de ni tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, it is like the heat of fire. Therefore, that which is called “nature” is conventional, not ultimate.

original: nges ni dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don 'gal ba nyid dang ma nges pa nyid dang ma grub pa nyid ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: nges ni dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don 'gal ba nyid dang ma nges pa nyid dang ma grub pa nyid ma yin par ston to //
translated: The meaning of the Madhyamaka reason “because it arises from causes and conditions” is not contradictory, uncertain, or unestablished.

original: 'di skad bstan te dngos po'i ngo bo nyid sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bu dag rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te dngos po'i ngo bo nyid sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bu dag rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: This is taught as follows: The nature of things, which is like an illusion, does arise from causes and conditions. However,

original: 'on kyang @316a * //🔽tha snyad du rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i dngos po gzhan la de'i ngo bo nyid med kyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang @316a * // tha snyad du rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i dngos po gzhan la de'i ngo bo nyid med kyi /
translated: it is not that🔽the nature of things does not exist.

original: rigs mthun pa'i rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i rang gi dngos po la de'i ngo bo nyid sgyu ma tsam du yod pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid ces brjod de /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i rang gi dngos po la de'i ngo bo nyid sgyu ma tsam du yod pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid ces brjod de /
translated: Rather, it is that the nature of things is merely an illusion, which arises from causes and conditions of a concordant type.

original: dper na me rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba la ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na me rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba la ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: For example, fire arises from causes and conditions, and it is not that its nature does not exist.

original: chu la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa gzhan la me'i ngo bo nyid med kyi me nyid kyi rang gi dngos po la me'i ngo bo nyid yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chu la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa gzhan la me'i ngo bo nyid med kyi me nyid kyi rang gi dngos po la me'i ngo bo nyid yod pa'i phyir /
translated: The nature of fire does not exist in other heterogeneous things such as water, but the nature of fire exists in the own nature of fire itself.

original: me'i ngo bo nyid ces brjod pa bzhin pas de'i phyir dngos po rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de ni tha snyad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: me'i ngo bo nyid ces brjod pa bzhin pas de'i phyir dngos po rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de ni tha snyad pa yin gyi /
translated: Since it is like saying “the nature of fire,” therefore the nature of things that arise from causes and conditions is a convention.

original: don dam pa pa ma yin pas kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid la sogs pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: don dam pa pa ma yin pas kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid la sogs pa'i skyon med do //
translated: Since it is not ultimate, our reason is not faulty in that its meaning is contradictory, etc.

original: don dam par ni /🔽ngo bo nyid ni byas pa zhes //
analyzed: don dam par ni / ngo bo nyid ni byas pa zhes //
translated: In the ultimate,🔽How could it be tenable

original: ci lta bur na rung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ci lta bur na rung bar 'gyur //
translated: That nature is produced?

original: byas pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag na re ngo bo nyid ni byas pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: byas pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag na re ngo bo nyid ni byas pa kho na yin te /
translated: The point is that if the opponent says, “Nature is only produced,”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is that?

original: 'di ltar snam bu'i dngos po sngon ma byung ba phyis byed pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes zer na don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar snam bu'i dngos po sngon ma byung ba phyis byed pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes zer na don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa yin na /
translated: Because it would be like a cloth that did not exist before but is made later.

original: de rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa zhes bya bar ci ltar rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa zhes bya bar ci ltar rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If things existed ultimately, how could it be tenable to say that they are created by causes and conditions?🔽Because being created is not possible without being essenceless.

original: byas pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs pas gang gi tshe don de dag dgag pa mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: byas pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs pas gang gi tshe don de dag dgag pa mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: Since this is the intention of the author of the sutra, when these two meanings are negated, they are contradictory.

original: gal te ngo bo nyid yin na ni byas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid yin na ni byas pa ma yin la /
translated: If something is an essence, it is not created.

original: ci ste byas pa yin na ni ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyang yin la byas pa yang yin no zhes sems pa dang bcas pa su zhig de ltar 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste byas pa yin na ni ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyang yin la byas pa yang yin no zhes sems pa dang bcas pa su zhig de ltar 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is created, it is not an essence. So what sensible person would think that something is both an essence and created?

original: de'i phyir dngos po rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore all things that arise from causes and conditions are essenceless.

original: de lta bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid dang ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar /
analyzed: de lta bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid dang ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar /
translated: Thus, because there is no discordant side, the meaning of the reason is not contradictory and it is not uncertain.

original: dngos po rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Since all things that arise from causes and conditions are ultimately essenceless, there is no discordant side. Therefore, the Madhyamaka reason, “because they arise from causes and conditions,”

original: ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba de'i don 'gal ba nyid dang ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba de'i don 'gal ba nyid dang ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: is not contradictory and is not uncertain with respect to the meaning of the statement, “They do not exist essentially.”

original: mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that it does not pervade all of the concordant side.

original: tha snyad du yang nam mkha' la sogs pa ma skyes pa dag ni ri bong gi rva @316b bzhin du yod pa nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag na re mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab pas gtan
analyzed: tha snyad du yang nam mkha' la sogs pa ma skyes pa dag ni ri bong gi rva @316b bzhin du yod pa nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag na re mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab pas gtan
translated: Because even conventionally, such things as space, which are not produced, are not accepted as existent, like the horns of a rabbit.

original: tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: It is also the case that the meaning of the verse is not established,

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas dag rgyu dang rkyen las ma byung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i lan ston to //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas dag rgyu dang rkyen las ma byung ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i lan ston to //
translated: because unconditioned phenomena such as space do not arise from causes and conditions.

original: dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The Madhyamaka reason “because it arises from causes and conditions” is not nonpervasive of all similar instances.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: nang gi skye mched rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa dag gi mthun pa'i phyogs phyi rol gyi skye mched la sogs pa dngos po tha snyad du sgyu ma'i rdzas bzhin du yod pa thams cad ni rgyu dang rkyen las
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa dag gi mthun pa'i phyogs phyi rol gyi skye mched la sogs pa dngos po tha snyad du sgyu ma'i rdzas bzhin du yod pa thams cad ni rgyu dang rkyen las
translated: Because internal bases arise from causes and conditions, they do not exist inherently. All similar instances of external bases and so on that exist conventionally like illusory substances exist from causes and conditions.

original: byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pas de dag la ni rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis khyab pa'i phyir don ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pas de dag la ni rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis khyab pa'i phyir don ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Because they arise, they do not exist inherently. Therefore, the reason, “because they arise from causes and conditions,” is not unestablished.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas ma skyes pa dag ni tha snyad du yang ri bong gi rva bzhin du yod par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de dag la ni rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de yang sbyar mi dgos
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas ma skyes pa dag ni tha snyad du yang ri bong gi rva bzhin du yod par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de dag la ni rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de yang sbyar mi dgos
translated: Uncompounded space and so forth are not produced. We do not accept that they exist even conventionally, like the horns of a rabbit. Therefore, the reason, “because they arise from causes and conditions,” is not applicable to them.

original: pas / de dag la gtan tshigs des ma khyab tu zin kyang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'grub pas don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: pas / de dag la gtan tshigs des ma khyab tu zin kyang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'grub pas don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Even though the reason is not applicable to them, they are established as lacking inherent existence. Therefore, the reason is not unestablished.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab tu zin kyang bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul pa med pas brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba bzhin du de yang gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir dang dus gcig tu phyogs su ma byas pa'i phyir dang 'dus ma byas kyi dngos
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab tu zin kyang bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul pa med pas brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba bzhin du de yang gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir dang dus gcig tu phyogs su ma byas pa'i phyir dang 'dus ma byas kyi dngos
translated: Although the reason “because it arises from causes and conditions” is not necessarily concomitant with all similar instances, it is not mistaken with respect to the predicate and it arises as soon as it is sought.

original: po phyogs su ma byas pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de /
analyzed: po phyogs su ma byas pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de /
translated: Therefore it is a reason and because it is not posited as a reason at one time and not posited as a reason at another time, it is not a nonestablished reason.🔽This is the response of the Mādhyamika.🔽The reason “because it arises from causes and conditions” is not necessarily concomitant with all similar instances, such as unconditioned phenomena such as space, because they do not arise from causes and conditions.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas pa dag rgyu dang rkyen las ma byung ba'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab tu zin kyang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin par ston te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas pa dag rgyu dang rkyen las ma byung ba'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab tu zin kyang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin par ston te /
translated: However, this does not indicate that the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de /
analyzed: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de /
translated: Although the reason “because it arises from causes and conditions” does not pervade such things as space, which are uncompounded, it is not mistaken with respect to the object to be proven, that the internal sense sources do not intrinsically exist. Therefore it is a reason.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas dag la ma khyab tu zin kyang nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pas bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul pa med pas de yang gtan tshigs yin te dper na sgra mi rtag par bsgrub pa'i🔽gtan @317a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas dag la ma khyab tu zin kyang nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pas bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul pa med pas de yang gtan tshigs yin te dper na sgra mi rtag par bsgrub pa'i gtan @317a * //
translated: For example, the reason “because it arises in dependence on effort” is not a correct reason for proving that sound is impermanent,🔽because it does not pervade such things as a lightning strike or a fire-wheel.

original: tshigs brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa dag la ma khyab tu zin kyang sgra mi rtag par bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul pa med pas de yang gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir skyon med pa
analyzed: tshigs brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de glog dang nags kyi me tog la sogs pa dag la ma khyab tu zin kyang sgra mi rtag par bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul pa med pas de yang gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir skyon med pa
translated: However, the reason “because it arises in dependence on effort” is a correct reason for proving that sound is impermanent, because it is not mistaken with respect to the object to be proven.

original: bzhin no // gzhan yang kho bos nang gi skye mched rnams dang phyi'i skye mched rnams dus gcig tu phyogs su ma byas pa'i phyir kho bos don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i
analyzed: bzhin no // gzhan yang kho bos nang gi skye mched rnams dang phyi'i skye mched rnams dus gcig tu phyogs su ma byas pa'i phyir kho bos don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i
translated: Moreover, since we do not take the internal bases and the external bases as being the same in time, we do not commit the fallacy of the nonestablishment of the reason in our proof that ultimately the internal bases do not exist due to their arising from causes and conditions.

original: phyir zhes bya ba de'i phyi rol gyi skye mched la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab tu zin kyang gtan tshigs su rung bas don ma grub pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba de'i phyi rol gyi skye mched la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab tu zin kyang gtan tshigs su rung bas don ma grub pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Even though the reason “because they arise from causes and conditions” does not pervade all similar instances, such as external bases and so on, it is still a correct reason. Therefore, we do not commit the fallacy of nonestablishment of the reason.

original: gzhan yang kho bos nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po phyogs su ma byas pa'i phyir kho bos don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes
analyzed: gzhan yang kho bos nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po phyogs su ma byas pa'i phyir kho bos don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes
translated: Moreover, since we do not take unconditioned things such as space as being the same in time, we do not commit the fallacy of the nonestablishment of the reason in our proof that ultimately the internal bases do not exist due to their arising from causes and conditions.

original: bya ba de /
analyzed: bya ba de /
translated: The reason “because they arise from causes and conditions”

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po thams cad la ma khyab tu zin kyang gtan tshigs su rung bas don ma grub pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //🔽da ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs brtags na yang de las bzlog pas phyogs kyi chos kyi dbang gis rjes su dpag pa smra bar 'dod nas bshad pa zhes bya bas ni 'dir ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ngo bo nyid gcig yod par brtags na
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po thams cad la ma khyab tu zin kyang gtan tshigs su rung bas don ma grub pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do // da ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs brtags na yang de las bzlog pas phyogs kyi chos kyi dbang gis rjes su dpag pa smra bar 'dod nas bshad pa zhes bya bas ni 'dir ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ngo bo nyid gcig yod par brtags na
translated: Even if it does not pervade all unconditioned things such as space, it is still a correct reason, so it is not the case that the meaning is not established.🔽Now, when the opposite is examined, the opponent wishes to state an inference based on the property of the subject, the opposite of that, and explains this.🔽Here, having imagined the opposite of the absence of intrinsic reality, the existence of a single intrinsic reality,

original: yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las bzlog pas ngo bo nyid med par sgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos byas pa nyid dang / ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba'i dbang gis dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa smra bar 'dod nas tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'di bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las bzlog pas ngo bo nyid med par sgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos byas pa nyid dang / ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba'i dbang gis dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa smra bar 'dod nas tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'di bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: the opponent wishes to state an inference of the absence of intrinsic reality based on the property of the subject, the opposite of that, the property of the subject of the probandum, “produced” and “dependent,” and explains this half-verse.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de rigs pa de gang dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de rigs pa de gang dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What is the reason for the absence of intrinsic reality, which is the opposite of intrinsic reality?

original: bcos ma ma yin pa dang gzhan la ltos pa med pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi rigs pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bcos ma ma yin pa dang gzhan la ltos pa med pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi rigs pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that the reason for the absence of intrinsic reality is that it is not fabricated and does not depend on another.

original: de nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that characteristic, it is said:

original: ngo bo nyid ni bcos min dang // gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni bcos min dang // gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //
translated: Intrinsic reality is not fabricated and does not depend on another.

original: bcos ma ma yin pa ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcos ma ma yin pa ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not fabricated because it is not produced by causes and conditions.

original: gzhan la ltos pa med pa ni brjod pa khyad par can sten pa gzhan la @317b ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med pa ni brjod pa khyad par can sten pa gzhan la @317b ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It does not depend on another because it does not depend on the special expression of another.

original: des ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par bstan to //
translated: This teaches the distinction of the opposite.

original: da ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las bzlog pas phyogs kyi chos bstan pa'i phyir nang gi dngos po rnams ni de ltar bcos ma ma yin pa dang / gzhan la ltos pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las bzlog pas phyogs kyi chos bstan pa'i phyir nang gi dngos po rnams ni de ltar bcos ma ma yin pa dang / gzhan la ltos pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the property of the subject by way of reversing that discordant factor, he says, “internal things are not unfabricated and not independent.”

original: 'on ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: byas pa nyid dang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: byas pa nyid dang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says, “They are produced and they are dependent.”

original: des ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog pas phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog pas phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan to //
translated: By this he teaches the property of the subject by way of reversing the discordant factor.

original: 'dis ni dngos po'i chos byas pa nyid dang ltos pa dang bcas pa yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po'i chos byas pa nyid dang ltos pa dang bcas pa yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement, “This teaches that the property of things is being produced and being dependent,”🔽means that this section teaching the property of the subject teaches that the property of things that are to be established as lacking entityness is being produced and being dependent.🔽The statement, “This teaches that the property of things is being produced and being dependent,”

original: phyogs kyi chos bstan pa'i skabs 'dis ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni ma byas pa nyid dang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos bstan pa'i skabs 'dis ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni ma byas pa nyid dang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: means that this section teaching the property of the subject teaches that the property of things that are to be established as lacking entityness is being produced and being dependent.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the inference is: ultimately, internal things are essenceless,🔽because they are produced and because they depend on the use of special terminology, just like, for example, the people and so on conjured by a magician.

original: byas pa'i phyir dang brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i mi la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang /
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir dang brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i mi la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum,

original: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /🔽dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i mi la sogs pa ni byas pa'i phyir dang brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du nang gi dngos po rnams kyang byas pa'i phyir dang brjod
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i mi la sogs pa ni byas pa'i phyir dang brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du nang gi dngos po rnams kyang byas pa'i phyir dang brjod
translated: the property of the probandum, and the example are to be applied in order.🔽For example, the people and so on conjured by a magician are essenceless because they are produced and because they depend on the use of special terminology.

original: pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no //
translated: In the same way, internal things are essenceless because they are produced and because they depend on the use of special terminology.

original: gang ngo bo nyid yod pa de ni de las bzlog par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan te /
analyzed: gang ngo bo nyid yod pa de ni de las bzlog par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan te /
translated: The phrase “that which has intrinsic reality would change into something else” indicates the contradictory position.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog pa nyid du nges par 'grub po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re ci tsam du gang dag byas pa nyid dang brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa dag thams cad dngos po'i ngo bo nyid
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog pa nyid du nges par 'grub po zhes bya bar sbyar ro // rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re ci tsam du gang dag byas pa nyid dang brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa dag thams cad dngos po'i ngo bo nyid
translated: The reason is ascertained to be the opposite of the contradictory position.🔽The rest is as before.

original: yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: If the opponent says that whatever is dependent on being produced and on being expressed is an intrinsic reality of an entity, then the meaning of the reason is contradictory.

original: ma nges pa nyid kyang yin te sgyu ma la sogs pa kha cig mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid kyang yin te sgyu ma la sogs pa kha cig mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also indefinite because some illusions and so on exist in both the similar and dissimilar classes.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: It is also not established because it does not pervade the entire similar class.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas dag byas pa nyid dang @318a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas dag byas pa nyid dang @318a * //
translated: Uncompounded space and so on are not dependent on the creation of something special, such as a pot, or on the expression of something special.

original: brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na de yang bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa khyad par can sten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na de yang bzang po ma yin te /
translated: But that is not good, because

original: dngos po ngo bo nyid sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / smig rgyu lta bu dag byas pa nyid dang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin du zin kyang gzhan la med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid ces brjod de /
analyzed: dngos po ngo bo nyid sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / smig rgyu lta bu dag byas pa nyid dang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin du zin kyang gzhan la med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid ces brjod de /
translated: even though things that are essentially like illusions, dreams and mirages are created and dependent, they are said to be essentially existent because they do not exist elsewhere.🔽For example, just as heat is the essence of fire, therefore essence is a conventional expression, not an ultimate reality.

original: dper na me'i tsha ba nyid bzhin pas de'i phyir ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de ni tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ma yin no zhes rgyas par snga ma bzhin du lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na me'i tsha ba nyid bzhin pas de'i phyir ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de ni tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ma yin no zhes rgyas par snga ma bzhin du lan btab pa yin no //
translated: The response is the same as above.

original: de ltar dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrubs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las bdag gi dngos po med pa zhes gsungs pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrubs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las bdag gi dngos po med pa zhes gsungs pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since things are established as lacking entityness, the meaning of the statement in the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas that “there is no entityness of self” is explained.

original: da ni gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Now, otherness should be established as emptiness.

original: de'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
translated: In order to set forth the opponent’s position here, it is said:

original: don dam par nang gi skye mched kyi dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam par nang gi skye mched kyi dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa yin te /
translated: In the ultimate truth, the entities of the internal sense bases exist by way of their own entity.

original: rang las gzhan pa'i brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na ring po thung ngu'i brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba khyad par can gyi rgyu yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rang las gzhan pa'i brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na ring po thung ngu'i brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba khyad par can gyi rgyu yin pa bzhin no //
translated: This is because they are the cause of the special expression and object of expression that is different from themselves, just as long is the cause of the special expression and object of expression of short.

original: de bzhin du rang las gzhan pa la yang 'di ni gzhan no zhes brjod pa dang brjod pa khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang las gzhan pa la yang 'di ni gzhan no zhes brjod pa dang brjod pa khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In the same way, there is the cause of the special expression and object of expression that is different from itself, “This is different.”

original: 'dis ni pha rol po dag gzhan gyi dngos po yod pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyis bdag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te //
analyzed: 'dis ni pha rol po dag gzhan gyi dngos po yod pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyis bdag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te //
translated: This shows that the opponent’s inference proves that the entity of self exists by the reason of the existence of the entity of other.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the probative property, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na ring po ni rang las gzhan pa thung ngu'i brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ring po yod pa la ltos nas thung ngu yang yod pa de bzhin du nang gi skye mched kyi dngos po rnams kyang rang las gzhan pa gzhan gyi dngos po'i brjod pa dang brjod par bya
analyzed: dper na ring po ni rang las gzhan pa thung ngu'i brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ring po yod pa la ltos nas thung ngu yang yod pa de bzhin du nang gi skye mched kyi dngos po rnams kyang rang las gzhan pa gzhan gyi dngos po'i brjod pa dang brjod par bya
translated: For example, because long is the cause of the expression and the expressed of short, which is different from itself, short exists in dependence on the existence of long. In the same way, the entities of the internal sense bases also exist in dependence on the existence of the entities of other, which are different from themselves.

original: ba khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po la ltos nas bdag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ba khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po la ltos nas bdag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the distinctive effect, the entity of self exists in reliance on the entity of other.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:
