original: 'di la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa du ma brjod pas dngos po'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bstan zin pas /
analyzed: 'di la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa du ma brjod pas dngos po'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bstan zin pas /
translated: Since many inferences have been stated to demonstrate the absence of intrinsic reality, it has been demonstrated that things lack intrinsic reality.

original: ngo bo nyid ni yod min na //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni yod min na //
translated: Intrinsic reality does not exist.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po ga la @318b yod pa de smros shig ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po ga la @318b yod pa de smros shig ces bya ba smras te /
translated: So tell me, how could the entity of other exist?

original: gzhan gyi dngos po la brten nas kyang bdag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yod par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po la brten nas kyang bdag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yod par mi 'thad de /
translated: Even in reliance on the entity of other, the entity of self is untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid mi 'thad pa nyid du sngar bstan pas gzhan gyi dngos po yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid mi 'thad pa nyid du sngar bstan pas gzhan gyi dngos po yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because since the entity of self is untenable, as has been previously demonstrated, the entity of other is also untenable.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid ni de las gzhan pa'i dngos po la ltos nas gzhan gyi dngos po zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid ni de las gzhan pa'i dngos po la ltos nas gzhan gyi dngos po zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, “because its intrinsic reality is called the reality of another in dependence on a thing that is other than it.”

original: gal te bdag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rab tu grub par gyur na ni des na de'i gnyen po gzhan gyi dngos po yang yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rab tu grub par gyur na ni des na de'i gnyen po gzhan gyi dngos po yang yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the intrinsic reality of self were fully established, then its antidote, the reality of another, would also exist.

original: bdag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid mi 'thad de ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin na gzhan gyi dngos po ga la yod /
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid mi 'thad de ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin na gzhan gyi dngos po ga la yod /
translated: But the intrinsic reality of self is untenable. If intrinsic reality does not exist, how could the reality of another exist?

original: de ltar gzhan gyi dngos po med na de'i gnyen po bdag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi dngos po med na de'i gnyen po bdag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if the reality of another does not exist, its antidote, the intrinsic reality of self, is not tenable.

original: gzhan yang ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan la gzhan gyi dngos po yang gzhan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan la gzhan gyi dngos po yang gzhan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, intrinsic reality is not one thing and the reality of another is not another.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gzhan gyi dngos po yin zhes brjod ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gzhan gyi dngos po yin zhes brjod ces bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The entityness of another thing is called another thing.”

original: gzhan gyi dngos po'i rang gi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni dngos po gzhan la ltos nas gzhan gyi dngos por brjod pa yin na ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po yang ma grub pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po'i rang gi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni dngos po gzhan la ltos nas gzhan gyi dngos por brjod pa yin na ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po yang ma grub pas /
translated: If the entityness of the entity of another thing is called another thing in reliance on another thing, then since it has no entityness, another thing is not established.

original: de'i phyir rang las gzhan pa'i brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang las gzhan pa'i brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin la /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason, “because it is the cause of the distinction of the expression and the expressed that are different from itself,” is not established, and it is also contradictory.

original: dpe yang med de ring po dang thung ngu dag ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dpe yang med de ring po dang thung ngu dag ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: And there is no example because long and short are not established.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dngos po zhes brjod pa yin pas de'i phyir gal te gzhan gyi dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid med pa de kho na yin na gang gis de yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dngos po zhes brjod pa yin pas de'i phyir gal te gzhan gyi dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid med pa de kho na yin na gang gis de yod par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, since the intrinsic reality of another is called “the intrinsic reality of another,” if that intrinsic reality of another is nonexistent, how could it exist?

original: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan la gzhan gyi dngos po yang gzhan zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan la gzhan gyi dngos po yang gzhan zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is untenable to say, “Intrinsic reality is one thing and the intrinsic reality of another is something else.”

original: de ltar na gnyen po nyid med de gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyen po nyid med de gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, there is no antidote because they are identical.

original: gnyen po med na ci ltar gnyen po la brten nas ngo bo nyid 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyen po med na ci ltar gnyen po la brten nas ngo bo nyid 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no antidote, how could the establishment of intrinsic reality depend on an antidote?

original: des na gtan tshigs dang dpe ma grub po //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs dang dpe ma grub po //
translated: Therefore, the reason and example are not established.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: mig la sogs pa'i dngos po dag don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dngos po dag don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa yin te /
translated: Things such as the eyes exist ultimately because they have intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir dper na me'i tsha ba nyid bzhin no zhes bya @319a * //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir dper na me'i tsha ba nyid bzhin no zhes bya @319a * //
translated: For example, this is like the heat of fire.

original: ba ni de ltar bdag ge dngos po dang / gzhan gyi dngos po ma grub pa dang / 'dir pha rol po dag na re ngo bo nyid med pas gzhan gyi dngos po yang med la /
analyzed: ba ni de ltar bdag ge dngos po dang / gzhan gyi dngos po ma grub pa dang / 'dir pha rol po dag na re ngo bo nyid med pas gzhan gyi dngos po yang med la /
translated: The meaning of the passage is as follows: Since neither one’s own nor another’s entity is established, here the opponent says, “Since there is no entityness, there is also no other entity.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po med pas ngo bo nyid med pa yang bden mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po med pas ngo bo nyid med pa yang bden mod kyi /
translated: Since there is no other entity, there is also no entityness.”🔽  However, the opponent’s words are intended to prove that entities exist, for they say, “It is true that there is no entityness and no other entity.

original: 'on kyang re zhig yod pa nyid gang yin pa'i dngos po de nyid yod pas des na dngos po yod do zhes brjod par nus so zhes dngos po yod par bsgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang re zhig yod pa nyid gang yin pa'i dngos po de nyid yod pas des na dngos po yod do zhes brjod par nus so zhes dngos po yod par bsgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: Nevertheless, since the entity that is existence itself exists, one can say that entities exist.”

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These words are to be applied in order to the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na me'i tsha ba nyid ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na me'i tsha ba nyid ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as the heat of fire is the ultimate entity because it is an entity,

original: mig la sogs pa'i dngos po dag kyang dngos po yin pa'i phyir don dam pa ba'i ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dngos po dag kyang dngos po yin pa'i phyir don dam pa ba'i ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Because things such as eyes are things, they are ultimately existent, having intrinsic reality.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to such statements, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: me dang bud shing brtag pa'i skabs su don dam par me'u tsha ba nyid bsal ba'i phyir dang / don dam par yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / skye ba bkag pa'i phyir me ma grub pas dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon dang /
analyzed: me dang bud shing brtag pa'i skabs su don dam par me'u tsha ba nyid bsal ba'i phyir dang / don dam par yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / skye ba bkag pa'i phyir me ma grub pas dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon dang /
translated: Since fire is not established ultimately because heat is eliminated ultimately, because existence ultimately is refuted, and because arising is refuted, there is the fault that the exemplification of the example is not established.

original: dpe bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dpe bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: There is the fault that the example does not possess the qualities to be proven.

original: don dam par me ma grub pas dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon dang / kun rdzob tu yang mig la sogs pa yul gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin nus par bsgrub par bya ba chos de me'i dpe la med pas dpe bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pa'i skyon yod pas dngos po yod par ma grub po /
analyzed: don dam par me ma grub pas dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon dang / kun rdzob tu yang mig la sogs pa yul gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin nus par bsgrub par bya ba chos de me'i dpe la med pas dpe bsgrub par bya ba chos dang mi ldan pa'i skyon yod pas dngos po yod par ma grub po /
translated: Since fire is not ultimately established, there is the fault that the exemplification of the example is not established. Since the object to be established, the ability of the eye and so on to apprehend objects such as form and so on, does not exist in the example of fire, there is the fault that the example does not possess the object to be established. Therefore things do not exist.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs dngos po ga la yod //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs dngos po ga la yod //
translated: Apart from identity and difference, how could there be things?🔽The meaning of the words “Things do not exist” is shown by this.

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya bas ni snga ma brnan pa ston te /🔽gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ngo bo nyid dam gzhan gyi dngos po zhig yin grang ste /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya bas ni snga ma brnan pa ston te / gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ngo bo nyid dam gzhan gyi dngos po zhig yin grang ste /
translated: This restates the previous point.🔽If things existed, they would be either identity or difference.

original: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag yod na dngos po 'grub par 'gyur na gang gi tshe ngo bo nyid kyang med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag yod na dngos po 'grub par 'gyur na gang gi tshe ngo bo nyid kyang med la /
translated: Therefore, if identity and difference existed, things would be established. But when identity does not exist,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yang med pa de'i tshe ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag ma gtogs pa'i dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa rang dang gzhan du ma gyur pa 'ba' zhig ba de yod par ga la 'gyur bas pha rol po'i gtan
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yang med pa de'i tshe ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag ma gtogs pa'i dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa rang dang gzhan du ma gyur pa 'ba' zhig ba de yod par ga la 'gyur bas pha rol po'i gtan
translated: But if the entity of another does not exist, then how could an inexpressible entity that is neither itself nor another exist?

original: tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: To explain that point in detail, why is it so?

original: rgyu dang rkyen @319b rnams la brten te byung ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid ni ngo bo nyid ces bya /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen @319b rnams la brten te byung ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid ni ngo bo nyid ces bya /
translated: The nature of things that arise in dependence on causes and conditions is called “intrinsic reality.”

original: ngo bo nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po rgyu la sogs pa dag ni gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po rgyu la sogs pa dag ni gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya ste /
translated: The entity of things that is different from intrinsic reality, such as causes, is called “extrinsic reality.”

original: de la / ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / yod na dngos po 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: de la / ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / yod na dngos po 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: If intrinsic reality and extrinsic reality exist, then things would be established.

original: de dag kyang ci ltar med pa de ltar sngar spyi dang khyad par bsal bas de bsal zin pas de'i phyir dngos po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de dag kyang ci ltar med pa de ltar sngar spyi dang khyad par bsal bas de bsal zin pas de'i phyir dngos po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Moreover, since the general and specific refutations have already been presented above, the meaning of the reason “because it is an entity” is not established.

original: da ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid du bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid du bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, the emptiness of non-entity will be explained.

original: de'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
translated: In order to present the opponent’s position here, it is said:🔽Those who view intrinsic reality, extrinsic reality,

original: gang dag dngos nyid gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba //🔽de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
analyzed: gang dag dngos nyid gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba // de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
translated: Entity, and non-entity🔽Do not see the truth

original: de nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: In the Buddha’s teaching.

original: zhes khyod kyis 'og nas smras pa de la de ltar khyod /
analyzed: zhes khyod kyis 'og nas smras pa de la de ltar khyod /
translated: You will say this below, but here you say:🔽Apart from intrinsic reality and extrinsic reality,

original: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs dngos po ga la yod //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs dngos po ga la yod //
translated: How can there be any entity?

original: ces smras pa 'dis gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ces smras pa 'dis gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is said to be undermined.

original: khyed dbu ma pas 'og nas ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa nyid du lta ba 'gog pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa de skad smras pa 'byung ba de la /🔽da ltar khyod ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag ma gtogs pa'i dngos po ga la yod ces dngos po med pa nyid yod par smra ba 'dis gnod par 'gyur bas de'i phyir dngos po med pa yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pas 'og nas ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa nyid du lta ba 'gog pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa de skad smras pa 'byung ba de la / da ltar khyod ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag ma gtogs pa'i dngos po ga la yod ces dngos po med pa nyid yod par smra ba 'dis gnod par 'gyur bas de'i phyir dngos po med pa yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: You Followers of the Middle Way will say later in your root text, “How can an entity exist that is neither an essence nor a different thing?”🔽You will say this in the context of refuting the view that entities exist. But now, when you say that entities do not exist apart from essences and different things, you are undermining your own assertion that entities exist. Therefore, you are saying that entities exist but also that they do not exist.

original: yang na dngos po ni yod pa nyid de mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa'i phyir dper na bya rog yod pas 'ug pa yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dngos po med pa nyid yod par bsgrub pa'i tshad ma gzhan yin te /
analyzed: yang na dngos po ni yod pa nyid de mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa'i phyir dper na bya rog yod pas 'ug pa yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dngos po med pa nyid yod par bsgrub pa'i tshad ma gzhan yin te /
translated: Or, you may say, “Entities do exist because their opposites exist. For example, because crows exist, there are also hawks.” This is another argument of the counterparts that attempts to prove the existence of nonentities.

original: de dag ni chos can dang bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na bya rog ni 'ug pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir bya rog yod pas 'ug pa yod pa de bzhin du dngos po med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang dngos po yin pas dngos po yod pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yang med do zhes
analyzed: dper na bya rog ni 'ug pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir bya rog yod pas 'ug pa yod pa de bzhin du dngos po med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang dngos po yin pas dngos po yod pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yang med do zhes
translated: Just as the existence of an owl is established by the existence of a crow, since a crow is the opposite of an owl, so too, since an entity is the opposite of a nonentity, the existence of an entity establishes the nonexistence of a nonentity.

original: zer ro // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: zer ro // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: don dam par skye ba bkag pas /
analyzed: don dam par skye ba bkag pas /
translated: Since arising is refuted ultimately,

original: gal te dngos po ma grub na //
analyzed: gal te dngos po ma grub na //
translated: if an entity is not established,

original: dngos med 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos med 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: a nonentity is not established.

original: dngos po bkag pas dngos po med pa zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya @320a * //🔽ba smras te /
analyzed: dngos po bkag pas dngos po med pa zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya @320a * //🔽ba smras te /
translated: Because a nonentity is said to be an entity that is refuted.

original: dngos po yod par gyur na ni de bkag pas dngos po med pa zhes brjod pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yang 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: dngos po yod par gyur na ni de bkag pas dngos po med pa zhes brjod pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yang 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If things existed, then by negating them, non-things would be expressed, and thus non-things would be established.

original: dngos po nyid 'ga' yang rab tu ma grub na /
analyzed: dngos po nyid 'ga' yang rab tu ma grub na /
translated: But since things are not established at all,

original: dngos po med par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dngos po med par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: non-things are not established.🔽Since the Madhyamaka does not even express non-things, there is no fault in our assertion, and the meaning of the reason is not unestablished.

original: dngos po med pa yang mi brjod pas khas blangs pa la gnod pa yang med la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa dngos po med par yang mi brjod pas 'og nas /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang mi brjod pas khas blangs pa la gnod pa yang med la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa dngos po med par yang mi brjod pas 'og nas /
translated: Since the Madhyamaka does not even express non-things, later it says:🔽Those who view intrinsic reality, extrinsic reality,

original: gang dag dngos nyid gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba //🔽de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
analyzed: gang dag dngos nyid gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba // de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
translated: Reality, and unreality,🔽Do not see

original: de nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: The reality of the Buddha’s teaching.🔽Since the Madhyamaka does not even express non-things, there is no fault in our assertion.

original: zhes khas blangs pa la gnod pa yang med la 'dir /
analyzed: zhes khas blangs pa la gnod pa yang med la 'dir /
translated: Here it says:🔽Apart from intrinsic reality and extrinsic reality,

original: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs dngos po ga la yod //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs dngos po ga la yod //
translated: How could things exist?

original: ces smras pas dngos po ma grub pas dngos po med pa yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin no //🔽yang na / dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: ces smras pas dngos po ma grub pas dngos po med pa yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin no // yang na / dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
translated: Thus, since the thing does not exist, the nonthing also does not exist. The meaning of the reason that proves this is not unestablished.🔽Again,🔽People say that the transformation of a thing

original: dngos med yin par skye bo smra //
analyzed: dngos med yin par skye bo smra //
translated: Is a nonthing.

original: zhes bya bas ni /🔽gal te dngos po ma grub na //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni / gal te dngos po ma grub na //
translated: This is stated🔽If a thing does not exist,

original: dngos med 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos med 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: A nonthing does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi smon pa bstan to /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi smon pa bstan to /
translated: This teaches the statement of the reason.

original: 'di ltar dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa yin no zhes skye bo dag smra na dngos po de yang med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa yin no zhes skye bo dag smra na dngos po de yang med de /
translated: In this way, if people say that the transformation of a thing is a nonthing, then that thing does not exist.

original: de med na dngos po med pa de gang gi yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na dngos po med pa de gang gi yin par 'gyur /
translated: If that does not exist, then what would a nonthing be?

original: de ltar dngos po med pa med na khyod kyi de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med pa med na khyod kyi de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs /
translated: Thus, if a nonthing does not exist, how could a thing,

original: dngos po 'thad par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po 'thad par ga la 'gyur //
translated: Which is its opposite, be tenable?

original: dngos po med na yang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dngos po med pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med na yang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dngos po med pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If things do not exist, then the nonexistence that is the opposite of things is not tenable.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i phyir de yang med pas gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i phyir de yang med pas gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, “Because that also does not exist due to the nonexistence of things, the reason is not uncommon or else it contradicts the meaning.”

original: dpe yang med de don dam par bya rog dang 'ug pa dag yod pa nyid du ma grags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /🔽dngos po med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa de yang med pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de don dam par sgrub na ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas ma grub ste /
analyzed: dpe yang med de don dam par bya rog dang 'ug pa dag yod pa nyid du ma grags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te / dngos po med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa de yang med pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de don dam par sgrub na ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas ma grub ste /
translated: There is also no example because crows and owls are not renowned in the ultimate to exist.

original: dngos po la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs med la dngos po med pa yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs med la dngos po med pa yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things do not exist, that nonexistence also does not exist. If the opponent’s reason, “because the discordant class exists,” is established in the ultimate, then it is not uncommon because there is no discordant class in things and there is also no discordant class in nonthings.

original: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid de @320b kun rdzob tu mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par de yod par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid de @320b kun rdzob tu mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par de yod par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you establish it conventionally, then the meaning is contradictory, because a reason that has a discordant factor conventionally does not establish that it exists ultimately.

original: pha rol po dag gi dpe bya rog yod pas 'ug pa yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi dpe bya rog yod pas 'ug pa yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang ma grub ste /
translated: The opponent’s example, “Like the existence of an owl because of the existence of a crow,” is also not established,

original: don dam par de dag yod pa nyid du ma grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par de dag yod pa nyid du ma grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those are not renowned to exist ultimately.

original: de ltar re zhig de dag gis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bdag gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid kyi khyad par dang ldan pa grub par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig de dag gis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bdag gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid kyi khyad par dang ldan pa grub par bstan to //
translated: Thus, in this way, they have taught the establishment of dependent arising as it is taught in the Perfection of Wisdom, endowed with the features of the emptiness of intrinsic reality, the emptiness of extrinsic reality, the emptiness of both, and the emptiness of ultimate reality.

original: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re 'di la de kho na mthong bas thar par 'gyur ro zhes bya zhing de kho na zhes bya ba yang de'i dngos po ni de kho na ste /
analyzed: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re 'di la de kho na mthong bas thar par 'gyur ro zhes bya zhing de kho na zhes bya ba yang de'i dngos po ni de kho na ste /
translated: Here, the opponent might say, “One is liberated by seeing reality, and that which is called ‘reality’ is the suchness of that.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de la gal te dngos po'i ngo bo nyid med pa yin na de ltar na khyod la /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // de la gal te dngos po'i ngo bo nyid med pa yin na de ltar na khyod la /
translated: That is the reality of things.

original: de kho na mthong ba mi 'thad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba mi 'thad par 'gyur la /
translated: If things do not have intrinsic reality, then it is untenable that you see reality.

original: de kho na mthong ba med na thar pa 'thad par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba med na thar pa 'thad par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: And if you do not see reality, how could liberation be tenable?🔽Therefore the view that things are said to be essenceless is not good.”

original: de lta bas na dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya bar lta ba de ni bzang po ma yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya bar lta ba de ni bzang po ma yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: Here the author of the commentary himself gives the following response to this former opponent.

original: kho bo cag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i nyi ma shar bas snang bar gyur ba'i dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin du mthong bas de'i phyir kho bo cag nyid la de kho na mthong ba yod
analyzed: kho bo cag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i nyi ma shar bas snang bar gyur ba'i dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin du mthong bas de'i phyir kho bo cag nyid la de kho na mthong ba yod
translated: Since we see the lack of entityness of things that are illuminated by the rising sun of dependent origination just as it is, we alone see reality.

original: pas / kho bo cag kho na la thar pa yang 'thad kyis gang zag de ltar ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa nyid du lta ba de dag ni /
analyzed: pas / kho bo cag kho na la thar pa yang 'thad kyis gang zag de ltar ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa nyid du lta ba de dag ni /
translated: Therefore liberation is tenable only for us, but for those who view the person as having intrinsic character, as having the nature of being other, as having the nature of being a thing or nonthing,🔽liberation is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa mchog tu za ba pa la de kho na mthong ba ma yin pas de dag la thar pa yang mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa mchog tu za ba pa la de kho na mthong ba ma yin pas de dag la thar pa yang mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain that since they do not see reality, they do not see the Buddha’s teaching as supreme, and therefore liberation is not tenable for them, the text says:

original: gang gi phyir de ltar de nye bar btags na ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa ma grub pa de'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa'i sras gang dag chags pa med pa'i blo yod pa shes bya'i rgya mtsho chen po mtha' dag la blo gos  kyi 'od zer thogs ba med pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar de nye bar btags na ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa ma grub pa de'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa'i sras gang dag chags pa med pa'i blo yod pa shes bya'i rgya mtsho chen po mtha' dag la blo gos  kyi 'od zer thogs ba med pa dang ldan pa /
translated: Because in this way, intrinsic reality, extrinsic reality, existence, and nonexistence are not established when imputed in this way, therefore the heirs of the sugatas, who have minds free from attachment, who have unimpeded rays of light of mind with regard to the entire great ocean of objects of knowledge,

original: sa thams cad la phan gdags pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul spyad dka' ba spyod par byed pa /
analyzed: sa thams cad la phan gdags pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul spyad dka' ba spyod par byed pa /
translated: who practice the difficult conduct of the way of the tathāgatas in order to benefit all sentient beings,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi shing rta la spyod pa de dag ni ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang / @321a * //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi shing rta la spyod pa de dag ni ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang / @321a * //
translated: who ride the chariot of nonconceptual wisdom, do not see intrinsic reality, extrinsic reality, existence,

original: dngos po med par mi lta'o //
analyzed: dngos po med par mi lta'o //
translated: and nonexistence.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems can bsod nams chung ngu tshe rabs gzhan dag tu yang chos zab cing rgya che ba la bzod pa ma skyes pa ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med par smra ba la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis blo nyams par gyur pa /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems can bsod nams chung ngu tshe rabs gzhan dag tu yang chos zab cing rgya che ba la bzod pa ma skyes pa ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med par smra ba la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis blo nyams par gyur pa /
translated: Other sentient beings, who have little merit and have not generated patience for the profound and extensive Dharma even in other lifetimes, have minds impaired by the latent potentialities of adherence to the views of reificationism, nihilism, intrinsic reality, extrinsic reality, reality, and unreality.🔽Those who view intrinsic reality, extrinsic reality,

original: gang dag dngos nyid gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba //🔽de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
analyzed: gang dag dngos nyid gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba // de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
translated: Reality, and unreality🔽Do not see the truth

original: de nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: In the teaching of the Buddha.

original: ngo bo nyid la sogs par lta ba ni rigs pa dang lung dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la sogs par lta ba ni rigs pa dang lung dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The view of intrinsic reality, etc., is inconsistent with reasoning and scripture.

original: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: 'di ltar / de la ci ltar rigs pa dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa de ltar ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de la ci ltar rigs pa dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa de ltar ni bstan zin to //
translated: It has been demonstrated how it is inconsistent with reasoning.

original: ci ltar lung dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa de ltar 'dir bshad do //
analyzed: ci ltar lung dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa de ltar 'dir bshad do //
translated: It is explained here how it contradicts scripture.🔽The Lord has taught

original: bcom ldan dngos dang dngos med pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan dngos dang dngos med pa //
translated: both existence and nonexistence

original: ston pas k'a ty'a ya na yi //🔽gdams dag las ni yod pa dang // med pa gnyi ga'ang dgag pa mdzad //
analyzed: ston pas k'a ty'a ya na yi // gdams dag las ni yod pa dang // med pa gnyi ga'ang dgag pa mdzad //
translated: in the instructions to Katyayana🔽in the sutra called “The Instructions to Katyayana,” the Lord, who is skilled in ultimate reality, has taught both existence and nonexistence.🔽In the sutra called “The Instructions to Katyayana,” the Lord, who is skilled in ultimate reality, has taught both existence and nonexistence.

original: gad gi phyir bcom ldan 'das don dam pa de kho na la mkhas pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa rab tu ston pas /
analyzed: gad gi phyir bcom ldan 'das don dam pa de kho na la mkhas pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa rab tu ston pas /
translated: In the sutra called “The Instructions to Katyayana,” the Lord, who is skilled in ultimate reality, has taught both existence and nonexistence.🔽In the sutra called “The Instructions to Katyayana,” the Lord, who is skilled in ultimate reality, has taught both existence and nonexistence.🔽In the sutra called “The Instructions to Katyayana,” the Lord, who is skilled in ultimate reality, has taught both existence and nonexistence.🔽In the sutra called “The Instructions to Katyayana,” the Lord, who is skilled in ultimate reality, has taught both existence and nonexistence.🔽In the sutra called “The Instructions to Katyayana,” the Lord, who is skilled in ultimate reality, has taught both existence and nonexistence.🔽In the sutra called “The Instructions to Katyayana,” the Lord, who is skilled in ultimate reality, has taught both existence and nonexistence.🔽In the sutra called “The Instructions to Katyayana,” the Lord, who is skilled in ultimate reality, has taught both existence and nonexistence.🔽In the sutra called “The Instructions to Katyayana,” the Lord, who is skilled in ultimate reality, has taught both existence and nonexistence.🔽In the sutra called “The Instructions to Katyayana,” the Lord, who is skilled in ultimate reality, has taught both existence and nonexistence.🔽In the sutra called “The Instructions to Katyayana,” the Lord, who is skilled in ultimate reality, has taught both existence and nonexistence.🔽In the sutra called “The Instructions to Katyayana,” the Lord, who is skilled in ultimate reality, has taught both existence and nonexistence.🔽In the sutra called “The Instructions to Katyayana,” the Lord, who is skilled in ultimate reality, has taught both existence and nonexistence.🔽In the sutra called “The Instructions to Katyayana,” the Lord, who is skilled in ultimate reality, has taught both existence and nonexistence.

original: k'a ty'a ya na'i gdams ngag ces bya ba'i mdo las /🔽k'a ty'a ya na 'jig rten 'di ni gnyis la gnas te phal cher yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du mdo gzhan dag las kyang kun dga' bo yod ces bya ba ni rtag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: k'a ty'a ya na'i gdams ngag ces bya ba'i mdo las /🔽k'a ty'a ya na 'jig rten 'di ni gnyis la gnas te phal cher yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du mdo gzhan dag las kyang kun dga' bo yod ces bya ba ni rtag par 'gyur la /
translated: In the sutra called “The Instructions to Katyayana,” the Lord, who is skilled

original: med ces bya ba ni chad par 'gyur ro zhes kyang gsungs pas yod pa zhes bya ba dang / med pa zhes bya ba gnyi ga yang dgag pa mdzad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: med ces bya ba ni chad par 'gyur ro zhes kyang gsungs pas yod pa zhes bya ba dang / med pa zhes bya ba gnyi ga yang dgag pa mdzad pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since it is also said, “To say ‘it does not exist’ is nihilism,” both “it exists” and “it does not exist” are negated.

original: gang dag dngos po rnams la yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du rjes su lta ba de dag gis de kho na mi mthong bas de dag nyid la thar pa yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang dag dngos po rnams la yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du rjes su lta ba de dag gis de kho na mi mthong bas de dag nyid la thar pa yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, since those who view things as existent or nonexistent do not see reality, liberation is not tenable for them.

original: kho bo cag yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa med par tha snyad byed pa dag la ni thar pa mi 'thad pa med do //
analyzed: kho bo cag yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa med par tha snyad byed pa dag la ni thar pa mi 'thad pa med do //
translated: But for us, who make assertions without adhering to existence or nonexistence, liberation is not untenable.

original: yang na kha cig la blo 'di lta bu 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang na kha cig la blo 'di lta bu 'byung ste /
translated: Or, the following idea occurs to someone:🔽“If ultimately things do not exist, then what is seen by those who see reality is called seeing reality?”

original: gal te don dam par dngos po rnams med pa yin na 'o na gang dag gi de kho na mthong ba la de kho na mthong ba zhes bya snyam na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa gong ma gnyis kyi don rnam pa gzhan
analyzed: gal te don dam par dngos po rnams med pa yin na 'o na gang dag gi de kho na mthong ba la de kho na mthong ba zhes bya snyam na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa gong ma gnyis kyi don rnam pa gzhan
translated: The meaning of the two previous verses is

original: du rnam par bshad pa ston te /
analyzed: du rnam par bshad pa ston te /
translated: This verse teaches the explanation.

original: bstan bcos 'di las don dam par dngos po thams cad skye ba med par bstan @321b pas de'i phyir gang zag las dang po pa kha cig la blo 'di lta bu 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di las don dam par dngos po thams cad skye ba med par bstan @321b pas de'i phyir gang zag las dang po pa kha cig la blo 'di lta bu 'byung ste /
translated: Since this treatise teaches that ultimately all things are non-arisen, some beginning practitioners will have the following thought:

original: gal te don dam par dngos po rnams med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par dngos po rnams med pa yin na /
translated: If ultimately things do not exist,

original: 'o na gang dag gi de kho na mthong ba la de kho na mthong ba zhes bya /
analyzed: 'o na gang dag gi de kho na mthong ba la de kho na mthong ba zhes bya /
translated: then what is seen by those who see reality is not the reality of things.🔽It is not tenable that the reality of things that do not exist, like the horns of a rabbit, is seen.

original: 'di ltar ri bong gi rva la sogs pa lta bu med pa dag gi de kho na mthong bar ni mi rung ngo snyam du sems pa de dag gi the tshom bcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar ri bong gi rva la sogs pa lta bu med pa dag gi de kho na mthong bar ni mi rung ngo snyam du sems pa de dag gi the tshom bcad pa'i phyir /
translated: To eliminate the doubts of those who think in this way, the following verse is stated.

original: thub pa chen po'i sras rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis mi shes pa'i mun pa bsal ba gang dag dngos po rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa dag la shes rab kyis yongs su rtog
analyzed: thub pa chen po'i sras rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis mi shes pa'i mun pa bsal ba gang dag dngos po rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa dag la shes rab kyis yongs su rtog
translated: The sons of the Great Sage, who are the light rays of the sun of the knowledge of dependent origination, dispel the darkness of ignorance. Those who use wisdom to fully investigate things that arise from causes and conditions and are parts of conventional reality will not have doubts about the reality of things.

original: pa ni ngo bo nyid kyang med /
analyzed: pa ni ngo bo nyid kyang med /
translated: Nor is it that it is not nonexistent.🔽

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yang med /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yang med /
translated: Nor is there any other entity.🔽  Nor is there any entity or nonentity.

original: dngos po yang med dngos po med pa yang med do zhes dgag pa'i tshul gyis mthong ba de dag ni de kho na mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po yang med dngos po med pa yang med do zhes dgag pa'i tshul gyis mthong ba de dag ni de kho na mthong ba yin te /
translated: Those who see in this way through the mode of negation see reality.

original: de kho na mthong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is the cause of seeing reality.

original: gang gi phyir ngo bo nyid la sogs pa dag dgag pa'i tshul ni de kho na mthong ba skye ba de'i phyir ngo bo nyid la sogs pa dag dgag pa'i tshul ni de kho na mthong ba'i rgyu yin no zhes nye bar gdags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ngo bo nyid la sogs pa dag dgag pa'i tshul ni de kho na mthong ba skye ba de'i phyir ngo bo nyid la sogs pa dag dgag pa'i tshul ni de kho na mthong ba'i rgyu yin no zhes nye bar gdags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mode of negation of intrinsic reality and so on is the cause of seeing reality, it is designated as seeing reality.

original: de las bzlog pa'i sems can dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la sogs par lta bas 'jigs shing skrag par gyur pa dag de kho na mthong ba ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i sems can dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la sogs par lta bas 'jigs shing skrag par gyur pa dag de kho na mthong ba ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that sentient beings who are frightened and terrified by the view of the absence of intrinsic reality and so on are not seeing reality,🔽  the treatise states:

original: gzhan stong pa nyid du lta bas 'jigs shing skrag par gyur pa /
analyzed: gzhan stong pa nyid du lta bas 'jigs shing skrag par gyur pa /
translated: Frightened by the view of emptiness,

original: nam mkha' 'jigs shing skrag pa thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas kyi gnas su gyur pa'i nam mkha' sel bar 'dod pa lta bu ngo bo nyid la sogs par lta ba la gnas pa /🔽gang dag dngos nyid gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba /
analyzed: nam mkha' 'jigs shing skrag pa thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas kyi gnas su gyur pa'i nam mkha' sel bar 'dod pa lta bu ngo bo nyid la sogs par lta ba la gnas pa / gang dag dngos nyid gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba /
translated: It is like the desire to eliminate space, which is the abode of material things that are obstructive and tangible, and which is itself nonobstructive and intangible.🔽Those who view entities, nonentities,🔽intrinsic reality, extrinsic reality,

original: de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
translated: reality,

original: de nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: and unreality do not see🔽the reality of the Buddha’s teaching.

original: de dag mthong ba ni log pa'i shes pas mthong ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dag mthong ba ni log pa'i shes pas mthong ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: They see with false knowledge, he thinks.

original: ngo bo nyid la sogs pa de dag mthong ba ni log pa'i shes pas mthong ba yin pa'i phyir de kho na mthong ba ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la sogs pa de dag mthong ba ni log pa'i shes pas mthong ba yin pa'i phyir de kho na mthong ba ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Those who see intrinsic reality and so on see with false knowledge, and therefore they do not see reality, he thinks.

original: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid la sogs par lta ba ni lung dang 'gal ba nyid yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid la sogs par lta ba ni lung dang 'gal ba nyid yin pas /
translated: Therefore, since the views of intrinsic reality and so on contradict the scriptures,

original: ngo bo nyid la sogs par mi lta ba ni de kho na mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar khong du chud par bya ba nyid du rigs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la sogs par mi lta ba ni de kho na mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar khong du chud par bya ba nyid du rigs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement “One should understand that not seeing any entity, etc. is seeing reality” is taught as a principle for understanding that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: bcom ldan dngos dang dngos med pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan dngos dang dngos med pa //
translated: the Lord, the Teacher, in the advice

original: @322a * // ston pas k'a ty'a ya na yi //
analyzed: @322a * // ston pas k'a ty'a ya na yi //
translated: to Katyayana,

original: gdams ngag las ni yod pa dang // med pa gnyi ga'ang dgag pa mdzad //
analyzed: gdams ngag las ni yod pa dang // med pa gnyi ga'ang dgag pa mdzad //
translated: refuted both existence and nonexistence.

original: ngo bo nyid la sogs par mi lta ba ni de kho na mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar khong du chud par bya ba nyid du rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la sogs par mi lta ba ni de kho na mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar khong du chud par bya ba nyid du rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The statement “One should understand that not seeing any entity, etc. is seeing reality” is taught as a principle for understanding that.

original: gal te dngos po dang / dngos po med par mthong ba de kho na mthong ba yin na ni de kho na ma mthong ba 'ga' yang med par 'gyur bas de ni de kho na mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te dngos po dang / dngos po med par mthong ba de kho na mthong ba yin na ni de kho na ma mthong ba 'ga' yang med par 'gyur bas de ni de kho na mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: If seeing entity and nonentity were seeing reality, then there would be no one who did not see reality, but that is not so.

original: de lta bas na dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni de kho na yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni de kho na yin la /
translated: Therefore, the absence of intrinsic reality of entities is reality.

original: de mthong ba kho nas thar par 'gyur bas ngo bo nyid la sogs par mi lta ba ni de kho na mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar khong du chud par bya ba nyid du rigs te /
analyzed: de mthong ba kho nas thar par 'gyur bas ngo bo nyid la sogs par mi lta ba ni de kho na mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar khong du chud par bya ba nyid du rigs te /
translated: Since one is liberated merely by seeing that, it is reasonable to understand that not seeing in terms of essence and so on is seeing reality.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: Ācārya Āryadeva also says:

original: srid pa'i sa bon rnam shes to //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon rnam shes to //
translated: Consciousness is the seed of existence.

original: yul rnams de yi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: yul rnams de yi spyod yul lo //
translated: Objects are its sphere of activity.

original: yul la bdag med mthong na ni //
analyzed: yul la bdag med mthong na ni //
translated: When one sees the selflessness of objects,

original: srid pa'i sa bon 'gag par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon 'gag par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The seed of existence ceases.🔽Why is it reasonable to understand that not seeing in terms of essence and so on is seeing reality?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ngo bo nyid la sogs par mi lta ba ni de kho na mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar khong du chud par bya ba nyid du rigs so zhes bstan pa'i 'thad pa ston te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ngo bo nyid la sogs par mi lta ba ni de kho na mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar khong du chud par bya ba nyid du rigs so zhes bstan pa'i 'thad pa ston te /
translated: This is taught by the passage beginning with “Why is that?”

original: de ni de ltar nges pa kho nar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de ltar nges pa kho nar shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood with certainty that it is just as it is said.

original: gzhan du na /
analyzed: gzhan du na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: gal te rang bzhin yod nyid na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin yod nyid na /
translated: if essence existed,

original: de ni med nyid mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni med nyid mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not become nonexistent.

original: gal te dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid yin par gyur na /
translated: If things did exist inherently,

original: yod pa nyid rang bzhin gyis yod pa de ni phyis med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba zhig na dngos po rnams la ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa nyid dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: yod pa nyid rang bzhin gyis yod pa de ni phyis med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba zhig na dngos po rnams la ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa nyid dag kyang yod do //
translated: that existence would not become nonexistence later, but things do not exist prior to or subsequent to their existence.

original: de bas na dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid ma yin pas ngo bo nyid la sogs par mi lta ba ni de kho na mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar khong du chud par bya ba nyid du rigs so zhes bya bar sbyar
analyzed: de bas na dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid ma yin pas ngo bo nyid la sogs par mi lta ba ni de kho na mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar khong du chud par bya ba nyid du rigs so zhes bya bar sbyar
translated: Therefore, since things do not exist inherently, it is reasonable to conclude that seeing reality is not seeing things such as essence.

original: ro // 'dis ni dngos po'i chos gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid bstan to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ro // 'dis ni dngos po'i chos gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid bstan to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This shows that the property of the thing is the transformation of the thing.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'dis ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid la sogs pa med par bsgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'dis ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid la sogs pa med par bsgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: This first half of the verse shows that the property of the thing that is to be proven, the nonexistence of essence, etc., is the transformation of the thing, the reason.

original: ci'i phyir dngos po'i bdag nyid rang bzhin gyi yod pa nyid yin na gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dngos po'i bdag nyid rang bzhin gyi yod pa nyid yin na gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why, if the nature of things exists essentially, is it not maintained that it transforms into something else?

original: de'i phyir dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi //
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
translated: The transformation of the nature🔽of a thing into something else

original: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Is never tenable.

original: me'i tsha ba'i @322b mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin grang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: me'i tsha ba'i @322b mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin grang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Just as the nature of fire, heat, does not transform into cold.

original: 'di ltar gzhan du 'gyur ba'i gnyen po ni rang bzhin yin pas de'i phyir rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba rtag pa yin pa'i rigs na dngos po rnams la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba snang bas de'i phyir de dag la rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid mi 'thad
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan du 'gyur ba'i gnyen po ni rang bzhin yin pas de'i phyir rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba rtag pa yin pa'i rigs na dngos po rnams la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba snang bas de'i phyir de dag la rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid mi 'thad
translated: Since the antidote to transformation is nature, it is reasonable that nature is unchanging and permanent. But since it is seen that things transform, it is not tenable that they exist essentially.

original: do // rang bzhin ni me'i tsha ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin grang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin du gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: do // rang bzhin ni me'i tsha ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin grang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin du gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that it is not tenable that intrinsic reality transforms into something else, just as the intrinsic reality of fire, which is the characteristic of heat, does not become cold.

original: de'i phyir de ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin te /
translated: Therefore this is a statement of an example of dissimilar reason.

original: dper na rtag pa la byas pa nyid yod pas mi rigs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper na rtag pa la byas pa nyid yod pas mi rigs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For example, it is illogical that permanence exists in a product.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma shos de ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid la sogs pa med par sgrub pa'i chos mi mthun pa'i tshig yin te /🔽dper na sgra mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nam mkha' rtag ste /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma shos de ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid la sogs pa med par sgrub pa'i chos mi mthun pa'i tshig yin te / dper na sgra mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nam mkha' rtag ste /
translated: The second half of the verse is a statement of an example of dissimilar reason that proves that things do not have intrinsic reality and so on.

original: ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no ;
analyzed: ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no ;
translated: For example, it is like the dissimilar example of the syllogism “Sound is impermanent because it is a product,” where the example is “Space is permanent because it is not a product.”

original: /'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams la ci ltar rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: /'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams la ci ltar rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here the inference is as follows: Ultimately, internal things do not have the intrinsic reality that is conceived because they are produced.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir dper na chu'i reg pa me dang phrad pas tsha ba'i dngos por gyur pa la don dam pa pa'i tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir dper na chu'i reg pa me dang phrad pas tsha ba'i dngos por gyur pa la don dam pa pa'i tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum,

original: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the proving property, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na chu'i reg pa me dang phrad pas tsha ba'i dngos por gyur na ni gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na chu'i reg pa me dang phrad pas tsha ba'i dngos por gyur na ni gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, when the contact of water becomes the thing that is hot through meeting fire, it becomes something else.

original: de la don dam pa pa'i tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa nang gi dngos po yul 'dzin pa rnams dang / lus kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i nang gi dngos po sra ba la sogs pa rnams kyang gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag la yang yul 'dzin pa yin no zhe'am sra ba la sogs pa yin no zhes ci ltar rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin
analyzed: de la don dam pa pa'i tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa nang gi dngos po yul 'dzin pa rnams dang / lus kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i nang gi dngos po sra ba la sogs pa rnams kyang gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag la yang yul 'dzin pa yin no zhe'am sra ba la sogs pa yin no zhes ci ltar rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin
translated: because they transform into something else.

original: no // ci ste yang la la 'di snyam du sems te lung las /
analyzed: no // ci ste yang la la 'di snyam du sems te lung las /
translated: But if someone thinks, “Since a sutra declares,🔽This tree has various elements,🔽water also has heat, so your example is not established,”🔽then we reply, “Since a sutra declares,🔽This tree has various elements,

original: shing sdong po 'di la khams sna tshogs yod do zhes gsungs pas chu la yang tsha ba nyid yod pa'i phyir dpe med do snyam na zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag na re lung las /
analyzed: shing sdong po 'di la khams sna tshogs yod do zhes gsungs pas chu la yang tsha ba nyid yod pa'i phyir dpe med do snyam na zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag na re lung las /
translated: water also has heat, so your example is not established,”🔽then we reply, “Since a sutra declares,

original: shing sdong po 'di la 'byung ba @323a * //
analyzed: shing sdong po 'di la 'byung ba @323a * //
translated: This tree has various elements,

original: chen po thams cad kyi khams sna tshogs yod do zhes gsungs pas des na chu la yang me'i khams yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chen po thams cad kyi khams sna tshogs yod do zhes gsungs pas des na chu la yang me'i khams yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is said that the various elements exist in all great elements,

original: dbu ma pa'i dpe chu'i reg pa me dang phrad bas tsha ba'i dngos por gyur pa la don dam pa ba'i tsha ba'i dngos po nyid med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i dpe chu'i reg pa me dang phrad bas tsha ba'i dngos por gyur pa la don dam pa ba'i tsha ba'i dngos po nyid med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: then since the fire element exists in water, it is not correct to say that the example of the Madhyamikas is not valid, namely, that the heat of water when it comes in contact with fire is not ultimately heat.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /🔽de la rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis / de la rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'am /
translated: In response to such statements, the author of the commentary says:

original: sems la dbang thob pas rtsva dang phub ma dang lci ba la sogs pa gang dang gang dag la nor bu dang gser dang dngul la sogs par gyur cig ces byin gyis rlob par byed pa de dang de de bzhin du 'gyur ba shing la yang zhal gyis
analyzed: sems la dbang thob pas rtsva dang phub ma dang lci ba la sogs pa gang dang gang dag la nor bu dang gser dang dngul la sogs par gyur cig ces byin gyis rlob par byed pa de dang de de bzhin du 'gyur ba shing la yang zhal gyis
translated: One who possesses magical powers or who has attained control over the mind can transform grass, straw, excrement and so on into jewels, gold, silver and so forth by blessing them and saying, may they become jewels, gold, silver and so forth.🔽The Buddha said that the same is true of wood.

original: bzhes nas shing sdong po 'di la khams sna tshogs yod do zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bzhes nas shing sdong po 'di la khams sna tshogs yod do zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: and having accepted it, he said, “This tree has various elements.”

original: de ni shing sdong po la gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni shing sdong po la gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But the tree does not have the nature of something else.

original: dper na rnal 'byor pa rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: dper na rnal 'byor pa rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'am /
translated: For example, yogis who possess supernatural powers

original: 'phags pa sems la dbang thob pa rin chen lag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa dag gis rtsva la sogs pa la nor bu la sogs par byin gyis rlob par byed pa de de bzhin du 'gyur ba la nor bu la sogs
analyzed: 'phags pa sems la dbang thob pa rin chen lag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa dag gis rtsva la sogs pa la nor bu la sogs par byin gyis rlob par byed pa de de bzhin du 'gyur ba la nor bu la sogs
translated: or aryas who have attained mental control, such as Rattapala, who has attained concentration, transform grass and so on into jewels and so forth.

original: pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: But jewels and so on do not exist in grass and so on.

original: rdzu 'phrul lam sems kyi dbang gis de bzhin du 'gyur ba de bcom ldan 'das kyis zhal gyis bzhes nas /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul lam sems kyi dbang gis de bzhin du 'gyur ba de bcom ldan 'das kyis zhal gyis bzhes nas /
translated: The Bhagavan accepts that they transform in that way through the power of supernatural powers or the mind.

original: shing sdong po 'di la khams sna tshogs yod do zhes gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: shing sdong po 'di la khams sna tshogs yod do zhes gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: He said, “This tree has various elements.”

original: de la me la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pas kho bo'i dpe med pa ma yin no //🔽gal te khams sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni nus pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i don yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag na re khams sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nus pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i don yin pas des na chu
analyzed: de la me la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pas kho bo'i dpe med pa ma yin no // gal te khams sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni nus pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i don yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag na re khams sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nus pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i don yin pas des na chu
translated: Since the nature of fire, etc. does not exist, my example is not nonexistent.🔽If you say that the meaning of the term “variety of elements” is “variety of potencies,”

original: la sogs pa la yang me la sogs pa'i nus pa sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i dpe mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: la sogs pa la yang me la sogs pa'i nus pa sna tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i dpe mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: the Sāṃkhyas say that the term “variety of elements” means “variety of potencies,” and therefore water, etc. have the nature of a variety of potencies such as fire, etc., so the Madhyamaka example is not suitable.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says here:

original: gang zhig gang gi nus pa dang ldan pa de ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi nus pa dang ldan pa de ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that that which possesses the potency of something is the nature of that.

original: sa'i sra ba nyid dang gsher ba nyid dang tsha ba nyid dang g-yo ba nyid gyi  ngo bo nyid du @323b gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sa'i sra ba nyid dang gsher ba nyid dang tsha ba nyid dang g-yo ba nyid gyi  ngo bo nyid du @323b gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is untenable that earth becomes the essence of solidity, fluidity, heat, and motility.

original: gal te nus pa yod pa'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'dod na de lta na sa la sogs pa la yang khams thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yod par thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi rung ba'i phyir kho bo'i dpe grub po /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu bzhi pa /
analyzed: gal te nus pa yod pa'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'dod na de lta na sa la sogs pa la yang khams thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yod par thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi rung ba'i phyir kho bo'i dpe grub po / // / bam po lnga bcu bzhi pa /
translated: If you assert that it is their essence because they have the potential for those, then it follows that earth and so on would have the essence of all the elements, but that is untenable. Therefore my example is established.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas say that past and future things exist substantially

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag gis smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba dag /'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po dag rdzas su yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gzhung ston te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag gis smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba dag /'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po dag rdzas su yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gzhung ston te /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that past and future things exist substantially.

original: de'i phyir dngos po gnas skabs dang dus gzhan du gyur pa dag kyang yod pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po gnas skabs dang dus gzhan du gyur pa dag kyang yod pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore things that have changed to another state or time should be understood to exist.

original: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na da ltar bzhin pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na da ltar bzhin pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is the object of consciousness, like the present.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /🔽dper na da ltar gyi dngos po ni rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du shes par bya ba de bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po gnas skabs dang dus gzhan du gyur pa dag kyang rnam par shes pa'i yul yin
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na da ltar gyi dngos po ni rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du shes par bya ba de bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po gnas skabs dang dus gzhan du gyur pa dag kyang rnam par shes pa'i yul yin
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example are applied in order.

original: pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: For example, because present things are objects of consciousness, they are known to exist. In the same way, because past and future things that have changed to another state or time are objects of consciousness, they are known to exist.

original: des na gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gal te byung nas 'jig pa yin na ni gzhan la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: des na gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gal te byung nas 'jig pa yin na ni gzhan la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, if the meaning of the reason “because it changes to another” is that it arises and is destroyed, then the meaning of the reason is not established in relation to another.

original: ci ste gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na ni rang las gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po gnas skabs dang / dus gzhan du gyur pa dag kyang yod pa nyid yin pa des na sngar dbu ma pas don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams la ci ltar rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /🔽gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir dper na chu'i reg pa me dang phrad pas tsha ba'i dngos por gyur pa la don dam pa'i tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don gal
analyzed: ci ste gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na ni rang las gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po gnas skabs dang / dus gzhan du gyur pa dag kyang yod pa nyid yin pa des na sngar dbu ma pas don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams la ci ltar rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te / gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir dper na chu'i reg pa me dang phrad pas tsha ba'i dngos por gyur pa la don dam pa'i tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don gal
translated: But if it transforms, then the meaning of the reason would not be established with respect to itself.🔽Thus, since past and future things that exist in different states and times, the Madhyamaka’s earlier statement, “Ultimately, internal things do not have the nature that is conceived because they transform, like the nature of heat in water that comes into contact with fire,” is a reason whose meaning is not established with respect to itself.

original: te byung nas 'jig pa yin na ni gzhan la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: te byung nas 'jig pa yin na ni gzhan la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: If it is said that the meaning of that reason is “because it transforms,” then if it is said that it transforms after arising, the meaning of the reason would not be established with respect to itself.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag dngos po rnams byung nas 'jig par mi 'dod pas gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma @324a * //🔽grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag dngos po rnams byung nas 'jig par mi 'dod pas gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma @324a * // grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we do not assert that things arise and are destroyed, any reason is unestablished.

original: ci ste gtan tshigs de'i gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na ni rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: ci ste gtan tshigs de'i gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na ni rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: If you say that the reason is otherwise, then the meaning of the reason is not established for you.

original: khyed dbu ma pas dngos po rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba mi 'dod pas gtan tshigs rang la ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pas dngos po rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba mi 'dod pas gtan tshigs rang la ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because you Madhyamaka do not assert that things are otherwise, the reason is not established for you.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to such statements, the author of the commentary here says:

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical.

original: don dam par da ltar byung ba'i dngos po yang yod pa nyid du ma grub pas dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi phyir dang / gnas skabs dang dus gzhan du gyur pa yang med de skye ba bkag pa bzhin du de dag kyang bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: don dam par da ltar byung ba'i dngos po yang yod pa nyid du ma grub pas dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi phyir dang / gnas skabs dang dus gzhan du gyur pa yang med de skye ba bkag pa bzhin du de dag kyang bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Because ultimately even present things are not established as existing, the example is incomplete. And because they are like the refutation of arising, they do not transform into other states or times.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs po'i dngos po gnas skabs dang dus gzhan du gyur ba dga' ba'i zhig ma grub par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs po'i dngos po gnas skabs dang dus gzhan du gyur ba dga' ba'i zhig ma grub par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it not established that past and future things are essentially different due to their transformation into another state or time,

original: 'di ltar don dam par da ltar byung ba'i dngos po yang yod pa nyid du ma grub pas khyed kyi dpe da ltar bzhin pas zhes bya ba de med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gzhan yang bye brag tu smra ba dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i gnas skabs dang dus gzhan du gyur ba zhes bya ba dag kyang med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par da ltar byung ba'i dngos po yang yod pa nyid du ma grub pas khyed kyi dpe da ltar bzhin pas zhes bya ba de med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gzhan yang bye brag tu smra ba dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i gnas skabs dang dus gzhan du gyur ba zhes bya ba dag kyang med de /
translated: but also, ultimately, things that occur in the present do not exist. Therefore, since your example “like the present” does not exist, and also because the so-called transformation into another state or time imputed by Vaibhāṣikas does not exist,

original: skye ba bkag pa bzhin du de dag kyang bkag pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba bkag pa bzhin du de dag kyang bkag pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: because they are refuted like arising is refuted, that is illogical.🔽To demonstrate an inference that refutes the existence of past and future things, it says:

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams yod pa nyid ma yin par dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams kyang yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams yod pa nyid ma yin par dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams kyang yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Past and future things do not exist.

original: da ltar ma yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ltar ma yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because they do not exist in the present, like a sky flower.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
