translated: And these are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proof, and the example.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni de ltar ma yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams kyang da ltar ma yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni de ltar ma yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams kyang da ltar ma yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: For example, a sky flower does not exist because it does not exist in that way. In the same way, past and future things do not exist because they do not exist in the present.

original: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re dbu ma pa la 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams yod pa nyid du ma grub pa phyogs su byas pas phyogs kyi khyad par gyi gzhi ma grub pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa'i skyon yod do zhes zer na de'i lan du /
analyzed: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re dbu ma pa la 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams yod pa nyid du ma grub pa phyogs su byas pas phyogs kyi khyad par gyi gzhi ma grub pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa'i skyon yod do zhes zer na de'i lan du /
translated: Here, if the opponent says, “Since the Madhyamaka position is that past and future things are not established as existent, there is the fault that the basis of the distinction of the position is not established and the basis of the reason is not established,” the response to that is as follows.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'i @324b sgra'i yul la sgra gang gis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgra de la 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i yul du nye bar btags nas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'i @324b sgra'i yul la sgra gang gis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgra de la 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i yul du nye bar btags nas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya
translated: The term “past and future” is a referent of sound. The sound by which one understands “past and future” is designated as the referent of the terms “past and future.”

original: ba'i sgra yod pa de phyogs su byas pas phyogs kyi khyad par gyi gzhi ma grub pa dang gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa'i skyon med do zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i sgra yod pa de phyogs su byas pas phyogs kyi khyad par gyi gzhi ma grub pa dang gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa'i skyon med do zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The sound that exists as the term “past and future” is taken as the subject. Therefore there is no error of the subject of the thesis not being established or the reason not being established.

original: don dam par lta bar zhig gi tha snyad du yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams yod pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: don dam par lta bar zhig gi tha snyad du yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams yod pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: In the ultimate sense, the existence of past and future things is not established even conventionally.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is a contradiction that cannot be mistaken.

original: 'di ltar khyod na re dngos po'i gnas skabs dang dus gzhan du gyur pa dang kyang yod pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod na re dngos po'i gnas skabs dang dus gzhan du gyur pa dang kyang yod pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: You say that the state of an entity and its transformation into another state are known to exist.

original: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na da ltar bzhin pas zhes zer ba de la /🔽kho bos 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams kyang yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na da ltar bzhin pas zhes zer ba de la / kho bos 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams kyang yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Because they are objects of consciousness, they exist like the present.🔽We reply: Past and future things do not exist because they are not present, like a sky flower.

original: da ltar ma yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes smras pas 'gal pa 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar ma yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes smras pas 'gal pa 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since this is a fault that contradicts your own assertions, you have not eliminated error.

original: gzhan yang kho bo ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag mi sgrub pa'i phyir kho bos ni dngos po yod pa bkag pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang kho bo ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag mi sgrub pa'i phyir kho bos ni dngos po yod pa bkag pa la /
translated: Moreover, we do not establish things and nonthings, so we refute the existence of things.

original: khyod kyis ni dngos po med pa bkag pas kho bo'i 'dod pa'i don grub pas bye brag tu smra ba dag gi tshig de ni bzang po ma yin no //🔽grangs can dag las gang dag yod pa nyid zil gyis non pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: khyod kyis ni dngos po med pa bkag pas kho bo'i 'dod pa'i don grub pas bye brag tu smra ba dag gi tshig de ni bzang po ma yin no // grangs can dag las gang dag yod pa nyid zil gyis non pa'i phyir ram /
translated: You refute nonthings, but we establish our intended meaning, so the words of Vaibhasikas are not good.

original: bag la zha ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ba de dag la yang /
analyzed: bag la zha ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ba de dag la yang /
translated: Some say: The meaning of the reason is not established because it is outshone by existence or because it is latent.

original: bsgrub pa brgal zhing brtag par bya ste zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag rgyu 'bru la sogs pa la 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa nus pa'i tshul gyis snga na yod mod kyi /
analyzed: bsgrub pa brgal zhing brtag par bya ste zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag rgyu 'bru la sogs pa la 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa nus pa'i tshul gyis snga na yod mod kyi /
translated: The phrase “one should investigate and analyze the proof” refers to the Samkhyas’ claim that the effect, such as a sprout, exists prior to the cause, such as a seed, in the manner of a potential.

original: gsal ba'i tshul du mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: gsal ba'i tshul du mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: However, it is not observed in the manner of a manifest entity.

original: ha cing rid phyir nye phyir dang // dbang po nyams phyir yid med phyir //
analyzed: ha cing rid phyir nye phyir dang // dbang po nyams phyir yid med phyir //
translated: They say: Because it is very subtle, because it is close, because the sense faculties are impaired, because there is no mind,

original: cha phra phyir dang bsgribs phyir dang // zil gnon phyir dang 'dres phyir ro //
analyzed: cha phra phyir dang bsgribs phyir dang // zil gnon phyir dang 'dres phyir ro //
translated: because it is subtle, because it is obscured, because it is overwhelmed, and because it is mixed.

original: zhes zer bas 'dir yang dngos po 'gags pa dang ma skyes pa dag yod mod kyi /🔽dper na skar ma dang zla ba'i 'od la sogs pa nyi mas zil gyis non pa dag de ni yod kyang zil gyis non pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa dang / dper na du ba dang / rdul @325a * //
analyzed: zhes zer bas 'dir yang dngos po 'gags pa dang ma skyes pa dag yod mod kyi / dper na skar ma dang zla ba'i 'od la sogs pa nyi mas zil gyis non pa dag de ni yod kyang zil gyis non pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa dang / dper na du ba dang / rdul @325a * //
translated: In the same way, although things that have ceased and not yet arisen exist,🔽for example, the light of the stars and moon and so on are overwhelmed by the sun, they exist but are not observed because they are overwhelmed.

original: dang khug rna la sogs pa bar snang la yan pa dag de na yod kyang bag la zha ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa bzhin pas /
analyzed: dang khug rna la sogs pa bar snang la yan pa dag de na yod kyang bag la zha ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa bzhin pas /
translated: For example, smoke, dust, mist, and so on that exist in the sky are not observed because they are obscured.

original: sngar dbu ma pas don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams la ci ltar rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar dbu ma pas don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams la ci ltar rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Previously, the Madhyamikas said, “Ultimately, internal things do not have the nature of being perceived,🔽because they change into something else. For example, the sensation of water, when it comes into contact with fire, changes into the thing that is hot, but ultimately it does not have the nature of being hot.”

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir dper na chu'i reg pa me dang phrad pas tsha ba'i dngos por gyur pa la don dam pa pa'i tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir dper na chu'i reg pa me dang phrad pas tsha ba'i dngos por gyur pa la don dam pa pa'i tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub
translated: The meaning of the reason “because they change into something else” is not established.

original: ba nyid do zhes zer ba de dag la yang dbu ma pas gtan tshigs gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ci ltar ma grub pa nyid yin zhes brgal zhing brtag par bya ba ston to //
analyzed: ba nyid do zhes zer ba de dag la yang dbu ma pas gtan tshigs gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ci ltar ma grub pa nyid yin zhes brgal zhing brtag par bya ba ston to //
translated: The Madhyamikas respond to this by asking, “What is the meaning of the reason ‘because they change into something else’? Why is it not established?”

original: de skad ces brgal zhing brtags pa na grangs can dag na re dngos po 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni yod pa nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de skad ces brgal zhing brtags pa na grangs can dag na re dngos po 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni yod pa nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: When this is asked, the Samkhyas say, “Past and future things do exist.

original: zil gyis non pa'i phyir ram bag la zha ba'i phyir mi dmigs par zad kyi gang gi tshe zil gyis non pa dang bag la zha ba'i rkyen dang bral ba de'i tshe na gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du dmigs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir dngos po snga na
analyzed: zil gyis non pa'i phyir ram bag la zha ba'i phyir mi dmigs par zad kyi gang gi tshe zil gyis non pa dang bag la zha ba'i rkyen dang bral ba de'i tshe na gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du dmigs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir dngos po snga na
translated: Because it is overwhelmed or because it is dormant, it is not observed, but when it is free from the conditions of being overwhelmed or dormant, then it is observed as having a clear nature.

original: med pa phyis gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: med pa phyis gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that a thing that did not exist previously becomes something else later.

original: dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the Madhyamaka reason “because it becomes something else” is not established.

original: de la grangs can dag gi gtan tshigs zil gyis non pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang tshig tsam gyis mi 'grub pas rjes su dpag pa'i sbyar ba bya dgos pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de la grangs can dag gi gtan tshigs zil gyis non pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de yang tshig tsam gyis mi 'grub pas rjes su dpag pa'i sbyar ba bya dgos pas de'i phyir /
translated: In response to that, the Sāṃkhya reason “because it is overwhelmed” is not established by mere words, so an inference must be applied. Therefore, it is said:

original: gal te de dag na re dngos po 'gags pa dang ma skyes pa ni yod pa nyid de zil gyis non pa'i phyir nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis skar ma'i 'od zil gyis non pa bzhin nam /
analyzed: gal te de dag na re dngos po 'gags pa dang ma skyes pa ni yod pa nyid de zil gyis non pa'i phyir nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis skar ma'i 'od zil gyis non pa bzhin nam /
translated: If they say that things that have ceased and not yet arisen exist because they are suppressed, like the light of stars is suppressed by the light of the sun, then that is not so.🔽

original: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dam /
translated: If they say that a past thing and a future thing exist because they are objects of consciousness,

original: dus su brjod pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: dus su brjod pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because they are expressed in terms of time,

original: li zhes bstan pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes zer na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: li zhes bstan pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes zer na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: or because they are indicated by the word “now,” like a present thing,

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: then the subject, the predicate of the proposition, the proof, and the example should be applied in order.

original: dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis skar ma'i 'od zil gyis non pa ni zil gyis non pa'i phyir yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i @325b dngos po 'gags pa dang / ma skyes pa yang zil gyis non pa'i phyir yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis skar ma'i 'od zil gyis non pa ni zil gyis non pa'i phyir yod pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i @325b dngos po 'gags pa dang / ma skyes pa yang zil gyis non pa'i phyir yod pa nyid do //
translated: For example, the light of the stars is eclipsed by the light of the sun. Because it is eclipsed, it exists. In the same way, past and future things, though they have ceased and not yet arisen, exist because they are eclipsed.

original: de bzhin du dngos po 'gags pa dang ma skyes pa ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po 'gags pa dang ma skyes pa ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: So too, an entity that has ceased or not yet arisen exists,🔽because it is the object of consciousness, like an entity that exists in the present.

original: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / dngos po 'gags pa dang ma skyes pa ni yod pa nyid nge dus su brjod pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / dngos po 'gags pa dang ma skyes pa ni yod pa nyid nge dus su brjod pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes bya ba dang /
translated: An entity that has ceased or not yet arisen exists, because it is described as past or future, like an entity that exists in the present.

original: dngos po 'gags pa dang ma skyes pa ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: dngos po 'gags pa dang ma skyes pa ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: An entity that has ceased or not yet arisen exists, because it is taught, like an entity that exists in the present.

original: 'i zhes bstan pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs dang / dpe de dag gi phyir yang yod pa nyid yin pas des na dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'i zhes bstan pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs dang / dpe de dag gi phyir yang yod pa nyid yin pas des na dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Because of these reasons and examples, it is not established that the meaning of the statement, “The reason of the Mādhyamika becomes otherwise because of that,” is that the reason is not established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to such statements, the author of the commentary here says:

original: de la yang dgag pa ci skad bstan pa nyid brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la yang dgag pa ci skad bstan pa nyid brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: We should state the refutations that were previously taught.

original: grangs can dag gis ci skad smras pa de la yang sngar bye brag tu smra ba dag gis smras pa'i dgag pa ci skad bstan pa nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: grangs can dag gis ci skad smras pa de la yang sngar bye brag tu smra ba dag gis smras pa'i dgag pa ci skad bstan pa nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: We should state the refutations that were previously taught by the Vaibhāṣikas to the Sāṃkhyas.

original: 'di skad bstan te grangs can dag na re dngos po 'gags pa dang / ma skyes pa ni yod pa nyid de zhes zer ba de gal te kun rdzob tu 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po phyogs su byed na ni gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te grangs can dag na re dngos po 'gags pa dang / ma skyes pa ni yod pa nyid de zhes zer ba de gal te kun rdzob tu 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po phyogs su byed na ni gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa nyid dang /
translated: They say: The Sāṃkhyas say that a thing that has ceased and not yet arisen exists. If they take the past and future things as the basis of that statement, then the reason is not established.

original: phyogs kyi khyad par gyi gzhi ma grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: phyogs kyi khyad par gyi gzhi ma grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: The basis of the distinction of the position is not established.

original: don dam par ni skye ba bkag pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po med pas dpe med do //
analyzed: don dam par ni skye ba bkag pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po med pas dpe med do //
translated: If they take ultimate reality as the basis, then the example does not exist because the present thing does not exist because arising is refuted.

original: ci ste gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon bsal ba'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po phyogs su byed na ni des kyang dpe med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon bsal ba'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po phyogs su byed na ni des kyang dpe med par 'gyur te /
translated: But if you make the present thing the subject because you want to clear away the faults of the unestablished subject, etc., then your example is not established because

original: thams cad kyang phyogs nyid du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang phyogs nyid du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: everything is made the subject.🔽The meaning of the reason “because it is refuted” should be stated as “because it is not established.” This shows that you should say that

original: zil gyis non pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don kyang ma grub pa nyid du brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni gang gi phyir kho bo cag la dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa de'i phyir khyed kyi gtan tshigs zil gyis non pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don
analyzed: zil gyis non pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don kyang ma grub pa nyid du brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni gang gi phyir kho bo cag la dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa de'i phyir khyed kyi gtan tshigs zil gyis non pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don
translated: because all things are unarisen for us, therefore the meaning of your reason “because it is refuted”

original: ma grub pa nyid dang / nyi ma'i 'od zer dag kyang ma grub pas khyed kyi dpe ma grub pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid dang / nyi ma'i 'od zer dag kyang ma grub pas khyed kyi dpe ma grub pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya ba bstan to //
translated: is not established. And because the sun’s rays are also not established, you should say that the fault of the nonestablishment of your example also arises.

original: grangs can dag na re yod pa nyid zil gyis non pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: grangs can dag na re yod pa nyid zil gyis non pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas say: Because existence is refuted,

original: @326a * // bag la zha ba'i phyir zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de nyid gun dbyung ba'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @326a * // bag la zha ba'i phyir zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de nyid gun dbyung ba'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The reason “because it is latent” is refuted by the following two syllogisms, which demonstrate valid cognitions that contradict it.

original: mi gsal ba ni gsal bar byar mi rung ste mi gsal ba'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni gsal bar byar mi rung ste mi gsal ba'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: That which is unclear cannot be clarified because it is unclear, like a sky flower.

original: de bzhin du bag la ma zha ba yang bag la zha bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bag la ma zha ba yang bag la zha bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, that which is not latent cannot become latent.

original: bag la ma zha ba'i phyir dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin nam gtso bo bzhin pas grub pa'i mtha' la gnod do zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa gnyis go rims bzhin du smras te /
analyzed: bag la ma zha ba'i phyir dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin nam gtso bo bzhin pas grub pa'i mtha' la gnod do zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa gnyis go rims bzhin du smras te /
translated: Because it is not latent, like the existence of consciousness or like the primal substance.🔽For example, a sky flower is not something that can be clarified because it is unclear due to being a nonentity.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni dngos po med pas mi gsal ba'i phyir gsal bar byar mi rung bas zil gyis non pa ma yin pa de bzhin du grangs can dag gis brtags pa'i chos gzhan yang dngos po med pas mi gsal ba'i phyir gsal bar byar
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni dngos po med pas mi gsal ba'i phyir gsal bar byar mi rung bas zil gyis non pa ma yin pa de bzhin du grangs can dag gis brtags pa'i chos gzhan yang dngos po med pas mi gsal ba'i phyir gsal bar byar
translated: In the same way, other phenomena imputed by Sāṃkhya are not something that can be clarified because they are unclear due to being nonentities.

original: mi rung bas zil gyis non pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rung bas zil gyis non pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not that they are overwhelmed by what is unsuitable.

original: gzhan yang dper na shes pa yod pa nyid dang / gtso bo dag ni nam yong bag la ma zha pa'i phyir bag la zha bar mi 'gyur pa de bzhin du dngos po yang bag la ma zha ba'i phyir bag la zha bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang dper na shes pa yod pa nyid dang / gtso bo dag ni nam yong bag la ma zha pa'i phyir bag la zha bar mi 'gyur pa de bzhin du dngos po yang bag la ma zha ba'i phyir bag la zha bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, just as consciousness and primal substance are not latent because they are not in a state of latency, so too things would not be latent because they are not in a state of latency.

original: ci ste dngos po bag la zha bar 'gyur na ni shes pa yod pa nyid dang gtso bo dag kyang dngos po yin pas bag la zha bar 'dod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: ci ste dngos po bag la zha bar 'gyur na ni shes pa yod pa nyid dang gtso bo dag kyang dngos po yin pas bag la zha bar 'dod par bya dgos te /
translated: But if things were latent, then since consciousness and primal substance are things, you would have to assert that they are latent.

original: de lta na khyed rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las de bag la zha bar mi 'dod pas gzhung la gnod do //
analyzed: de lta na khyed rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las de bag la zha bar mi 'dod pas gzhung la gnod do //
translated: In that case, since you do not assert that they are latent, your theory would contradict your own tenets.

original: dngos po yod pa nyid 'dzin pa la skyon gzhan 'di yang yod de /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa nyid 'dzin pa la skyon gzhan 'di yang yod de /
translated: There is another fault in asserting that things exist.

original: gal te rang bzhin yod nyid na //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin yod nyid na //
translated: If things exist essentially,

original: de ni med nyid mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni med nyid mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They could not become nonexistent.🔽It is never tenable

original: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //🔽nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //🔽nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For an essence to change into something else.

original: rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / dpe yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin gyis dngos po yod pa nyid yin na gzhan du 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i skyon gzhan bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / dpe yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin gyis dngos po yod pa nyid yin na gzhan du 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i skyon gzhan bstan to //
translated: “Because the nature is unchanging, and because there is no example” is the thought. This shows another error: if things existed essentially, it would be impossible for them to change into something else.

original: rang bzhin med pa yang gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa yang gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du bstan par mi nus te /
translated: Also, it is not possible to show that that which lacks essence changes into something else.

original: mo gsham gyi bu'i na tshod gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa bzhin pas /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu'i na tshod gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa bzhin pas /
translated: This is because, like the son of a barren woman, it does not change into something else.

original: rang bzhin yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If it does not exist through its essence,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang zhig yin //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang zhig yin //
translated: How could it change into something else?

original: zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin gyis dngos po med pa nyid yin na de la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i skyon gzhan ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin gyis dngos po med pa nyid yin na de la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i skyon gzhan ston to //
translated: This shows another error: if things are essenceless, it would be impossible for them to change into something else.

original: de lta @326b bas na mtha' de gnyi ga yang skyon che bas dam pa rnams de dag yongs su 'dzin par mi byed do zhes bya bas ni mtha' gnyis spang ba'i tshul snga ma gnyis kyi mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: de lta @326b bas na mtha' de gnyi ga yang skyon che bas dam pa rnams de dag yongs su 'dzin par mi byed do zhes bya bas ni mtha' gnyis spang ba'i tshul snga ma gnyis kyi mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, since both of these extremes are faulty, the holy ones do not accept them. This teaches the summary of the former two modes of abandoning the two extremes.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: khyod kyis rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa la gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes smras pa'i phyir dgag pa gnyis brjod pas /
analyzed: khyod kyis rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa la gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes smras pa'i phyir dgag pa gnyis brjod pas /
translated: Since you have said that that which does not intrinsically exist does not transform, you have stated two negations.

original: de'i skabs ston pa'i phyir sgra'i don gyi mthus rang bzhin yod na gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i skabs ston pa'i phyir sgra'i don gyi mthus rang bzhin yod na gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: In order to teach the context of that, you have accepted that if something intrinsically exists, it would transform.

original: des na khyod kyi phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na khyod kyi phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, your former position is undermined, and the meaning of your reason is not established.
